title: A Blunt President, Behind the Scenes
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Blemishes and all, President Nixon said, and he warned of ambiguities, embarrassments and brutal candor in the 1,308 pages that provided today perhaps the closest look outsiders have ever had of a President in privateand certainly of the private Richard Milhous Nixon.

title: Guide  GOING OUT
description: BANG CLANG That perennial fund raiser, FM radio's station WBAI, is launching another airwave marathonrunning an expected six weeksto try and collect $200,000.

title: U. S. Seen Losing A Trade Leverage With Soviet Union
description: Theodore Sorensen, former counsel to President John F. Kennedy, told a City University seminar yesterday that Congressional moves to curb SovietAmertican economic relations appeared to be losing their leverage as a result of recent rises in the prices of crude oil and other raw materials.

title: REDISTRICTING IS LIKELY HERE
description: WASHINGTON, April 30A threejudge Federal Court ruled unanimously today that Brooklyn, Manhattan and the Bronx were subject to the Federal Voting Rights Act, and thus made a reapportionment of Congressional and legislative districts in the three boroughs within the next two months almost certain.

title: Covenant Move Dismays MunicipalBond Dealers
description: Wall Street's municipalbond dealers, already discouraged after three months of declining prices and scarce profits, were further dismayed yesterday by New Jersey's final action to repeal a covenant that restricted involvement of the Port Authority in deficit mass transit.

title: Aaron Wallops 720th. Where It All Started
description: ST. LOUIS, April 30 (AP) Henry Aaron of the Atlanta Braves walloped the 720th homer of his career tonight in the same city where he hit his first 20 years ag; The game, however, was won, 72, by the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: HECKLERS DELAY ABORTION HEARING
description: TRENTON, April 30A public hearing on abortion regulations proposed by the State Department of Health was abruptly suspended this afternoon when foes of abortion defied the presiding officer's order to stop harassing a speaker for the New Jersey chapter of the National Organization for Women.

title: 4 Killed in Iowa Silo Blast
description: STOUX CITY, Iowa, April 30 (UPI)An explosion blasted the top off a silo at a grain elevator today, killing four persons and injuring one. The blast and flying debris also damaged several railroad cars and buildings in the vicinity. Investigators said they believed the blast was a dust explosion.

title: Rebels in Portuguese Guinea Oppose Spinola's Plan
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, April 30 African guerrilla leaders in Portuguese Guinea, or GuineaBissau as they call it, regard, Gen. Antonio de Spinola's solution for the colonial wars as totally unacceptable.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index Page 49

title: Philadelphian Gets Term In Hashish Smuggling Case
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 30 (UPI)Louis Agnes, 37 years old, of Philadelphia, pleaded guilty yesterday to charges of smuggling hashish, and was given 18 more months on a fiveyear sentence he is serving for possession of $3;400 in counterfeit bills.

description: NEW DELHI, April 30India released the last groups of Pakistani prisoners of war today, completing the return of 93,000 Pakistanis who we held in India for over two years.

description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI) The Senate Foreign Relations Committee approved today a bill creating a national commission to study allegations of mismanagement of United States Olympic teams. The Senate was expected to give its approval quickly.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The transcripts of the recordings of President Nixon's Watergate conversations show that Mr. Nixon never discouraged the payment of hush money to one of the Watergate conspirators. They depict Mr. Nixon as having been primarily interested early last year in keeping the facts of the Watergate case from becoming public, but as having been indecisive on the best way of accomplishing it. title: New Jersey Sports Benefit Ice Show
description: RED BANK, April 30Jack Rafter is called that damn women's, libber by some people and he's called some worse names by colleagues who don't fully appreciate his drive to advance track and field for girls. But doesn't seem to bother the former Seton Hall basketball player, who has made his career in coaching track.

title: Olympics Inquiry Bill Is Approved
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI)The Senate Foreign Relations Committee approved today a bill creating a national commission to study allegations of mismanagement of United States Olympic teams. The Senate was expected to give its approval quickly.

title: Copfucius, China's Sage Is Now a ComicStrip Villain and a Revisionist
description: HONG KONG, April 30China's ancient sage Confucius, who has been pictured throughout history, as an immovably placid and dignified figure, is now being caricatured in a comic strip as a rapacious villain with a frenzied, almost canine expression.

title: Statile, Former G.O.P. Chief in Bergen, Is Indicted in Cahill Financing Case
description: NEWARK, April 30  A Federal grand jury investigating illegal campaign financing today indicated Anthony J. Statile, a former Bergen County Republican chairman, on charges of inspiring fraudulent contributions and trying to impede the Federal investigation.

title: Judicial Gerrymander
description: Unless the Assembly stops a bill that has slipped through the State Senate masquerading as a civil rights law, local political bosses will be back in control of the selection of judges for the Civil Court in New York City.

title: WILLIAM HASSID, BIOCHEMIST, DIES
description: BERKELEY, Calif., April 30 (AP)William Zev Hassid, pioneer research scientist in sugar biochemistry, died Sunday at Alta Bates Hospital. He was 76 years old.

description: U.S AIDES REDUCE WIRETAPPING BIDS

title: FRESH OUTBREAK OF MEASLES NOTED
description: New Jersey and Federal health officials today reported a fresh outbreak of measles in Camden County and announced plans for an intensive immunization program to begin there next week.

description: Toronto  Clyde Gray, 150 pounds, Toronto, outpointed Art Kettles, 148, Asbury Park, N. J., 10 rounds.

title: Help for Nuclear Families: It's Called a Cocoon or a Cluster
description: You can't miss the XF3 Gang of the Unitarian Church in Westport, Conn. They're the ones in the midnightblue Tshirts with the gang's name popping out, comic bookstyle.

title: Senators Observe A Day of Prayer; Split on Humility
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP)  Congressmen gathered in small groups throughout the capital today, taking part in an unofficial National Day of Humiliation, Fasting and Prayer.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: SewerPipe Builder Seen in DefaultA contractor who constructed a $31million sewer outfall pipe off Wantagh, L. 1., was declared in default yesterday by Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso as he turned over the findings of a threeweek county investigation to the Nassau District Attorney's office for determination of possible criminal action. The investigation was made after reports that divers working on the twoandahalfmile ocean pipe, which extends, seven miles from the Wantagh sewage treatment plant, had falsified required air tests. The contractor, the DennyBuckley Company Montvale, N. J., could not be reached for comment.

title: White House Accuses Dean of Attempting to Blackmail Nixon to Gain Immunity
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The White House accused John W. Dean 3d today of attempting to blackmail President Nixon in an effort to gain immunity from prosecution.

title: G.M. Shows Unit to Cut Harmful Coal Emissions
description: DETROIT, April 30  The General Motors Corporation showed off a new scrubbing system today that may eventually make it possible to burn coal without emitting high levels of harmful sulphur dioxide.

title: DOW RISES BY 133; PACE IS LISTLESS
description: Stock prices showed no direction yesterday for the second consecutive session as trading continued at a listless pace.

title: ITALY PUTS CURBS ON SOME IMPORTS IN SURPRISE ME
description: ROME, April 30Italy unexpectedly imposed severe restrictions tonight on all imports of manufactured, goods.

title: People in Sports Hannum Ousted From Dual Rocket Posts
description: Alex Hafnium was dismissed yesterday as coach and general manager of the Denver Rockets of the American Basketball Association. He had held the dual position three years and his contract expired yesterday.

description: WASHINGTON, April. 30Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee are weighing a formal move to cite President Nixon for noncompliance with the committee's April 11 subpoena of White House tape recordings.

title: An American Proposal
description: The $4billion, tenpoint emergency program to assist countries hardest hit by price rises which the United States suddenly proposed at the United Nations yesterday seems intended to head off a rival $3billion emergency aid fund proposal that was gaining support among developing countries. As the formulation of Secretary of State Kissinger's April 15th pledge of a major United States effort to help meet the development crisis, it offers concrete hope for action to close what Secretary General Kurt Waldheim has called the potentially disastrous gap between the needs of those countries and peoples imperiled by steep price rises and the aid that is currently available to them.

description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: RISE IN RAIL RATES REJECTED BY I.C.C.
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission yesterday rejected) not unexpectedlya request made only last week by the nation's railroads to increase their freight rates by 10 per cent, effective tomorrow.

title: Stage: A Black Girl in a White World
description: Ray Aranha's play, My Sister, My Sister, which opened at The Little Theater last night, is a complex but moving play about growing up black in the white world of the South during the late nineteenfifties.

title: DR. MAX RABBINER
description: Dr. Max Rabbiner, formerly assistant professor of otolaryngology at New York University and Bellevue Medical Center, died Friday at his home here. He was 80 years old.

title: Farm Prices Drop 6 Per Cent In a Hopeful Sign for Shoppers
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Farm prices fell 6 per cent in the month ended April 15, their second consecutive decline, and one holding out the hope for some relief for shoppers at supermarket counters.

title: Insurance Was Low On 19 Works of Art Stolen in Ireland
description: DUBLIN, April 30 (AP)The 19 paintings valued at $20million that were stolen from an Irish mansion last Friday were insured for barely onetenth of that amount, their owner said today.

Ehrlichman, former Presidential adviser, said in court papers filed today that President Nixon had twice indicated his afterthefact approval of the Ellsberg burglary by White House plumbers and had ordered his Watergate investigators to stay away from it.

title: Marcia Beltzer Wed To William Guy Levy
description: Miss Marcia Dale Beltzer and William Guy Levy, who are doing freelance filming in Kenya and Tanzania, were married yesterday at Sheria House in Nairobi, Kenya. The ceremony was performed by Ben Opjyo, marriage officer.

title: Red Smith
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 30Woody Stephens is a 60yearold strip of whalebone and whipcord who looks like a former jockey out of Midway, Ky. The fact that he is a former jockey out of Midway, Ky., may account for the resemblance. It has been said that to get to Midway you take Interstate Highway 64 out of Lexington to State Road 62, turn right and go back 50 years. It is a tranquil village in the blue grass whose biggest building is a gracious old house painted in the racing colors of its former owner, J. M. Parrish. The first thoroughbred I ever rode, Woody Stephens was saying this morning, was on that place. I was 18 and we broke three yearlings for Mr. Parrish that summer. I lived on a farm about three miles away, rode a pony to school. Stephens was standing Outside Barn 42 on the backside of Churchill Downs watching a groom wash down Cannonade, half the entry that is almost sure to go to the post as the public choice in the 100th Kentucky Derby Saturday. As he watched, the other half of the entry, Judger, watched him over ??? of his stall.

title: Bridge: 2 Americans Share Title For Most World Contests
description: Here is a simple question that most followers of the game would find difficulty in answering: which American expert has competed in the greatest number of world team championships for Olympiad or Bermuda Bowl titles?

title: U.S., at U.N. Session, Asks $4Billion for Poor Nations
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 30The United States proposed today a $4billion program to help the most economically distressed countries.

title: Clammers Expect Rough Season as Shoppers Fears of Sewage Pollution Cut Prices
description: couple dozen clammers were out in the bay because the demand for clams on the East Coast had fallen so rapidly in the last week or so that hundreds of bushels of clams were lying unsold in markets.

title: GURNEY COUNSEL CHALLENGES LAW
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 30 An attorney for Senator Edward J. Gurney formally accepted today a copy of an indictment charging the Florida Republican with violating a state law requiring the reporting of campaign contributions.

title: 19.9% Rate Increase, a Record, Is Sought by Public Service
description: NEWARK, April 30  The Public Service Electric and Gas Company, New Jersey's largest utility and the third largest in the nation, asked the state Public Utilities Commission today to approve a 19.98 per cent rate increase, a $257million request that is the largest in the company's history.

title: TIDO Who Served On Mitchell Jury Lose Their. Jobs
description: Two persons who served on the Mitchell  Stans jury for eight weeks have lost their jobs.

title: KODAK CAUTIOUS ON 1974 EARNINGS
description: FLEMINGTON, N. J., April 30  The Eastman Kodak Compan world leader of the photographic industry, predicted at its annual meeting here today that 1974 would be a big sales year. But the company's managers were cautious about the profit outlook.

description: BASEBALL

description: W.H.A. Playoffs

title: Earnings of Lockheed Continue to Lag
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, the financially troubled West Coast manufacturer that has been exploring possible mergers to broaden its income potential, reported firstquarter net earnings yesterday of $3.8million.

title: Advertising: Listening to Radio
description: Hooray! Hooray! The first of May! National Radio Month begins today! (Don't scoff: It may be the only noncatastrophic news you'll be getting.)

title: GEON WILL ACCEPT NEW BURMAH OFFER
description: Directors of Geon Industries, a distributor of automative replacement parts, especially for foreign cars, voted to accept a second and lower acquisition offer from Burmah Oil, Inc., a British company, for Geon's assets. The second offer involves a price of slightly less than $24  million, compared with an offer in midMarch of about $28mililon, or $11 a share, compared with about $13.

title: PORT PANEL BACKS MOVE ON TRANSIT
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has abandoned its oposition to repealing a 12yearold bond covenant that restricts its mass transportation capability, Dr. William J. Ronan, the authority's new chairman, said yesterday.

title: 10 Hurt in IndianPolice Clash at South Dakota Trial
description: SIOUX FALLS, S. D., April 30 (UPI)A trial of Indian militants erupted into a courtroom clash between the police and Indian supporters today. At least 10 persons were injured in the disturbance and two were killed: in a related car smashiup.

title: Panel Adopts Agenda for Tax Reform
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 The House Ways and Means Committee voted today to start work immediately on a tax reform bill that may include such items as an outright ban on deductions for the expenses of business conventions that are held outside the United States.

title: German Bridge Falls
description: KEMPTEN, West Liermany, April 30 (AP)  Nine persons were killed and 11 seriously injured today in the collapse of a bridge being built over a Bavarian mountain stream. The police said at least 27 construction workers fell, amid concrete and debris, 50 feet into the valley.

title: Nixon Asks Price Restraint
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP)  President Nixon called on business leaders tonight to use restraint in future price inCreases, warning that continued high inflation would bring back demands for wage and price controls.

title: Spring Mills Sues Saks Over Ultrasuecie Fabrics
description: Springs Mills, Inc., said yesterday that it had filed suit in the United States District Court here against Saks & Co., operator of the Saks Fifth Avenus chain, charging infringement of Springs Ultrasuede fabric and UltraSuede fabric registered trademarks. Saks & Co. is a unit of Gimbel Brothers, owned by Brown & Williamson Tobacco Company.

title: Grim Stays With Giants; Pact Deadline Today
description: Bob Grim, the New York Giants wide receiver, has agreed to contract terms with the National Football League team, according to Andy Robustelli, the Giants general manager.

title: College Baseball
Gurney Visits Mother
description: WATERVILLE, Me., April 30 Senator Gurney arrived here today to visit his 87yearold mother, but fended off newsmen's questions about his indictment in Florida on charges of violating state election laws.

title: Nixon, QB VII Share High Ratings.
description: If QB VII on ABCTV iost some viewers Monday night because President Nixon's televised address delayed the film's start by 40 minutes, it could not be discerned from the overnight Nielsen ratings for the New York area. Both the film and the President enjoyed very high ratings.

title: Army Inquiring Into Allegations
description: The Army, whose total recruiting advertising budget has gone beyond $35million a year, is conducting an inquiry into its relationship with its, agency, N. W. Ayer & Son.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: William Turner's warning (letter April 16) not to expect political dividends from aid to India is thoughtful, and his suggestion that India obtain a matching grant from the Russians is provocative. It's well known that foreign aid, unlike Shakespeare's concept of mercy, has blessed neither the giver nor the receiver. The manifold reasons have been well debated.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended April 23.

title: MCA Records Picks Officer
description: George Lee has been appoint ed vice president of MCA Records, Inc., in charge of Eastern operations, it was announced yesterday. He is a former vice president of Warner Bros. Records.

title: Karate Is Curbed in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 30 (Reuters)  Chile's military rulers today barred civilians from learning karate and all other oriental forms of unarmed combatto protect the armed forces. Only military personnel were exempt from the decree.

title: KUWAIT IS MOVING INTO A NEW ERA
description: KUWAIT, April 30  The payoff for higher oil prices started coming to Kuwait today.

title: The Effect on Criminal Cases
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Whatever else President Nixon may have accomplished or failed to accomplish in releasing his carefully edited transcripts of Watergate conversations, hey has opened up a vast trove of evidence that may effect a number of criminal cases now pending in the courts. His action may also lead to additional proceedings not previously contemplated, criminal as well as civil.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Motorists overpaid New Jersey service stations by more than $232,000 during March and April, the Internal Revenue Service reported. Elmer H. Klinsman, I.R.S. District Director, made the disclosure as the NixonAdministration's economic stablization program expired. The prices of petroleum products, however, will be controlled by the Federal Energy Office.

title: On the French Farm, the Election Is Not a GrassRoots Concern
description: GUERET, France, April 27 The political pulse is barely tangible in this part of the heartland of France as the presidential election approaches.

title: Weinberger Has His Blood. Pressure Taken as a Reminder to 23 Million Americans
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 Caspar W. Weinberger, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, had his blood pressure taken today for the benefit of 23 Million other Americans.

title: Mr. Nixon On the Barricades
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 In the great crises of his political life, Richard Nixon has been almost recklessly bold. He saved himself from charges of corruption in the Presidential campaign of 1952 with his Checkers speech. He came back after losing the Presidency of 1960 and the governorship of California in 1962, and, the guess here is that he has helped himself, by his latest TV defense against impeachment and conviction.

title: News Summary and Index WEDNESDAY, MAY 1, 1974
description: The transcripts of the recordings of President Nixon's Watergate conversations show that Mr. Nixon never discouraged the payment of hush money to one of the Watergate conspirators. They depict Mr. Nixon as having been primarily interested early last year in keeping the facts of the Watergate case from becoming public, but as having been indecisive on the best way of accomplishing it. [1:8.]

title: Saigon Father of 5, Unable to Feed Family, Seeks Death by Fir
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 30  Last evening 'about 6 o'clock, as the streets were choked with rushhour traffic, Vo Van Nam said goodby to his five children, walked into a green, wooded park across from Saigon's main cathedral and set himself on fire.

title: For the Gregarious Bicyclist, and Other Activities for Youngsters
description: If your child always has to have a friend along when he goes bicycle riding, simply hates to ride alone, an event this Sunday in Central Park should make him ecstatic. It's a BikeAThon that is expected to have more than 5,000 riders as part of a benefit for United Cerebral Palsy of New York.

title: Hamilton Names President
description: CLINTON, N.Y., April 30 (AP),Dr. J. Martin Carovano, 38 years old, acting president of Hamilton College since July 1 was named the college's 16th president today. He succeeds John Chandler, who resigned in March, 1973, to become president of Williams College.

title: VIETCONG MISSION CURBED BY SAIGON
description: SAIGON, April 30  The South Vietnamese Government announced today that it had decided to put an end to a weekly news conference of the Vietcong's isolated military delegation here and had permanently cut Its telephone lines to the city.

title: TWO TIRE CONCERNS ARE SUED BY DAYCO
description: The Dayco Corporation of Dayton, Ohio, filed separate suits yesterday in the United States District Court in Cleveland against the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company and the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company charging each cornpany with attempting to monopolize the manufacture and sale of replacement tires in violation of the Sherman Antitrust Act.

title: OvertheCounter Qutations
description: Quotations supplied through NASDAQ as of 3:30 P.M. Quotes do not include retail markup, markdown or commisons. Volume represents shares that changed ownershipduring the day. Figures include only transactions effected by NASDAQ marketmakers but may Include some duplication where marketmakers traded with each other.

title: Freed Funds for Transit
description: The long fight to make the Port Authority a full partner in the planning and financing of improved mass transit in the metropolitan area is within hailing distance of success.

title: Count Moscow In
description: Intractable as it appears in itself, the ArabIsraeli conflict reaches its moments of most acute danger when it becomes an extension of Great Power rivalry in the Middle East. Conversely, any degree of superpower understanding in respect to peacemaking efforts between Arabs and Israelis brings a corresponding increase in the chance for an honest settlement.

title: Copper Companies Increasing Prices
description: With price controls dying at midnight, major copper producers announced yesterday that they were establishing a new price of 80 cents a pound for copper cathode, up 12 cents from the old price. The move was started by the Phelps Dodge Corporation and was followed quickly by the Inspiration Consolidated Copper Company and the Magma Copper Company. Other producers are expected to take similar action.

title: Ford Says Documents Prove Nixon Innocent
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP)  Vice President Ford, after reading the released White House summaries of Presidential conversations, said today, The President, in my opinion, is completely innocent.

title: Vote in State Senate Backing Death Penalty
description: Vote in State Senate Backing Death Penalty

title: Swan Song on Monday For Singing Telegrams
description: New Yorkers who have been planning to surprise Mother with a singing telegram on Mother's Day, May 12 should begin thinking of an alternate tribute. The Western Union Corporation received permission from the State Public Service Commission yesterday to end its singing greeting service next Monday.

title: HAROLD J. GORDON
description: Harold J. Gordon, an investment banker, died Saturday evening at his home in Chicago. He was 79 years old.

title: People in Sports Hannum Ousted From Dual Rocket Posts
description: Alex Hannwn was dismissed yesterday as coach and general manager of the Denver Rockets of the American Basketball Association. He had held the dual position three years and his contract expired yesterday.

title: JAMES GANNON
description: GREENWICH, N. Y., April 30 (AP)James Gannon, coauthor of the popular song I'll Be Home for Christmas, died yesterday at a hospital in Lake Worth, Fla. He was 73 years old.

title: Griffin of Red Sox Hit By Ryan, Has Concussion
description: BOSTON, April 30 (AP)Doug Griffin, the Boston Red Sox second baseman, was knocked unconscious when he was hit on the head by a fasthall thrown by Nolan Ryan of the California Angels during the first inning of tonight's game won by the Angels, 166.

title: CUOMO IS SEEKING N. 2 STATE OFFICE
description: Mario M. Cuomo, the Queens lawyer who mediated the Corona and Forest Hills housing disputes, announced yesterday his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for Lieutenant Governor.

title: The Atlantic Theater
description: PARISThe Atlantic farce is either burgeoning into broad comedy or moving toward tragedy. Governments everywhere are in disrepute, unable to establish priorities or agree on means. Occasionally, the leading actors revert to antics and threaten enmity while professing friendship, or feign hostility to frighten partners.

title: Television
Mets Defeat Dodgers, 87, After Surge
description: LOS ANGELES. Anril 30John Milner's tworun double off Mike Marshall's first relief pitch in the ninth inning tonight gave the New York Mets an 8.7 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers and ended the Dodger winning streak at seven.

title: Borne Asks Help on Jobs For Ousted City Employes
description: Mayor Beame yesterday directed the establialiment of a job referral center to help find positions for 2,500 provisional city employes who are being dismissed becanse of the fiscal crisis. It was estimated that by May 10 the first 250 employes would have been dismissed.

title: NIXON DEPICTED IN TRANSCRIPTS AS HAVING SEARCHED FOR WAYS TO HIDE DETAILS OF WATERGATE
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Democrats on the House Judiciary Committee are weighing a formal move to cite President Nixon for noncompliance with the committee's April 11 subpoena of White House tape recordings.

title: RUSSIANS READING ABOUT WATERGATE
description: MOSCOW, April 30The Soviet press, in a rare breach of its usual silence on the Watergate affair, informed its readers today that President Nixon was turning over transcripts of his taperecorded con versations on the matter to the Judiciary Committee of the House of Representatives.

title: Concert
description: The revived American Symphony Orchestra ended its first season on Monday night in Carnegie Hall, giving every evidence of good health and a long life ahead of it. Having to suspend operations last season with the unexpected departure of its founding conductor, Leopold Stokowski, it reorganized itself into a cooperative venture, engaged Kazuyoshi Akiyama as music director and set out last fall on a fiveconcert series.

title: How the Teams Stand Today
description: STANDING OF THE TEAMS

title: Sarah Lawrence President Evades Abduction Attempt
description: Dr. Charles R. DeCarlo, the president of Sarah Lawrence College Yonkers, disclosed yesterday that he had been accosted at gunpoint Saturday night by four young men who ordered him to get in their Volkswagen.

title: British Football
description: British Football

title: Loss of Rights in San Francisco
description: Under pressure of court challenge and black protests, the largescale stopandfrisk operation undertaken by the San Francisco police to find the socalled Zebra murderer has been modified amounted to the most senseless violation of civil rights in yeais, yet few people outside the northern California black community yoke out.

title: END OF SMALLPOX IN 1975 PREDICTED
description: GENEVA, April 30Dr. Halfdan Mahler, director general of the World Health Organization, predicted today that next year the world will have seen, its last case of smallpox.

title: BRIEF DECLARES NIXON IS INNOCENT
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 The White House declared today that President Nixon was never criminally liable in the Watergate coverup attempt despite damaging statements he made in conversations with key figures in the scandal.

title: Briefs On the Arts
description: The budget of the state Council on the Arts was more than doubled last night under a bill that received final approval in the Legislature last night. An appropriation of $34.1million was voted by the Senate, despite complaints that the funds could be better spent on the elderly and needy.

title: Senator Says Navy Inquiry Is Thwarted
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 A Congressional investigation into the use of military personnel as servants to the President and his staff has been thwarted by the White House, according to a statement released today by Senator William Proxmire.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: KABOOM! a musical with book and lyrics by Ira Wallach, score by Doris Schwerin, directed by Don Price, at the Bottom Line, 15 West 45th Street, 6:45.

title: LATE CITY EDITION
description: Weather: Partly cloudy today and tonight. Fair, pleasant tomorrow. Temp range: today 5873; Tuesday 6779. Additional details on Page 90.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: Alexander the Great: A Biography, by Robin Lane Fox (Dial Press, $15).

title: Flushing Board Mollifies Parents At School but Angers Others
description: A community school board Flushing, Queens, passed a school rezoning plane last night that pleased parents, whose childrat had boycotted their public school earlier in the day, but angered other parents, who said they would challenge it before the central Board of Education.

title: Prisonees Escape Foiled
description: HOUSTON, April 30 (UPI)Samnel G. Sanchez, 33 years old; wiigglod through the air, conditioning ducts of the county jail to, the roof. The roof tiles gaveWay and hecrished through to the courtroom be low, where a bailiff grabbed him and returned him to his cell He is awaiting sentence as a convicted habitual criminal.

title: 4 More Big Oil Companies Report Sharp Profit Rise
description: Sharply higher profits were announced yesterday by four more oil companiesPhillips, Cities Service, Atlantic Richfield and KerrMcGee. This completes the reports of firstquarter earnings (all of them up substantially) for the dominant concerns in the oil industry.

title: U.S., at U.N. Session, Asks $4Billion for Poor Nations
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 30The United States proposed today a $4billion program to help the most economically distressed countries.

title: CORRECTION
description: The address of one of the exhibition halls for Art Expo 74 was incorrectly given in The New York Times yesterday. The correct address is 1441 Broadway, near 40th Street.

title: TV: VVNBC s Sturdy TwoHour Wews Center 4
description: As the clucking gets louder over the menace of happy talk or tabloid news on television, WNBCTV has come up with an attractive and initially impressive alternative called NewsCenter 4. Claiming no help from outside consultants, the New York flagship station of NBCTV is bringing the metropolitan area its first twohour edition of the earlyevening news.

title: Girl Hurled 3 Floors Dies
description: DETROIT, April 30 (UPI)A man apparently upset because of an argument with his commonlaw wife early today threw his two children out of a thirdfloor apartment window on Detroit's West Side The polka said Felicia Patterd son, 6 years old, was dead at the scene and Harold Tillman, 17 months, was in serious condition at Henry Ford Hospital.

title: Paper Maker Is Sued
description: Essex Systems Company Inc., a maker of business forms filed a $20million Federal lawsuit here yesterday against the International Paper Company, alleging unlawful use of monopoly power during a paper shortage late last year. Essex accused International of refusing to continue supplying paper last November while competitors allegedly continued to get supplies from International.

title: Madeira Alert for Trouble
description: FUNCHAL, Madeira, April 30  Troops and the police here prepared today for possible civil disturbances on May Day.

title: Japan Asks Gradual Steps Toward Chemical War Ban
description: GENEVA, April 30 Japan submitted to the 25nation disarmament conference today the draft of an international pact providing for a stepbystep approach to a total ban on the development, production and stockpiling of chemical means of warfare.

title: Cleveland Quartet Plays With Vigor And Tight Control
description: America is spawning excellent young string cinartets with ad ichthyic enthusiasm these days, and the Cleveland String Quartet is certainly one of the best. The young ensemble, in residence at the State University of New York at Buffalo, appeared Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, and the result was an invigorating evening of music.

title: The Middle of the Journey
description: President Nixon and the nation are still in the middle of their journey toward truth and a final resolution the Watergate scandals. In his address to the nation, the President tried to hack a shortcut through the tangle of fact and accusation, suspicion and denial that surrounds him on every side. In doing so, he disclosed much that had been concealed. But the shortcut proved to be a detour leading inescapably back to the main road and leaving the subject only slightly advanced from where it had been before he spoke.

title: Miracles or Missiles?
description: DAMASCUS, SyriaMany miracles have been reported in this part of the world but I somehow Aloubt if Henry Kissinger, described as a miracleworker by his new friend, Anwar elSadat, President of Egypt, is going to pull one out of his hat when he comes here on his new tour of the Bible lands. To begin with, he doesn't wear a hat.

title: Releases in Mozambique
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, April 30The commander of the Portugese forces in Mozambique, Gen. Basta Machado, tonight announced that many hundreds of political_ prisoners would be released from jails throughout the territory tomorrow.

title: MinimumWage Booklet Tells Of New Benefits for Domestics
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) Persons who employ domestics in their households will soon be receiving from the Department of Labor a booklet spelling out their obligations under the new Minimum Wage Act.

title: Man Who Told of Tapes Leaves for Coast Tour
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Alexander P. Butterfield, the former White House aide who disclosed the existence of the Presidential tape recordings to the Senate Watergate committee last July, left here today to tour aircraft factories on the West Coast.

title: WASHINGTON
description: All this was presented by the President to the nation as an exercise of unprecedented generosity. No President in the history of the Republic, he said, had ever made available, to the Congress or the people so many secret conversations within the White House, which is true No doubt, he added, these documents would be misconstrued by his opponents in the Congress and the press, but he had always sought to do what was right, and now all these thousands of documents would be published, and if anybody had any doubt, the chairman of the House Judiciary Committee, Peter Rodino Jr., of New Jersey, and the senior Republican member of the committee, Edward Hutchinson of Michigan could listen to the tapes and confirm whether or not he was telling the truth.

title: communist Exile Receives A Big Welcome in Lisbon
description: LISBON, April 30The Portuguese Army and a tumultous crowd of leftists today welcomed home Alvaro Cunhal, the leader of Portugal's Communist party, after 12 years in exile.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROME, April 30 (UPI)Jaime Rivera Ballestero of Spain led his countrymen in taking three of the top five places in the main event of the rainswept Rome international horse show today.

title: AID PACT REACHED BY CITY AND STATE
description: ALBANY, April 30  After two days of intensive negotiations, Governor Wilson and Mayor Beame announced today a proposed response to the city's fiscal needs, including a oneyear, 1centperdollar increase in the sales tax, $520minion in borrowing authority and $201million in state aid financed primarily by advances by the state.

title: State Senate Votes DeathPenalty Bill, More Limited One Than Assembly's
description: ALBANY, April 30  The State Senate, after more than six hours of debate, tonight approved an even more limited restoration of the death penalty in New York State than that in a billpassed last week by the Assembly.

title: Port Authority Abandons MassTransit Opposition
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has abandoned its opposition to repealing a 12yearold bond covenant that restricts its masstransportation capability, Dr. William J. Ronan, the authority's new chairman, said yesterday.

title: Yankees Turn Back A's, 4.3 on Two Homers in 8th
description: The Yankees obviously had the Oakland A's well scouted before they met them last night for the first time. After all, how else would they have known that the eighth inning had been the A's worst this season?

title: INVENTORY GAINS SHRANK IN MARCH
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The steep recent rise in manufacturers inventories slowed in March and new orders fell off, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Phone Talks to Begin
description: WASHINGTON, April 30. (AP) The American Telephone and Telegraph Conipany said today that it would begin contract negotiations here May 15 with three unions representing 750,000 Bell system employes.

title: House Passes Energy Bill
description: WASHINGTON. April 30 (UPI) The House approved today a $27billion appropriation bill for energy research and development in the next fiscal year. This was $66 million more than President Nixon asked for.

title: 8 injured as Train Derails
description: WINAMAC, Ind., April 30 (AP)Several cars of an Amtrak passenger train derailed near this northern Indiana town today, the authorities said. The state police reported that eight persous were treated at a local hospital, but none was injured seriously. The train, No. 53 of Amtrak's Floridian, was bound for Chicago from Miami with about 100 passengers aboard.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (Reuters)The Securities and Exchange Commission said today it would hold an inquiry to determine whether banksponsored investment services ought to be subject to some kind of S.E.C. regulation. The commission said its action was prompted in part by Congressional concern over the growing trend of banks becoming involved more in investment service activities.

title: A.B.A. Championship
description: A.B.A. Championship

title: AMEX STOCKS OFF AS TRADING DROPS
description: After opening slightly higher, prices on the American Stock Exchanged dropped yesterday and closed off on slightly increased trading compared with the day before. However, prices rose in the overthecounter market.

title: People and Business
description: Billie Jean King will head a new equal lending program at the Lincoln Bank designed to end sex discrimination, the institution announced yesterday in Philadelphia.

title: Farm Prices Drop 6 Per Cent In a Hopeful Sign for Shoppers
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Farm prices fell 6 per cent in the month ended April 15, their second consecutive decline, and one holding out the holle'for some relief for shoppers at supermarket counters.

title: 3 Newspapers Pressing Talks on Automation Here
description: Negotiators for Typographical Union No. 6 and the city's three, major daily newspapers contintied to discuss automation problems yesterday and scheduled another session for 3 P.M. to day at Automation House, 49 East 68th Street.

title: No End in Sight for Prosecutor's Job
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Few observers ever thought the job of Watergate special prosecutor would be quick and tidy.

title: Nets Take Opener As Erving Gets 47
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., April 30  Kevin Loughery, the Nets coach, and Rod Thorn, his excitable assistant, may have ore throats from shouting and sore muscles from jumping on and off the bench tonight, but it was all worth it. With constant instruction from the bench and a 47point performance from Julius Eving, the Nets pulled through to an 8985 victory through to an 8985 victory over the Utah Stars in the opener of the fourofsevengame series for the American Basketball Association cham ???

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: N.H.L. Playoffs

title: Shipping/Mails AllHours Given in Daylight Saving Time
description: EXFORD (Amer. Export), Karachi Ma 31, Bangladesh June 29; sails from 42d St., Brooklyn.

title: About New York
description: The myth is that the streets are paved with gold, and sometimes it is almost true. Last Wednesday, shortly after 5 P.M., someone started throwing money onto Park Avenue from a window in the Regency Hotel.

title: Rukeyser Service Today
description: A funeral service will be held at 11 A.M. today at Temple Israel, New Rochelle, N.Y., for Mrs. Majorie S. Rukeyser, past president and director of the National Federation of Temple Sisterhoods, who died Monday. An obituary in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly reported her name as Mrs. Carrie Bailin Rukeyser. Her late mother's name was Carrie Bailin.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 47

title: Sir Frank Packer, Australian Publisher And Yachtsman, 67
description: SYDNEY, Australia (UPI)Sir Frank Packer, chairman of Australian Consolidated Press and head of the yachting syndicate that made three unsuccessful attempts to take the America's Cup for Australia from the United States, died of pneumonia today. He was 67 years old.

title: TASTEFUL PIANISM BY DIANNE CHILGREN
description: Dianne Chilgren, piano soloist with the New York City Ballet, gave an attractive, tastefully executed recital Monday night in Alice Tully Hall. While it may not have struck any momentous sparks, her playing was consistently tidy and frequently went directly to the point of the music.

title: DANCE MAKES A PUN IN HOOF AND MOUTH
description: Hoof and Mouth is a punning title used by Laura Pawel to characterize her speech and movement dance, shown for the first time Monday evening at the Cubiculo. It had moments of humor but was terribly diffuse.

title: SIRICA DECLINES BID TO STEP ASIDE
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (Reuters)Judge John J. Sirica refused today to disqualify himself from presiding at the Watergate coverup conspiracy trial of seven top former aides to President Nixon and in his reelection campaign five of the seven defendants, whose tentative trial is set to begin in September, had filed motions to have Judge Sirica removed from the case, charging among other things, a proprosecution bias.

title: No Quick Action Planned On New Bronx Hospital
description: Charles 3, Bensley, chairman of the Health and Hospital Corporation's committee on the new North Central Bronx Hospital, told more than 1,000 people at a public hearing last night that despite a staff report the corporation would not take any immediate action on the future of the $94million hospital.

title: Governor's Rent Measure Seeks Replacement of Vacancy Decontrol Act
description: ALBANY, April 30Governor Wilson asked the Legislature today for a broad restructuring of rent regulations throughout the state, including a new system designed to establish a fairmarket rent for every rentcontrolled apartment that becomes vacant.

title: LAOS WILL ACCEPT NONCOMMUNIST AID
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 30 In its first major action since assuming power three weeks ago, the coalition Government of Laos agreed today to accept continuing financial aid from nonCommunist countries to bolster, the chronically weak economy.

title: Homosexual Bill Protest Draws Small Crowd Here
description: A mass rally called by fire officers to protest the city's proposed homosexual rights law attracted only few demonstrators to City Hall yesterday.

title: Flyers Defeat Rangers, 41, Take 32 Lead in Cup Series
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 30 Kate Smith and Bernie Parent, the Odd Couple of sports, helped the Flyers tonight to become the first expansion team to win three games in a playoff series against hockey's Establishment with a comeback 41 victory over the Rangers.

title: Women's Interclub Golf
description: Women's Interclub Golf

title: VLADIMIR MANSVETOV
description: Vladimir Mansvetov, chief of the features branch of the Voice of America's Russian Service, died Friday of cancer at the George Washington University Hospital in Washington. His age was 64 and he lived at Chevy Chase, Md.

title: ITALY PUTS CURBS ON SOME IMPORTS IN SURPRISE MOVE
description: ROME, April 30Italy unexpectedly imposed severe reIstrictions tonight on all imTorts of manufactured goods.

title: 19745 Allocation Of Shared Revenue Totals $62Billion
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) About half of the nation's 38;000 local and state governments will receive more money and the other half will get less under revenue sharing allotments announced today for the 1975 fiscal year.

title: NIXON REPORTED TO PAY BACK TAX
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI)  President Nixon has paid most of his nearly halfmilliondollar debt in back income taxes, an Administration official said today.

title: Humphrey's Doctors Say Radiation Destroyed Tumor
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's doctors said today that radiation therapy last winter destroyed a tumor in the Minne sota Democrat's bladder.

title: Death
description: Death

title: Speer Discloses Capital Budget Will Double
description: The United States Steel Corporation realized a gain of 82.7 per cent in firstquarter earnings over the like 1973 period on an increase of just under 29 per cent in sales and revenues.

title: Fire Destroys a School; Firemen Blame Vandals
description: CAMDEN, April 30 (UPI)A generalalarm fire that destroyed, an 87year old public school early today was apparently set by vandals who kicked in the school door and ignited papers inside the school, the police said.

title: Few Mourn for Controls
description: Price W. Controls, a child of the Nixon Administrationrenowned as an anti  inflation fighter in his youth but failing in health for more than a year 1expired In Washington last night at the age of 2 years 8 months. Conservative doctors gave old age as the cause of death, but an autopsy is to be held to determine whether there was foul play.

title: Heavy Golan Gunfire Sets Mood for Kissinger
description: TEL AVIV, April 30, (Reuters)  Fighting flared again between Israel and Syria in the Golan Heights today as Israeli leaders worked out their strategy for talks with Secretary of State Kissinger later this week.

title: 6 FORD PLANTS SHUT IN SUPPLIER'S STRIKE
description: DEARBORN, Mich., April 30 (AP)The Ford Motor Company closed, six of its automobile assembly plants today and said by Thursday eight others would be out of work, idling about 37,000 workers. The company said, that strikes against two of its parts suppliers were to blame.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE Edited by WILL WENG
description: DOWN

title: Agnes Moorehead Dies at 67; Acclaimed in a Variety of Roles
description: Agnes Moorehead, the actress, died yesterday in the Methodist Hospital in Rochester, Minn., where she had been under the care of Mayo Clinic physicians. She was 67 years old.

title: Liza Minnelli Is Joined byAznavour in Song
description: The teaming of Charles Aznavour and Liza Minnelli last night in an Mtn of sohg over NBCTV was delightful, rather suprisingly so. For one thing, Miss min., nelli's recently overexposed stridency was toned down. In one number, she even shed that lurid Theda Bara eyesoot. The diminutive, unglamorous Frenchman came across with distinct, manly charm and persuasion, and in clearly enunciated English that was a lesson for today's caterwaulers.

title: N.B.A. Championship
description: N.B.A. Championship

title: 4 Democratic Aipirants Ask Liberal Backing for Governor
description: Four Democrats seeking their party's nomination for Governor made appeals last night seeking the endorsement also of the Liberal party.

title: Ervin and Tunney Want Inquiry Into Silbert's Watergate Work
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, called today for an indepth investigation by the Senate Judiciary Committee of the Justice Department's handling of the Watergate breakin case.

title: Monday's Fights
description: Toronto  Clyde Gray, 150 pounds, Toronto outpointed Art Kettles, 148, Asbury Park, N. J., 10 rounds.

title: Rozelle's Charter Ruling Scored
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI)A spokesman for the National Football League Players Association said today that Commissioner Pete Rozelle acted irresponsibly in fining eight San Diego Charger players for alleged drug use without giving them a hearing before an impartial arbitrator.

title: Kissinger Meeting Sadat On Syria Disengagement
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, April 30Secretary of State Kissinger arrived here tonight and immediately conferred with President Anwar elSadat as part of an effort to build a broad base of support for a compromise troopseparation agreement between Israel and Syria.

title: Cowboys And W.F.L. Still Battle
description: DALLAS, April 30 (AP)The Dallas Cowboys of the National Football League dropped legal action against Calvin Hill and Craig Morton today but continued to seek an injunction against the World Football League, which lured away the two stars.

title: Boy Drowns in Bronx Pool
description: A 12yearold South Bronx boy apparently drowned last evening while swimming with friends in a pool at St. Mary's Recreation Center, 145th Street and St. Ann's Avenue, in the Mott Haven section. The boy, Perry Collins of 735 Dist 165th Street, Was pronounced dead at 8:20 P.M. at Lincoln Hospital, where he was taken after firstaid efforts failed.

title: Officer, 70 Pounds Lighter, Is Promoted
description: A year ago, on the day she was to be promoted to sergeant, Police Officer Helena Epstein was called aside by her superior officer and told that at 273 pounds (in full uniform and carrying her gun), she did not meet departmental weight standards and that, although she was eligible for sergeant in every other respect, she was being passed over.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: ATTENTION MASOCHISTS: THE ANNUAL WBAI MARATHON Starts tonight at 7:30 p.m with Pacifica is 25 Anniversary Documentary ListenerSponsored WBAI 99.5 FMADVT.

title: RENTRISE REPEAL APPROVED, 9 TO 1
description: A bill to repeal rent increases of up to 4 per cent a year in many of the one million rentcontrolled apartments here was approved yesterday by the City Council's General Welfare Committee by a 9to1 vote.

title: A.E.C. Orders Utilities to Arm Guards
description: The Atomic Energy Commission, fearing possible sabotage, is ordering utilities throughout the country to hire armed guards to protect nuclear plants, despite the protests of some utilities  including the Consolidated Edison Company  that the weapons will add new dangers.

title: Dumpson Appoints a Black And Two Puerto Ricans
description: Promotion of one aide and appointments of two Puerto Ricans and one black to other posts were announced yesterday by Human: Resources Administrator James R. Dumpson, whose reorganizationt; plan is under study byMayor Seame.

title: Doctor Barred in Michigan
description: PONTIAC, Mich., April 30 (AP)Judge Frederick Ziem of Oakland County Circuit Court today barred Dr. Jesse Ketchum, who was convicted of negligent homicide after performing an abortion in Buffalo, N. Y., from practicing medicine in the county. Dr. Ketchum is free on $10,000 bail while he appeals the New York conviction.

title: NINE STEEL MAKERS LOSE A TRUST CASE
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) The Justice Department asked a Federal court today to order nine steel companies to pay damages for alleged violation of antitrust laws in the sale of reinforced steel bars in Texas.

title: It Was 1949, and Here's How Some Saw the Future
description: Television was in its infancy. Suburbs had only begun to sprout on the fringes of the nation's great cities. The memories of World War II were fading,and crew cuts, bobby socks and convertibles were once again cruising Main Street America. People had not yet heard of Sputnik or the Super Bowl and knew little of faraway places called Seoul, Panmunjom, Saigon and Hanoi. But there was plenty to think about.

title: 2 HEALTH TESTS CALLED BOGUS
description: Health Commissioner Lowell E. Bellin urged a group of black civic leaders last night to stop being conned by faddish ethnic health programs and to concentrate instead on public health programs that have some impact.

title: Problems Over, Grant's Chairman Tells Complaining Stockholders
description: Richard W. Mayer, chairman of the W. T. Grant Company, yesterday heard shareholders blame favoritism among buyers, overage directors, too many new stores and too many bargains for the company's problems.

title: NIXON INNOCENCE AFFIRMED IN BRIEF
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 The White House declared today that President Nixon was never criminally liable in the Watergate coverup attempt despite damaging statements he made in conversations with key figures in the scandal.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
description: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE

title: Ford's Net Drops
description: DETROIT, April 30  The Ford Motor Company announced today that earnings for the first quarter of 1974 dropped by 65.7 per cent from the same qtlarter last year.

title: Chandler Appeared Before Geotek Jury, U. S Attorney Says
description: A spokesman in the United States Attorney's office here confirmed today that Otis Chandler, publisher of The Los Angeles Times, appeared voluntarily before a Federal grand jury investigating charges of criminal fraud in an oildrillingfund program yesterday.

title: Dance: Errand Revival
description: The Martha Graham Dance Company embarked on its third and last week at the Mark Hellinger Theater Monday night with the revival of Miss Graham's great duet Errand Into the Maze. Although now more than a quarter century old, it remains a remarkable choreographic statement about the abstract reality of fear.

title: Artists Here Honor Pope's Inspiration
description: In honor of the inspiration and leadership he has given to contemporary artists, Pope Paul VI received last night a special tribute from the Skowhegan (Me.) School of Painting and Sculpture.

title: May Is P.A.L. Month
description: To mark the start of the 60th anniversary of the Police Athletic League at a City Hall ceremony yesterday, Robert M. Morgenthau, president of P.A.L., was presented with Mayor Beame's proclamation naming May as P.A.L. Month.

title: EXAIDE TO GROSS INDICTED BY U.S.
description: NEWARK, April 30A FedIeral grand jury investigating illegal campaign financing today indicted Anthony J. Satile, a former Bergen County Republican chairman, on charges of inspiring fraudulent contributions and trying to impede the Federal investigation.

title: Market Place: Pace Quickens In Margin Calls
description: Securities purchasers who have taken advantage of reduced down payments on stocks this year in the hope that a depressed market would quickly move higher are now finding themselves in danger of persistent margin calls following further market setbacks in April.

title: Journalism Awards Given to 4 Newsmen By ScrippsHoward
description: Four newsmen and a television station, KGWTV of Portland, Ore., won top honors yesterday in journalistic competition sponsored by the ScrippsHoward Foundation.

title: Stone Falls 12 Stories On Madison at 45th
description: A portion of an ornamental stone windowsill on the Op floor of the Abercrombie & Fitch Co. building broke loose shortly before midnight last night and fell 12 stories to the deserted sidewalk below, scattering in pieces on the corner of 45th Street and Madison Avenue.

title: Signal Raises Dividends
description: Directors of the Signal Companies, Inc., yesterday increased the quarterly cash dividend on the company's common stock to 20 cents per share from 15 cents, and declared regular quarterly dividends on preferred stocks. The common dividend is payable June 10 to stockholders of record May 10. Regular quarterly dividends on the preferred stocks, both payable July 1, 1974 to stockholders of record May 10 are 55; cents on the $2.20 dividend preferred and 25 cents on the $1 dividend preferred.

title: OIL PROFITS TAX GAINS IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The House Ways and Means Committee gave final approval today to legislation that would increase the taxes by the oil industry to the Government this year from an estimated $1.6billion to $2.6billion.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Today's Entries at Aqueduct

title: Women's Interclub Golf
description: Women's Interclub Golf

title: Her Art Is Like a Circus Gone Mad, But Her Toys Are. Made for Cuddling
description: so it's not as if I suddenly decided to be an artist It just seems natural,

title: COPPER. FUTURES. NARROWLY MIXED
description: Copper traders on both sides of the Atlantic waited yesterday In anticipation that producers would raise the price of the metal after United States controls expired last night. The expected increases calm soon after the markets closed.

title: WagePrice Controls Quietly Expire
description: WASHINGTON, April 30With many a dry eye in both houses, Congress went about its business routinely today and let pass into history the nation's first comprehensive peacetime wage and price controls.

title: TRANSCRIPTS BACK JAWORSKI THEORY
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The White House transcripts released today support what is known to be one of Special Prosecutor Leon Jaworski's key theories in the pending Watergate case: That a principal motive for the alleged highlevel coverup was a desire to prevent disclosure of the 1971 Ellsberg burglary.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Oakland A's at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2 P.M. (Radio  MICA, 2 P.M.)

title: 2 IN FRENCH RACE GIVE POLICY VIEW
description: Two of the three major candidates in the French presidential race say that if elected they would not change France's equivocal position in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, but would seek to improve relations with Israel and assure good relations with the United States.

title: Assembly Kills Measure to Appoint, Rather Than Elect, Appeals Judges
description: ALBANY, April 30  A proposal for the appointment rather than election of the judges of the Court of Appeals was killed in the Assembly today as a final package of limited courtreform legislation was readied for passage.

title: Notes on People
description: William E. Simon was confirmed by the Senate yesterday to be Secretary of the Tivasury. One of the least controversial major appointments of the Nixon Administration, the Simon nomination was routinely brought out on the floor by Senator Mike Mansfield, the Democratic leader, and it was passed by voice vote with no debate.

title: Good Planting Prospects in Midwest Point to Record Corn and Wheat Crops
description: BAGLEY, Iowa, April 25The soil, slightly moist and coal black, slipped through Max Naylor's fingers as he knelt to uncover a bright Orange corn seed he had just planted.

title: Table of Contents
description: The New York Times begins publishing today, in chronological order, transcripts of subpoenaed Watergate tape recordings as edited and released by the White House. Also included is the text of President Nixon's legal argument issued yesterday. Additional tape transcripts will be published tomorrow.

title: Ellington's Sacred Music Is Played for His Birthday
description: Portions of Duke Ellington's three Sacred Concerts the works that, he says, have meant the most to Ern during the last decadeformed the basis for a service at the Central Presbyterian Church, Park Avenue at 64th Street, on Monday evening, celebrating Mr. Ellington's 75th birthday. The service, conducted by the Rev. John Garcia Gensel, was performed by Mr. Ellington's orchestra and a choir and singers conducted by Roscoe Gill.

title: GEORGE J. FEINMAN
description: George J. Feinman, chief civil engineer of the Port Authority, of New York and New Jersey, who worked on the expansion of the Kennedy and Newark Airports, died Monday at New York Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived at 7535 189th Street, Flushing, Queens.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN BOND TRADING
description: Trading remained quiet as prices turned mixed yesterday in the Government, taxexempt and corporate bond markets. Specialists suggested that participants were awaiting word of the Treasury Department's upcoming refunding plans, which is expected today. In advance of the announcement of precisely what the Treasury will be offering in its $5.6billion refunding, credit market activity yesterday was somewhat tentative.

title: Tides Around New York
description: Tides Around New York

title: Police Chief of Salem Guilty of Poker Playing
description: CAPE MAY COURT HOUSE, April 30 (AP)The suspended Police Chief of Salem, George A. Johnson, has pleaded guilty to a single count of playing poker and has agreed to resign from the force.

title: EDWARD C. DENAPLE
description: Edward Charles Denaple, board chairman of the Hazard Advertising Company, 211 East 43d Street, died Monday at Doctors Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 433 East 51st Street.

title: Jersey Utility Seeking Record 19% Rate Rise
description: NEWARK, April 30 The Public Service Electric and Gas Company, New Jersey's largest utility and the third largest in the country, today asked the State Board of Public Utility Commissioners to approve a 19.98 per cent rate increase. The rise, which would total $257million, would be the largest in the company's history.

title: Ga Hai Captures Derby Trial,. Martin Readies His 12 Punch
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 30Hours before today's 47th running of the Derby Trial, a man in the. Churchill Downs Stable area deftly clipped a tiny microphone to a trainer's collar and nodded to his camerman.

title: It Was 1949, and Here's How Some Saw the Future
description: Television was in its infancy. Suburbs had only begun to sprout on the fringes of the nation's great cities. The memories of World War II were fading, and crew cuts, bobby socks and convertibles were once again cruising Main Street America. People had not yet heard of Sputnik or the Super Bowl and knew little of faraway places called Seoul, Panmunjom, Saigon and Hanoi. But there was plenty to think about.

title: A Blunt President, Behind the Scenes
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Blemishes and President Nixon, said, and he warned of ambiguities, embarrassments and brutal candor in the 1,308 pages that provided today perhaps the closest look outsiders have ever had of a President in privateand certainly of the private Richard Milhous Nixon.

title: Bucks Win In Overtime; Series Even
description: MILWAUKEE, April 30In a game almost crucial to their hopes of winning the National Basketball Association championship, the Milwaukee Bucks squandered a 16point thirdquarter lead, then got some unexpected help in overtime to beat the Boston Celtics, 10596, tonight before a capacity crowd at Milwaukee Arena.

title: Candide Actors Surround Audience
description: Ticket buyers to hit shows milling to pay the top price have rarely had to worry about their seating arrangements, but Candide, an adventuresome romp in open theater and multistaging, may have changed all that.

title: California Aide Disputes Alioto on Zebra Kilings
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 30 (UN)  California's Attorney General, Evelle J. Younger, said today that he has no evidence to link San Francisco's Zebra killings with 80 other slayings in California in the last three years as charged yesterday by Mayor Joseph L. Alioto.

title: Ransomed U.S Oilman Rejoins Family
description: MIAMI, April 30 (AD)Victor E. Samuelson, the American oil executive held for 144 days by Marxist guerrillas in Argentina, returned to the United States today to rejoin his family.

title: Became and Governor Agree on Aid to Close the Gap in City Budget
description: the city's share of health services for Orison inmates.

title: CORRECTION
description: The address of one of the exhibition halls for Art Expo 74 was incorrectly given in The New York Times yesterday. The correct address is 1441 Broadway, near 90th Street.

title: Stans Is Sued Over Ads In Re.election Campaign
description: A radio and television monitoring service filed suit in Manhattan Supreme Court yesterday against Maurice H. Stans and two other trustees of (liquidation trust of funds that were raised for President Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign but are still unspent.

title: Avon Blames Inflation; Predicts a Comeback
description: There's nothing wrong with the fading glamour girl, of Wall Street that an improved economic climate won't cure, stockholders of Avon Products, Inc., were assured at their annual meeting, held yesterday at the Americana.

title: Raid Into Cambodia By South Vietnam Reported in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday; May 1 (AP)South Vietnamese infantrymen supported by armor and heavy air strikes crossed two and a half miles into Cambodia in a raid aimed at North Vietnaniese gun positions bombarding Government outposts on the Vietnam side of the border, military sources reported today.

title: L.I. Clammers Expect Rough Season as Shoppers Fears of Sewage Pollution Cut Prices
description: ISLIP, L.I. April 30 As Dick Rosenkranz walked along the dock to his clamming boat before dawn here today, he appeared worried.

title: Books of The Times
description: Now, at the height of his fame, Norman Mailer feels that he can confer significance on things that had none before. As he says himself: And the ego is capital convertible to currency by the use of the name. Mr. Mailer's journalism assumes that everything in the world is, In a sense, related, and if your imagination has range enough, you can see each phenomenon in a cosmic perspective. The cosmic perspective is Mr. Mailer's journalistic stock in trade. It is this that sent him to the moon for a subject, that tempted him to translate Marilyn Monroe into someone who combined the Willendorf Venus, the Virgin Mary and everyman's dream of delight.

title: All Our Tomorrows
description: ROMEThe complex and baffling problems of our time are not just bigger and somewhat modernized version of old ones. Sweeping quantitative and qualitative changes are transforming everything. The manmade world has spread all over the planet, displacing and subjugating the natural world that has produced our species and nurtured it.

title: Chess: The Lustful Pawn Expands Toward Majesty or Mayhem
description: The farther into enemy territory a passed pawn advances, the greater becomes the threat it posesfor both players. Looming large as an incipient queen, a passed pawn may make the defender's blood run cold, but if it is thrust forward in unplanned haste it may outrun its support and be engulfed by eager counterattackers.

title: Albany Votes Bill to Free Port Unit for Mass Transit
description: ALBANY, May 1With virtually no debate, the. Assembly voted unanimously today to give final legislative approval to a measure that would repeal the restrictive covenants that bar the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey from spending its funds on unprofitable masstransportation projects.

title: BIG ES. OIL, ROLE FOR SAUDIS SEEN
description: KUWAIT, May 1 (Reuters)Two Kuwaiti newspapers said today that the Saudi Arabian Government was likely to buy a large stake in the four United States oil companies that are shareholders in the Arabian American, Oil Company.

title: Nixon's Candor: Effect Debated
description: WASHINGTON, May 1Will it hurt him or help him? That was the bottomline question being asked in Washington today about President Nixon's release of more than 1,200 pages of transcripts of WaterNews gate conversations. Analysis The President's, friends, who had been urging him for months to come clean, felt that the torrential outpouring of evidence could only help in the fight against impeachment.

title: City Pays an Interest Of 6.636% to Sell 483Million in Notes
description: The city was forced yesterday to pay the highest in terest rates in its history for $483.5 million worth of shortterm taxrevenueanticipation notes.

title: CoverUp
description: A reading of the first installment of the transcripts of the White House tapes as published in The Times supports the contention that President Nixon was aware of a deliberate coverup of the Watergate scandal. The transcripts also offer a striking insight into the ethical decay that pervaded the Oval Office. The deleted expletives coulcfnot have been'nearly as appalling as the moral standards which Mr. Nixon and his aides applied to serious problems of politics, law and justice.

title: Path to Peace in Africa
description: Gen. Antonio de Spinola's plan for giving Portugal's African territories selfgovernment, inside a federation with the mother country could be a halfway house on the road to full independence for Angola, Mozambique and GuineaBissau. The similarity of the federation idea Gen. Charles de Gaulle's French Community concept of the nineteenfifties is striking; the parallel could also be instructive.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROME, May 1 (AP)Major Rainiondo D'Inzeo of Italy won both events today in the Rome international horse show.

title: Yanks Top A's, 43, on Blomberg Double In 8th After He Homers for 33 Tie in 6th
description: A group of men disguised as the Oakland A's showed up again at Shea Stadium yesterday and just as they did 18 hours earlier, they lost to the Yankees, 43.

title: House Votes Bill to Delay Some Clean Air Standards
description: House Votes Bill to Delay Some Clean Air Standards

title: Jogger, 19, Raped in Daylight Near Grand Central Parkway
description: A 19yearold girl jogging in a wooded area near the Grand Central Parkway in Queens was raped in broad daylight yesterday and, in struggling with her assailant, apparently suffered back injuries that left her paralyzed from the waist down.

title: Black Wins in Louisiana
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 1 (UPI) Sidney J. Berthalmy, a Democrat, will be Louisiana's fiest black state senator since Reconstruction, based on unetficial returns of a special doe, tion.

title: Nixon Defense Scenario Devised in One Morning
description: WASHINGTON, May 1It was April 16, 1973. The day before, President Nixon had been told by senior Justice Department officials that a number of White House officials were involved in the Watergate coverup.

title: Baroness von Soosten, 79, A Founder of LilyTulip Cup
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., May 1 (AP)Baroness Margaret von Soosten, an international businesswoman who once married an heir to the Bayer aspirin fortune, thinking he was a garage mechanic, died today. She was 79 years old.

title: EDWARD HAINES
description: Edward Haines, a lawyer in Toms River, N.J., died yesterday in Jefferson Hospital, Philadelphia. He was 66 years old.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Hawaii Ends Gas Rationing
description: HONOLULU, May 1 (UPI)Hawaii's mandatory gasoline rationing program, the first in the nation, was suspended yesterday. Acting Gov. George Ariyoshi, who imposed the plan three months ago, said it was no longer needed but would be reinstituted if gasoline became scarce again.

title: Off Off Broadway Is Going on Parade
description: Off Off Broadway, a theatrical state of mind divided by a hundred neighborhoods, will take a giant step Saturday toward achieving a clearer focus in the eyes of New Yorkers with a gala Festival Fortnight that will run through May 19.

title: Jamaica A.S.P.C.A. Gets Reprieve From Closing
description: Instead of a threatened closing yesterday, the Jamaica, Queens, shelter of the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals is to remain open for two more years, according to an agreement announced yesterday by Borough President Donald R. Manes.

title: FANNY'S ROCK MUSIC STRESSES OPINIONS
description: A year or so ago, Fanny, just formed, looked all set to become the first really successful allfemale group in rock, music. If it hasn't exactly happened that way, Fannyto judge by its showing at Town Hall on Tuesdayis still in there pitching its highly energized rockn'roll, still revealing a potent approach to the basic blues form.

title: Nixon Leaves Capital; Flies to Camp David
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (AP)  President Nixon left by helicopter this afternoon for Camp David, Md., the White House said.

title: In Australian Race Personalities of the Two Candidates Overshadow Issues
description: SYDNEY, Australia, April 27 In Sydney, car stickers proclaim: Pm Dreadin Snedden. In Canberra, somebody changed the sense of a sign reading Gough's Going Great by putting a period after the second word.

title: Silbert Is Termed White House Link For Jury Minutes
description: WASHINGTON May 1 (UPI)  James W. McCord, convicted Watergate conspirator, charged today that Earl J. Silbert had supplied the White House with minutes of grand jury deliberations concerning the original Watergate defendants.

description: South America, West Indies, Etc. PORTLAND (SeaLand), San Juan May 6; sails from Elizabeth, N.J.

title: Glider Derby Begins
description: PACOIMA, Calif., May 1 (UPI)Seven top glider pilots were towed aloft today for the start of the third an, nual Sailplane Derby, a 2,900mile race that is expected to end in Washington, D.C., about May 20.

title: 1,100 More Named as Winners Of National Merit Scholarships
description: The names of a third and final group of 1,100 high school seniors were announced yesterday by the National Merit Scholarship Corporation as winners of $1,000 nonrenewable, college scholarships.

title: Hospital in Brooklyn Closing Permanently In a Union Dispute
description: Adelphi. Hospital, a 150bed facility in the Fort Greene section of Brooklyn, closed its doors permanently after a union blocked it from receiving Blue Cross, Medicaid and Medicare payments. Under a court order, the funds will gp to the union instead.

title: Howell Twp. Fire Burns 300 Acres; Homes Are Saved
description: HOWELL TOWNSHIP, May 1 A forest fire in a populated neighborhood burned out of control for five hours here today but more than 400 firemen were able to prevent it from damagingg homes,

Resources Administrator, James R. Dumpson. Davenport was previously exl ecutive director of the HaryouAct community corporation.

title: Ruling Due Today on Ehrlichman Venue
description: LOS ANGELES, May 1 (AP)Attorneys for John D. Ehrlichman presented a mountain of newspaper clippings and testimony by television executives today in an effort to move Mr. Ehrlichman's perjury trial out of Los Angeles on the ground of excessive publicity.

title: Newark Awards $135,000 For 1969 Beating by Police
description: In an unusual settlement expected to be approved next week by Judge James A. Coolahan of the Federal District Court, the City of Newark has awarded $135,000 in damages to the motorist, Elmer Dunning, 49 years old, of Harrison, NEWARK, May 1A motorist who charged that Newark policemen had beaten him when he refused to pay them off for safe passage through the city has won his fiveyear fight to prove he was a victim of police brutality.

title: JORDAN REVISES STAND ON GENEVA
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 1 King Hussein of Jordan, in a shift of position, announced today that he would agree to the presence of a Palestinian delegation at Middle East peace talks in Geneva but with restricted negotiating rights.

title: CAREY IS CRITICAL OF SAVE GAS SIGNS
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey, a Democratic gubernatorial contender, charged yesterday that the Outdoor Advertising Association of New York State was using 450 billboards around the state to plug Governor Wilson under the guise, of a publicservice message on the energy crisis.

Dean 3d, and Jeb Stuart Magruder, deputy director of the Committee for the Reelection of the President, is described in the Watergate tape transcripts as perhaps the quietest meeting in history.

Mr. Nixon, 42 years old, a liberal, and the incumbent, Gov. Meldvin Thomson, 61, a conservative, are the only two candidates so far in the September Republican Primary.

title: EN. SHUNTS ASIDE U.S. AID PROPOSAL

description: Mayor Beame professes to be pleased with the fiscal package be has brouglit back from Albany but there is little comfort for the citizens of New York in still another expense budget that relies heavily on new debt and gimmickry to achieve an extremely precarious balance.

title: News Plans Automation Monday If Printers Continue Slowdown
description: The Daily News, hampered by 13 days of slowdown by its printers, served notice yesterday that it would begin to use automated typesetting processes exnt Monday if the job action continued and there was no substantial progress in contract negotiations.
