title: Landslides Kill 57 in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANIERO, May 1Landslides caused by heavy rains were reported today ?? have caused the death of 57 persons in Brazil's northeastern states. More than 200 people have died because of the floods, most of them the state of Ceara.

title: 3 ISRAELIS WOUNDED IN SHELLING ON GOLAN
description: JERUSALEM, May 1(Reuters) Three Israeli soldiers were wounded today in an artillery clash with the Syrians on the Golan Heights, the Israeli command reported.

title: Sperry Rand Raises Profits by 15.8%
description: The Sperry Rand Corporation reported yesterday a 15.8 per cent increase in its net income to $33.8million for the fiscal fourth quarter. The company also said its net rose 25 per cent for the fiscal year ended March 31 to $112.6million, or $3.27 a share.

title: RODINO AIDS FINE THEIR TIONSPIIPTS VARY FRORNIXON'S
description: WASHINGTON, May 1Lawyers for the House Judiciary Committee disclosed tonight that discrepancies, perhaps*. nor, existed between some, of the transcripts of the White House tape recordings President Nixon made public yesterday and transcripts of: the same tapes made by the committee staff.

description: WASHINGTON, May 1The White House employed private sources to tap the telephones of jourialists almost from the beginning of the first Nixon Administration, according to transcripts of Oval Office conversations between the President and his aides.

title: Old Tensions Mark May Day Festivities
description: As men and women around the world observed May Day, the international workers holiday yesterday, celebrations in the great Communist capitals, Moscow and Peking, were marked by an air of informality and relaxation.

title: ARNO PRESS PLANS 4 BIOGRAPHICAL LISTS
description: Arno Press will inaugurate a series of biographical directories under Stanley R. Greenfield, managing director of a newly formed division.

title: Pepsico Meeting Focuses On Political Fund Raising
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., May 1 Business was good for Pepsico, Inc., last year and even better during the first quarter of this year, but a number of questions at the annual meeting here today dealt not with profits but with the political activities of Donald M. Kendall, chairman.

title: VOTE IS 20 TO 18
description: WASHINGTON, May 1The House Judiciary Committee rejected tonight President Nixon's offer of edited transcripts is a substitute for subpoenaed Watergate tape recordings. The vote rejecting the transcripts followed the disclosure by the committee's lawyers that, he transcripts were, at least in part, not accurate.

title: Burglar Uses Deposit Slot
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., May 1 (AP)The police say a 15yearold boy allegedly crawled through a night deposit slot at a postal substation here and took $440 he found inside the building. The youth was arrested yesterday and charged with delinquency by means of larceny over $100.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: EAST. BRUNSWICK, May 1Harry Singleton hascoached hundreds of baseball and basketball players through the yearsfrom the juniorhigh level to the colage ranks. But he admits he gets a special kind of thrill helping two blind children prepare for the 50yard dash in the Special Olympics.

title: St.John's Students Aid African Relief Campaign
description: Hundreds of students at St. John's University in Queens skipped lunch yesterday to dramatize the plight, of starving people in Africa.

title: Samuel Bonchek, 84, Zionist And Jewish Leader, Dies
description: Samuel Bonchek, a founder of the Labor Zionist Movement of America and honorary president of the Labor Zionist Alliance, died Monday at Beth Israel Hospital. His age was 84, and he lived at 40 East Ninth Street.

title: Employment Up in Panama
description: PANAMA CITY (UPI)Unemployment, one of Panama's most persistent problems, dropped from 7.6 percent of the economically active population in 1972 to 6.8 per cent in 1973, according to the controller general's office.

title: Cutbacks in Service Set By Cities Service Gas
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 1 (AP)The Cities Service Gas Company said today it would curtail natural gas service throughout the summer to some industrial customers so it could build up reserves for next winter.

title: RealEstate Unit Offers Plan To Stimulate Housing Here
description: A realestate group yesterday urged Governor Wilson and his potential opponents in this year's goveronrship race to back a fivepoint program to stimulate housing construction in the city.

title: Release of 554 Prisoners in Mozambique Brings Wild Rejoicinig
description: LOITRENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, May 1More than 550 political prisoners, most of them blacks, were released from Machava Prison here today in scenes of wild rejoicing. More are expected to be released in the next few days.

title: RUTGERS TO PUSH MINORITIES DRIVE
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 1  Rutgers University said today it would increase its ef[fort to enroll minority students and to help them graduate.

title: STRIKE THREATENED BY ETHIOPIAN UNIONS
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, May 1 (Reuters)The Confederation of Ethiopian Labor Unions said today that if the Government carried out its threat to close down the confederation this could lead to a general strike, the second in two months.

title: A SEISMIC SURVEY SET OFF COIF
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Mt 1 (AP)  Two oilresearch ve sels, working for a consortium Of 48 oil companies, will conduct a seismic survey off Cape Cod, indluding George's Bank beginning in May, according a spokesman.

title: Nuclear Plant Permit Denied
description: SEABROOK, N. H., May 1 (AP)A building permit hiS been denied for a nuclear power plant, proposed by the Public Service Company for this southeastern New Hampshire town. A spokesman for the company said today that the denial was simply a technicality, and that the permit had to be denied before a variance could be granted.

title: House Reorgnization Plan Arouses Conflicting Views Caucuses
description: WASHINGTON, May 1The script for the most sweeping reorganization of the House of Representatives in 28 years had its first tryout today at separate Democratic and Republican caucuses and drew only mixed reviews.

title: Israel Planning to Build A Third Village in Sinai
description: TEL AVIV, May 1 (Reuters) A new Israeli village will be built in southeastern Sinai, the third such settlement to be set up there since Israel captured Sinai during the 1967 war.

title: Astros Lose Infielder
description: HOUSTON, May 1 (AP)Dave Campbell, an infielder, was placed on the disabled list by the Houston Astros today with an injury to his right hand, received in last night's game against the Chicago Cubs.

title: Mobil Chairman Calls Profits Not Exorbitant or Obscene
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 1Rawleigh Warner Jr., chairman of the Mobil Oil Corporation, old about 300 shareholders at the annual meeting here today that if you take our entire profit away, gasoline would only be about 2 cents a, gallon cheaper.

title: Catholic Charities Marks Its 75th Year in Brooklyn
description: Two thousand supporters of Catholic Charities of the Diocese of Brooklyn gathered at the Americana Hotel here last night to celebrate the 75th anniversary of their agency, salute the collection efforts in the diocese's parishes and confer awards on two persons for unselfish support of human services.

description: Controller Harrison. I. Goldin yesterday demanded that the city be compensated for any takeover by the state of Consolidated Edison facilities in the city in lieu of lost revenues.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The wife of a Fort Monmouth soldier and her 15monthold daughter died in an earlymorning apartment fire in Ocean Township in Monmouth County. Authorities identified the victims as Mrs. Susan Rudolph, 30 years old, and her daughter, Diana. They said George Rudolph, 31, was taken to Paterson Army Hospital in Fort Monmouth to be treated for shock and minor injuries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Isn't it possible that education's financial troubles, and educators withdrawal from issues of substance, are in fact symptoms of profound national doubt regarding the validity of the article of faiththat education and the nation's progress are tied together by policy and fate? title: West Coast Dockworkers End 1 Day Work Stoppage
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 1 (AP)West Coast dockworkers will return to work tomorrow while their union and shippers discuss a demand for a costofliving salary adjustment, the Pacific Maritime Association said tonight.

title: Consumer Notes
description: An official of the Civil Aeronautics Board was quoted this week as deploring the use of doubletalk in airline ticketing regulations. He didn't Mention advertisements, however, but he could have, as a letter from a reader Makes clear.

Taoudini Basin in northwestern Mali is held by Texaco and Exxon has acquired a half interest in it.

title: Warner Comes Out of Obscurity as Bucks Hero
description: MILWAUKEE, May 1  Cornell Warner, who had been unceremoniously dropped by two teams in his fouryear National Basketball Association career, was one of the most valuable Milwaukee Bucks last night as they evened the championship series with the Boston Celtics af one game apiece with a 10596 overtime victory. The next two games are at Boston Friday night and Sunday at a time still to be determned.

title: Blast Falls to Halt Oil Flow In the TransArabia Pipeline
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 1A maintenance station for controlling pressure in the transArabia pipeline Was damaged by an explosion inside Lebanon today but pumping operations were unaffected.

title: Senate, 53 to 42, Supports NoFault Auto Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (UPI) The Senate voted, 53 to 42, today to approve a controversial bill to establish nofault automobile insurance plans in every state. The measure now goes to the House, where its fate is uncertain.

It has any number of recruiting prochutes attesting to rosy employment opportunities in the field. Trouble is, it has no students.

Griffin's Condition Is Called Stable

description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, May 1As a warm surf pounded over the beach today, thousands of Sri Lankans waved flags, ate pineapple, drank pink coconut juice and applauded Government pleas for austerity.

description: On the first day after the end of wage and price controls, producers of several basic products raised prices yesterday. The increases ranged from copper and stainless steel to vitamins and light bulbs age 75.

description: Ira Neimark has been named executive vice president and geneal merchandise manager of B. Altman & Co. Mr. Neimark joined the store in 1969 as vice president and general merchandise manager.

title: About the Yankees
description: Ken Wright, the overweight and underTed pitcher, was optioned to Syracuse and will be replaced by Dave Pagan, also a pitcher, on the Yankee roster. Yesterday was not Jim Mason's first threehit giame in the majors. I had three hits against the Yankees one day last season, said the Yankee shortstop who has been hitting surprisingly well. He would've had a fourth hit, but Rollie Fingers, the Oakland pitcher, deflected his bouncer in the eighth just enough to keep it from going into center field. Ron Blomberg rates Jim (Catfish) Hunter as one of the toughest pitchers for him to hit. I'll bet I haven't got more than three hits off him before this, he said, after striking a homer and a double.

Butterfield, who until becoming Federal Aviation Administrator last year was the White House aide responsible for the tape recording devices there, challenged today a report in The New York Times dealing with Mr. Butterfield's departure yesterday for the West Coast.

description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., May 1The next time you chide yourself for blowing a big lead in tennis, consider Helen Gourlay's match with Evonne Goolagong today: Miss Gourlay led, 76, 5.0, 4030, and lost.

title: Seven Blacks Seized in Zebra Murders
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 1Seven black men were arrested by the police here early today on murder charges, and within hours Mayor Joseph L. Alioto said I am satisfied that we have the men who committed 12 apparently motiveless slayings of whites in five months.

title: Nissan Motor Postponement
description: TOKYO, May 1 (AP)The Nissan Motor Company said today It would postpone selling vehicles equipped with rotary, engines at least until next year Introduction had been scheduled this fall. Nissan officials cited poor fuel economy of rotary engines as the major reason for the postponement.

title: Italian Import Move Seen Imperiling E.E.C. Trade
description: BRUSSELS May. 1Common Market officials in Bruisels said today the measures taken by Italy yesterday to discourage imports of manufactured goods endangered the principle of free trade among the nine members. But they added that Italy ad indicated that she was operating in the spirit of the Rome treaty, the European Economic Community's founding docurnent. This left hope that the move could be reconciled with the interests of the other members and that further erosion in the crisisridden, 16yearold Organization might be avoided.

description: JERSEY CITY, May I (AP)Fire damaged a construction barge and the I,000foot wooden pier of the Continental Oil company along the Hudson River here today. Deputy Fire Chief Frank Wisniewski said the fire had begun on the barge and spread to the pier.

title: NonCompliance
description: As the House Judiciary Committee recognized last night, the simple fact is that President Nixon has failed to comply with a subpoena duly served by the committee. Nor, it seems, does he intend to comply with a subpoena served upon him by the special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski. The subpoenas required the submission of tape recordings, not selective transcripts edited by the person under investigation.

description: ALBANY, May 1Governor Wilson said today that President Nixon should be treated like everyone else in the payment of taxes in New York State.

description: SEOUL, South Korea (Reuters)  An intoxicated paratrooper killed nine persons with a carbine here before killing himself early today. The soldier was reported to have been angered by a recall to barracks.

Ambassador, will give up his posts sock probably in Julyand return home for business and family reasons. The 66yearold Mr. Annenberg, whose Triangle Publications publishes TV Guide, has been Ambassador to Britain since 1969.

description: A dull, vulgar little musical satire titled Kaboom! goes kaplunk. Too bad. The dwindling theater season could have used a bright daisy, especially at a place like Greenwich Village's The Bottom Line, a cabaret showcase that is as clean, spacious and comfortable as can be.

title: 2 Saigon Raids into Cambodia Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 1 (AP)South Vietnamese infantrymen backed by tanks and planes have made incursions into Cambodia at two points along the border west of Saigon, according to military sources and reports from the field.

description: NEW HAVEN, May 1 (UPI) A strike shut down Yale's dining hells today, and the university told its 9,400 students to find their own eating places. Students on prepaid meal plans vfill be given a rebate later.

title: Dr. Bernard Raginsky, Leader In Psychosomatic Medicine, Dies
description: Dr. Bernard Boris Raginsky, Associate physidian and honorary attending physician to the Montreal Jewish General Hospital, died Sunday at his home in Montreal. He was 72 years old.

title: Dave Anderson
description: By now Julius Erving's teammates on the New York Nets have come to expect the unexpected. For him, the spectacular is almost routine; the astonishing is almost ordinary. When the Nets resume their American Basketball Association championship series with the Utah Stars on Saturday night at the Nassau Coliseum, his teammates won't be surprised if he scores 47 points, as he did in the Nets 89.85 victory in Tuesday night's opener And on 45 of those points, his teammates reacted casually. They had seen all the shots beforethe slam dunks, the floating layups, the twisting jump shots. But the other 2 points were something special. The other 2 points occurred on Tuesday night's new move. Dr. J was loping around the left corner in front of the Nets bench when he started to drive the base line. But he was being angled out of bounds by Bruce Seals, the 6foot9inch forward guarding him. Although far behind the plane of the backboard, Dr. J sprang high, reached out with the ball in his right hand and flicked it over Seals outstretched hand, past the side of the backboard and through the orange rim. On the bench, his stunned teammates snapped their heads from side to side. Some even shrieked, Wh00000, Wh000, the way small boys might. His teammates hadn't seen that move before.

title: Auto. Output Down 19.6% Last Month From 1973 Level
description: DETROIT, May 1American auto plants built 677,783 cars last month, a decline of 19.6 per cent from the 843,242 units built in April, 1973. Production last month was the highest so far this year but still left 1974 production more than a million cars behind output in the first four months of 1973.

title: Traffic Deaths Drop 25%
description: CHICAGO, May 1 (AP)Traffic fatalities dropped 25 per cent in March, and lower driving speeds were an importent factor in the decline, the National Safety Council said yesterday. Vincent Tofany, council president, said there were 3,240 traffic deaths in March this year, compared with 4,320 in March, 1973.

title: Dance: An Unusual Turn

title: SOVIET LAMPOONS DISSIDENT DEBATE
description: MOSCOW, May 1A prominent Soviet weekly has dismissed as delirium the debate between Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the exiled writer, and Andrei Sakharov, the physicist over the future course for the Seviet Union.

title: SUPERIORS CLEAR POLICE SERGEANT
description: A police sergeant who is under. Federal indictment on corruption charges was found not guilty of substantially the same charges in a Police Department trial and was allowed to retire yesterday with A $10,000ayear pension.

title: Nixon's I Want It Out Order Touched Off Flurry of Movement
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (AP) I want it out. Get going. With those six words, Richard M. Nixon is said to have relayed to his aides his decision to release to the public edited transcripts of dozens of his private Watergate conversations.

title: Toros Triumph, 53, Take Series Lead
description: TORONTO, May 1 (UPI) Brit Selby, Billy Orr and Jack Gibson scored their first goals of the World Hockey Asscoiation tonight as the Toronto Toros gained a 53 victory over the Chicago Cougars.

title: SENATE REJECTS A MOVE TO RENEW WAGEPRICE CURB
description: WASHINGTON, May 1ln a decisive expression of dislike for wage and price controls, the Senate voted tonight, 57 to 31, against a proposal to give the Nixon Administration authority to reimpose the controls that expired at midnight last night.

title: ANTHONY H. FRANCIS
description: Anthony Hyde Francis, who retired in 1967 as vice president and national advertising director of Westchester Rockland Newspapers, Inc., died Tuesday in a White Plains nursing home. He was 81 years old and lived at 43 Beechwood Road, Hartsdale, N.Y.

title: Commission Bars Split Derby; 22 Entries Expected for Race
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 1While a field of 40 Belgian draft horses prepared to pull a circus bandwagon in toinorrow's Pegasus Parade, controversial steps were taken at Churchill Downs today to prevent a similar traffic jam in Saturday's 100th Kentucky Derby.

title: College and School Results
description: BASEBALL TRACK AND FIELD

title: HOUSE BILL EXTENDS LIFE OF TV LICENSES
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (AP) The House approved a bill today to grant radio and television broadcast licenses for five years instead of the present three and to require the Fedreal Communications Commission to streamline its procedures in determining license awards.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Yonkers Results

title: 2 in Wyoming to Be Executed
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., May 1 (UPI)Two men convicted of murdering an 11yearold girl and raping her halfsister have been sentenced to die in the gas chamber under a new Wyoming law. Judge John Raper today sentenced Jerry Lee Jenkins, 29 year old and Ronald Leroy Kennedy, 27, both of Casper, Wyo., to die before sunrise Sept. 25.

title: Music
description: The Fine Arts Chamber Orchestra of New York, an ensemble formed recently under the auspices of the Association for Arts and Culture and under the musical direct tion of Ronald Isaac, gave its first'midtown concert in Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night.

title: Albany Votes Bill to Free Port Unit for Mass Transit
description: ALBANY, May 1With virtually no debate, the Assembly voted unanimously today to give final legislative approval to a measure that would repeal the restrictive covenants that bar the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey from Ispending its funds on unprofitable masstransportation projects.

title: Nadjari Alleges Hindrance By U.S. Attorney Curran
description: State Prosecutor Gets a Court Order Aimed at Obtaining the Testimony of a Witness Reported in Custody

title: Backers Give Nixon Long Petition
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (AP) A 20ftfootlong petition of support was unrolled in President Nixon's Oval Office today as he met with backers from across the country.

title: News Plans Automation Monday II Printers Continue Slowdown
description: The Daily News, hampered by 13 days of slowdown by its printers, served notice yesterday that it would begin to use automated typesetting processes next Monday if the job action continued and there was no substantial progress in contract negotiations.

title: SOURCES SAY COLSON SPURNED PLEA OFFER
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (UPI) Charles W. Colson reportedly refused an offer from the special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, to plead guilty to A misdemeanor.

title: Mrs. Steers Wed to Michael Straight
description: Mrs. Nina Gore Auchincloss Steers and Michael Whitney Straight of Washington, deputy chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts, were married here at noon yesterday in St. Martin's Chapel at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine. The Right Rev. Paul Moore Jr., Episcopal Bishop of New York, performed the ceremony.

title: Adler Will Tighten School Supervision Of Sex Study Films
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker, displeased by the recent showing at a Bronx high school df a filmstrip explicity depicting sexual acts, said yesterday that he Was taking steps to tighten supervision over the use of sexeducation materials in the schools.

title: Peron Criticizes His Leftist Backers
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 1 President Juan Domingo Peron silenced chantiug left wing Peronists it May Day erowd today with a new attack on them and anexpressionof full support for his conservative followers.

title: If It's Variety You re After, There's Nothing Like Ninth Avenue
description: A few days ago we reCeived Communication from the secretary of a library association. It contained a form letter directed to men and women in various professions asking what they Would do on a busman's holiday in Midtown if they had one day in New York.

title: Fast and Peculiar Profits Charged in Tocks Project
description: TRENTON, May 1Two Federal offices have been asked to investigate land Aransactions in the Tocks Island Dam area that allegedly netted some realestate agents, quick resale profits from public funds and deprived other landowners of fair prices for their property.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: TollBooth Holdup
description: With the aid of a complaisant State Legislature, a skillfully engineered exercise in armed robbery is on the verge of execution at the toll booths of the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority. The union representing the 600 toll collectors has lobbied a bill making them pistolpacking peace officers through both the State Senate and the Assembly.

title: U.S Electricity Subsidy Here Backed
description: WASHINGTON, May 1John C. Sawhill, director of the Federal Energy Office, said today that he supported temporary Federal subsidies to ease the soaring cost of tecWelty in New York City.

title: Haldeman Wants Access To Original Nixon Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (UPI) H. R. Haldeman, the former White House chief of staff, asked the United States District Court today to permit him to inspect and test the original tapes of all his conversations with President Nixon to help him prepare a defense in the Watergate coverup case.

title: Moscow Dis patch Erred in Reporting Criticism of Turks
description: MOSCOW, MayThe Soviet Communist party newspaper Pravda has not accused Turkey of supporting Kurdish rebels in northern Iraq, as was reported in The New York Times on April 27.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NOSY It's not nosiness, it's charity. The Arthritis Foundation's New York chapter today legitimizes traipsing through five homes of very welltodo New Yorkers to get a glimpse of how the lessthanonepercent live.

title: Personal Finance Tax and Disability
description: The Internal Revenue Service, in a significant reversal of longstanding tax policy,. has decided to liberalize its treatment of disability pension benefits.

title: City Opera, in Capital, Finds Its Tour Work but Fun
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 We aren't this lively ever in New York, said Ruth Welting, the young soprano from Memphis who will sing the leading role of Lucia di Lammermoor in two performances here. We all come out here and we act crazy.

title: ExUnion President Sentenced To 3 Months in Embezzlement
description: Peter Ottley, the former president of Local 144 of the Hotel, Hospital, Nursing Home and Allied Service Employes Union, was sentenced yesterday in Federal District Court to three months in prison, probation for two years and a fine of $15,000 for aiding and abetting the embezzlement of union funds and failure to maintain adequate union finerncial records.

title: Legislature's Court Plan Is Denounced by Breitel
description: ALBANY, May 1Chief Judge Charles D. Breitel of the Court of Appeals today denounced the Legislature and, by implication, Governor Wilson for their handling of the courtreform issue.

title: Most Papers Printing Parts of Transcripts
description: Most of the nation's newspapers are printing excerpts or summaries of the 1,200 pages of transcripts of Presidential conversations released by the White House, an Associated Press spot check shows.

title: O.A.S. Parley Ends
description: ATLANTA, May 1 (ReuTers)  The Organization of American States ended a twoweek conference here today.

title: Mrs. Mitchell Demanding Tapes
description: Mrs. John N. Mitchell, dissatisfied with President Nixon's substitution of edited transcripts for the White House tapes, called upon newspapers and members of Congress yesterday to press for what she called the real thing.

title: MILTON A. SENN
description: LOS ANGELES, May 1 (UPI) Milton A. Senn, lawyer, Jewish leader and Government consultant, died Sunday at age 60.

title: Nixon Defense 'Scenario' Devised in One Morning
description: WASHINGTON, May 1It was April 16, 1973. The day before, President Nixon had been told by senior Justice Department officials that a number of White House officials were involved in the Watergate coverup.

title: Handcuffs Are Upheld For Attica Defendants
description: A State Supreme Court justice ruled yesterday that the 13 defendants in the Attica uprising could continue to be handcuffed behind their backs during the walk from the Erie County Court building in Buffalo to the Holding Center. He said he made the walk himself without any difficulty.

title: Union Aide Hurt in Crash
description: GENEVA, N. Y. May 1 (UPI) The car of Theodore Wenzl president of they State Civil Service Einployes Association, swerved off the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway and rammed an abutment today. He was listed in fair condition with multiple injuries at Geneva General Hospital following the single car accident.

title: 117 INDICTED HERE IN GAMING INQUIRY
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn declared yesterday that a major dent bad been put into operations of all five organizedcrime families in the city with the indictment of 117 persons allegedly involved in illegal gambling grossing at least $1billion a year.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Sunny skies will cover the Northeast today. Showers and thundershowers will spread from the Carolinas and Ohio Valley to northwestern Florida and southeastern Texas. Showers will prevail in the upper lake region, and over Montana and the northern Rockies; showers will be widely scattered in the central Rockies. Skies will be mostly sunny elsewhere. Cool or cooler temperatures are expected in the Northeast and. Atlantic States, ad fiom the northern Rockies and great basin to California. Warmer weather will occur from the Plains States to the southern plateau region.

title: Breitel Scores Legislature Court Plans
description: ALBANY, May 1Chief Judge Charles D. Breitel of the Court of Appeals today denounced the Legislature and, by implication, Governor Wilson for their handling of the courtreform issue.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A motorist who said he had been beaten by Newark policemen when he refused to pay them off for safe passa ge through the city has won a fiveyear fight to prove that he was the victim of police brutality. In an unusual settlement expected to be given final approval next week by Judge James A. Coolahan of Federal District Court in Newark, the City of Newark has awarded $135,000 in damagis to the motorist, Elmer Dunning, 49 years old, of Harrison.

title: Copies of Nixon's Transcripts Sold Out in Capital in 3 Hours
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 Eight hundred copies of the edited transcripts of President Nixon's Watergate conversations went on sale here today at the Government Printing Office Bookstore. The supply was sold out in a little more than three hours.

title: BP Lifts Gasoline Price By 6 Cents a Gallon
description: The BP Oil Company, Ltd., raised yesterday the price of gasoline at wholesale by 6 cents a gallon. The company said it would advance the price of heating oil and diesel fuel by 7 cents a gallon. The Standard Oil Company (Ohio) announced a similar advance in gasoline price.

title: Joseph Murphy Dies at 69; Retired Con Ed Executive
description: Joseph F. Murphy, a, retired assistant vice president of the Consolidated Edison Company of New York, died yesterday in a West Palm Beach hospital. He was 69 years old and lived in West Palm Beach.

title: Music: Season's Finale
description: course, the baritone soloist, standing in the middle of the four players while singing.

title: HOUSE FACES BAR ONNIXON MATERIAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 1James D. St. Clair, special counsel to President Nixon, indicated today that the White House would resist turning over to the House Judiciary Committee the additional material it has requested in its impeachment inquiry.

title: Election Campaign Brings Forward New French Communist
description: PARIS, May 1Pierre Dubois is a new member of the French Communist party. He it 29 years old, tall and handsome, with a sprightly face and winning ways. He comes from what he calls a favored familyupper middleclass, intelligent, sophisticated and affectionate.

title: ESSEX JAIL OFFICER TIED TO DRUG SALE
description: NEWARK, May 1 (AP)An Essex County correction officer, one of several who criticized conditions in the EsseX County Jail, was arrested today and charged with selling drugs to inmate informers.

title: BENDIX SETTLEMENT ENDSFORD SHUTDOWN
description: DETROIT, May 1(UPI)The Ford Motor Company today revised plans that would have idled 37,000 workers as a strike at a key parts supplier neared an end, A spokesman for the company said all its car assembly operations would be back to normal Monday.

title: Handicapped Program Set
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 (AP) The Joseph P. Kennedy Jr. Foundation has developed a program of physical fitness, play and recreation for mentally retarded and physically handicapped children that will be distributed nationally, the organization announced today.

title: KLEIN ASKS MORE FOR FARMLANDS
description: Seekss an Added $15Million for Suffolk Open Space

title: Ford Defends Opposition To 72 Watergate Inquiry
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., May 1Vice President Ford said today that he was only carrying out my responsibility in the fall of 1972 when he helped to undo the first Congressional investigation of the Watergate breakin.

description: Deaths

title: Nixon's Lawyers Ask Court to Quash Jaworski Writ for Tapes and Records
description: WASHINGTON, May 1President Nixon's lawyers asked the United States District Court today to quash the special Watergate prosecution subpoena for tapes and records of 64 White House conversations relating to the Watergate coverup.

title: Portuguese Town Takes Deep Breath of New Air
description: GUIMARAES, Portugal, May 1The main square of this northern hill town, with its 16thcentury facades, began to fill up by midmorning. Not a seat was available at the Cafe Dural and the noise of shouted conversations was deafening, The voltune has been turned up all ever Portugal.

title: HAROLD J. GORDON
description: Harold J. Gordon, an investment banker, died Saturday evening at his home in Chicago. He was 79 years old.

title: WILLIAM E. STRAHL
description: William. E. Strahl, founder and president of the Babylon Chemical Company and a partner in Strahl & pitsch, wax refiners in Babylon, L. I., died Tuesday of a heart attack at his home, 23. Priory Lane, Pelham Manor, N.Y. His age was 55.

title: Southern Pacific Shows 20% Rise In Quarter Profits
description: The Southern Pacific Company reported yesterday a first quarter net profit of $17million or 64 cents a share, a 20 per cent gain over the like 1978 period. Benjamin F. Biaggint S.P.'s president in announcing the quarter's results noted that the gain was not the result of the company's transportation operationsthe Southern Pacific operates the second largest railroad in terms of revenues in the country and also has a trucking and a pipeline subsidiary but due to improved nontransportation earnings.

title: Fires in Yonkers Suspend Service On Hudson Division
description: About 8,000 Penn Central commuters were caught in a suspension of service on the line's Hudson Division during the rushhour last night because of a series of major fires in Yonkers.

title: Grioles Strike Out On Two Protests
description: BOSTON, May. 1 (UPI)Earl Weaver manager of the Baltimore Orioles, was informed today that his protest of two games with the New York Yankees was disallowed.

title: Syrian Leader Rules Out Looking to the West for Arms
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, April 29 Syria has no intention of following Egypt's lead by diversifying the sources of her arms supplies, which at present are almost entirely Soviet. At the same time, Moscow has assured Damascus that it favors a just solution of the ArabIsraeli problem.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Films Music Dance Cabaret

title: Soviet Ships Visit Cuba
description: NORFOLK, Va., May 1 (AP)Two Soviet destroyers, a ballistic missile submarine and a tanker have arrived at Havana, the Atlantic Command in Norfolk said today.

title: Defense Concern and Chairman Fined in Illegal Campaign Gift
description: WASHINGTON, May 1 .A major defense contractor for the Government and the chairman of the concern's board of directors pleaded guilty today to charges of illegally contributing $150,000 in company funds to President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: Screen: Lee Marvin Commands 'The Spikes Gang':The Cast
description: "The Spikes Gang," which opened yesterday at the Trans-Lux West and other theaters, is a Western about an elderly desperado and the three young farm boys he tries, unsuccessfully, to turn into bank robbers.It's a movie without a center, with no coherent tone, directed by Richard Fleischer, fresh from such triumphs as "The Don Is Dead" and "Soylent Green." Mr. Fleischer is incapable of sustaining even minimal audience interest in the material. During something as basic as a chase one's mind is likely to notice the cloud coverings.The screenplay by Irving Ravetch and Harriet Frank Jr. is no help. It's nominally based on a novel by thors don't hesitate to lift a thors don't hestitate to lift a line ("Money is like manure. . . .") most recently used in "Hello, Dolly."The film stars Lee Marvin, as the old desperado, and Gary Grimes, Ron Howard and Charlie Martin Smith, as the boys, but none are of particular help, either. The entire enterprise is as convincing as the Spanish landscapes, which are meant to suggest the American Southwest but don't.

title: Advertising: Market Shelf
description: There are no losers in this program, believe it or not, said William. F. X. Byrne, dapper former head of the New York office of Gardner Advertising, who now, among other things, is a senior vice president of the Market Shelf.

title: Metropolitan in Auto Plan
description: The Metropolitan Life Insurance Company said it had begun the sale of auto insurance, beginning in Rhode Island and Connecticut. J. Albert Burgoyne, president of Metropolitan Property and Liability, said sales of home insurance would follow.

title: People and Business Forecast on Labor Challenged
description: The United States, will not experience major labor problems in 1974, according to B. J. Widick, professor of industrial relations at the Columbia University. Graduate School of Business.

title: Cowboys Win Injunction Against W.F.L. Raids
description: The National Fobtball League Yesterday, had a good day in its ongoing battle with the upstart World Football League. In Dallas a judge granted the Cowboys of the N.F.L. on injunction forbidding W.F.L., clubs from signing any more Cowboys to future contracts.

title: DEPUTY WARDEN JOB GOES TO A MURDERER
description: NEW HAVEN, May 1 (AP)Dennis Guayi who once pleaded guilty to seconddegree murder, has been named deputy warden of the Connecticut Correctional Center on Whalley Avenue here.

title: Soviet Tells China To Free Helicopter Or Face Retaliation
description: MOSCOW, May 2 (UPI)The Soviet Union demanded today that China immediately return a helicopter and its three crewmen or suffer inevitable consequences of this provocative stand, the official press agency, Tass, reported.

title: SUSPECT ACQUITTED IN MUSLIM SLAYINGS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI) One of five defendants on trial for the murder of seven Hanafi Muslims last year was ordered acquitted today after prosecutors conceded there was not enough evidence for a guilty verdict.

description: Herewith a few notes on a couple of new French restaurants, one of which I'm pretty sure you will enjoy, while the otherI dunno.

title: CON EDISON IS SUED ON BOND STATEMENT
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York, Inc., said yesterday that, along, with six managing underwriters, it had been sued over alleged defects in its registration statement on $150million of first and refunding 9 per cent 30year mortgage bonds, Reuters reported.

description: Prices of Commodity Futures

description: LA JOLLA, Calif., May 2Baroness Margaret von Soosten, opera patron, philanthropist and one of the founders of the Lily Cup Company, died early yesterday at Scripps Memorial Hospital. She was 79 years old.

title: BOMB KILLS 4 IN BAR IN ULSTER TERRORISM
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 2 (AP)Terrorists threw a bomb into a crowded bar tonight, killing four persons and injuring at least 20, the police reported.

title: Marathon Raises Gas Price
description: The Marathon Oil Company said yesterday it would increase its gasoline price to dealers and wholesale customers by 4.3 cents a gallon. The company did not announce any price moves affecting other products.

title: Britain is Sarting WideRanging Inquiry on the Press
description: LONDON, May 2The Government announced today a wide inquiry into the British press, focusing on economic problems as well as editorial standards.

title: Retail Store Sales Gain
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Department of Commerce reported today that the department store sales last week were an estimated $1,003,000,000, up 10 per cent from the yearearHer $908,000,000. Total retail store sales were about $10,111,000,000, up 6 per cent from last year's $9,552,000,000.

title: U.S. Industry Increases 74 Spending Plans 19%
description: American industry plans to spend $119.1billion for new plant and equipment this year, an increase of 19.4 per cent compared with 1973, McGrawHill Publications said yesterday.

description: WASHINGTON, May 2The United States Treasury today auctioned 52week bills at an average rate of 8.421 per cent.

description: John G. Phillips, president and chief executive officer of the Louisiana Land and Exploration Company, has been elected to the additional post of chairman. He succeeds Ford M. Graham, who has retired.

description: WASHINGTON, May 2 Twenty major drug concerns gave doctors more than two billion free samples of drugs last year the Senate health subcommittee says it has learned.

description: Remember Homer Jones? The New York Stars of the World Football league are going to bring Homer back to this city for the coming football season with the hope that Jones, now 33 years old, can still run.

title: CITY DELAYS STAND ON CENTER PLAN
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration acknowledged yesterday that it was trying to get, around state, guidelines that say it must take a stand before public hearings are held on how the proposed $200million convention center on the Hudson River would affect the airpollution problem here.

title: REPORT ON A TAPE DENIED BY ALBERT
description: WASHINGTON, May. 2 (AP) Calling it complete fiction, the House Speaker, Carl Albert, has denied a statement in White Houseedited tape transcripts that he ordered a General Accounting Office audit of Republican campaign practices.

description: A twoyear study by the National Urban League has found widespread racial bias in the boast Guard.

description: Joe Frazier and Jerry Quarry, respectively the second and thirdranking heavyweight contenders, will clash in a 12round bout at Madison Square Garden June 17 as part of a closedcircuit television doubleheader, it was announcedyesterday by Teddy Brenner, the Garden boxing president.

description: A reporter for The New York Daily News and a, reporter for The Wall Street Journal have been named to receive Columbia University's 1974 Meyer Berger Award.

title: MUST AUTOMATE THE TIMES INSISTS
description: Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, chairman and president of The New York Times Company, declared yesterday that he was determined to modernize The Times and to give stockholders operating margins they deserve.

description: DALLAS, May 2 (AP)Homero Blancas, with eagles on two of the last nine holes and nine oneputt greens, surged to the firstround lead of the $150,000 Byron Nelson golf tournament today with a sixunderpar 65.

title: Study of G.H.I. Doctors Finch Only 29% Accept $5 Office Fee
description: A survey of individual family physicians listed as participating in a Group Health, Inc., medical insurance plan has disclosed that only 29 per cent accept the G.H.I. allotment of $5 for an office visit as payment in full, although all participating physicians ere supposed to do so.

title: Nixon Inaction on Nevada BreakIn Cited
description: WASHINGTON, May 2President Nixon was told more than a year ago by his two top assistants of a burglary at the office of a Las Vegas newspaper publisher, but neither he nor the aides, H. R. Haldeman and John D. Ehrlichman, informed the Justice Department, according to well placed sources there.

title: DEPlIOGRAMMER OF YOUTH GUILTY
description: DENVER, play 2Ted Patrick, who calls himself a deprogrammer of wayviard young people, was found guilty last night of falsely imprison, ing two young Denver women.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 2 (AP)The United States Ambassador, Graham A. Martin, said today that the airline of the Central Intelligence Agency had been used to transport North Vietnamese prisoners, but he denied that this, represented a violation of the ceasefire terms.

title: Former Stella Wright Tenants Say Noisy, Undisciplined Children Were Major Irritation
description: NEWARKIt was not just the upswept halls and uncollected garbage in the troubled Stella Wright houses that had bothered many of its former tenants. Nor was it just the leaky pipes and roofs, the frequent elevator breakdowns or the urine on the stairways.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: An arbitration pariel ruled yesterday that suspensions and a fine imposed by the, Cincinnati Reds against Bobby Tolan an outfielder, last season were unjustifed. The Reds traded Tolan to the San Diego padres during the offseason after he was fined and suspended for allegedly failing to keep a medical appointment, reported insubordination and abusive language and alleged lack of interest in battitig and fielding practice.

description: The demand for borrowed money continues to mushroom, driving some key shortterm interest rates to their highest levels on record, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

description: ALBANY, May 2The State Court of Appeals ruled today that all prison inmates must be given a full hearing before being placed in solitary confinement in any prison in the state.

title: Lee Myles Accused of Using Stolen Parts for Repairs
description: The chief officer and the former operations manager of Lee Myles Transmissions, one of the largest transmission repair franchise companies in the country, were arrested yesterday and, charged with possession of 180 stolen, latemodel automobile engines and transmissions.

title: Lee Myles Accused of Using Stolen Parts for Repairs
description: The chief officer and the former operations manager of Lee Myles Transmissions, one of the largest transmission  repair franchise companies in the country, were arrested yesterday and, charged with possession of 180 stolen, latemodel automobile engines and transmissions.

title: Hokkaido, an Wile Fronter for Japan
description: SAPPORO, JapanThis norhtorn island of Hokkaido, long a backward agricultural region in Japan, has become the country's new industrial frontier. It is one of the few areas in Japan with any open space.

title: Agitate Draws Rail for Derby
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky, May 2The countdown for Saturday's 100th Kentucky Derby began dramatically at Churchhill Downs today when an entry clerk called out, Number 8 is J.R.'s Pet.

title: OFFICER ACQUITTED IN MIDTOWN SLAYING
description: A suspended police officer who shot and killed an alleged pimp in an altercation on midtown street in 1971 has been acquitted of charges of criminally negligent homicide and perjury in the case.

title: SCHLESINGER'S BOOK WINS HILLMAN PRIZE
description: Artur M. Schlesinger Jr., the historian and writer, is among seven recipients of the 24th annual Sidney Hillman Foundanun Awards presented for outstanding achievement in mass communication during 1973.

title: Le Petit Theatre de Jean Renoir, C'est Merveilleux
description: LE PETIT THEATRE DE JEAN, RENOIR (The Little Theater of Jean Renoir), directed and narrated by Jean Renoir; screenplay (French with English subtitles) by Renoir; editor, Genevieve Winding; director of photography. Georges Leclerc; produced for French tplevision by Son et Lumiere and the Jean Renoir Company; distributed by Phoenix'Films. Running time: 100 minutes. At the First Avenue Screening Room, near 61st Street. This film has not been rated.

title: News Suzrzmary and Index FRIDAY, MAY 3, 1974
description: Administration officials said the United States and the Soviet Union had begun negotiations on a treaty for a limited ban on underground nuclear testinga project that has been sporadically discussed since 1958. Officials said it was hoped to have a treaty ready for signing during President Nixon's planned visit to the Soviet, Union, probably at the end of June. [1:5.]

title: Legistors Call Criticism by Breitel On CourtReform Proposals Unethical
description: ALBANY, May  Mem hers of the Legislature opene a bipartisan counterattack ?? chief Judge Charles D preite of the Court of Appeals today accusing him of violating judi cial ethics in his criticism o the Legislature's courtreforn package.

title: U.S. REBUKES ITALY ON IMPORT ACTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The State Department issued a mild rebuke to the Government of Italy today for its sudden imposition last Tuesday of sharp import controls to check rampant inflation.

title: CoverUp II
description: In his public statements, President Nixon has insisted that, once apprised of the Watergate coverup on March 21, 1973, he bent every effort toward full disclosure. The second installment of the transcripts of the White House tapes as published yesterday in The Times offers persuasive proof that, far from aiming at disclosure, the huddles in the Oval Office sought feverishly to keep the truth from reaching the American people.

title: Insurer Pays Woman $148,000 After Lawyer Took First Check
description: NEWARK, May 2 (AP)  A young woman who lost her leg in a freak boating accident, and then lost a $148,000 insurance payteent when her lawyer absconded, received her money today by order of Judge James A. Colahan in Federal District court.

title: City and State Chided. As Lax on Air Quality
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Past and present New York City and state administrations were criticized by an environmental group today for what was called absence of leadership in implementing a federally required transpoigation plan to reduce air pollution in the New York City area.

title: PALOMAR MORTGAGE SETS LOAN RESERVE
description: Trustees of Palomar Mortgage investors of San Diego said yesterday that the cornpany would set up a $2million reserve to cover any losses on its loan to Family Loan, Inc., of Springfield,. Mo. Creation of the reserve, it was said, will Prevent any trust distribution payments in the second and third quarters of the current fiscal year ending Nov. 30.

title: SchoolAid Inequities
description: Concerned citizens from propertypoor communities who had hoped that the Legislature would address the basic problems created by the unequal, distribution of taxable wealth) among New York State's 760 school districts were disappointed by the $2.88billion elementary and secondary school aid package approved last week. The new formula, although more beneficial to poor districts than the present arrangement, leaves in existence a system whereby property owners in many school districts pay larger taxes than residents of neighboring districts, yet still have less money per pupil available.

title: The. Pop Life
description: Mott the Hoopla and Queen, who will play six shows at the Uris Theaternext week, are the hardest rocking groups yet to appear on Broadway. But they are part of a larger trend that will see more and more pop music acts in theaters formerly reserved for theatrical productions.

title: Ehrlichman Wins Delay on Coast Perjury Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, May 2 (AP) A Superior Court judge agreed today to delay John D. Ehrlichman's perjury trial until after he was tried on Federal charges in the Daniel Ellsberg breakin case, but the judge refused to move the perjury trial from Los Angeles.

title: PAUL WE LOE YOU. WE'RE WORRIED. PLEASE LET US KNOW YOU'RE O.K. MOM DAD. BINGO.Advt.
description: PAUL WE LOE YOU. WE'RE WORRIED. PLEASE LET US KNOW YOU'RE O.K. MOM DAD. BINGO.Advt.

title: The Bell Stays Home
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 2 (AP)The Philadelphia Bell, after a week of indecision, will retain its World Football League franchise and operate in Philadelphia in 1974. Bell investors became discouraged when the team failed to obtain the University of Pennsylvania's 70,000seat Franklin Field as a playing site. The Bell will play in 100,000seat John F. Kennedy Stadium.

title: Legislature Approves Bill to Fund State Campaigns
description: TRENTON, May 2  The Assembly gave final legislative approval, 49 to 22, tonight to a bill that would provide for public financing of gubernatorial campaigns. It sent the bill to Gov Byrne for his signature.

title: N.B.A. Championship
description: Boston vs. Milwaukee

title: PANEL DECLINES TO INDICT CORSO
description: A Brooklyn grand jury investigating a closely contested Democratie primary in 1972 has voted not to indict a judge who allegedly permittedl fraudulent votes to be cast. District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn said yesterday.

title: Court Hearing Wednesday On Subpoena by Jaworski
description: WASHINGTON; May 2 Judge John J. Sirica today scheduled a hearing for 10 A.M., Wednesday on arguments on whether President Nixon must honor the latest subpoena from the Watergate special prosecutor's office.

title: At Every On Parlor, Derby Bettors Are Off
description: Carol. Charming, the entertainer, joiied Paul R. Screvane, the president of the New York City Offtrack Betting Corporation, yesterday at the Penn Station branch office for the opening betting ceremonies for the Kentucky Derby.

title: Widespread Bias in Coast Guard Found in Urban League Survey
description: A twoyear study by the National Urban League has found widespread racial bias in the boast Guard.

title: U. S. Jaclge Is Unable to Resolve NacliariCurran Dispute on Leuci
description: After deploring the unseemly quarrel between the Special State Prosecutor and the United States Attorney here, a Federal judge tried and failed yesterday to arrange a closeddoor settlement on access to an undercover anticorruption witness.

title: LISBON AMNESTIES MILITARY EVADERS
description: LISBON, May 2Portugal's military junta decreed an amnesty today for thousands of military deserters and draft dodgers who had sought to evade duty in the country's wars In the African territories.

title: DAISY DARLING
description: Daisy Darling, an actress of the nineteentwenties and the widow of Dr. Walter. Zeitz, Brooklyn dentist, died Monday of cancer at her home in Canoga Park, Calif. She was 67 years old.

description: Morning

title: Ward, a Lindsay Holdover, Resigns as Traffic Chief
description: One of the holdover Lindsay aides, Traffic Commissioner Benjamin Ward, resigned yetterday.

title: Yunich Now M.T.A.'s Chief Motorman
description: David L. Yunich took office yesterday as Chairman and chief executiye officer of the Metropolita'a Transportation Authority; and said he was interested in such marketint ideas 0. cheaper transit fare 10 offpeak hours.

description: College Baseball

title: A Key Democrat in Cook County Is Indicted by Jury in Land Deal
description: CHICAGO, May 2  Alderman Thomas E. Keane, floor leader in the City Council for Mayor Richard J. Daley and the second most powerful man in the Cook County Democratic machine, was indicted today by a Federal grand jury on charges of conspiracy and mail fraud.

title: HENRY T. ZWIRNER
description: Henry T. Zwirner, retired vice president and Midwest director of Fairchild Publications, Inc., publisher of Women's Wear Daily and other trade journals, died yesterday, apparently of heart attack, in his home in Deerfield, Ill. He was 70 years old.

title: Dr. Ebbe Munck, 69, Dead; Danish Resistance Leader
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, May 2 (AP)Dr. Ebbe Munck, veteran Arctic exporer, journalist and diplomat who became Nazioccupied Denmark's chief spokesman in the free world during World War II, died today after a brief illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Patman Runs Hard, Haunted By His 1928 Campaign Slogan
description: TEXARKANA, Tex., May 2Soon after Wright Patman entered Congress in 1929, he spoke out for the impeachment of Andrew Mellon, as Secretary of the Treasury. He still feels that way about big bankers.

title: Tigers Box Score
description: Tigers Box Score

title: SENATE VOTES RISE IN PAY OF CABINET
description: TRENTON, May 2  The State Senate today approved a compromise oneyear, $3,000 annual pay increase for the heads of governmental departments. The measure was sent to the Assembly.

title: Market Place: A Report on I.B.M. Stock
description: For some months Internetional Business Machines, an investor's darling, has been buffeted by the illwinds that have affected stocks generally.

description: New York569808

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 2If nothing else, the transcripts of Richard Nixon's conversations have shown how hollow the once magic invocation of the words national security can be. It may well be that Mr. Nixon unwittingly has done the public the great service of destroying that phrase as a useful tool of Presidential deception.

title: Wilson Spurns Aides Advice to Make Rent Proposals Politically Palatable
description: ALBANY, May 2  Governor Wilson's rent proposals, which have angered landlords and [tenants alike, were very much the product of the Governor's own thinking, interviews disclosed today.

title: Petersen Ties With Nixon Reportedly Led to 73 Rift
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The original Watergate prosecutors broke off all contacts with the Justice Department in April, 1973, after Henry E. Petersen, an Assistant Attorney General, refused their demands that he end his close association with President Nixon, authoritative sources said today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A survey of individual family physicians listed as participating in a Group Health, Inc., medical insurance plan has diclosed that only 29 per cent accept the G.H.I. allotment of $5 for an office as payment in full, although all participating physicians are supposed to do so. The patients were asked to make up the difference between the fee and the $5 allotment.

title: Delay on lndemnnity Bill Vote
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI) Leaders of the House Agriculture Committee have delayed a final vote on a bill to pay Mississippi Poultry producers indemnities for 7.5 million contaminated chicken because the measure faced certain Hodge defeat in its present form. On Thursday sponsors of the measure were urged to seek agreements on modifying the bill before bringing it back for a committee vote next Monday.

title: Dance: Decade of Gain
description: The Pennsylvania Ballet is now, remarkably enough, 10 yuars old. During its decade of achievement the company, difected by Barbara Weiseberger, with Robert Rodham and, later, Benjamin Harkervy, as the two associate directors, has both changed and developed. It is now one off the hesttrained troupes in Ithe country, and it proceeded to demonstrate that at last night's opening to its fourday engagement at the of Music.

title: Viernamese Sides Battle  In Cambodia for 3d Day
description: MOC HOA, South Vietnam, May 2Fighting between North Vietnairiese and South Vietnamese troops inside Cambodia contiinidd for the third day today.

title: MILK PRICERULING LINKED TO 72 GIFT
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Investigators for the House Judiciary Committee have apparently constructed a chain of circumstantial evidence that they contend links President Nixon's 1971 decision to raise Government milk price supports to a pledge by dairy industry groups to give $2pillion to the President's reelection campaign.

title: Witness Changes Testimony in Trot Fixing Case
description: The trial of 12 harness drivers and nine gamblers acctised of fixing superfecta races at Roosevelt and Yonkers Raceways in 1973 took on a bit of a baseball theme yesterday when Joseph (Bear) Pullmans originally considered as the prosectition's key witness, repudiated part of his grand jury testimony.

title: Deaths
description: ALTMANLoulsWe mourn the passing of our good friend and regular worshipper, the father of our devoted board member, Jay Altman. We extend our deepest SYMpathy to the bereaved family.

title: 700 UNION LEADERS ARRESTED IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, May 2Seven hundred union leaders were arrested today in a Government move aimed at heading off a crippling railroad strike threatened for Monday.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 41

title: Haig, on Nixon's Order, Refuses Questions of Watergate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., the Presidential chief of staff, refused to answer questions before the Senate Watergate committee today, Senate sources said.

title: County Attorney Named
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 2John F. O'Shaughnessy of Seaford was appointed by Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso today as the new County Attorney. Mr. O'Shaughnessy replaces Joseph Jaspan of Woodmere, whose appointment as a Court of Claims judge by Governor Wilson was confirmed by the State Senate on Monday.

title: Trail of Blood
description: Yoshiro Harada's strong, brooding performance as a reformed derelict in Old Japan who is goaded into his murderous, sword  swinging specialty gives strength to Trail of Blood, part one, which opened yesterday and plays through Saturday (with Kurosawa's Sanjuro) in the Regency Theater's Cinema East festival of Japanese films. Part two will follow late this month.

title: Music: Youthful Bartok
description: The Metropolitan Opera will be staging MIR Bartk's Bluebeard's Castle, in a month or so, during its June Festival, but close to 3,000 listeners  the capacity of Carnegie Hallgot a preview of it on Wednesday night. A cncert version was on the program of the Chicago symphony Orchestra, conducted by Georg Solti.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Ticketron Corporation, losing money because of lagging New Jersey daily lottery sales, will reducd the number of lottery vending machines by 40 per cent.

title: Texts of Documents Sent to White House to Justify Judiciary Panel's Bid for Tapes on Milk and I.T.T. Cases
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Following are documents sent to the White House on April 19 by lawyers for the House Judiciary Committee outlining the reasons for seeking tape , recordings and documents that bear on President Nixon's decision to raise milk price supports and on the settlement of Government antitrust action against the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation in 1971:

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: OAKDALE, L.I.In 1839 the American angler and author, Genio Scott, wrote: There is not within any settled portion of the United States another piece of territory where the trout streams are comparatively so numerous and productive as they are throughout Long Island. The value of the Long Islaai trout streams to New York City is iriestimable, for each of them is approachable by railroad in a few hours. They are above price.

title: FREDM. VOGEL
description: Fred M. Vogel, who retired in 1964 as manager of the patent department of North American Philips Company, Eindhoven, the Netherlands, died, apparently of a heart ailment, in Mountainside (N. J.) Hospital yesterday. He was 75 years old and lived in Glen Ridge and Brielle, N. J.

title: American Metal Climax Sets Change in Name to AMAX
description: Stockholders of American Metal Climax, Inc., voted yesterday to change the corporate name to AMAX, Inc., which is based on its registered trade mark. The official change is expected to take place on July 1. They also approved an increase in authorized common stock from the present 35 million to 50 million shares and in preferred from 5 million to 7 million shares.

title: DR. HYMAN. HERSHBERG
description: Dr. Hyman Hershberg, a general practitioner who retired in 1965 after half a century of practice in this city, died yesterday, a patently of a heart attack, a Montetiore Hospital. He was 84 years old and lived at 2080 Barnes Avenue, the Bronx.

title: AIR FORCE ACCUSED OF DESTROYING DATA
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (Reuters)Senator Harold E. Hughes said today that the Air Force apparently routinely destroyed orders that created a deceptive bombingreport procedure used to conceal 1970 air strikes in Cambodia.

title: Bachelor's Life: Things Aren't Always HunkyDory in Paradise
description: Among many single, welleducated young women living in New York, there is a saying that has been repeated so many times that it has became a cliche: The only men I meet in this city are either married or gay.

title: N.L. Attendance Up
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 2 (U1)Attendance at Nationat League games is better so far this year than in 1973, is was reported today by the league. This year 1,878,899 fans have passed through the turnstiles for an average of 15,017 a game. Figures for the same period of 1973 showed 1,763,436 persons, for a 14,700 average.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Periods of rain or showers will occur across the Northeast today. Skies will be overcast from the North and Middle Atlantic States through the central lake relion and Ohio Valley to the Central Plains States; scattered showers are forecast from the Middle Atlantic States to the southern Appalachians and eastern Ohio Valley, and also in the middle Mississippi Valley. Except for cooler temperatures in the upper Mississippi Valley, Northern Plains States,  central Rockies and southern plateau region, warmer weather will prevail throughout the country.

title: N.H.L Playoffs
description: Rangers vs. Philadelphia

title: Notes on People
description: The Roman Catholic Bishop of Grand Rapids, Mich., has resigned as honorary chairman of the board of trustees of Aquinas College there because that Catholic college plans to present an honorary degree to Representative Shirley Chishoim, Democrat of Brooklyn. Bishop Joseph M. Breitenbeck objected to a degree fpr Mrs. Chisholm because of her active advocacy of legalized abortion, which conflicts with Catholic teaching. A spokesman for Aquinas College said, It is a tragedy and with deep regret that the Bishop took this stand, but he felt obliged to doso. Some of the people at the college who advocated the honorary degree for her civil rights achievements did not know of her militant and deep involvement in the proabortion controversy. Mrs. Chisholm is scheduled to receive the degree May 11.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
description: Front Page 3  No Title

title: U.S. STEEL RAISES ITS PRICES BY 5.7%
description: Price of steel coppy, brass, chemicals, aircraft, airconditioners and other basic materials rose yesterday, the second day after the official end of Most wage and price, controls. The nation's largest steelmakerthe United States. Steel Corporationled the parade by increasing prices by an average of 5.7 per cent on its total steel product line. The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the No. 2 producer, had no comment, but industry sources said they felt Bethlehem would follow, U. S. Steel's move, probably today.

description: Yonkers Entries

title: THREAT IS RECEIVED IN PAINTINGS THEFT
description: DUBLIN, May 2 (UPI)A man saying he was a member of the gang in the world's biggest art robbery threatened today to burn three Old Masters unless a $250,000 reward was withdrawn, the police said.

title: POTATO FUTURES CONTINUE TO DROP
description: With only three trading sessions remaining, May potato futures continued their long and dramatic decline. The price has dropped from a high of 19.15 cents a pound April 9 to 14.51 cents at the close yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange.

title: SCIENTISTS OUTLINE AID TO SOVIET JEWS
description: An international committee, including eight Nobel winners, is planning an unofficial seminar July 1 to 5 in the Moscow apartment of one of a group of Soviet Jewish scientists who have been living in professional limbo since seeking exit visas.

title: 3 Papers Push for Pact by Monday; Union Chief Sees a Long Way to Go
description: Top negotiators for the typographical union and the city's three major daily newspapers intensified their bargaining yesterday in an attempt to resolve contract differences before Monday's deadline.

title: CHARGES OF FRAUD AT PENN CENTRAL ARE FILED BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Securities and Exchange Commission filed a civil action today against the Penn Central Company and the bankrupt Penn Central Railroad and various of its subsidiaries and, former officers and directors charging fraud in connection with the railroad's collapse in 1970 and losses to stockholders estimated in the billions of dollars.

title: LATE CITY EDITION
description: LATE CITY EDITION

title: Panel Loses Court Bid
description: WASHINGTON, My 2 (UPI) A Federal appeals court ordered the Senate Watergate committee today to try to get along without transcripts or copies of five White House tapes it has sought since last summer, rather than pushing for the originals in court.

title: Senate Votes to Increase Aid for Disabled Veterans
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) The Senate quickly passed and sent to the House today bill increasing benefit payments to disabled veterans and their survivors.

title: Plea to Truck Drivers
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI) The Government's top labor mediator asked independent truck drivers today not to join another threatened nationwide shutdown of trucks May 13. W. J. Usery Jr., director of the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service made his plea in a breakfast address to the National Asociation of Truck Stop Operators.

title: MILK LOBBYIST SAYS HE WAS TOLD OF GIFT
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)  A former milk producer lobbyist, Bob A. Lilly, is quoted in court papers as saying his chief told him campaign donations had been pledged to President Nixon in conjunction with the 1971 price support increase.

title: Issues in Papers Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTS: The New York Times, The Daily News and The New York Post, negotiating as the Publishers Association of New York City, and New York Typographical Union No. 6, representing 819 printers, including 170 substitutes, at The Times; 945 printers, including 200 to 220 substitutes, at The News; and 312 printers, including 38 substitutes, at The Post.

description: Nelson Golf Scores

title: CHARGES OF FRAUD AT PENN CENTRAL ARE FILED BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Securities and Exchange Commission filed a civil action today against the Penn Central Company and the bankrupt Penn Central Railroad and various of its subsidiaries and, former officers and directors charging fraud in connection with the railroad's collapse in 1970 and losses to stockholders estimated in the billions of dollars.

title: Some Airlines Nit Up Despite Woes
description: Robust passenger., traffic, higher fares and fewer empty seats are producing an unexpected 1974 boom for most of the nation's airlines.

title: Fonda Gets Pacemaker; Condition Satisfactory
description: Henry Fonda, who has been in Lenox Hill Hospital since April 24 when he collapsed from what physicians called total exhaustion, had a pacemaker implanted yesterday as a safety precaution against a heart rhythm disorder.

title: MANES PUTS WORTH IN 1973 AT $28064
description: Borough President Donald R. Manes of Queens, a candidate for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination, disclosed yesterday that his net worth totaled $282,364.

title: MILK PRICE RULING LINKED TO 72 GIFT
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Investigators for the House Judiciary Committee have appa7 rently constructed a chain of circumstantial evidence that they contend links President Nixon's 1971 decision to raise Government milk price supports to a pledge by dairy industry groups to give $2million to the President's reelection campaign.

title: Soviet Said to Ease inspection Stand
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Soviet representatives were reported today to have indicated a new flexibility on the key issue blocking a treaty banning the production of chemicalwarfare weapons.

title: Advertising: Market Strategy
description: The generals in the battle of the market place operate from a carefully drawn marketing strategy of which advertising is but a small part.

title: Derby Starter: Alone at the Maelstrom
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 2 The official starter for the most crowded Kentucky Derby in history is a 42yearold Kentuckian natned Toni Wagoner, and he took this news calmly today: He will stand alone on an eightfoot platform at 5:30 P.M. (Eastern Daylight Time) Saturday trying to sort out a multicolored swirl of 23 horses, 23 stable ponies, 46 riders and 18 crewmen on the track.

title: Army Shifts Forces in Attempt to Gain Fleldbility
description: The Army is shuffling its forces to increase their flexibility and hitting power and to speed overseas reinforcement in case of a crisis.

title: Some Portuguese Slow at Adjusting, Others, Rush to Deny OldRegime Ties
description: LISBON, May 2The Portuguese people, after close to half a century of dictatorship, are still having trouble adjusting to the freedom they suddenly won after the military coup last Thursday. In one gathering a man, responding to queries from newsmen, said in a clear voice: I am a Communist. A woman gasped, then smiled and said, This is the first time I have ever heard anybody in Portugal say that out loud.

title: A PLOT TO MURDER SHABAZZ IS DENIED
description: NEWARK, May 2  Albert Chavies, who is being tried for murder in connection with the assassination last September of James McGregor Shabazz, a Black Muslim minister, took the witness stand today to deny vehemently the existence of any plot to kill Mr. Shabazz.

title: City Council Votes to Send HomeRule Budget Pleas
description: The City Council voted last night to send a series of homerule messages to Albany on behillf of Mayor Beanie's budgetbalancing package.

description: College and School Results

title: Toronto, Once Dull, Is Becoming First City of Canada
description: TORONTO  After spending 100 years in second place, Toronto is suddenly on its way to becoming the first city, of Canada, much to the distress of Montreal, its rival 300 miles to the northeast.

title: Stars Sign Jones, the ExGiant
description: Remember Homer Jones? The New. York Stars of the World Football league are going to bring Homer back to this city for the coming football season with the hope that Jones, now 33 years old, can still run.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NORTH BERGEN, May 2  The legend is that sons of famous athletes seldom match their fathers accomplishmerits. Gene Mancino Jr. of North Bergen disproves the legend:

title: Rent Muddle
description: A worthwhile concept underlies Governor Wilson's proposals for overhauling New York City's chaotic rentcontrol system, but his specific recommendations would merely make a bad program worse.

title: Alger Hiss Sees 4 Words in Nixon Transcripts as Chance for Exoneration
description: Alger Hiss the former State Department official who was convicted of perjury in 1950 in connection with espionage charges, believes that four words in the transcripts of President Nixon's conversations may point the way to his exoneration Reuters reported.

title: Shipping/Maids All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time
description: Tomorrows May 4

title: Two Areas on Jobless List
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) Auto industry, layoffs prompted the Labor Department to add today the Kalamazoo and LansingEast Lansing, Mich., areas to its list of major labor areas with substantial unemployment of 6 per cent or more. The total of such areas is 43, the highest since January, 1973.

title: Intruder Wounds Woman
description: A 26yearold Brooklyn woman was shot in the stomach in the hallway of her home by man who had followed her home. The wounded woman, Mrs. Dianne Monteleone, was taken to Wyckoff Heights Hospital in critical condition. The gunman fired several shots after Mrs. Monteleone slammed shut the glasspaneled entrance at 1642 DeKalb Avenue in the Bushwick section. The gunman then fled.

title: Appeal for Fairness
description: A highly emotional campaign by religious and civil service union groups threatens once Mare to forestall City Council approval of a bill that would ban discrimination against homosexuals.

title: ABRAHAM LOWENBRAVN
description: Dr. Abraham Lowenbraum, a general practitioner, in the Brord for 40 years, died yeriterday in Montefiore Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived in Yonkers.

title: Jean Harlow's Father Dies
description: JOPLIN, Mo., May 2 (AP)Dr. Mont Clair Carpenter, father of Jean Harlow, the movie star, died yesterday. He was 96 years old. Dr. Carpenter, a dentist, outlived his famous daughter by more than a third of a century. She died in 1937.

title: SAIGON MILITARY AID CUT BY HOUSE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The House Armed Services Committee cut $20.0million today from the $1.6billion that the Administration had requested for military aid to South Vietnam in the fiscal year starting July 1.

description: American League

description: Pro Transactions

title: Dean Reportedly Finds Deletions in Transcripts
description: Friends of John W. Dean 3d quoted him yesterday as asserting that major deletions had been made in the edited White House transcripts, which were released Tuesday.

title: Commodity Price Index Off Two From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials fell to 229.4 from 231.4 last week.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker announced yesterday that two Bronx high school teachers who showed a filmstrip that explicitly depicted sexual acts would be reassigned to other schools. Letters of reprimand will also be placed in the teachers records, he said.

title: Why AppledCheeked Young Men in Gucci Loafers Sought Permission to Eat in the White House Mess, Where the Air Is Rarefied and the Food Is Mexican
description: CARMELVALLEY, Calif.I'll never ride the Orient Express, nor get the emeralds through to Zagreb in crushed chamois pouch. Like every little girl who saw Charlie Chan on Saturday afternoon and watched Greta Garbo in Mata Hari, I wanted to be, among a lot of other things, a spy. Now, the Watergaters have made spy a slimy word. They've even killed the small and foolish dreams.

title: Gun Control Bill Advances
description: BOSTON, May 2 (AP)The Massachusetts House gave initial approval today to a bill banning Saturday night specials, pistols of lowquality Metal or with barrels less than 3 inches long, despite opposition by the Council of Sportsmen's Clubs.

title: 30 DRIVEN BY FIRE FROM HARLEM HOMES
description: A fivealarm fire engulfed a fivestory tenement and spread to parts of two adjacent buildings in Harlem before it was declared under control shortly before midnight last night, the Fire Department reported. At least 30 persons were forced from their homes and 12 persons were treated at the scene for smoke inhalation.

title: RailTrackge Plan   Dropping of 15,000 Miles Proposed by Transportation. Department to Revamp Bankrupt Carriers Is Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Interstate Commerce Commission said today that it was in fundamental disagreement with a Department of Transportation plan calling for the abandonment of about 25 per cent of the 60,000 miles of railroad trackage in the Northeast and the Middle West now operated, hyp the Penn Central and, other bankrupt carriers.
