description: WASHINGTON, May 7The White House has sent an urgent request to all Cabinetlevel departments seeking new ideas to be utilized in the next 1,000 days.

title: The Screen:'Face of Another' Joins Japanese Festival
description: A youngish engineer named Okuyama has had his facial features almost completely obliterated in an accident. Once out of the hospital he lays about the house all day and broods. He wears the kind of white bandages and dark glasses that the Invisible Man used to wear so people wouldn't look through him. Okuyama is nasty to his wife, curses fate and is numbingly philosophical. "A faceless man can feel free only in the dark," he may say. Or: "The face is the door to the mind. Without it, the mind is shut off."In view of all the talking Okuyama does, the latter statement doesn't make much sense, but that's the sort of movie Hiroshi Teshigahara's "Face of Another" is. It talks too much and too foolishly for its own good, like someone who can only be reassured by the sound of his own voice.The film was shown yesterday at the Regency Theater as part of its current festival of Japanese films. It will be seen again May 29-30 at Japan House as part of another festival of Japanese films sponsored by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the Japan Society."Face of Another," which was made in 1966, shares with an earlier, better Teshigahara film, "Woman of the Dunes," a preoccupation with modes of identity. When Okuyama receives what is, in effect, a facial transplant, the new face takes over the old personality for eventually fatal results. As fiction it's too fanciful to be seriously compelling and too glib to be especially thought-provoking.

title: Plantation is Carved Out of North Carolina Wilderness
description: ROPER, N.C.  A wealthy New York investor is carving what is believed to be the country's largest private plantation out of an eastern North Carolina wilderness of swamps and forested lowlands. Experts say the development holds both great agricultural potential and environmental hazards.

The loss of Brandt, even if it is only temporary, is particularly sad.

title: Treasury Begins $5.6Billion Refinancing
description: Prices showed Some improventent yesterday in the corporate bond market, remained mostly steady in the taxexempt sector and were mixed at the close of quiet trading in the Government sector, Government securities received most of the attention as the Treasury DePartment held the first round of this week's $5.6billion refinancing. In the corporate secondary market the moderate price upturn of recently offered utility and industrial obligations was termed largely, technical by specialists.

title: Stopping Inflation
description: The Secretary of Labor, Peter J. Brennan, emerged from a White House meeting this week and said he had told President Nixon that rankandfile workers were more concerned about inflation  breadand  butter issues than about impeachment. When asked what he thought should be done to stop the inflation, Mr. Brennan said he had been appointed, not anointed. And he added, I don't have any real answer, other than that we all have to try to find the answer.

title: Captured Inmates Report Paying Officers for Saw
description: Two of three inmates captured after their escape from the Brooklyn House of DetenOen late Friday have told investigators for Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutdr, that correction officers had been paid $50 to supply the hacksaws used in the escape, according to sources close to the investigation.

title: AN UPSTATE D.A. FACES INDICTMENT
description: BELMONT, N.Y., May 1 (AP)  District Attorney John T. D'Arcy of Allegany County was indicted today on 85 counts including unlawful imprisonment and official misconduct.

title: 3 Are Seized in Hoboken In Beef Theft in Secaucus
description: HOBOKEN, May 7 (UPI)The police arrested three men today charged in connection with the theft of five carcasses of beef one hour before the theft was reported. The beef is worth an estimated total of $65,000.

title: HomeRule Charter Is Approved In Capital by a Margin of 4 to
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (AP) A charter giving the District of Columbia its first elected mayor and city council in almost a century was approved by voters today.

title: U.S. FREEZE ENDED ON RURAL SEWERS
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 UPI) Surrendering to strong Congressional pressure, the Administration has agreed to end a White House freeze on $120million appropriated for rural water and sewer grants, Earl L. Butz, the Secretary of Agriculture, disclosed today.

title: Pulitzer Jurors Dismayed on Pynchon
description: All three members of the Pulitzer Prize jury on fiction expressed distress and bewilderment yesterday that their unanimous recommendation for a prize for Thomas Pynchon's Gravity's Rainbow had been turned down and that no fiction award was given this year.

title: C.B.S. Slates 60 Minutes for Summer Prime Time
description: The CBS television magazine, 60 Minutes, will become al primetime series during the summer months, running Sundays from 9:30 to 10:30 P.M. The move will take place July 7, and the weekly news series will continue at that time through Sept. I.

title: TRUDEAU'S DEFEAT EXPECTED AS FOES CONDEMN BUDGET
description: OTTAWA, May 7Both of Canada's principal opposition parties today introduced mo tions of noconfidence in the minority Liberal party Government of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau because of its budget policies. Theit action was generally expected to topple the Government.

title: Deaths
description: ALPERNEarl 3, Beloved husband of Loretta, Devoted father of Matthew; Eric and DeVId. Loving son of Henrietta. Dear brother of Hale, Claire Stein and'Marllyn Gorlin. Se'rv. Ices Wednesday 12 Noon, Schwartz Brothers Forest Park Chapels, Queens Boulevard and 76th Road, Forest Hills.

title: OPIUM AGAIN HURTS U.S.TURKISH LINKS
description: ANKARA, TurkeyAmerican diplomats here are worried that the Turkish decision to resume cultivation of opium poppies may seriously impair relations between the United States and Turkey, allies in NATO.

title: Lockheed Considers Textron Merger
description: BURBANK, Calif., May 7The Textron Corporation is one of the companies being considered as a merger partner, Daniel J. Haughtorr; chairman of the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, said today in answer to a question at the annual stockholders meeting here.

title: Germany's AllRound Politician
description: I asked him for his friendship and he refused, Helmut Schmidt said last year of Willy Brandt, recalling an encounter more than 15 years ago at a Social Democratic party convention. The incident illuminated the difference between the two German leaders. For Brandt, with his Scandinavian experience, friendship is something that grows naturally and doesn't require any formal declarations, a diplomat once observed. For Schmidt, with his purely German background, friendship is something that has to be sealed with a bond.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PLANTS At the age of 25, the annual Brooklyn Botanic Garden plant sale is itself an institution. For two days it turns ordinary flower lovers into lessthangenteel horticultural bargain hunters.

description: MOSCOW, May Soviet Union today pledged $600million in creditsto help Argentina double her poviergenetating capacity by the end of 1977.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW A DECLINE
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange fell sharply again yesterday with a broad decline in Canadian petroleum and mining stocks adding to the pressure of high prime interest rates in this country. In the overthecounter market, prices klso fell compardd with the day before.

description: Major League Leaders

title: TRADING HALTED FOR COMBUSTION
description: The stock of Combustion Engineering, Inc., was not traded on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday following publication of an article in The Wall Street Journal that was highly critical of the company's nuclear business.

title: Vinyl Chloride Ban In Household Sprays Is. Weighed by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (AP) The United States Consumer Products Safety Commission served notice today that it intended to ban use of vinyl chloride in most household aerosol sprays because the chemical is considered a potential health hazard.

title: Rumanian Skipper Freed
description: BALTIMORE, May 7 (UPI)Rumania paid the United States, $100,000 today for the release of Ion M. Ancuta, captain of a 290foot fishing trawler seized off the coast of North Carolina in March. The payment, delivered to the United States Attoiney's Office in Baltimore, was the maximum fine for charges of violating United States territorial waters. The ship and her 84men crew were thus free to leave Baltimore harbor.

title: Mr. Nixon and the Law
description: Although he was educated in the law, President Nixon seems to have difficulty comprehending that the problems that now engulf him are problems neither of politics nor of publid relations, but of law. There are wellestablished legal rules of, procedure that are followed regardless of the identity of the individuals involved in particular case.

title: League of Women Voters Votes to Let Men Join It
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 7 The League of Women Voters agreed today to end its longstanding policy of barring full membership to men. The vote, by a margin of better than 2 to 1, came after a long and often bitter debate over whether women have enough selfconfidence to work equally with men.

title: Big Board Prices Mixed As Rate Climb Persists
description: The stock market ended mixed yesterday in dull trading as high interest rates and the growing inflationary spiral continued to keep many investors on the sidelines.

title: i CONSENT ORDER SET BY COLT INDUSTRIES
description: HARTFORD, May 7 (AP) The Colt Industries Operating Corporation of Hartford has agreed to a consent order prohibiting the company from fixing reseale prices of its products, the Federal Trade Commission said yesterday.

title: Victor Starzenski, 87, Dies; Hudson Valley Fuel Officer
description: Victor Starienski, retired vice president and general manager of the Hudson Valley Fuel Corporation, Troy, N. Y., a former subsidiary of the Niagara Mohawk Corporation, died Saturday at his home in Galway, Ireland. He was 87 years old.

title: Piper Aircraft to Bury StormDamaged Parts
description: LOCK HAVEN, Pa. May 7 (UPI)  The Piper Aircraft Company is buying an estimated $20million worth of parts, partial, airplanes and completed aircraft, which were damaged during tropical storm Agnes in June, 1972.

title: GARMENT CENTER SEEKS NEW IMAGE
description: A 12week exgerimental program to improve conditions in the streets of the garment center got under way ysterday, I spearheaded by 18 former oflenders and former addicts who have undergone an intensive training program.

title: Dead Welder Is Identified
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 7 (UPI) The body of a welder who fell into the Delaware River 13 days ago has been positively identified, the Medical Examiner's Office said yesterday. The victim was identified as William P. Toner, 45 years old, of Croydon, Pa.

description: The RCA Corporation expects the second half of 1974 to be substantially better than the first half, Robert W. Sarnoff, its chairman, told some 750 stockholders at yesterday's annual meeting at 30 Rockefeller Plaza.

title: A MOTHER AND SON SLAIN IN BROOKLYN
description: A 43yearold woman and her 14yearold son were found stabbed to death in their home in the Dyker Heights section of Brooklyn last night, according to the police.

title: 5 Tunisians Get Hard Labor For Spying for Soviet Union
description: TUNIS, May 7Five Tunisiani found guilty last night of spying for the Soviet Union received sentences ranging from three years to 10 years hard labor.

Metzenbaum, in the state primary for the Democratic nomination for the Senate seat vacated by William B. Saxbe, a Republican who is now the Attorney General.

description: Vice President Ford was given five standing ovations by 1,000 members of the Grand Lodge of Masons in New York State as he called here last night for support of the Nixon Administration's defense spending program.

description: As this city's second oldest musical organization (the New York Philharmonic is the oldest), the Oratorio Society of New York has a history that is rich and eventful.

description: WASHINGTON, May 7 One of many questions to strike readers of the 1,254 pages of transcripts of the President's conversations ore Watergate released last week is, What is the little red box?

description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 7Two Roman Catholic men were killed and four were injured today by gunmen who fired machine guns at a but on a construction site here.

title: JOHNSON QUOTED ON DAIRYMEN GIFT
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (AP) Former President Johnson once declared that dairymen had promised him a $250,000 campaign contribution but did not deliver, according to a statement attributed to the leader of the nation's biggest dairy cooperative.

title: Coast Police Feared Kidnapping Plot on Alioto's Grandchildren
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 7About three weeks ago, the San Francisco police set a trap for members of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army in the belief that two of Mayor Joseph L. Alioto's grandchildren were being stalked as kidnapping victims, confidential sources said today.

title: Rep. Conte Discloses Income
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., May 7 (AP)Representative Silvio 0. Conte and his wife earned a combined total of $13,672.25 beyond his $42,500 Congressional salary during 1973, the Massachusetts Republican disclosed today. Mr. Conte said the income came from stocks, savings accounts, rental property, speaking engagements and a directorship.

title: What Special U.N. Session Did
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 7The General Assembly's first economic session ended week with many participants saying it marked a turning point in relationships between the poor and the prosperous nations. The United States however, was far from pleased with the outcome

description: More than 50,000 ohildren who entered New York City's elementary schools in thelast school year have not yet been given the physical examinations required under the city's ilealth Code, according to a survey by the Citizens Committee for Children of New York.

title: Tax Investigators Are Studying Possibly Illegal. Use of Returns
description: WASHINGTON, May 7Congressional investigations into the relationship between the Nixon Administration and the Internal Revenue Service have shifted their focus to the ques tion of whether tax returns were used illegally as a source of politically valuable information for the White House.

title: Glenn Wins in Ohio Over Metzenbaum
description: CLEVELAND, Wednesday, May 8John H. Glenn Jr., the former astronaut, scored a stunning victory yesterday over Senator Howard M. Metzenbaum in the Ohio state primary for the Democratic nominations for the United States Senate.

title: Wilson Recasting Rent Bill To Meet Tenant Objections
description: ALBANY, May 7Governor Wilson has agreed to revise drastically his weekold rent proposals, eliminating nearly all the provisions to which tenant groups had Objected. The. Governor's office would say only that a bipatrisan bill is now being drafted.

description: MOSCOW, May 7The Soviet Union today pledged $600million in credits to help Argenlina double her powergenerating capacity by the end of 1977.

title: Hayliceir, Coweris Get 28 Each in 9687 Victory
description: MILWAUKEE, May 7 We really dug deep, into ourselves tonight, we really pushed, said John Havlicek, the captain and heart of the Boston Celtics, who drew to within one victory of the National Basketball Association championship with a 9687 triumph over the Bucks tonight at Milwaukee Arena.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, May 7 (Reuters)Prime Minister Harold Wilson emphasized today the Labor Government's disapproval of the British national rugby team's tour of South Africa and Rhodesia. But in a message to the Supreme Council for Sports in Africa he said the Government had no powers to prevent the team, the Lions, which left last night, from taking part in the tour. He was replying to protest telegram from the council in Tunis urging him respect world opinion against apartheid by persuading the rugby authorities to cancel the tour.

title: Maine Town Votes Accord On 650Millioni Refinery
description: SANFORD, Me., May 7Voters at a special town meeting approved last night zoning changes that would allow construction here of a proposed $650million oil refinery.

title: WILSON RECASTS RENT PROPOSALS
description: ALBANY, May 7Governor Wilson has agreed to revise drastically his weekold rent proposals, eliminating nearly all the provisions to which tenant groups had objected. The Governor's office would say only that a bipartisan bill is now being drafted.

title: 3 WOMEN IN LISBON WIN RIGHTS CASE
description: LISBON, May 7  Three women writers were acquitted by a Lisbon court today of having offended public morals with book attacking the repression of women's rights in Portugal.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Board of Public Utility Commissioners ordered an electric company to make $1million in refunds and rate reductions to its 46,000 customers because of overcharging and collecting of excess profits. The order against Rockland Electric Company was the first time in five years power company in the United States had been ordered reduce its rates, a P.U.C. spokesman said. Rockland serves customers in Bergen, Passaic and Sussex Counties. The utility was ordered to reduce bills by $100,000 a month for the next six months starting, June 1, because of excess profits earned in 1973. The company had been assigned profit rate of 8.2 per cent, but it actually earned 10.2 per cent last year, the spokesman said.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The midi died four years ago because, among other things, it was the only length in town. Women saw it, tried it on, and said No, thank you in droves. They were not going to be hassled into anything.

title: Siderowf Advances at Pinehurst
description: PINEHURST, N. C., May 7 (AP)  Dick Siderowf of Westport, Conn., and Marty West of Bethesda, Md., both Walker Cup players, were among the favorites who survived today's second round of the NorthSouth amateur golf tournament.

title: Rodino Unit to Hear Some Nixon Tapes as Hearings Open This Week
description: WASHINGTON, May 7The House Judiciary Committee will hear some of the White House tape recordings when it begins historic hearings later this week on the possible impeachment of President Nixon.

title: Tigers Knuckle Under To Wood White Sox, 10
description: Wilbur Wood, Chicago's 32yearold lefthanded knuckleballet, who has led the American League in innings pitched and in victories for the last two seasons, proved his stamina again last night by, pitching an 11inning 1.0 triumph over the Tigers in Detroit.

title: High State Witnesses on Call As Police Bribery Trial Opens
description: MORRISTOWN, May 7  A State Supreme Court justice, the Attorney General of New Jersey and the commander of the state police are expected to be called as witnesses for the defense in a police bribery trial that opened in Superior Court here today.

title: Contract Awards
description: Three Brazilian airlines placed orders yesterday with the Boeing Company for a total of 21 advanced 737 jet transports. The order, valued at about $135million, is the largest South American order ever placed with Boeing. Varig will take 10 planes, Cruziero will take six and Vasp will take five.

title: FORD ADDING $163 TO ITS 74 PRICES; ASSAILS RISE
description: DETROIT, May 8The Ford Motor Company announced today price increases averaging $163 on its 1974 cars and trucks to offset in part unprecedented cost increases. The rises amount to $113, or 2.4 per cent, in the sticker price, and $50, or 1.1 per cent, for options that have become standard equipment.

title: Dean Buys Coast Home; Price Pats at $100,000
description: (AP)John W, Dian 3 ciN has, purchased A canyon home near the exclusive Trouser dale Estates section of Los Angeles for a reported price of $100,000.

title: MRS. HAROLD SHAPIRO
description: Mis.Pauline Shapiro, Wife of Harold Roland Shapiro, retired senior assistant district attorney of New York County, died Tuesday at the Albert Einstein Hospital, the Bronx. She was. 67 years old and she lived at 16801 12th Avenue, Whitestone, Queens.

title: SYRIANS MAY ASK FOR ARAB SUMMIT
description: DAMASCUS, May 8After Secretary of State Kissinger completed more than five hours of talks with President Hafez alAssad today, official sources said: that a meeting of Arab chiefs of state might be necessary at an early date.

title: United Brands Shows Deficit in Quarter
description: Huge losses from its banana business was the major contributor to the $1.5million deficit reported yesterday by the United Brands Company for the first quarter this year. In the similar three months last year the company had a net income of $5.6million, or 46 cents a share.

title: JURY IN POLICE DEATH IS TOLD OF THREATS
description: A defense lawyer in the trial of five men accused of the 1971 slaying of two policemen at a Harlem housing project contended yesterday that the prosecution's case was inconsistent and full of contradictions.

title: Foreign Investing Study Set
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (Reuters)The. Senate Commerce Committee approved today a bill calling for a twoandahalfyear Federal study of the effects of foreign direct and, portfolio investment in the United States. The bill's sponsor, Senator Daniel Inouye, Democrat of Hawaii, said he was basically opposed to any form of direct controls on such investing.

title: Brdge:
description: LAS PALMAS, Canary Islands, May 8The world mixedpair championship began here this afternoon, with 236 pairs competing in the twoday event.

title: Dividing Presidential Functions
description: There is no need to adapt the Presidency to a parliamentary model. Etut there is an acute need to modify the office. It is time to consider a step we have for two centuries avoided: seg.ration of the Presidency into two functions, head of state and chief executive.

title: Pact Vote Today
description: PITTSBURGH. May 8 (UPI)The 700 members of local 211 of the teamsters are to vote tomorrow to ratify a contract proposal that ended their fiveweek strike against the Pittsburgh Press Company.

title: Jesuit at the White House Defends Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Dr. John McLaughlin, the Jesuit priest who is a special assistant to President Nixon, held an extraordinary news conference today to deny charges by Hugh Scott, the Senate minority leader, and other Republicans that, as Mr. Scott put it, the Watergate transcripts portrayed deplorable, disgusting, shabby, immoral performances by the President and his aides.

title: FOREIGN MINISTER RESIGNS IN ETHIOPIA
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, May 8 (Agence FrancePresse) Foreign Minister Menassie Haile resigned today. The resignation was accepted by Premier Endalkachew Makonnen after Emperor Haile Selassie had approved it.

title: No Health Hazard On. Taconite Seen By Republic Steel
description: FLEMINGTON, N.J., May 8The Republic Steel Corporation expects 1974 to be a good year if the Reserve Mining Company's taconite plant at Silver Bay, Minn., is allowed to operate, William J. De Lancey, president, told about 50 stockholders at the annual meeting here today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BENEFIT The September, 1973 Chilean coup scattered thousands of refugees as Tar away as Sweden and Canada. To aid Chilean refugees, wherever they are, Arlo Guthrie, Melanie, Melvin Van Peebles, Dennis Harper, Phil Ochs and many others have been rounded up by the Friends of Chile, 777 United Nations Plaza. And, the whole herd will appear and perform at the Madison Square Garden Felt Forum tonight at 8 o'clock.

title: Beame Orders an Investigation of Jails, Covering Escapes and Bribe Charges,
description: Mayor Beanie, declaring that he Was quite concerned about recent escapes and breaches of security in the city's jails, ordered an immediate investigation of the correction system yesterday.

title: ICORRECTION
description: In an article on the Mathematical Olympiad in The New York Times yesterday, five paragraphs were misplaced. The quotation concerning dividing a problem into three sets and adding up the probability of each was part of an explanation by Ellen Hahne of Houston. The remarks that followed were also hers.

title: A Most Unretiring Horowitz Tells All
description: Vladimir Horowitz, possibly the most retiring and certainly the most often retired of great pianists, is back again and fairly champing at the Steinway. The Ukrainianborn virtuoso sat back on his living room sofa last night, smiled a keyboardwide smile and explained what made him choose to reappear. Sunday afternoon in Cleveland for his first public recital since 1969.

title: Flyers Are 1 Down, Far From Out
description: BOSTON, May 7Nobody apparently convinced anyone of anything after the first game of the Stanley Cup final series last night, in which the Boston Bruins won, 32, from the Philadelphia Flyers on Bobby, Orr's goal in the last seconds of play.

title: Crangle is Said to Order Withholding of Votes
description: ALBANY, May 8The Senate majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, put aside in iniddebate tonight a bill for the takeover of two Consolidated Edison Company power plants, charging that the State democratic Chairman, Joseph F. Crangle, had ordered all Democratic Senators not to support the measure.

title: Pan Am Jet Device To Warn of Peaks
description: Pan American World Airways, concerned over two crashes this year in which 204 persons were killed, ordered for its entire 140plane fleet yesterday a new cockpit warning system designed to prevent such disasters.

title: Every Effort Vowed to Reopen Morristown H.S. After Clashes
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., May Education officials here said today they would make every effort to resume the normal class schedule on Monday at this affluent commuter town's high school, which has been closed most of the week because of fighting between black and white students.

title: Chess:

title: Preston Sutphen, 75, Dies; Boat Company Executive
description: Preston L. Sutphen, who retired in 1948 as a vice president, of the Electric Boat Company, which later became a division of the General Dynamics Cor poration, died yesterday at his home in Delray Beach, Fla. He was 75 years old and also lived in East Hampton, L. I.

title: House Votes to Suspend Zinc Ore Duties Till 77
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (AP) The House has voted to suspend the duty on zincbearing ores until mid1977 to end competitive disadvantage of United States smelters in buying zinc ores on the world market.

title: BlastSite. Tenants Voice Complaints
description: Complaining of looting, red tape and legal snags, about 30; smallbusiness executives from foompanies at the site of last month's East Side gas explosion met yesterday to look for ways to get back on their feet.

title: Diamond Gets New State Job
description: ALBANY, May 8 (AP)Henry L. Diamond, former State Environmental Conservation Commissioner, was named yesterday by Governor Wilson to the state's Environmental Board. Mr. Diamond resigned last December to become executive director of former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller's Commission on Critical Choices for Americans. Members of the parttime board, which has limited power to promulgate environmental rules, are paid $100 a day, up to a maximum of $5,000 a year.

description: TOKYO, May 8 (Reuters)Japan today asked the United States to discontinue operations of the Voice of America in Okinawa as soon as possible, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said.

title: Mother and Two Daughters Killed in Bloomfield Blast
description: BLOOMFIELD, May 8 (UPI)A young mother and her two daughters were killed and two other children were seriously injured tonight when an explosion and fire rocked the woman's home here, the police said.

title: Kuh Assigns Aides to Precincts To Provide Community Liaison
description: In an effort to assure more reporting of climes, District Attocney Richard H. Kuh an last night that he had assigned an, assistant: district attorney to each of Manhattpues 21 police precincts.

title: Priest Shrinks Into His Job
description: WOODBRIDGE, May 8 (AP). A 377pound priest who had difficulty getting into and out let a confessional box was honored today by a local diet club for having shed more than half his former bulk. The Rev. James Clark, now a svelte 172, ecelved a tempting slice of cake and a set of ieweled cufflinks as rewards. Father Clark is pastor of St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church and School in Perth Amboy.

title: Gov. Meskill Conciliatory as Assembly Adjourns
description: HARTFORD, May 8The Connecitcut General Assembly heard some words of faint, unaccustomed praise tonight from Gov, Thomas J. Meskill when it met in joint session to adjourn after a threemonth session.

title: New Storm King Hearings Ordered; Aid for Con Edison Stalled in Albany
description: In a unanimous decision, a Federal Court of Appeals ordered yesterday an immediate reopening of hearings on the Consolidated Edison Company's controversial Storm King power plant on the ground that the danger of killing the Hudson River's fish life had not been adequately considered.

title: Advertising: The Unique Mets
description: Many advertisers think of baseball fans generally as a very bluecollar audiencean impression they get from national surveys done by A. C. Nielsen on the annual incomes of TV households that are tuned in to the games.

title: Hardship List of N.B.A. Involves 20
description: James (Fly) Williams of Austin Peay, a sophomore, Gary Brokaw of Notre Dame and Michael (Campy) Russell of the University of Michigan, juniors, were among the 20 college undergraduates accepted yesterday by the National Basketball Association as hardship applicants for its May 28 college draft.

title: Times Report Criticized
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8 (AP)The capture of Symbionese Liberation Army members may have been, foiled by a published reporreport that the terrorists were plotting to kidnap Mayor JoAlioto's grandchildren, police said today.

title: I. Is VS MEETING PICKETED BY 500
description: SEATTLE, May 8Officials SEATTLE, May 8,Officials and shareholders of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation who gathered here today for the controversial conglomerate's annual meeting were greeted by more than 500 shouting pickets and protesters chanting that I.T.T. mint go.

title: Mrs. H. Harris Jonas, 89, Philanthropic Leader Here
description: Mrs. H. Harris Jonas, a leader in philanthropic activities, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital. She was 89 years old and lived at 998 Fifth Avenue.

title: Joe Venuti Pioneer Of the Jazz Violin, Still Sounds Fresh
description: Joe Venuti, the veteran jazz violinist, plays a deceptive game at Michael's Pub, 211 East 55th Street, where he will be fiddling until May 25. He sneaks up on you with a set of bland tunes from My Fair Lady, pours some gypsy schmalz over you and, just as you begin to wonder if we're back in the era of string quartets behind potted palms, he takes off like a jackrabbit, bowing and plucking through a series of rolling riffs that lift everything in the room a few feet off the floor.

title: Witness in Boyle Trial Gets 15Year Sentence
description: PITTSBURGH, May 8 (AP)William J. Turnblazer, the key prosecution witness in the murder trial of W. A. Boyle, former president of the United Mine Workers of America, was sentenced today to 15 years in a Federal prison.

title: Dance Groups Give Joint Concert at Y For Its Centenary
description: It's a pity that nothing short of fiscal disaster or the stray, centenary celebration drives moderndance companies together for cooperative programs. They are really very pleasant, as was Tuesday evening's retrospective at the 92d Street Young Men's and Young Women's Hebrew Association, which is celebrating its first 100 years.

title: 8 INDICTED IN FRAUD ON CAR INSURANCE
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 8 (UPI) A Federal grand jury indicted eight area residents yesterday on charges of defrauding two insurance concerns of $15,000 in a scheme that involved nonexistant new autos.

title: Result of School Voting in Nassau Suffolk, Rockland, Westchester
description: Following are the results of yesterday's local school elections in Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester and Rockland Counties. Further school elections will be held in these counties over the next six weeks.

title: AUTHORITY BONDS*
description: AUTHORITY BONDS

title: To Protect Yorkville
description: When a zoning change is proposed that would impose controls in the public and environmental interest, the manipulative arguments against it are as predictable the real estate opposition.

title: N.H.L. Championship
description: May 7Bost. 3, Phila. 2.

title: Siderowf Wins Twice At Pinehurst
description: PINEHURST, N. C., May 8 (AP)The younger set took over the North and South amateur golf tournament today and after the third and fourth rounds, the eight survivors ranged in age from 19yearold Glen (Skeeter) Heath of Hampton, Va., to 36yearold Dick Siderowf, the British Amateur champion from Westport, Conn.

title: MOYERS TERMINATES HISVOURNAL'ONP.B.S.
description: Bill Moyers announced at the close of his weekly program on the Public Broadcasting Service Tuesday night that it was the final edition of the threeyearold Bill Moyers Journal. Although for weeks Mr. Moyers had been openly vacillating about leaving public television, his resignation on the air caught his production source, WNET in New York, by surprise.

title: BLACK BISHOP 89, PUBLISHES A BOOK
description: Bishop William J. Walls, eider statesman of the African. Methodist Episcopal Zion Church (A.M.E. Zion), who began his preaching career at the age of 14, celebrated his 89th birthday yesterday with some adfice to his fellow Christians.

title: Commonwealth Chemical Cited In S. E.C StockFraud Charges
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday charged in United States District Court here that Commonwealth Chemical Securities, Inc., and its principals had defrauded the public and three mutual funds of $600,000 in the last three and a half years.

title: Penalties Paid British Strike Is Halted
description: LONDON, May 8A nationwide strike by one of Britain's largest trade unions was settled today when a lawyer appeared in court and paid $156,000 on behalf of an anonymous donor to cover fines and damages levied against the labor organization.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NORFOLK, Va., May 8 (AP)Joseph Wheeler, owner of the Virginia Ambassadors of the World Football League, said today if he could not get more investors for the franchise by Friday he, would have to sell the club. Wheeler said a group in Orlando, Fla., had expressed interest in buying the franchise after meeting with him last night.

title: Brandt Resigned, in Part, Overdata on Private Lif
description: BONN, May 8Willy Brandt, who resigned as Chancellor of West Germany Monday night following the discovery of an East German spy on his staff, said in a televised speech tonight that he had quit, in part, because there were indications my private life would be drawn into speculation about the case.written about that, Mr. Brandt told his television audience in his first public statement about his resignation, it is and remains grotesque to maintain that a German Chancellor can be blackmailed. I, certainly, cannot be. He said at a meeting of his party leadership earlier today, Out of office, will stand up to anything may be charged with in this.

title: ROONEY BILLBOARDS BEING INVESTIGATED
description: Howard M. Pack, president of Seatrain Lines, Inc., which operates a shipbuilding enterprise in the former Navy Yard here, expressed surprise yesterday at being the target of a new investigation by the Brooklyn District Attorney's office.

title: Mott the Hoople at Uris
description: Mott the Hoople arrived on Broadway Tuesday night for the first of six shows, the first hard rock group ever to appear there, and the Uris Theater will probably never be the same again. Apart from the cigarette burns in the rugs and the spilleddrink stains on the floor, the overwhelming volume of the music must somehow stick in the theater's walls, deafening mere unamplified speech and song forever.

title: Personal Finance: Cashing of Checks
description: For many holders of bank checking accounts, getting their own checks cashed at their own banks or other branches of the banks can be frustrating. Cashing a check written by someone else can be a virtual Impossibility for the average checkirt account holder. Relief from some of these difficulties has finally arrived. Several New York City banks have instituted new checkcashing policies.

title: LISBON'S ECONOMY SIDESTEPS CRISIS
description: LISBON, May 8Portugal LISBON, May 8Portugal has been able to get through the first two weeks of revolution without a serious financial crisis because of emergency, measures taken at the start of the military coup that toppted the dictatorship April 25.

title: Market Averages
description: Wednesday, May 1, 1974 THE NEW YORK STOCK EXCHANGE

title: (Fire Destroys Former Studio)
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif., May 8 (AP)Fire has destroyed a former motion pitcure studio at the eastern edge of Thousand Oaks. Ventura County arson investigators said that the fire last night appeared to have been deliberately set.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Watergate Effect on Most Primaries Appears Slight
description: WASHINGTON, May, 8 Six, states with 100 seats in the House of Representatives have now held Democradt and Republican primaries withbut a single upset of an incumbent Representative. So much, politicians were saying today; for the notion that the ins are automatically in trouble in this Watergate era of political disenchantment.

title: VICTORY BY GLENN LINKED TO IMAGE Issue of Political Morality Called a Key in Defeat of Senator Metzenbaum
description: CLEVELAND, May 8John H. Glenn Jr., who defeated Senator Howard M, Metzenbaum by nearly 100,000 votes in yesterday's Democratic Senatorial primary, spent the long months of his campaign deploring the moral climate that fostered the Watergate scandals and President Nixon's tax woes and calling for a return to integrity in government.

title: Trudeau Government Out Over Budget; Parliamentary Election Expected July
description: OTTAWA, May 8The minority Liberal party Government of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau was toppled today when it lost a confidence vote in the House of Commons over its budget policies.

title: MRS. EUNICE HOLSAERT
description: Mrs. Eunice Spellman Holsaert, editor of children's books at Holiday House, died of cancer Monday at Calvary Hospital in the Bronx. She was 64 years old and lived at 410 Central Park West.

title: Canned Oysters Recalled As a Botulism Safeguard
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI)The Food and Drug Administration said today that 24,900 cans of oysters were behie taken off the market in fouc Southern states because they could cause botulism, a deadly form of food poisoning.

title: Moscow Priest is Ordered to Stop Open Discussions That Drew the Faithful
description: MOSCOW, May 8A simple, low Russian church, tucked away on a side street in northeast Moscow; has in recent weeks beccime the focus of an unusual pilgrimage of young and old; attracted by the outspoken opinions of one of its priests, the Rev. Dmitri Dudko.

title: Priest a 70 Candidate
description: A tall, ruddyfaced man, Father McLaughlin was named to the White House staff in 1971 after attracting national attention in 1970, when he ran unsuccessfully on the Republican ticket in trying to unseat Senator John 0. Pastore, Rhode Island Democrat. Senator Pastore won by a 2to1 margin.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Primping Set for Princeton Battlef ield
description: MEDIA, Pa., May 7The architect John M. Dickey has submitted to New Jersey officials plans for a $553,000 project to develop Princeton's Revolutionary War battlefield for the country's 1976 bicentennial.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Kennecott Copper Corporation announced yesterday that it had notified the Environmental Protection Agency of the company's intention to file a citizen's suit to force the agency to live up to the rules of the Clean Air Act of 1970.

title: BIG BOARD FORMING EVALUATION GROUP
description: Formation of a fivemember committee of directors of the New York Stock Exchange to study procedures by which companies to be listed on the exchange are allocated to specialist member firms, was announced yesterday by James J. Needham, chairinan.

title: DeRoss Salisbury is Dead; PipeOrgan Designer, 88
description: DeRoss Salisbury, a designer of pipe organs who has been associated since 1946 with the Schantz Pipe Organ Company, died Tuesday in Bellevue Hospital, He was 88 years old and lived at 124 Ancon Avenue in Pelham, N.Y.

title: Credit Venture in Japan
description: BALTIMORE, May 8 (UPI)The Commercial Credit Corporation announced today it is joining the $4billion Japanese finance and insurance combine, Nippon Shinpan, Ltd., in a venture to establish an international company to operate a full range of leasing services in Japan, Hong Kong and elsewhere in Asia. Commercial Credit and Nippon Shinpan each will have 40 per cent of the venture and 14 other Japanese firms will own the other 20 per cent. The project must be approved by the Japanese and other Asian Governments.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: Captain Scott and the Antarctic Tragedy, by Peter Brent (Saturday Review Press, Dutton, $12.50). An illustrated account of the explorer's life and times.Gather Together in My Name, by Maya Angelou (Random House, $5.95). Part two of an autohlography.

title: Music: Ginastera Quartet
description: The works of Schoenberg may be fated never to make a deep dent in the general public's consciousness, but composers have not tired of paying homage to this century's most influential musieal innovator. Alberto Ginastera's Third String Quartet, which the Juilliard String Quartet presented in its first performance on Tuesday light at Alice Tully Hall, was written in a frank attempt to capture the spirit of Schoenberg's Second String Quartet.

title: TV: California Jam Simulates Live Rock Session
description: The Concert iseriei, which is presented every other Friday on ABCTV; begint the first of four programs entitled California Jam tomorrow night at 11:30. The programs represent still another maneuver in a relatively contained but fierce battle for the rockmusic audi, ente on television. In terms of numbers, that audience is not blockbuster large, at least so far, but in terms of &dyertiser targets, significant, consisting mostly of what the ad agencies like to call young spenders.

title: Turnpike Restaurant Shut Alter Failing Test
description: TRENTON, May 8 (AP)The State Department of Health announced today that a restaurant on the New Jersey Turnpike had closed voluntarily after failing a State sanitation inspection.

title: Commuter Train Loses To Bicycles in Race
description: LAKE GENEVA, Wis., May 8 (AP)Eight amateur bicyclists challenged a commuter train to a race. The cyclists won.

title: Federal Jury to Investigate Killing of 2 at Southern U.
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI) The Justice Department announced today that a Federal Grand jury in Baton Rouge, La., would begin hearing testimony May 20 concerning the deaths of two Southern University students in campus disorders in 1972.

title: Gulf Costs Challenged
description: The Federal Energy Administration challenged Gulf Oil to Justify $46.5million of costs claimed for crude oil it bought from two foreign affiliates. Details on Page 65.

title: U.S. STOCKS ARMS FOR ASIAN ALLIES
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Without ever clearly informing Congress, the Defense Department has been building a $1billion stockpile of weapons and military equipment to turn over to Asian allies in event of war.

title: 2 NBC News Programs Shifting to Washington
description: NBCTV disclosed yesterday that it would move its two principal news programs, the Nightly News and the Today show, to Washington on May 20 until further notice. The open sessions of the House Judiciary Committee's impeachment hearings are expected to begin on May 21.

title: Royal Couple, Visiting City, Leave Protocol to Others
description: Princess Margaret, flanked by her equerry and lady in waiting, took dainty sips from a light gin and tonic and brushed off suggestions that the protocol for a princess was more rigid in Britain than it was in America.

title: Television
For a Third Time, Purchase Is Trying to Secede From Harrison
description: HARRISON, N. Y., May 7 Residents of Purchase, a once exclusive residential hamlet in this Westchester town, are seeking to secede from Harrison by incorporating as a village. The aim is to slow or stop further commercial development in Purchase.

title: Newark Statute Requiring Worker Residency Upheld
description: TRENTON, May 8The State Supreme Court upheld today the constitutionality of a Newlark ordinance that, with certain exceptions, requires city employes to live in the city.

title: Diamond Gets New State Job
description: ALBANY, May 8 (AP)Henry L. Diamond, former State Environmental Conservation Commissioner, was named yesterday by Governor Wilson to the state's Environmental Board. Mr. Diamond resigned last December to become executive director of former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller's Commission on Critical Choices for Americans. Members of the parttime board, which has limited power to promulgate environmental rules, are paid $100 a day, up to maximum of $5,000 a year.

title: A.B.A. Championship Nets vs. Utah
description: April 30Nets 89, Utah 85.

title: In the Balance
description: Between Egyptian President Sadat's unabashed predictions of miracles and the fears of some Israelis that the slightest concessions would mark the beginning the end, Secretary of State Kissinger is today a man on the spot. The stakes are so high that no party to the complex diplomacy now under way can lightly contemplate the possibility of breakdown in the indirect talks between Israel and Syria.

title: TWO LENS MAKERS SET JOINT VENTURE
description: The Milton Roy Company, a major producer of hard contact lenses based in St. Petersburg, and Automated Optics, Inc., an East Northport, LI., company that owns patents to cosmetic soft contact lenses recently approved for marketing by the Food and Drug Administration, formally announced yesterday a Joint, venture for the manufacturing, and sale of the new lenses on a nationwide scale.

title: MITCHELL IS CITED IN INQUIRY REPORT
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) The weight of evidence tends to establish that former Attorney General John N. Mitchell approved the intelligencegathering plan, that led to the Watergate breakin, the Senate Watergate committee staff says in a draft report.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Of Thee I Sing
description: FREEPORT, Minn.L am a peon little rich boys I didn't, grow up in the, slums of Chicago or the ghetto of New York. I was a poor boy without even knowing that I was poor. I grew up on the west, side of St. Paul, Minn., not too far from the home of F. Scott Fitzgerald and across the Mississippi from the mansion of James J. Hill, the financier and railway promoter.

title: FASHION TALK The Closet May Seem Too Little This Fall
description: Voluminous. Massive. Wide. Flowing. These are the words to describe the new clothes that are emerging as the fall collections unfold on Seventh Avenue. Voluminous capes. Wide coats and jackets. Big, flowing skirts. It's not the sort of change that is going to knock people off their feet. But as clothes get roomierand at the same time longer it makes skimpy shapes look obsolete.

title: NIXON TAPES TIED TO TAX DEDUCTION
description: CBS News said last night that the special Watergate prosecutor's staff believed one reason President Nixon bugged his offices and telephones was to create future income tax deductible gifts, The Associated Press reported.

description: Pro Transactions BASEBALL

title: 4 Dominicans Die as Military Clash With Demonstrators
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic May 8Four persons wens killed during a clash between the military and a group protesting the jailing of political prisoners, the police said today.

title: LOUISE BRANDWEN
description: Louise Brandwen, who founded Stage Studio, an actIng school in Washington, in the early nine Leensixties, died of cancer Saturday in George Washington Hospital. She was 52 years old.

title: Toronto Funds Sue Vesco And the Bank of New York
description: Robert L. Vesco, the international financier who has been a fugitive since he was indicted a year ago along with two former Cabinet officers, John N. Mitchell and Maurice H. Stans, was cited yesterday in a $60million complaint filed in the Federal District Court here.

title: The Screen Theater: Idiot's Delight
description: Considering the bleak news from overseas, it might be welcome to have a sunny, sparkling Israelimade musical, foaming with melody and dancing and with a sweet underlying spirit of brotherhood. And this is exactly what happened yesterday with the arrival of Kazablan at the Festival and other showcases. The picture is delightful.

title: Russian Envoy Calls On Giscard, Stirring A Dispute in France
description: PARIS, May 8The Soviet Ambasiador has called on Valery Giscard d'Estaing, the conservative presidential candidate, resulting in an assertion by some rightwing commentators that Moscow was interfering in France's internal affairs.

title: Nets Bow to Stars, 97 to 89, Losing Bid for Series Sweep
description: SALT LAKE CITY, May 8 The distinction of sweeping a finalround series for the American Basketball Association championship eluded the New York Nets tonight, as they lost a hardfought 9789 decision to the Utah Stars.

title: Bates Raises Bid to Martin for Shares
description: The Bates Manufacturing Company, Inc., announced yesterday that it had submitted new offer to the Martin Foundation, Inc., for Bates stock owned by the foundation. The company said, it would pay $14.25 a share for the 827,990 Bates common shares and $18.125 share for 31,000 convertible preferred shares, for a total $12,360,732. Merger News

title: SHALL PRICE RISES FOR FOOD FORECAST
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI)The Agriculture Department said today that consumers would probably see only slight price increases for food during the rest of this year and might see a small decline late in the year.

title: Books of The Times
description: Here's a murder mystery in which the only, witness to the crime is a chimpanzee a chimpanzee who has learned to communicate through a set of symbols. Here's a plot that raises such questions as Can a chimpanzee lie? Disguised as a suspense novel, The Poison Oracle also broaches such issues as the interplay between language and culture. If the language disintegrates, will the culture join it in a suicide pact? Does the absence of any terminology for cause and effect preserve a society from the decadence that seems to overtake all others? Might it not be necessary for the 200), century to maintain at least one undeveloped country as a guarantee, in a sense, of our history? Are we, as Max Lerner once said about literature, constantly in need of rebarbarization?

title: Kaballah Inspires a Bernstein Dybbuk
description: The relaticinship of mathematies to music is not news, but the relationship of Leonard Bernstein to the Kaballah, the traditional Jewish mysticism with a passion for numbers, strikes a new note.

title: 7 Die in. New Haven Fire That Destroys a Building
description: NEW HAVEN, May 8 Seven persons, including a 2year old boy and his infant brother, died in a threealarm fire that destroyed a fourstory brick apartment house here last night. Officials called it the wdrst residential fire in the city's history.

title: LeadPaint Ban Tying Up Mortage Help for Poor
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 8A continuing controversy over leadbased paint has all but eliminated mortgage assistance for lowincome families in this city and seriously jeopardized similar home loan plans in urban areas all across the country.

title: House Blocks Mail Registration Of Voters in Federal Elections
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The House of Representatives blocked and probably killed today a Pill that would have allowed voters to register by postcard for Federal elections:

title: SYRIA SAYS ISRAELIS SUFFER CASUALTIES
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 8 Reuters)Syria's military spokeshian asserted today that artillery fire was inflicting losses on Israeli forces along the Golan Heights.

description: On U.S. Doinors, Prim In dollars are valid only for stocks accompanied by Validation Certificate

title: Losses for April Expected By the Securities Industry
description: WHITE SULPHER SPRINGS, W. Va., May 8Many of the nation's leading stockbrokers and investment bankers, assembled here for three days with their wives and golf clubS, heard another grim report on their industry today.

title: 2 Washington Papers End Pacts With Printers but Will Negotiate
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) The Washington StarNews and The Washington Post terminated their labor contracts with the printers union today but said they intended to continue negotiations.

title: Boy, 11, Found Dead Inside Septic Tank After a 3Day Hunt
description: Boy, 11, Found Dead Inside Septic Tank After a 3Day Hunt

title: Quarry, Floored, Winsin2d
description: UNIONDALE, LI., May 8 Jerry Quarry almost lost a $200,000 paycheck in the Nassau Coliseum tonight when littleknown Joe Alexander of Sumpter, S.C.; floored the world's secondranking heavyweight challeger in the first round for a mandatory 8 count.

title: After Paved Roads, Canadian Wheat Town Wilts
description: LUCKY LAKE, SaskatchewanLike small towns everywhere, this one sustains itself with endless discussion of any tiny irregularity that appears: How did the broken Coke bottle get scattered all over Florence Ashdown's sidewalk this morning? Whose new Chevy is that in the space where the bank man usually parks?

title: TV to Carry Remarks On House Hearings
description: The three major television networks said yesterday that they would present live coverage today of the opening statements as the House Judiciary Committee begins its hearings into the possible impeachment of President Nixon.

title: BIG WEATHER TEST TO BEGIN IN JUNE
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The first ships are leaving port this, week as part of a great mobilization of research vessels, aircraft, satellites, men and equipment for what Government officials calf the largest and most complex international scientific experment ever undertaken.

title: Woman, 66, Slain After Asking Gunman to Leave Some Change
description: The elderly wife of a South Bronx shopkeeper was slain by a young gunman yesterday after she had pleaded with him during a $25 holdup to leave some change in the cash register.

title: Work Will Force Detour On Brooklyn Expressway
description: The Queensbound roadway of the BrooklynQueens Expressway from Fulton Street to Sands Street, Brooklyn, will be closed to traffic from 9 P.M. today to 5 A.M. tomorrow.

title: DEMOCRATS GRADE GOVERNOR'S TERM
description: ALBANY, May 8A nonGovernor, said Representative Ogden R. Reid, Failure across the board, said Representative Hugh L. Carey. Should be demoted, said Howard J. Samuels.

description: Chicago Board Options Exchange Wednesday, May 8, 1974

title: Printers Growing Bitter About Lack of Union Aid
description: Locked Out by The Daily, News, read the signs on the picket line yesterday.

title: Each Other's Mail
description: WASHINGTON, May 8In 1929, Secretary of State Henry Stimson closed down the black chamberthe State Department's codebreaking officeon the principle that the way to make men and nations trustworthy was to trust them. As he later told aide McGeorge Bundy, Gentlemen do not read each other's mail.

title: Long Shot Ties Mark At Aqueduct
description: Mike John G. equaled the track record of 1:08 35 for six furlongs in winning the 81st running of the $27,625 Toboggan Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Soviet Affirms Right to Send Ships to Indian Ocean
description: MOSCOW, May 8The Soviet Union today asserted its right to send ships into the Indian Ocean and accused China of purposely misrepresenting the Soviet naval presence in an effort to whip up antiSoviet sentiment in the region.

title: People and. Business Dunlop Weighs Inflation Trend
description: The director of the Cost of Living Council said yesterday that he expected the rate of inflation to decline in the Necond and third quarters before rising again in the last three months of 1974.

title: People in Sports
description: Shep Messing, a member of the 1972 United States Olympic soccer team, has finally unglued himself from the New York Cosmos bench and will become the team's regular starting goalie beginning Sunday against the Miami Toros. Jerry Sularz of Poland was relegated to Messing's former seat.

title: Fred Kelly Aviation Pioneer And Olympic Medal Winner
description: MEDFORD, Ore., May 8 (UPI) Fred W. Kelly, a 1912 Olympic goldmedal winner and aviation pioneer died yesterday in a nursing home at the age of 82.

description: LONDON METAL MARKET

title: Wilson Alters Rent Bill To Reflect Tenant Views
description: ALBANY, May 8Governor Wilson tonight sent to the. Legislature a new rent bill, replacing one he had introduced last week and incorporating many suggestions of tenant groups.

title: Seizure of Property by Nasser Is Ruled Illegal by Cairo Court
description: CAIRO, May 8Egypt's highest court of appeals, in the first judgment of its kind, has ruled that confiscation of private citizens property during the peqd of power by the late President Gamal Abdel Nasser was illegal and must be rescinded.

title: Copper Range Company to Base Its Prices on Listing of Futures
description: The Copper Range Company announced yesterday that, In contrast to other major companies, it would base its prices for domestic sales of refined copper on New York Commodity Exchange, Inc., prices for the metal. The net effect of the policy, which went into effect May 1, is that Copper Range will charge, considerably more for copper) than do other producers.

title: Measure to Take Over 2 Plants Put Aside
description: ALBANY, May 8The Senate majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, put aside in middebate tonight a bill for the takeover of two Consolidated Edison Company power plants, charging that the State Democratic Chairman, Joseph F. Crangle, had ordered all Democratic Senators not to support the measure.

title: W.H.A. Championship
description: May 12 AtChlcago, 8:30 P.M.

title: Black Population Growth Slows But It Still Exceeds White Rate
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The population growth rate of black Americans; although undergoing a slowing trend, continues to outpace that of Whites, the Bureau of the census reported today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New Jersey Supreme Court upheld the constitutionality of a Newark requirement that, with certain exemptions, employes live within the city limits. The opinion affirmed a ruling by the State Civil Service Commission that an employe of the city's Law Department had not been unjustly dismissed when she had moved from Newark to Union. Justice Morris Pashman dissented in a 35page opinion, contending that the residency requirement infringed on the right to travel and violated the equalprotection clause of the Constitution.

title: INQUIRY BY SENATE ON JUSTICE AGENCY IN COVERUP VOTED
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Senate Judiciary Committee voted unanimously today executive session to begin fullscale hearings into the Justice Department's failure to unravel the Watergate coverup in the summer and fall of 1972, Senate sources said.

title: Political Watershed for France
description: It remains to be seen what vestiges are left, but the spirit is gone and gradually the policies are likely to change. Now the question for France is, Left or right?the historic division of this oftentroubled society. Gaullism blurred that underlying issue, gathering people from all classes into a broad political spectrum.

title: Hearst Offers $50,000 Reward For Aid in Release of Daughter
description: HILLSBOROUGH, Calif., May 8 (AP)Calling his daughter's abductors a bunch of criminals, Randolph A. Hearst posted a $50,000 reward today and said he would do anything in his power to secure her release.

title: Walter C. Lowdermilk, Conservationist, Is Dead
description: Walter Clay Lowderrnilk, an international authority on fcTest, land and water conservation, died, Monday at his home in Betkeley, Calif. He was 86 yeari old.

description: WASHINGTON. May 8The staff of the Senate Watergate committee has recommended that Congress create permanent public attorney's of lice to investigate and prosecute alleged wrongdoing within the executive branch of the Government.

title: SYRIAISRAEL GAIN SERBY KISOR
description: JERUSALEM, May 8Secretary of State Kissinger said that he had made some progress in his peacemaking efforts today, as he shuttled between Israel and Syria to convey each side's revised proposals for separating their troops on the Golan Heights.

title: Market Is Mixed in Dull Trading
description: A sharp decline in the price Of Combustion Engineering highlighted activities on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday as the market finished mixed in lethargic trading.

title: Notes on People PODC Blesses Couples on DivorceTest Eve
description: Three days before Italians vote on whether to repeal Italy's threeyearold divorce law, Pope Paul VI yesterday pointedly gave a group of newlyweds his special benediction, adjuring them to be faithful to the mission that the Lord confides in the family. Along with the Vatican, the dominant Christian Democrat party and the neofascist Italian Social Movement support repeal of the divorce law, but the church has been particularly active in the campaign for repeal.

title: Business Writers Elect
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8 (UPI)Hobart Rowen, assistant managing, editorfinancial of The Washington Post, was reelected today as president of the Society of American Business Writers at their annual meeting. Also reelected were Don Campbell, financial editor of The Daily News, New York, as vice president and Myron Kandel of the Wall Street Leter, New York as treasurer.

title: Dance Royal Ballet's. Lush Manon
description: It is all unfair. Institutions, by, calendar count, grow old as quickly as the people watching them. But institulions, at least the right intitutions, are forever renewing themselves and are, as a consequence eternally young. Tuesday at the Metropolitan Opera House, Britain's Royal Ballet started one of its regular New York seasons, but this time celebrating its first visit to the Seshoreg 25 years ago. And the company seems to have  gotten younger. It is as welcome as the flowers in May.

title: OUTPUT OF GASOLINE EASES FOR THE WEEK
description: The American Petroleum Institute reported today that estimated gasoline production, aviation and motor, for the week ended Friday amounted to 6,267,000 barrels a day, compared with 6,287,000 barrels day in the previous week and 8,509,000 barrels a day a year ago.

title: Consumer Notes G.E. LightBulb Price Falls Sharply
description: The same 100watt General Electric light bulbs that until recently were selling for as much as $1.48 for a package of four can now be found for as little as 69 cents at Times Square Stores. The lower price represents the latest price break in General Electric bulbs following a court order on pricefixing last year and a move by the Pathmark chain last month to lower prices.

title: News Summary and Index THURSDAY, MAY 9, 1974
description: Prime Minister Elliott Trudeau's Governmeta was toppled when the Canadian House of Commons rejected his budget, leaving the administration without funds for its economic program. The 137to123 vote against the Government paved the way for new parliamentary elections this summer. [1:13.]

title: Business Records
description: Chapter XI Petition for an arrangement by; CALINA INDUSTRIES, INC., manufacture of warp knit fabrics, 1133 Ave. of Americas, N. Y., operates a plant in Marion, S. C. Signed by W. D. Clark, president. Liebillties, $5,131,055; assets, $3,839,019.

title: 2 Die in Freight Train Crash
description: CLEVELAND, May 8 (AP)Two crew members were killed early today when a Penn Central freight train crashed into raised drawbridge near downtown Cleveland. A railroad spokesman identified the dead as E. J, Koester, 53 years old, of Bellefontaine, Ohio, the engineer, and Ronald M. Connor, 21, of Youngstown, the fireman.

title: Dave Anderson
description: The carnival music of boyhood once seemed to be tinkling wherever Willie Mays went. But now soft violins accompany him. In his new role with the New York Mets he's almost invisible. He's listed as a coach but he's really an instructor and an ambassador. Tonight he will represent the Mets at a dinner for The Lighthouse and tomorrow he will go to Chicago, where the Mets open a weekend series. The other coaches will be lodged in single hotel rooms but Willie Mays will check into a suite. He will put on his uniform with the same 24 on it, but he won't run fast enough to lose his cap. He might take a few swings in the batting cage or shag few fly balls. Then he'll hit grounders a the infielders. But he won't sit in the dugout during the game. He'll be dressed and gone by then.

title: 4 Buffaloes Flee
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., May 8 (UPI)Four buffaloes escaped from their home at the Roger Williams Park Zoo and roamed for more than three hours yesterday after vandals tore a hole in a fence. The police said one of the frightened animals died of shock and exhaustion after darting across Interstate 95 at rush hour. Two others were found swimming in a pond in nearby Cranston. The fourth was recaptured inside the park.

title: Daley Gets GetWell Raise
description: CHICAGO, May 8 (AP)The City Council sent Mayor Richard J. Daley a getwell card today and sweetened it with a $25,000ayear raise. Mr. Daley has been in RushPresbyterianSt. Luke's Hospital since Monday, undergoing treatment for high blood pressure and diabetes. The City Council's 45to0 vote will increase the Mayor's salary from $35,000 a year to $60,000.

title: Wrecker Falls 4 Stories
description: Cleon Rubin, 49 years old, of 914 Hancock Street, Brooklyn, a member of a demolition, crew working on a building at 650 Fifth Avenue at West 52d Street, fell four stories through a stairwell at 10 A.M. yesterday. He was taken to Polyclinic Hospital, where his condition was reported as critical.

title: Central Japan Rocked By Sharp. Earthquake
description: TOKYO, Thursday, May 9 (AP)A sharp earthquake rocked central Japan this morning. The police said 70 homes collapsed in an area about 50 miles southwest of Tokyo and at least one person was killed.

title: Over Here! and Coward Produce Derwent Winners
description: Two Broadway performers were chosen yesterday as winners of the 30th annual Clar, ence Derwent awards for the actor and actress who gave the best supporting performances.

title: Lopsided Boom
description: The latest McGrawHill capital spending survey finds that American corporations are planning a huge increase in their outlays on new plant and equipment this yeara jump of nearly 20 per cent to a total of $119 billion.

title: WESTCHESTER ACTS IN GARBAGE CRISIS
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 8Westchester County proposed today to assume the entire responsibility for processing and disposing of the 900,000 tons of garbage discarded in the county every year.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
description: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE

title: Akron Strike Ends
description: AKRON, Ohio, May 8 (UPI)The Akron Beaconrournal resumed normal publication yesterday after six days, having reached agreement on a new, oneyear contract with members of Local 473 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: JEWISH EDUCATOR SACKS RRITNN:
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N.Y., May 87 Dr. Gerson D. Cohen, newly ordained chancellor of the Jewish Theological Seminary of America, tonight criticized those Americans, including Jews, who seek to abandon the merit system in their support of minority rights.

title: SPORTS AUTHORITY FIGHTING COST RISE
description: Though inflationary pressures have made for a substantial increase in its building costs, the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority maintains it will be able to finish its proposed Meadowlands football stadium and race track without further financing.

title: Yankee Box Score
City College Leaders in Dispute Over Medical Program Quotas
description: The president of City College, Robert E. Marshak, and his dean of the Faculty of Liberal Arts were in dispute yesterday over charges that the college's accelerated medicaltraining program used racial quotas to fill its classes.

title: Consumer Chief Reports a Plea To  Go Easy on a Beame Backer
description: Elinor Guggenheimer, the Commissioner of Consumer Affairs, said yesterday that Irving Goldman, the Commissioner of Cultural Affairs and a major fundraiser in Mayor Beame's election campaign, had asked her to go easy on a Beame campaign contributor whose company was under investigation for alleged consumer fraud.

title: LeadPaint Ban Tying Up Mortgage Help for Poor
description: LeclPaint Ban Tying Up

title: Rodino Proposes to Issue Series of Tape Subpoenas
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 President Nixon will face series of subpoenas for tape recordings and other documents on specific subjects if he continues to withhold evidence from the House impeachment inquiry, according to a plan the chairman of the House Judiciary Committee outlined privately to other Democrats this morning.

title: Mets Records
description: Mets Records

title: SYRIAISRAEL GAIN SEEN BY KISSINGER
description: JERUSALEM, May 8Secretary of State Kissinger said that he had made some progress in his peacemaking efforts today, as he shuttled between Israel and Syria to convey each side's revised proposals for separating their troops on the Golan Heights.

title: YOUTH, 15, IS HELD IN FAMILY DEATHS
description: A 15yearold Brooklyn youth who telephoned the police Tuesday night to report the stabbing murder of his mother and brother was charged yesterday with the homicides.

title: Policeman Changes His Story At Hearitig in Slaying of Boy, 10
description: Pretrial hearings in the murder trial of Police Officer) Thomas J. Shea got under way in Queens yesterday, with al fellow policeman changing his story about what Officer Shea told him about the fatal shooting of a 10yearold boy a year ago.

title: Interior of Municipal Building To Get $24Million Renovation
description: The Municipal Building, stereotyped in the public mind as a bureaucratic filing cabinet where the arcane business of city government is conducted in grubby surroundings, is scheduled for interior modernization at an outlay of $24milliontwice what it cost to put up the building 60 years ago. As a result of the renovation, the building will be able to accommodate 6,500 workers instead of the present 3,000.

title: $87,000 Net Reported By Amex for Quarter
description: Despite a continuing decline in trading volume, the American Stock Exchange had a net income of $87,000 in the first quarter of this year, compared with a $107,000 loss in the similar period of 1973, Paul Kolton, chairman, reported yesterday.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Chief Justice Richard J. Hughes of the State Supreme Court says lawenforcement officials in New Jersey were authorized to wiretap telephones and conduct electronic surveillance in 227 cases in 1973. He disclosed the figure in a report to Governor Byrne and the Legislature. The authorizations, Mr. Hughes said, came under the state Wiretapping and Electronic Surveillance Control Act of 1969.

title: Kissinger Aide, Said to Be Dissatisfied, Quits
description: WASHINGTON, May 8A high aide to Secretary? of State Kissinger resigned today over what his associates said was his despair over the way Mr. Kissinger was running the Stkte Department and dealing with the Pentagon.

title: Sun Oil Price Increase
description: The Sun Oil Company said yesterday that it had increased prices by 2 cents a gallon, on kerosene, No. 1 and No. 2 distillate fuel and diesel fuel to all classes of customers.

title: India Strike Snarls Trains But Fails to Halt Service
description: NEW DELHI, May 8A national railway strike brought major passenger and freight disruptions to India today. But Government officials were exultant that on its first day the walkout had not effectively crippled the transport system.

title: TREASURY ISSUE GIVES PEAK YIELD
description: Investors moved out enthusiastically yesterday to buy the Treasury's new 8 per cent bonds and 8 per cent notes the highest interest rates for such securities in the country's history individuals and smaller banks and pension funds submitted orders for $831million of the new Treasury, securities yesterday, bringing to $1.63billion the volume of such orders this week as the Treasury moved to refinance $4.05billion of notes and bonds that come due May 15.

title: Soviet Stresses Support of East Germany
description: MOSCOW, May 8The Soviet, leadership expressed its soliatirity with East Germany today in the wake of the espionage case that toppled Chancellor Willy Brandt. But there Were signs that Moscow was not entirely happy with East Germany over the affair.

title: LATE CITY EDITION
description: Weather: Rain likely today; cool tonight. Fair and cool tomorrow. Temp. range: today 4658; Wed. 4365. Additional details on Page 86.

title: Dogs Draw Interest at Bank Here
description: The rate of interest soared to new heights at the Manhattan Savings Bank last week. The interest, however; was canine and not monetary, for the bank was staging its 14th annual dog exhibition From Monday through Friday, during the luncheon hours, representatives of 23 breeds went through their paces in a ring set up in the institution's lounge at Madison Avenue and 47th Street lihere even were dogs in thewindows and they made nary a sound; for they were Royal porcelain.

title: Lonborg Turns Back Time Padres, 4.0
description: It's been a long time since Jim Lonberg won the Cy Young Award with Boston in 1967 with a 229 wonlost record while leading the American League in strikeouts with 246. And it's also been a long time between shutouts.

title: Gulf Oil Challenged On Cost Increases
description: WASHINGTON, May 8In the first of several promised actions against major international oil companies, the Federal Energy Administration challenged the Gulf Oil Corporation today to justify $46.5million of costs claimed by Gulf for crude oil it bought from two of its foreign affiliates last winter.

title: Robbers Hit Giants Two Nights Running
description: The San Francisco Giants, victimized by robbers Tuesday night while winning a doubleheader from the New York Mets, were hit again by thieves prior to last night's game.

title: Truman. Is Honored By Family on Birthday
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., May 8 (UPI)On what would have been former President Harry S. 90th birthday members Truman's his family gathered beside his grille here today at a brief ceremony.

title: Brandt Resigned, in Part, Over Data on Private Life
description: BONN, May 8Willy Brandt, who resigned as Chancellor of West Germany Monday night following the discovery of an East German spy on his staff, said in a televised speech tonight that he had quit, in part, because there were indications my private life would be drawn into speculation about the ease.

description: British Football

title: Northern Ireland Gunmen Kill 10th Catholic in 6 Days
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 8 (UPI)Two gunmen shotand killed a Roman Catholic who answered a knock at his door outside Belfast late tonight, then fled in two automobiles.

title: News Broadcasts
description: 9:0610 A.M., WQXR: Plano Personalities. Geza Anda and Agustin Anievas. Waltzes, Brahma; Rhapsody for Piano and Orchestra, Bartok.

title: Vermont Man Enters Race
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., May 8 (AP)The House Speaker, Walter Kennedy, announced today that he would seek the Republican nomination for Governor.

title: Matlack Stops Giants, 42, for Mets
description: With a sparkling performance that gave Manager Yogi Beirajust cause to feel thire's no pitcher like a southpaw, lanky Jon Matlack led the New York Mets to an easy 42 victory over the San Francisco Giants last night at Shea Stadium.

title: Rockefeller Aide Gets Post
description: ALBANY, May 8 (UPI)John W. McGrath, a longtime campaign aide to former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller, has been named director of the Republican State Committee's designating convention to be held June 11 and 12 in the Nassau Coliseum. Richard Rosenbaum, the G.O.P. State chairman, announced Mr. McGrath's selection today. Mr. McGrath, a Manhattan lawyer, was active in Mr. Rockefeller's political campaigns from 1964 through 1970.

description: The Associated Press

description: Wednesday, May 8. 63d day. Weather clear, track fast.
