description: World Team Tennis

title: A New Phase for the Europeans
description: BONN, May 12The startling series of recent government changes and frailties in the Western world has prompted many efforts to find a common thread that would explain them. On the face of it, each case has been different. Some of the upheavals appear to have been accidental, haphazard, personal, as in the death of the French President, Georges Pompidou; the miscalculations of Britain's Prime Minister, Edward Heath, who called an election in the hope of settling a disastrous coal strike and lost out to Harold Wilson, or the conscience of Willy Brandt, who took responsibility for a spy scandal within his office and resigned as the West Chancellor. News Analysis

title: KISSINGER'S TALKS SHOW NO PROGRESS
description: JERUSALEM, May 14Secretary of State Kissinger shuttled between Syria and Israel today without making any significant progress toward a troop separation agreement between the two countries.

title: Newcombe, Smith, Laver Net Victors
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 14 (Reuters)  Topseeded John Newcombe of Australia and Brian Gottfried, last year's winner, won firstround matches today in the $150000 Alan King tennis tournament.

title: Wellesley Upgrades Matrons
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., May 14 (AP)Wellesley College has agreed to upgrade the salary levels of 26 matronspart of the 311member maintenance staff at the collegeto give them parity with the custodians, officials said. The decision today came after a year of demands from the matrons that they be paid the same as their male counterparts. The increase in some cases amounts to 64centsanhour.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: NEWS INDEX

title: The Gentleman In S208
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Senator Mike Mansfield of Montana is a reminder that there are still a lot of steady decent folk around here watching the store. Everybody in Washington is not crazy; it just seems that way.

title: Bridge: To Qualify for Pairs Final Most U.S. Teams on Road
description: LAS PALMAS, Canary Islands, May 14Most of the American representatives in the world openpair championship were comfortably placed here tonight, going into the final qualifying session, but a few pairs were having to fight for their places in the foursession final beginning tomorrow. Sixty pairs will qualify in the field of 192 pairs.

title: Public Trial in Thefts Opens at the Vatican
description: ROME, May 14  The first public criminal trial to be held in Vatican courts opened today, with four former lay employes of the Vatican as defendants and three lay judges.

title: Deaths
description: ABOUDYGeorge. John Hancock Lodge, No. 70, F. & A. M., records with sorrow the loss of Its esteemed Brother.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: 30,000 Hail Celtics in Boston

title: U.S. Steel Plans To Keep Its Prices At Present Level
description: The United States Steel Corporation does not plan any further price increases at this time, David M. Roderick, chairman of the finance committee, told security analysts at San Francisco yesterday. He indicated there was still a 6 per cent costprice deterioration from Phase 2 to Phase 4, but said after the meeting that the company does not plan any further increases unless costs continue to rise.

title: Stock Prices End Mixed In Day of Slow Trading
description: The stock market made halfhearted attempt to advance yesterday but did not succeed and finished mixed in very slow trading.

title: Fringe Benefits Attract A Civilian 26 to Force
description: I liked the fourweek vacation and the free medical benefits, 26yearold Roseanne Reed said yesterday as she talked about some of the reasons why she decided to take the Civil Service test a year ago last February to work as a civilian employe in the Police Department.

title: GEORGES HIRSCH, LED PARIS OPERA
description: Also Ran OperaComiqueResistance.Leader Dies

title: SUGAR BILL CLEARED IN HOUSE COMMITTEE
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The House Agriculture Committee voted today to reduce Federal payments to sugar growers and to allow a $110million excise tax on the refined produce to expire in 1975.

title: Sparta Computer Voting Marks a First for State
description: SPARTA, May 14  Voters picked up stubby styluses with pinsized steel tips today and punched yellow data cards to record their choices for the Sparta Township Council. Tonght a pintsized computer read and counted the votes.

title: TESTIMONY REREAD IN POLICE SLAYINGS
description: A Manhattan Supreme Court jury of 11 men and one woman spent most of yesterday in court listening to a rereading of testimony by key witnesses, including several who had testified they witnessed the fatal shooting in 1971 of two police officers in a Harlem Housing project.

title: Arabs Seize Israeli, School, Hold 90 Children Hostage
description: MAALOT, Israel, Wednesday, May 15Arab guerillas seized an Israeli school near the Lebanese border before dawn today, captured at least 90 children and threatened to kill them unless the Government agreed to release imprisoned Arab guerrillas.

title: Gifts of Jewels to Nixons From Saudis Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The White House acknowledged today that Mrs. Richard M. Nixon and her daughters had received gifts/ of jewelry, including a $52,400 matched set of emeralds and diamonds, from the Saudi Arabian royal family.

title: Con Edison Wins Support For 17% Rise in Gas Rates
description: ALBANY, May 14The Consolidated Edison Company won preliminary approval of a $27.8Million, or 17 per cent, increase in its gas rates today as Governor Wilson summoned the bipartisan legislative leadership to his offices this evening for final effort at resolving the impasse that continued to block state aid for the financially pressed utility.

title: Savings Banks Urged to Study. Varied Yields by F.DI.C. Head
description: PORTLAND Ore., May 14The chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation asked savings bankers today to consider a variable interest rate on longterm deposits that would be tied to fluctuations in Federal Treasury bill rates.

title: BENJAMIN HELLER
description: Benjamin Heller, a lawyer here since. 1930, died Monday in. North Shore Hospital in Manhasset, L. L He was 69 years old and lived at 166 Hemlock Road, Flower Hill, Manhasset.

title: Police Resentment Fading As Civilians Take On Jobs
description: In the fall of 1972, a decision was made within the high command of the Police Department that was, in time, to alter the very essence of the department.

title: C.I.T. Bank Unit Seeking Empire National Merger
description: The National Bank of North America, a subsidiary of the C.I.T. Financial Corporation, announced yesterday an agreement to merge the Empire National Bank into the National Bank of North America. The agreement, which has been approved by the boards of both banks, provides that stockholders of Empire National will receive seventenths of one share of C.I.T. common in a taxfree exchange for each share of Empire common stock.

title: FAITHFUL AT GARDEN FOR BRITISH GROUP
description: Sometimes It's possible to admire what a band is doing, but still find oneself almost totally detached from it emotionally.

title: Kuwait Ratifies Agreement for a 60% Share in Oil
description: KUWAIT, May 14 (AP) Kuwait's Parliament and Cabinet ratified today an agreement that gives the Government a 60 per cent share in Western oil company operations in the Persian Gulf sheikdom.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: NEWS INDEX

title: 7 Accused of Using Locomotive To Steal Carloads of Produce
description: A sevenman gang used a railroad locomotive to hijack box cars and steal produce ati the Hunts Point Terminal Mar'to ket, the police charged yesterday. Five Penn Central employes and two private security guards were arrested.

title: PRODUCERS DEFINE SHUBERT SUPPORT
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz's call for the directors of the Shubert Foundation to disqualify themselves produced a show of Broadway unanimity that has caused wonderment even among those who participated in it.

title: HOARDERS IN IRAN FACING EXECUTION
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 14Iran, plagued by inflation and shortages partly resulting from its vastly increasing oil revenues, has established the death penalty and max.mum prison terms of 15 years as punishments that may be imposed for hoarding consumer goods.

title: Rainout Gives Mets Pitchers a Chance to Recover
description: ST. LOUIS, May 14Having treated St. Louis to one of their finer performances of skating on thin ice, the New York Mets got a little extra time from the rain tonight to prepare for an encore against the unamused and slipping Cardinals.Scrnith, also transplanted from F'enway Park. Now secure as the right fielder, Smith was leading his new team in batting with 376, in hits with 47, runs batted in with 27 and home runs with six. The only department dominated by a resident Cardinal was stolen bases, and the resident was Lou Brock, with 22 in a row.

title: F.P.C. IS STUDYING PENNZOIL SPINOFF
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Federal Power Commission, raising questions of selfdealing, today began an investigation of the Pennzoil Company's proposed sale of the United Gas Pipe Line Company.

title: A Catholic on Gay Life
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J.Like most people, I grew up with, and have continued to develop in the direction of, heterosexuality. Gay life has never appealed to me and, if truth be told, I have found the concept repugnant.

title: A CUSTOMS JUDGE AND SON ACCUSED OF LYING TO JURY
description: Paul P. Rao Sr., former chief judge and now senior judge on the United States Customs Court here, was arrested yesterday and charged with lying to a special grand jury. The jury was investigating an alleged scheme to bribe a State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn to influence the outcome of a robbery case.

title: U.S. Five Triumphs
description: LENINGRAD, May 14 (AP) A United States basketball team pulled away in the second half today for a 79.64 victory over a Soviet junior team in an exhibition game. The Americans led only 3530 at halftime, before breaking open the game in the second half.

title: FEDERAL JOB LINKED TO DATA ON POLITICS
description: HOUSTON, May 14 (UPI) Charles G. Rebozo, former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and Senator John G. Tower, Republican of Texas, all aided in obtaining a Government job for a political supporter in exchange for information on Chicano political party in Texas, The Houston Post said in a copyrighted article today

title: GROUP TO REVIEW U.S. LATIN POLICIES
description: Twenty  three prominent Americans have agreed to serve on an independent commission that will reexamine United States relations with Latin America. The group will make recommendations on United States policies toward Cuba and on trade and investment.

title: About the Mets
description: Jon Matlack and Tug McGraw, the two ranking casualties on the Mets pitching staff, were examined by the Cardinals physician Dr. Stan London, who found no complications. Matlack strained a muscle in the left thigh last Saturday but will be allowed to try throwing again in a few days. McGraw warmed up in the bull pen Monday night and found some improvement in his left shoulder, intellectual note: The Cardinals audience for the Mets opening game included 12,503 straightA high school students. Even Yogi Berra was impressed. Rusty Staub injured his shoulder in the National League playoff last October and people have been challenging his arm since then. So far, he's thrown out nine base runners in 32 games this season.

title: Quotes From Transcripts
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Following are excerpts from the White House transcription in which portions of the same conversation between President Nixon and Henry E., Petersen, are repeated in different versions.

title: Beame Seeks Stronger Ethics Board
description: Mayor Beame is planning a change that will greatly increase the status and authority of the city's Board of Ethics for the first time since it was formed in 1959 and became the model for some 500 similar municipal and state bodies.

title: Articles on Jews Stir Austrian Dispute
description: VIENNA, May 14A series of newspaper articles on the Jewish people, appearing amid a wave of films and books on Hitler, has caused a major controversy in Austria.

title: LILLIAN. ROOK, 71, FEMINIST, IS DEAD
description: Lillian D. Rock, who as vicepresident of the National Asso, ciation of Women Lawyers and as national chairman of Wornen in Public Service, Inc., suggested in the nineteenthirties that women fill high public office, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at her home, 440 East 57th Street. She was 71 years old.

title: Witnesses Recount Details of Shooting Of Robert Kennedy
description: LOS ANGELES, May 14 (AP) Amid challenges by critics of political motivation, experts and witnesses have gone over the sixyearold assassination

title: MAHEUEU JURY TOLD OF HUGHES DOUBTS
description: LOS ANGELES, May 14A Federal trial jury was told today that Howard R. Hughes hired private detectives to follow bankers who had turned down his request for financing of Trans World Airlines jet planes purchases in the nineteensixties.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: A DECISION BY VW ON U.S. NOT NEAR
description: Arthur J. Railton, vice president for corporate relations for Volkswagen of America, cautioned yesterday that a decision by Volkswagen to assemble or produce cars in the United States was several months off.

title: Schmidt Selects Bonn Cabinet; Few New Names Are on the List
description: BONN, May 14Chancellordesignate Helmut Schmidt today completed the selection of his Cabinet, which will be sworn in after his expected election in the West German Parliament Thursday to succeed Willy Brandt.

title: Senate Backs Access of Parents to School Records of Children
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 The Senate voted tonight with virtually no opposition to allow parents access to the, school records of their children and to prevent such documents from being given to others without parental consent.

title: I.B.M. AND TELEX ARGUE ON PRICING
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 14 A lawyer for Telex Computer Products, Inc., told a United States Court of Appeals here today that the International Business Machines Corporation had purposely redesigned electronic dataprocessing equipment and cut prices to drive Telex out of business.

title: Hot Brewers Beat Orioles. 83
description: Del Crandall, asked to explain the sudden success of the Milwaukee Brewers, replied, We're not doing anything differently. I guess we're just doing all the right things better.

description: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX

title: Nebraska Democrats Nominate Governor Exon to Second Term
description: OMAHA, May 14 (AP) Gov. J. James Exon, a Democrat, easily won nomination to a second term today and carried his virtually unknown running mate to victory over one of the state's most powerful figures.

title: About New York
description: The most beleaguered man in town defended his own yesterday, saying that most things were getting better, but that some things were getting worse. He was Benjamin J. Malcolm, the Commissioner of Correction, and he said that prisons were always full of troubles.

description: WASHINGTON, May 14Raoul Berger, the legal scholar, has given James St. Clair, President Nixon's chief defense attorney, an academic scolding for basing his impeachment defense on what Mr. Berger calls instant history, farfetched theories and sheer effrontery.

title: A Congreve Play To Open Season At Phoenix Theater
description: The Phoenix Theater, the nonprofit repertory, organization of which T. Edward Hambleton and Michael Montel are the managing directors, has settled on its opening attractions for next season, its 22d.

description: Events Today

title: Tracids Ordered To Remove Horses
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., May 14 (UPI)  Pocono Downs, Inc., denied racing dates this year by the Pennsylvania Harness Racing Commission today ordered all horses removed from the barn area of its race track.

title: Indian In flux Bring Racial Strife to West Canada Cities
description: SASKATOON, Saskatchewan The cities that are strung out across Canada's broad prairies tend to be neat little clusters of straight, flat roads, with a gotobedearly tradition and a pervasive sense of order.

title: Bollinger to Port Unit
description: ALBANY, May 14 (UPI)George F. Berlinger, the state's welfare inspector general, has been appointed by Governor Wilson to the 12member Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to a term ending July 1, 1976. Appointment to the unsalaried post requires Senate confirmation. Mr. Berlinger fills the vacancy created by the resignation of Bernard J. Lasker of New York City.

title: MRS. HENRY CHALMERS
description: Mrs. Sallie Kittner Chalmers, widow of Henry Chalmers, an authority on international trade who at his death in 1958 was adviser on commercial policy to the Department of Commerce, died on Friday at the George Washington University Hospital in Washington. Her age was 79.

title: U. S. Steel Plans To Keep Its Prices At Present Level
description: The United States Steel Corporation does not plan any further price increases at this time, David M. Roderick, chair man of the finance committee, told security analysts at San

title: Woman's Appeal Terms Police Surveillance Illegal
description: HACKENSACK, May 14  A 39yearold woman twice convicted of interfering with plainclothes state policeman taking pictures of a women'srights group in the Stae House in Trenton appealed her case to the Appellate Division of the State Superior Court today on the ground that the trooper's surveillance violated the First and 14th Amendments of the Constitution.

title: Forecast of G.N.P. Is Revised Upward By U.S. for 1974
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 The Government has revised upward its early 1974 forecasts of the gross national product, personal income and corporate profits for this year, apparently mainly because inflation is more severe than originally anticipated.

title: Books of The Times
description: Mr. Morrison is so fat that his downstairs neighbor who has hidden in his room for this express purpose can't ascertain his sex. As she covertly watches him undress, wondering where he could have purchased his elephantine yellow undershorts and how they could have lain foldedhow many times?on an ordinary shelf; as she finally sees Alleghenies of thigh and buttock when he lets them drop; as she puzzles over the layers and layers of Mr. Morrison's accumulated self that hides what she seeks  she feels love stealing over her.

title: Legislators in Closing Hours Use a Code
description: Legislators in Closing Hours Use a Code

title: Mutation Aids in Research on Malaria
description: A mysterious mutation in a strain of malaria parasites stored in a deep freezer has led to an accidental discovery that could ultimately help prevent many deaths among the world's 100 million malaria suffers.

title: New Anglican Primate Frederick Donald Coggan
description: LONDON, May 14In nonclerical terms, Dr. Donald Coggan has a hard act to follow. Dr. Coggan, who was named today as the next Archbishop of Canterbury, is seldom spoken of outside of the Church of England while the beaming face and portly figure of the present Archbishop of Canterbury, Dr. Arthur Michael Ramsey, are known to television viewers by the million. Alan in the News

title: Cincinnati Education Board Sues U.S. on School Funds
description: CINCINNATI, May 14 (UPI) The Cincinnati Board of Education filed suit in Federal court today in a dispute with the United States Department of Health, Education and Welfare over Federal funds for school desegregation.

title: Monroe, With 69, Leads by a Shot
description: DENVILLE, N. J., May 14 Lloyd Monroe of Upper Montclair, twice a New Jersey state amateur champion, took a onestroke lead today with a threeunderpar 69 in the opening round of the $25,000 Dodge open at the Rockaway River Country Club.

title: Handle With Care Wins 18th in Row
description: YONKERS, May 14Handle With Care, undefeated in 17 starts as a 2yearold last year, made her 3yearold debut a winning one tonight at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Kent State, 4 Years Later: Routine
description: KENT, Ohio, May 11 Mickey Cohen and Holly Schwartz tucked their mitts under their arms at the end of a girls intramural softball game and kidded their way across the campus common at Kent State University here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An explosion, rumbling out of the cellar of a crowded Queens firehouse as day and night shifts changed, enveloped two firemen in a sheet of flame and sent a dozen others reeling and tumbling about the premises.

title: Capture by British Of a Plan for Battle Admitted by I.R.A.
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 14 (AP)The Irish Republican Army acknowledged today that British security forces had captured one of its battle plans, but said it was winning the fight to oust Britain from Northern Ireland.

title: Fire Killing 8 Laid to Arson
description: NEW HAVEN, May 14 (AP)An arsonist set last week's fire that took eight lives in the city's Fair Haven section, police and fire officials said today. Nicholas Pastore, Chief Police Inspector, and Fire Marshal Thomas Lyden issued a joint statement saying that an accelerant had been found in the materials tested at a state laboratory in Hartford. They said the fire in a fourstory brick apartment on Castle Street had been caused by arson.

title: Bill Would Cut Oil Provision
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (UP) Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, cosponsored today a measure to end the oil depletion allowance; that lets oil companies write: off 22 per cent of their gross; income

description: PITTSBURGH; May 14The Greeniburg (Pa.) TribuneReview, whose publisher gave $1. million to. President Nixon's reeliclion campaign two yerars ago; urged the House today to impeach the President and urged the President to step aside pending a.Senate trial.

description: LONDON, May 14Dr. Donald Coggan, an energetic evangelist and a critic of permissiveness, was named today to be the next Archbishop of Canterbury, the spiritual leader of the world's Anglican communion of more than 45 million people.

title: Texas Nine Moves To District Playoff
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., May 11 (UPI)Kal Segrist, the Texas Tech baseball coach, chairman of the National Collegiate District 6 selection committee, announced that Texas, Louisiana Tech and Pan American have been selected for the district playoff at Arlington Stadium May 24 to 26.

description: Little by little last night Ralph Houk became less of an exYankee and more of manager of the Detroit Tigers.

description: Bargaining talks between the printers and the city's three major newspapers were reIcessed at 11:45 last night without an agreement.

title: Mindszenty in Perth Amboy
description: PERTH AMBOY, May 14 (UPI)Josef Cardinal Mindszenty, the aging Hunpzr primate, returned to New Jersey today to visit several Hungarian parishes. The Cardinal presided over a mass at St. Michael's Byzantine Rite Hungarian Church here and, speaking Hungarian, addressed the congregation on responsibilitiel of family life.

title: People in Sports
description: George McGinnis, the Indiana Pacers muscular star forward, headed for New York yesterday to talk to representatives of the Philadelphia 76ers, New York Knicks and Los Angeles Lakers, after having played out his option with the American BasketBall Assocation club. Although he wasn't impressed with the 76ers offer, he termed those of the Knicks and Lakers. unbelievable, and said: It's very very evident that they're both strong ball clubs. They're strong financially, so I don't think there's going to be a problem there.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Most designers show two collections, one vaguely sportswear, one vaguely couture. Couture actually refers to madetoorder clothes, but Seventh Avenue has picked up the term to mean anything that is relatively high priced and relatively well made.

title: What Nixon Knew, and When, and What He Did: A View
description: WASHINGTONThe bottom line in the entire Watergate affair, and by extension in the impeachment inquiry, consists of answers to these questions: What did the President know? When did he know it?. And what did he do about it?

title: A CUSTOMS JUDGE AND SON ACCUSED OF LYING TO JURY
description: Paul P. Rao Sr., former chief judge and now senior judge on the United States Customs Court here, was arrested yesterday and charged with lying to a special grand jury. The jury was investigating an alleged scheme to bribe a State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn to influence the outcome of a robbery case.

title: Hudson County Sizzling, 1: 11 for 6f, at Pimlico
description: BALTIMORE, May 14Hudson County stepped off a sizzling six furlongs in 1:11 35 today and sent the handicappers for Saturday's Preakness Stakes scurrying back to their racing forms. There was some speculation off this workout that the little offspring of Black Mountain mght be able to reverse the Kentucky Derby finish. Hudson County ran second in the Derby to Cannonade, the likely favorite in the 99th Preakness. Cannonade arrived on the scene today feeling frisky and fit.

title: Hot Brewers Beat Orioles, 83
description: Del Crandall, asked to explain the sudden success of the Milwaukee Brewers, replied, We're not doing anything differently. I guess we're just doing all the right things better.

title: Church in Italy Deplores Divorce Vote But Pledges Due Respect for Result
description: ROME, May 14Italy's Roman Catholic hierarchy today deplored the victory of the prodivorce forces in the national referendum Sunday and yesterday, but said that the church would show due respect for the will of the majority.

title: HOUSE UNIT BACKS POULTRY AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 A bill compensating Mississippi poultry farmers for the destruction of chickens that had been contaminated by a pesticide appeared to be in trouble in the House Rules Committee this afternoon until Representative G. V. Montgomery, a Mississippi Democrat, plunked down a box on the committee table and pulled out a rubber chicken.

title: TAX CASE QUASHED, CHICAGO PAPER SAYS,
description: CHICAGO, May 14 (AP)A Federal grand jury is investigating a charge that former Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie persuaded former United States Attorney. General John N. Mitchell to kill an incometax fraud case against Mr. Ogilvie's top political adviser, The Chicago Daily News says.

title: INQUIRY FOCUSES ON NIXON IN DAYS AFTER WATERGATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The House Judiciary Committee, in its second closed impeachment hearing, focused today on the period immediately after the Watergate burglary in an effort to determine whether President Nixon played any role in the genesis of the attempt to cover up the breakin.

title: Despite Breakthrough Rumors, Governor's Rent Bill Is Still Stalled as Compromise Amendments Are Sought
description: ALBANY, May 14Despite a flurry of rumors of an im breakthrough, Governor Wilson's rent bill remained stalled this afternoon as opposing forces studied a package of compromise amendments.

title: Jaime Torres Bodet Is Buried; Mexican Officials Pay Tribute
description: MEXICO CITY, May 14 (AP)  Government diplomats paid tribute today to Dr. Jaime Torres Bodet as he was buried in the Rotunda of Illustrious Men.

title: Banks Extend Pan Am Credit One Year
description: The head of Pan American World Airways announced yesterday that the hanks had granted the financially ailing company a year's extension on its $270million credit agreement and had eased its terms.

title: House Interior Committee Votes Compromise Version of Strip Mine Measure
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 The House Interior Committee finally approved today a compromise measure that would impose  if Congress has time ]eft to act on it this year the first Federal environmental controls on the strip mining of the nation's coal.

title: TRANSCRIPT VALID, WHITE HOUSE SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The White House admitted today that differing versions of the same conversation had appeared in its edited Watergate transcript, but reiterated its assertion that the transcript gave the full substance of the tape recordings from which they were taken.

title: Judge Rao, a Fading Patriarch, Wielded Power Among Italians
description: The city's political first families that wielded considerable power, particularly through the nineteenfifties and sixties. Judge Paul P. Rao Sr. of United States Customs Court has been the patriarch of one of

title: No Fault
description: Since the automobile first came into wide use a halfcentury ago, automobile accident cases have clogged the nation's lower courts. For plaintiffs, these trials have capricious results. Determining who was at fault is often so difficult as to be almost a metaphysical exercise. Some victims win huge damage awards while others who suffered approximately the same physical injuries receive much less or even nothing. Winners and losers alike have to wait years for a verdict.

title: N.H.L. Championship
description: May 7Bost. 3, Phila. 2.

title: Meyer Tops Scott By 67, 64, 76
description: WOODBURY, L.I., May 14 Ricky Meyer of Great Neck, an 18yearold Pennsylvania freshman, upset firstseeded Gene Scott of New York, 6.7, 64, 76, and reached the quarterfinals of the Eastern men's hardcourt tennis championship today at the Woodbury Country Club.

title: House Unit,36 to 0, Approves Report On Nixon's Homes
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) A House report that $1.7.1million in Federal funds had been spent in connection with President Nixon's homes was approved today by the House Government Operations Committe, The vote was 36 to 0.

title: News Summary and In WEDNESDAY, MAY 15, 1974
description: No significant progress was reported in Secretary of State Kissinger's efforts to obtain a troop separation agreement between Israel and Syria as he shuttled in his Air Force jet between Damascus and Tel Aviv. He had; set last night as his deadline for the completion of the agreement, but he said he needed 24 to 36 hours more. [1:1.]Queen': Elizabeth II, advised by Prime Minister Wilson, appointed a new Archbishop of Canterbury to succeed Dr. Michael Ramsey, who will retire in November. He is Dr. Donald Coggan, 64 years old, an active evangelist, a critic of permissiveness and, at present, Archbishop of York. [1:35.1NationalWhether President Nixon played any role in originating the Watergate coverup attempt was the principal question the House Judiciary Committee considered in its second closed impeachment hearing. The committee moved toward subpoenaing 11 more White House tape recordings when its lawyers decided it would not be possible to clarify the President's early attitude toward the Watergate breakin without them. [1:5.1General revulsion was expressed by Republican party leaders in a dozen stateseast and west, north and southwho were interviewed about their reactions to President Nixon's edited Watergate transcripts. They agreed that the President had been harmed by the transcripts release, and like most Republicans in Congress they appeared to want the House impeachment investigato continue. [1:23.1 James D. St. Clair, Mr. Nixon's chief defense attorney, has been rebuked by Raoul Berger, a constitutional scholar, for basing the impeachment defense on what Mr. Berger calls instant history, farfetched theories and sheer effrontery. Mr. Berger's criticism of Mr. St. Clair's legal defense of the President appears in the current issue of the Yale Law Journal, published today. 11:4.1Gifts of jewelry to Mrs. Nixon and her daughters, made in recent years by the Saudi Arabian royal family, were acknowledged by the White House. A White House spokesman deplored published reports that said there had been no public announcement of the gifts. Public disclosure of the gifts to Mrs. Nixon, which included an emerald and diamond necklace with matchihg pieces valued at $52,400, was made by The Washing: ton Post. [1:23.1 Congress and the Nixon Administration appeared to be heading for another battle: this time over the refusal of the Internal Revenue Service to provide certain information about I.R.S. investigations of militant and revolutionary organizations wanted by the Senate Subcommittee on Constitutional Rights, headed by Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. The I.R.S. has decided so far to provide only one of the items requested, a list of the names of the 8,000 politically active individuals and 3,000 activist organizations on which the I.R.S. has gathered information. [33:1.2.] Metropolitan Paul F. Rao Sr., former chief judge and now senior judge on the United States Customs Court, was arrested and charged with lying to a special grand jury investigating a plan to bribe a justice of the State Supreme Court in Brooklyn to influence the verdict in a robbery case. Judge Rao's son, Paul Jr., and the son's law partner were also arrested, special state prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari announced. [1:8.1 The Consolidated Edison Company won preliminary approval of a 17 per cent increase in its gas rates, amounting to $27.8million, as Governor Wilson summoned the bipartisan legislative leadership to his offices last night for a final effort at resolving the impasse that has blocked state aid for the financially pressed utility. 11:67.1 Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson of Newark was reelected to a second term on the strength of black votes in the city's South and Central Wards, which also put him in office in 1970. He defeated his principal opponent, State Senator Anthony Imperiale, easily and with 50 per cent of the vote he avoided a runoff. [1:67.1 Mayor Beame wants it to be compulsory for Mayors and heads of city agencies to submit all nominees for important jobs to the Board of Ethics for approval before naming them to the posts. He is planning a change that will greatly increase the status and authority of the Ethics Board. This will mean that no one could get a key job with the city without the board's clearance. At present submission of proposed appointees to the board's scrutiny is optional. L1:68.1

title: Natomas in India Oil Deal
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 14 (UPI) The Natomas Company said today that its Indian subsidiary had won the first contract awarded by India for petroleum exploration in the country's offshore waters. The concession covers 7 million acres on the Bay of Bengal.

title: Advertising:British Uncertainty
description: Although for British advertising agencies this is the most uncertain year in at least a decade, James O'Connor, director of the Institute of Practitioners in Advertising, says he believes that the worst is over and that the British industry should do as well as in 1973, or almost as well.

title: Rodino Explains a. Request For File in Kopechne Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 The House impeachment inquiry requested and received legal papers filed in the inquest into the death of Mary Jo Kopechne in its staff's search for precedents on the role of counsel in nonjudicial proceedings, Representative Peter W. Rodino Jr, said today.

title: TV Review
description: The Magical Mystery Trip Through Little Red's Head, today's Afterschool Special on ABCTV at 4:30, is a fully animated musical fantasy about the adventures of two children traipsing through their older sister's head. Their guide is a Jimmy Crickettype character named Timer, who helpfully reduces the children to his own nearly microscopic size: The older sister is the same Little Red of Riding Hood fame, in this case flattening the nasty old wolf with a few devastating karate chops.

title: MRS. FRANCES B. REDICK
description: Mrs. Frances Burke Redick, Connecticut Secretary of State from 1943 to 1945 and from 1947 to 1949, died on Monday. She was in her eighties and lived in Newington, Conn.

title: BALAGUER'S FOES TO BOYCOTT VOTE
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, May 14The Dominican Republic's main opposition group decided tonight to boycott the elections on Thursday in which President Joaquin Balaguer is seeking a third successive term.

title: Flyers Subdue Bruins, 42, Take 31 Lead in Playoffs

The triumph gave them a 31 lead in the fourofsevengame final playoff

title: SYRIA GIVES PRESS A FRONTLINE TOUR
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 14The 14 American newsmen accompanying Secretary of State Kissinger were taken on a guidIed tour of part of the Syrian front lines today and ran into a moderate to heavy artillery exchange.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Z. D. Bonner's extravagant praise of free enterprise (OpEd May 6) is almost laughably naive. He states, for example, speaking of the oil companies, that making more oil and gas available is what freeenterprise is all about.

title: A Successful Pirsig Rethinks Life of Zen and Science
description: After what he describes as a lifetime of rejection and humiliation that culminated in a mental breakdown, Robert M. Pirsig now faces the prospect of learning to live with success

title: Court Rejects Bengals Bid To Prevent Raids by W.F.L.
description: A court ruling in Cincinnati went in favor of the World Football League yesterday and against the Bengals, the local National Football League team that sought an injunction barring W.F.L. clubs from signing any more of its players. Two have jumped to the W.F.L., Bill Bergey and Steve Chomyszak.

title: Henry Benson Rockwell Of the Putney School Dies
description: Henry Benson Rockwell, who retired in 1969 as director of the Putney School in Vermont, died Sunday at his home in West Lebanon, N. H. He was 58 years old.

title: TRANSCRIPT VALID, WHITE HOUSE SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The White House admitted today that differing versions of the same conversation had appeared in its edited Watergate transcript, but reiterated its assertion that the transcript gave the full substance of the tape recordings from which they were taken.

title: 2 Democrats and Aide to Nixon Urge President Not to Resign
description: WASHINGTON, May 14At least two prominent Democrats and a White House aide found themselves in unusual agreement today in opposing any resignation by President Nixon.

title: Monday's Fights
description: New York (At Felt Forum)Angel Oquendo, 176 pounds, Puerto Rico, outpointed Juan Aguilar, 176, Argentina, 10 rounds.

title: College Degree Helps Prisoner to Freedom
description: SANTA FE, N. M., May 14 (AP)  Ralph D. Armstrong was one of 12 state prison inmates who received a twoyear college degrees yesterday in ceremonies at the College of Santa Fe. The convicts had been allowed to attend college on a special program to rehabilitate prisoners.

title: Seniors Golf Won By Vergara on 79
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., May 14Joseph Vergara of Winged Foot won the 40th annual spring tournament of the Westchester Seniors Golf Association today by scoring 38, 4179 at the Wykagyl Country Club. Vergara triumphed by two strokes in a field of 168 that played the 6,393yard, par 37, 3572 course.

title: Memorex Announces Shift
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Ma 14 (AP)The Memorex Corot ration announced today till it had changed its public a., counting firm from Arthur At derson & Co. to Haskins Sells. The computer equipmet manufacturer said it had it formed the Securities and E: change Commission of tr change in a letter.

description: Pro Transactions

title: Denis Dillon Weighs Race For Prosecutor in Nassau
description: Denis E. Dillon, chief of the Organized Crime Strike Force in the Eastern District of New York, said yesterday that he was considering entering the race for Nassau County District Attorney.
