description: TEL AVIV, May 16 (Reuters) Syrian gunners shelled Israeli positions and one settlement on the Golan Heights today, mainly around the salient captured by Israel in the October war, a military spokesman said here. Israel suffered no casualties, he added.

title: Pittsburgh's Newspapers Are Back After 46 Days
description: PITTSBURGH, May 16This city's two daily newspapers resumed publication today after a 46day strike by members of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: Hudson County Trainer Is Talking Tall
description: BALTIMORE, May 16He didn't finish Harvard, as the press releases have suggested.

title: Man Held as Killer After Widow Tells Of Chance Meeting
description: A murder charge was brought against a man yesterday after the victim's widow recognized the alleged killer by his tattoos and earings in a chance encounter in a hospital corridor on Wards Island.

title: Elderly Woman Rescued In Brooklyn Heights Fire
description: An elderly woman was carried unconscious from her burning apartment and seven firemen were felled by dense smoke last night in a threealarm blaze htat heavily damaged a brownstone in Brooklyn Heights and left half a dozen faniilies homeless.

title: Checking Big Brother
description: STOCKHOLM, May 16If Richard Nixon lived in Sweden, the truth about his tax deductions and payments would have been known as soon as he filed his return. By tradition and law, just about every public document here is open to anyone who wants to see it, whether it concerns him or not. That is one reason why the Swedish Government is pushing ahead with unique plan to control computer data banks.

title: Transcript of Conversation at Maalot
description: TEL AVIV, May 16Following is a transcript published by the Israeli Defense Ministry of exchanges yesterday between Israeli Army officers and Arab terrorists holding students hostage in the Maalot school:

title: Russian Church Leaders Call Outspoken Priest to Account
description: MOSCOW, May 16  A popular Russian Orthodox priest has been called in by the church hierarchy and ordered to explain in writing the outspoken opinions he expressed in an exchange of questions and answers with his congregation.

title: 3 Witnesses See No Hint Of Trot Fix
description: The defense in the racefixing trial of New York harness drivers yesterday trotted out three of the sport's wellknown authorities at the Brooklyn Federal Building to support its claim that there had been no wrongdoing by its clients.

title: If Only They Hadn't Piled Up All Those Dishes
description: For 48 hours last week it looked as if we were going to have to get out that fourth star and dust it off for use on Shinbashi, a new Japanese restaurant officially listed at 280 Park Avenue, although the entrance is on 48th nearer Madison than Park.

title: 10,000 Here Protest Terrorist Incident at Maalot
description: Angered and dismayed by the death of Israeli students in the terrorist incident at Maalot, more than 10,000 Jewish youngsters, rabbis, public officials and other sympathizers took part here yesterday in demonstrations of protest.

title: JAWORSKI ASSAILS PLUMBER DEFENSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, urged a Federal judge today to reject the contention that national !security was involved in the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's psychiatrist in 1971.

title: Energy Goals in Doubt
description: An expert panel of engineers reported yesterday to the Federal Government that it would take enormous effort to provide enough energy for American needs during the next 10 years and even then the effort might only postpone a grim future. Page 53.

title: Woman, Carrying Boy, Leaps in Front of Train
description: A woman with her 3yearold son in her arms leaped in front of a Queens subway train yesterday and, although two cars passed over them, neither was seriously injured.

title: People and Business New Outsider Joining Lehman
description: William Blackie, who was chairman and chief executive officer of the Caterpillar Tractor Company from 1966 to 1972, will join Lehman Brothers, the investment banking firm, as a senior partner.

title: ERIC GURER, 85, ARCHITECT, DIES
description: Eric Gugler, an architect who specialized in monuments and public buildings, died yesterday at his home in Sneden's Landing, N.Y. He was 85 years old,

title: SENATE IN JERSEY VOTES TO APPROVE CASINO GAMBLING
description: TRENTON, May 16A controversial measure authorizing casino gambling in New Jersey cleared the final legislative hurdle this evening with State Senate approval by a vote of 24 to 13. The bill thus received just the threefifth majority needed for a constitutional amendment.

title: Met Opera's President William Rockefeller
description: With the election of William Rockefeller as president of the Metropolitan Opera Association, a question that comes instantly to the mind of a nonRockefeller is Which Rockefeller is he? I'm not a descendant of John D. Rockefeller, said this member of the family. My greatgrandfather was his brother. Does that make him a greatgrandnephew of the original John D.? I never get these things quite straight, he said, but I guess that could be right.

title: Senate in Jersey Approves Casino Gambling Measure
description: TRENTON, May 16A controversial measure authorizing casino gambling in New Jersey cleared the final legislative hurdle this evening with State Senate approval by a vote of 24 to 13. The bill thus received just the threefifths majority, needed for a constitutional amendment.

title: Helmut Schmidt Sworn In as West German Chancellor
description: BONN, May 16  Helmut Schmidt, elected and sworn in today as West Germany's fifth postwar chancellor, said that he would continue the foreign policy conceived and begun by Willy Brandt, who resigned 10 days ago in an espionage scandal.

title: Across Color Line: A Lonely Step at 6
description: NEW ORLEANS To yearold Gail Etienne and Te: sie Prevost, it was only flat ural to leave for their firs day of school accompanie by their parents and Federa marshals.

title: Arafat in Damascus
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Friday, May 17 (Agence FrancePresse) Yasir Arafat, chairman of the Palestine Liberation Organization, the overall guerrilla group, arrived in the Syrian capital early this morning.

title: RUTH M'GINNIS, 64, BILLIARD CHAMPION
description: HONESDALE, Pa., May 16 (UPI)  Ruth McGinnis, women's pocket billiard world champion, died of cancer yesterday at the age of 64.

title: Israelis Scream Revenge! At Rites for Slain Students.
description: SAFAD, Israel, May 16 Several hundred angry and grief  stricken demonstrators screaming Revenge! Revenge! disrupted the state funeral held here today for 18 of the teenaged students murdered in the Arab terrorist assault yesterday.

title: RollCall Votes On the Rent Bill
Nixon Stands Firm
description: President Nixon says he has given long thought to the possibility of resignation but has decided he will not quit under any circumstances, James J. Kilpatrick, the syndicated columnist, wrote following an interview with the President. Page 24.

title: Gen. Guy Simonds Dies at 71; Canadian Field Commander
description: TORONTO, May 16 (AP) Lieut. Gen. Guy Granville Simonds, a leading Canadian field commander in World War II who was at the age of 39 the Dominion's youngest general, died yesterday. He was 71 years old.

title: Skelly Oil Raises Dividend
description: The board of directors of the Skelly Oil Company voted yesterday to increase the quarterly dividend to 30 cents a share from 25 cents. It is payable June 18 to stockholders of record May 28.

title: Sheila Hicks: Unusual Weaver
description: The way she tells it, the secret to the success of Sheila Hicks, the most prominent weaver at work today, is an operation that's unconventional enough to curl the hair of a yak.

title: SMOKING WARNING IN ADS IS CHECKED
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Federal Trade Commission has initiated an investigation to determine whether the health warning required for cigarette advertisements in newspapers and magazines has been printed in type smaller than required by a twoyearold consent decree.

title: Wide Deficiencies Seen At Manhattan Community
description: A confidential evaluation by the City University has concluded that Manhattan Community College is sufferring from severe deficiencies. The report has found that faculty morale is at an alltime low, that student grades have been inflated beyond meaning and that the college has failed to provide counseling and remedial services for its students.

title: Lobby for Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UP) A delegation of Impeace Nixon Committee member from Illinois met with 23 oF the state's 26 members of. Congress during a twoday tri here to urge members of Congress to support impeach ment of President Nixon, Lyn Heidt of Evanston, a spokeman; said last night.

title: Hudson County Trainer Is Talking Tall
description: BALTIMORE, May 16He didn't finish Harvard, as the press releases have suggested.

title: Maheu Testifies White House Wanted a Friendship Broken Up
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16Robert A. Maheu, once man, ager of the Howard Hughes holdings in Las Vegas, told a Federal court jury today that he had once had a White House request to break up a friendship between a man who worked for him and F. Donald Nixon, the President's brother.

title: Pilic Will Play for Sets Tonight
description: Nikki Pilic returned from a Davis Cup battle and prepared for a new war of nerves with the New York Sets of World Team Tennis.

title: 3 Soloists In Concert At Carnegie
description: The Three by Three concert format Carnegie Hall introduced last year in cooperation with a National Public Radio project has been brought back this year in series of three events, of which the first was given Wednesday night.

title: 19 TRIFECTA PLAYERSI FACE I.R.S. CHARGES
description: CHERRY HILL, May 16 (AP)  The United States Internal Revenue Service filed a Federal complaint today accusing 19 persons of evading taxes on horserace winnings at Garden State Park race track.

title: BLYTHE P. L. CARDEN
description: Blythe P. L., Carden, who retired several years ago as general adjuster for the National Board of Fire Underwriters (now the American Insurance Association), died Wednesday at the Brunswick Hospital Center in Amityville, L. I. He was 73, years old and lived in Massapequa, L. I.

title: SECRETARY HOLDS DAMASCUS TALKS
description: TEL AVIV, Friday, May 17 Secretary of State Kissinger returned to Israel early this morning after making some last minute new approaches to President Hafez alAssad of Syria to overcome the remaining hurdles toward a SyrianIsraeli troop separation agreement on the Golan Heights.

title: Defendant Given 2 Life Terms For Twin Murders in Montclair
description: NEWARK, May 16Robert Petrarca, a 27yearold window washer, was sentenced today in Essex County Court by Superior Court Judge Ralph L. Fusco to two consecutive life terms in prison for the murder of two Upper Montclair women in their home on May 14, 1973.

title: House Votes3Year Extensi on On Operations of O.P.I.C.
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)  The House voted today to keep the Overseas Private Investment Corporation going three more years but to move it out of the risky war and expropriation insurance business.

title: U.S. TO PUT CURBS ON FEEDLOT BUYING
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The Agriculture Department, alarmed at a growing intrusion of meat packers into the custom feedlot business, announced today that it would put into effect stiff new rules to prohibit dual ownership of such enterprises.

title: Hutton Drives in 5 Runs As Phils End Expo Spell
description: The Montreal Expos, in a running battle with Philadelphia for first place in the National League's Eastern Division, had beaten the Phillies eight successive times.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS May 16, 1974
description: New York689641

title: U.S. JEWS WARNED ON ANTISEMITISM
description: The executive vice president Of the American Jewish Committee cautioned American Jews yesterday not to label everyone who disagrees with them as antisemitic.

title: Western Union Asks F.C.C. For Increases on Telegrams
description: Western Union asked the Federal Communications Commission on Wednesday to permit price increases of up to 42 per cent or telegrams sent within the continental United States and Canada, The Associated Press reported.

title: James Simonds Dies at 61; Wrote for Herald Tribune
description: James Gledhill Simonds, a former reporter for The New York Herald Tribune, died Wednesday evening, apparently of a heart attack, while attending a town meeting in Snowvine, N. H. He was 61 years old and lived in Snowville.

title: Cab Drivers Increase Request for Rate Rise
description: The Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, representing fleet owners of 6,100 medallion cabs, raised its rateincrease application to the Taxi and Limousine Commission yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Church Group Reports Torture of Chilean Prisoners
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 16An interchurch group concerned with the treatment of political prisoners in Chile has compiled reports of hundreds of cases of torture since the military seized power last September.

title: Bruins Bounce Back With 51 Victory Over Flyers and Trail in Series, 3 to
Nastase Advances In Munich Tennis
description: MUNICH, West Germany, May 16 (Reuters)Ilie Nastase of Rumania and Manuel Orantes of Spain, seeded first and second, won their secondround matches today to enter the quarterfinals of the men's singles in the Bavarian international tennis tournament.

title: Advances Exceeded Marks in Quarter
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., May 16The Xerox Corporation did slightly better in April than the 13 per cent profit increase and 20 per cent revenue gains reported for the first quarter, the company disclosed here today,

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Transit Strike Threat Called Costly

title: PAUL GONSALVES, 53, TENOR SAXOPHONIST
description: LONDON, May 16 (AP)Paul Gonsalves, Duke Ellington's tenor saxophonist, was found dead in bed Wednesday at a house in North London, the police there reported. He was 53 years old and lived in New York.

title: The Frick Changes Plan for Vacant Plot, Proposing 2d Wing
description: The Frick Collection has changed its plans for the development of the vacant property adjacent to it on East 70th Street, and intends to put up a onestory building where the sixstory George D. Widener mansion stood until it was demolished last year.

title: Nixon, in Interview, Vows Not to Quit
description: WASHINGON, May 16 (AP) President Nixon says he has given long thought to the possibility of resignation but has decided he will not quit under any circumstances, a newspaper columnist reports.

title: Poseidon Rockets Launched
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., May 16 (UPI)Twin Poseidon rockets were fired from a nuclear submarine last night in flight tests down the eastern test range. U.S.S. The Will Rogers fired the rockets while cruising submerged about 30 miles off the shores of Cape Canaveral. In keeping with usual policy, Navy oficials refused to comment on the outcome of the tests.

title: Red Smith
description: When Mel Hein was a cleareyed youth playing basketball for Washington State University, he suborned two civil servants to tamper with the United States mail. expiation of his sin, Hein did 15 years hard labor in the National Football League against predators named Mike Michalske, Bronko Nagurski, Bulldog Turner, Turk Edwards and Danny Fortmann. It would have reduced an ordinary human to a grease spot but the worst Hein got out of the experience was a broken nose, and that was on Pearl Harbor Day in 1941 at the end of his 11th professional season. Two weeks later, in the only concession to human frailty he ever made, he wore a nose guard while he helped the New York Giants lose the world championship game the Chicago Bears, 379.

title: Across Color Line: A Lonely Step at 6
description: NEW ORLEANSTo 6yearold Gail Etienne and Tes sie Prevost, it was only natural to leave for their first day of school accompanied by their parents and Federal marshals.

title: Imperial Oil Raises Price of Gasoline
description: Imperial Oil, Ltd., which is 70 per cent owned by the Exxon Corporation, announced in Toronto yesterday that it had raised its wholesale prices for gasoline and heating oil, its principal products. The company said that west of the Ottawa Valley, gasoline prices were increased by 9.2 cents a gallon and heating oil prices by 8.6 cents a gallon,

title: Plan for Kennedy Library
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 16 (AP)New architectural designs for the proposed John F. Kennedy Library, will be unveiled in Boston during the week of June 2, library officials say.

title: Big Stockholder Got Fee of $60,000 in 1973
description: Michele Sindona, the Italian financier who holds almost 22 per cent of the outstanding common stock of the Franklin New York Corporation, has been active in developing the international banking. operations of the holding company's subsidiary, the Franklin National Bank.

title: Time for Due Process
description: A Congressional investigating committee is not a court or a grand jury. Insofar as possible, however, a committee has the moral obligation to observe careful procedures that protect the reputations and legal rights Individuals whether they be the subjects of investigation, the witnesses, or merely mentioned in testimony.

title: 20 Years After Brownthe Unresolved Dilemma
description: Twenty years ago, Chief Justice Earl Warren, writing for all of his colleagues on the United States Supreme Court, asked the following key question: Does segregation of children in public schools solely on the basis of race, even though the physical facilities and other tangible factors may be equal, deprive the children of the minority group of equal educational opportunities?

title: OFFICIALS REPORT MAALOT CONFUSION
description: TEL AVIV, May 16A misunderstanding may have led to the battle in the Maalot school yesterday in which 20 Israeli high school students and three; Arab terrorists were killed, officials involved in the negotiations said today.

title: City Health Unit Votes in Principle a Ban on Smoking in Public
description: A ban on smoking in markets and elevators, and segregation of smokers in indoor arenas, large restaurants, oclassrooms and other places of public assembly were approved in principle yesterday by the Board of Health.

title: Judge Jails Two for Refusing To Testify Before Hearst Jury
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 16United States District Judge Alfonso J. Zirpoli ordered two persons jailed today who had refused to testify before a Federal grand jury investigating the Patricia Hearst kidnapping here.

title: Still No Reason
description: In their letter published on this page today rebutting our editorial of May 13, four distinguished Democratic members of the House of Representatives seem to us be evading the real issue: their reaction to the proposed splitting of the House Education and Labor Committee into two major committees, one for education, one for labor.

title: Bridge: U.S. and British Teams Win Top Honors in World
description: LAS PALMAS, Canary Islands, May 16 The United States and Great Britain captured the major titles in the World Bridge Federation's Olympiad here tonight. The pairs was won conopen by Bob Hamman and Bob Wolff of Dallas, two members of the Aces team that will challenge for the World team title in Venice, Italy, next week.

title: REV. T. T. BRUMBAUGH
description: The Rev Thoburn T. Brumbaugh, former associate secretary of the Board of Missions of the United Methodist Church for Japan, Korea and the Philippins, died Wednesday in Dunedin, Fla.

title: 20 Years After Historic Rights Decision On Schools, Celebration Is Restrained
description: Their faces first appeared before the public framed within the 15inch world of American television screens the children moving through cordons of Federal marshals, anxious parents in obscure Dixie towns, clergymen preaching change and challenge, grimfaced lawyers, a United States. Attorney General.

title: PRESIDENT SENDS ISRAELIS MESSAGE
description: President Nixon yesterday sent to Premier Golda Meir message of personal sorrow over the deaths of the Israeli students in the guerrilla action in Maalot.

title: OTB Taking All Bets on Preakness
Nixon Backer Seeks Office
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., May 16 (UPI)One of President Nixon's strongest backers in Vermont, State Senator Madeline Harwood, announced today her candidacy for the republican nomination for Congress. She is Vermont's Republican Committeewoman and has been delegate to three national conventions of the party.

title: Israelis Scream RevengerAt Rites for Slain Students
description: SAFAD, Israel, May 16 Several hundred angry and grief  stricken demonstrators screaming Revenge! Revenge! disrupted the state funeral held here today for 18 of the teenaged students murdered in the Arab terrorist assault yesterday.

title: 4 BLACKS INDICTED IN COAST KILLINGS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 16Four Black Muslims were indicted today by a state grand jury on charges of murdering three white persons and of conspiring to murder whites at random.

title: NEWS GUILD HERE STRIKES REUTERS
description: The Newspaper Guild of New York went on strike against the Reuters News Service yesterday, primarily over the refusal of management to agree to a costofliving escalator clause in a new threeyear contract.

title: REBOZO IS REPORTED FIGHTING SUBPOENA
description: WASHINGTON, May 16A lawyer for Charles G. Rebozo reportedly said in a telegram sent today to the Senate Watergate. committee that because of intentional false and malicious leaks about his client's testimony, he would petition the panel to withdraw its subpoena for Mr. Rebozo's bank records.

title: Impeachment Panel Hears Evidence on Hush Money
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Members of the House Judiciary Committee were told in a. closed session today the details of how funds from President Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign were allegedly used to try to obtain the silence of the Watergate burglars.

title: Diary of Day at Maalot Has a Stark Signature
description: TEL AVIV, May 16 (Reuters)  A small diary was found today among the debris of Maalot school.

title: EGYPT DENOUNCES ISRAELI BOMBINGS
description: CAIRO, May 16Egypt tonight denounced Israel's bombing attacks on Lebanon but continued to observe complete official silence about the attack on a school in Maalot, Israel, yesterday.

title: Abrams Urges Veto of Bill Backing Vacancy Decontrol
description: Robert Abrams, the Bronx Borough President, called on Governor Wilson yesterday to veto the rent bill passed by the Legislature.

title: News Summary and Index FRIDAY, MAY 17, 1974
description: International In swift reprisal for Maalot, Israeli planes bombed and strafed Palestinian refugee camps and suspected guerrilla hideouts in Lebanon, reportedly killing more than 20 persons and wounding more. than 130. It was the heaviest Israeli attack ever carried out against Lebanon, and reports from the attack Zone, where bomb targets were said to inclUde roads and, bridges, indicated Israel was making good the threat to render southern Lebanon uninhabitable if Lebanon did not repress local guerrilla forces. [1:8.1

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: WILLCOX & GIBBS service related ??? Amounted to S18.000.674 (WGAMEX)Advt.

title: Girl, 16, Describes Terror as a Hostage
description: NAHARIYA, Israel, May 16 We were sleeping on the second floor of the school when we heard shouts at 4 o'clock. Three terrorists came in and began firing at the soldiers accompanying our group.

title: Weekly Retail Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated 81.144billion up 12 per cent from the yearearlier $1.017billion. Total retail store sales were about $10.660billion, up S per cent from last year's $9.841billion.

title: Federal Judge Orders Redistricting Of Lane High to Improve Race Balance
description: A Federal district judge yesterday ordered the Board of Education here to produce a plan for redrawing Franklin K. Lane High School district within 30 days, to bring about greater racial balance in the Brooklyn school.

title: Judge Rao Relieved of Duties Pending Resolution of Case
description: Customs Court Judge Paul P. Rao Sr., who was indicted on perjury charges Tuesday, has been excused from the trial work of the court pending resolution of the charges, Chief Customs Court Judge Nils A. Boe said last night.

title: 10.72 Fall in Dow Index Led by Aluminum Issue
Ritual Tones Reflect Skill Of Bernstein
description: Leonard Bernstein's music for the New York City Ballet's Dybbuk proves once again, if proof be needed, that he can craft a thoroughly workable theatrical score. It certainly will cause no stir in the avantgarde but neither will it be regarded with as much disdain as Mr. Bernstein's recent Mass, a different sort of hodgepodge entirely.

title: BALAGUER WINS DOMINICAN VOTE
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, May 16  President Joaquin Balaguer today won reelection to a third successive term, but many Dominicans observed an opposition boycott of the election.

title: LEE THOMAS MELLY
description: Lee Thomas Melly, former vice president and vice chairman of the board of the Ward Baking Company, died Wednesday in St. Vincent's Hospital, Bridgeport, Conn. He was 75 years old and lived in Bronx. ville, N. Y.

title: JAMAICA OUTLINES BAUXITE TAX PLAN
description: The island nation of Jamaica the world's leading exporter of bauxite and the largest supplier to the United States outlined plans yesterday to almost triple the taxes and royalties that it takes from foreign aluminum companies engaged in mining its precious natural resource.

title: Business Briefs
description: Reflecting continuing low trading volume, the New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that first quarter net revenues declined 43 per cent from the yearago period.

title: Bank Appoints Chief of Trading Operations
description: The Franklin National Bank, which recently reported a loss, of $14million in foreignexchange dealings and said it could lose as much as $25million more, yesterday appointed a retired First National City Bank executive to reorganize its currencytrading operations.

title: NORTH VIETNAMESE SEIZE SAIGON BASE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 16 (AP)The Saigon cornmend said today that up to 5,000 North Vietnamese troops, backed by tanks, had overrun a South Vietnamese base, inflicting heavy losses and pushing the remnants of the fleeing government forces into a tight pocket.

title: Field of 13 Going at Pimlico
St. Clair's Letter to Rodino
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Following is the text of a letter from James D. St. Clair. special counsel to President Nixon, sent today to Representative Peter W. Rodino chairman of the House Judiciary committee:

title: Colonial Golf Led By Irwin
BURMAH OIL SETS A DEAL IN CANADA
description: The terms of a proposed plan whereby the Burmah Oil Company, Ltd., of Glasgow, Scotland, would acquire the 35 per cent interest in the Great Plains Development Company of Canada, Ltd., that does not already Merger own have been News changed, the companies announced yesterday. They indicated that a change would be made to avoid the need of filing a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in Washington.

title: Monroe Takes Dodge Open Golf By Four Strokes
RAIL STRIKE IN INDIA IS REPORTED EASING
description: NEW DELHI, May 16  The Indian Government said today that the nationwide railway strike was weakening and that crucial freight and passenger movements had sharply improved. We're getting back to normal, said M. N. Berry, chairman of the Railway Board'The strike has petered out.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WESTFIELD, May 16Team tennis, which is now bigtime with the professional New York Sets and 15 other league franchises, has a familiar ring in New Jersey. Town. teams of youngsters up to 15 years of age have been battling on the courts for some time in a grassroots program to stimulate interest in the sport.

title: India and Bangladesh Settle Key Issues
description: NEW DELHI, May 16 Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and Sheik Mujibur Rahman, (Prime Minister of Bangladesh, have reached agreement on several issues that date from the time Bangladesh was East Pakistan.

title: 31 Indicted as Members of Crime Ring That Got $456,000 in Score of Thefts
description: NEWARK, May 16Federal and Essex County grand today indicted 31 persons who they charged were members of a loosely knit crime federation that had allegedly committed more than a score of armed robberies and burglaries in northern New Jersey and in the Scranton, Pa., area since 1969.

title: ALBANY APPROVES $500MILLION AID TO RESCUE CON ED
description: ALBANY, May 16  The State Legislature voted early today to buy two Consolidated Edison power plants, providing $500million in assistance to the financially pressed utility. It marked the first time that a state had taken such action to preserve a major public utility.

title: JAMAICA OUTLINES BAUXITE TAX PLAN; Measures Would Mean Rise in Prices Americans Pay for Aluminum Products
description: The island nation of Jamaica the world's leading exporter of bauxite and the largest supplier to the United States outlined plans yesterday to almost triple the taxes and royalties that it takes from foreign aluminum companies engaged in mining its precious natural resource,

title: PLANTS TO MAKE FUEL OF GARBAGE
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. May 16 Agreement was reached here today on the first steps toward construction of Connecticut's innovative $290million system for converting all the state's household and commercial garbage into lowsulphur fuels for electric generating plants and commercially salable scrap iron, aluminum and glass.

title: GUERRILLA CALLS PEACE BID TARGET
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 16A Palestinian leader said here today that the attack. at Maalot, Israel, that three members of hi organization staged yesterday had been aimed against the Middle East peace mission of Secretary of State Kissinger.

title: ALBANY APPROVES AID TO CON EDISON
description: ALBANY, May 16  The State Legislature voted early today to buy two Consolidated Edison power plants, providing $500million in assistance to the financially pressed utility. It marked the first time that a state had taken such action to preserve a major public utility.

title: Mets Woes Go On Despite 64 Victory
Kleindienst Admits Misdemeanor Guilt
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Richard G. Kleindienst, the former United States Attorney General, pleaded guilty today to a minor criminal offense growing from his testimony before the Senate in 1972 during an investigation of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation case.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Gross's Conviction Is Upheld

title: JURY DELIBERATES IN RONCALLO TRIAL
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 16A Federal jury started deliberations this evening in the conspiracy and extortion trial of Representative Angelo D. Roncallo and Frank J. Antetomaso, deputy commissioner of public works in the Town of Oyster Bay.

title: PROFITS WEAKEN AT CAMPBELL SOUP
DOLLAR IS MIXED IN TRADES ABROAD
description: LONDON, May 16 (Reuters) Rumors of an imminent breakup of the European joint currency float  strongly denied by the participating governments  threw foreignexchange markets into confusion today.

title: PRIME LOAN RATE MAY REACH
Ride the Winds,'
description: Before it was turned back into a legitimate theater, the Bijou Theater on West 45th Street was a home for Japanese movies. Now the samurai fight again, live, onstage, in a new musical, Ride the Winds. But this mild show, which opened last night, will not easily be mistaken for its swashbuckling predecessors.

title: Launching Postponed For Weather Bureau
description: The launching of the first weather bureau in the sky, originally scheduled for yesterday morning, was postponed a day when tests suggested that a component of the launching vehicle was defective.

title: The Legislature Retains Vacancy Decontrol of Rents
Statement by Kleindienst
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Following is the text of a statement by Richard G. Kleindienst, former Attorney General, after he pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor in United States District Court today:

title: Find Painless Cuts In Beame's Budget, City Council Urged
description: The 43member City Council prepared to pare Mayor Beanie's austere $11.1billion budget yesterday. The Councilmen33 are up for reelection in Novemberseem determined not to impose nuisance taxes or increase the realestate tax by 45 cents to balance the budget.

title: Senate Votes ScottMansfield Compromise Curb on School Busing
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Senate narrowly approved today a weakened version of provision aimed at barring the longdistance busing of childrew to end school segregation but leaving the final decision on school busing cases to the courts.

title: Bridge: 2 of the Aces Seem on the Way To Capturing World Pair Title
description: Las Palmas, Canary Islands, May 16Two great American players seemed headed for the world pair champion

title: FAKE BILLS SEIZED HERE BY THE F.B.I
description: The seizure of $4.9millior in counterfeit Treasury bills, in denominations of $10,000 was reported yesterday by the Secret Service to have beer made by agents during arrests Wednesday night of three men. One defendant is a Park Avenue investment adviser.

title: Police Inquiry Aide Named
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16 (AP)The prosecution inquiry into alleged corruption in Philadelphia's Police Department will be headed by the former chief investigator for the Senate Watergate committee. Wayne Bishop, 53 years old, an investigator for 24 years with the Connecticut State Police, was named to the job yesterday by the special prosecutor, Walter M. Phillips.

title: Honduran Incursions Allege
description: SAN SALVADOR, May, 1 (Reuters)Salvador has accused Honduras of eight border incidents in the last two week in which Honduran troops of civilians crossed into Salvadorean territory or fired across the frontier.

title: Aftermath
description: More death, more tragedy, more terror for the peoples of the Middle East. The murder of twenty Israeli schoolchildren is almost beyond comprehension in its horrorand in its abysmal viciousness. No purpose has been served, nothing has been achievedexcept the death innocents and the clouding over of. the most promising prospect for peaceful disengagement that the troubled area has known for many years past.

title: Nixon Backer Seeks Office
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., May 16 (UPI)One of President Nixon's strongest backers in Vermont, State Senator Madeline Harwood, announced today her candidacy for the republican nomination for Congress. She is Vermont's Republican Committeewoman and has been a delegate to three national conventions of the party.

title: Newspapers and Printers Plan a Full Day of Talks
description: Negotiators in the newspaper contract dispute planned a full day of bargaining talks today in an effort to resolve remaining differences on money and automation issues.

title: MORE THAN 20 DIE
description: SAIDA, Lebanon, May 16Israeli planes bombed and strafed Palestinian refugee camps and suspected guerrilla hideouts in Lebanon today in swift reprisal for the massacre of 20 Israeli students yesterday.

title: Nixon Stands Firm
description: President Nixon says he has given long thought to the possibility of resignation but has decided he will not quit under any circumstances, James J. Kilpatrick, the syndicated columnist, wrote following an interview with the President. Page 24.

title: TV: A Tribe and a Star
description: Tonight it's two for ABCTV. At 8, there's the National Geographic Society's documentary on Bushmen of the Kalahari. At 11:30, it's Goodbye to Norma Jean and Other Things, a documentary about Elton John, the rock star, and a pop milieu that might be subtitled bushmen of hyperbole. scholarly spareness. It's all very much for the better.

title: U.S. Women Beat France, Gain at Net
description: NAPLES Italy, May 16 (UPI)Julie Heldman and Jeanne Evert defeated French opponents In straight sets today to move the United States into the. semifinals of the Federation Cup Women's tennis tournament.

title: Dance: The Essence of African Ritual
description: The Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater has drawn its chief inspiration from the black heritage, but that heritage up to now seemed to be defined by the Western hemisphere.

title: Long Last Meeting Wilts Legislators
description: ALBANY, May 16The State Legislature closed its electionyear session with an allnight marathon of wrangling and compromise early today, and then was ordered to return in two weeks for the delicate political task of reapportioning Congressional and legislative districts in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Highland Park Widow Slain in Door of Her Home
description: A widow who operated a, jewelry store was shot to death yesterday morning in the doorway of her home in Highland Park without apparent motive, the state police reported.

title: PROTESTANTSPUSH STRIKE IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 16A protest strike organized by extreme Protestant groups went into its second day today, with industry largely shut down but most shops and services functioning.

title: Met Park Series On
description: The Metropolitan Opera announced yesterday that it was reversing an earlier decision, and would present a summer saeson of concertorgans in the city's parks. At the same time the Met reported that William Rockefeller, a 57yearold greatgrandnephew of John D. Rockefeller, had been elected as its new president and chief executive officer.

title: PRODUCTION OF CARS DOWN 0.8% IN WEEK
description: DETROIT, May 16American car production is expected to drop by 1,413 units this week from last, largely because of a strike that has forced the shutdown of the main Cadillac assembly plant in Detroit.

title: Tito Is Named President for Life Under New Government Setup
description: BELGRADE, May 16  With the boom of ceremonial cannons and crowds cheering outside the Federal Assembly building today, 82yearold Marshal Tito signed a document making him President of Yugoslavia for life.

title: Impeachment Urged
description: BOSTON, May 16 (AP)The Massachusetts Senate, without a single objection, called on the state's congressional delegation today to support the impeachment of President Nixon.

title: Okker Laver Gain In $150,000 Tennis
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev May 16 (AP)Tom Okker upheld his second seeding with a 64, 57, 6.0 victory over Cliff Richey today in gusty winds to reach the quarterfinals of the $150,000 Alan KingCaesar's Palace tennis tournament.

title: Moscow Displays Mounting Concern On Nixon's Future
description: MOSCOW, May 16The Soviet press agency, Tass, rose today to the defense of President Nixon by contending that his Watergate troubles were being fanned by the President's political adversaries,

title: Youth Finds 55 Firebombs
description: WARREN, Mich., May 16 (AP)A teenager has discovered 55 firebombs hidden in a wooded children's playground, th'e police report. The police said the devices were ready to go and would have ignited mice their fuses were lighted and burned down.

title: Man Is Killed by DC8 After He Falls on Ramp
description: A 29yearold employe of Icelandic Airlines was crushed to death last night by a front nose wheel of a DC8 jet on a ramp at John F. Kennedy International Airport, the police reported.

title: Nixon Reported to Have Urged, Cut Loss Fast, in June, 1972
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Washington Post reported to might that a transcript of remarks made by President Nixon only two weeks after the Watergate breakin indicated that he had tried to get top aides to hold further disclosures about the case to a minimum.

title: Wide Deficiencies Seen At Manhattan Community
description: A confidential evaluation by the City University has concluded that Manhattan Community College is sufferring from severe deficiencies. The report has found that faculty morale is at an alltime low, that student grades have been inflated beyond meaning and that the college has failed to provide counseling and remedial services for its students.

title: The Frick Changes Plan for Vacant Plot, Proposing 2d Wing
description: The Frick Collection has changed its plans. for the development of the vacant prop, erty adjacent to it on East 70th Street, and intends to put up a onestory building where the sixstory George D. Widener mansion stood until it was demolished last year.

title: People in Sports
description: Breaking Babe Ruth's career home run record easily enabled Henry Aaron to win the April poll of sports writers for the S. Rae Hickok athleteof the year award. Aaron gained 89 of 112 firstplace votes and finished with 281 votes.

title: Books of The Times
description: Who ever discovered America deserved to be dragged home, in chains, to die. So says one of the characters in James Baldwin's new novel, If Beale Street Could Talk. And I say that Mr. Baldwin has already picked that particular bone clean, and it is time he found himself another. There is no color line in cliches. We live in a nation of pigs and murderers"; here's another bit of small talk from a second character. Now, when I come across such line, I wonder how the author's nonblack readers will receive it. Do they assume that buying the book automatically exempts them from both categories? Or can it be that they don't take Mr. Baldwin altogether seriously, that they simply nod their heads sympathetically and say, It's only natural for him to feel like that.

title: Two Decades Later
description: Twenty years ago, Chief Justice Earl Warren wrote for a unanimous Supreme Court in Brown v. Board Education: We conclude that in the field of public education the doctrine of separate but equal has no place. The nine Justices agreed that to separate black children by order of the law may affect their hearts and minds in a way unlikely ever to be undone.

title: Field of 13 Going at Pimlico
description: BALTIMORE, May 16 When Larry Abbundi drew Post Position No. 6 for Cannonade this morning there was a general expression of satisfaction among the many onlookers crowded into the racing secretary's office. But no one was more satisfied than Woody Stephens, the 60yearold trainer who directs the activities of Cannonade.

title: Batting 188, Gonzalez Still a Hit
description: As the Yankees rested yesterday before beginning a fourgame series in Milwaukee tonight, they tried not to think about their caliber of play in the past eight games. They had lost seven of the eight, batted 196 made seven errors and were guilty of a number of other fielding lapses.

title: Oil Concern to Pay AgeBias Settlement
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 The Standard Oil Company of California agreed today to pay $2million in back wages to 160 employes it had discharged and to rehire 120 of them. The settlement was, by far, the largest ever made under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act.

title: BRITAIN WILL PAY RECORD INTEREST
description: LONDON, May 16  The Treasury announced today it would pay a record interest rate of 12.75 per cent to borrow $960million from the public in the costliest financing in British history.

title: New Lisbon Government Is Threatened by Wide Labor Unrest
description: LISBON, May 16Under close military supervision, Portugal's new civilian Government came into office today and faced the immediate challenge of sweeping labor unrest.

title: JOHN H. MULHOLLAND OF N.Y.U. SURGERY
description: Dr. John H. Mulholland, former George David Stewart Professor and chairman of the department of surgery of the New York University School of Medicine, died yesterday at his home in Heritage Village, Southbury, Conn. He was 73 years old.

title: Hearing on Ration Coupons
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) A House subcommittee has scheduled a hearing next Wednesday on a disclosure that 4,8 billion gas ration coupons can be used in changemaking ma. chines, Witnesses will include Representative Bill Gunter, Democrat of Florida, who said last week that the portrait of George Washington on the coupons triggered most standard dollarhillchanging machines.

title: Oil Concern to Pay AgeBias Settlement
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 The Standard Oil Company of California agreed today to pay $2million in back wages to 160 employes it had discharged and to rehire 120 of them. The settlement was, by far, the largest ever made under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act.

title: TALKS REPORTED IN COVERUP CASE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 John J. Caulfield, a former White House aide, and L. Patrick Gray 3d, former acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation are dealing! with the special Watergate prosecutor's office over possible criminal charges, according to informed sources.

title: Energy Agency Asks Rules That Could Cut Oil Prices
description: WASHINGTON, May 16In a step that could force some major oil companies to reduce prices, the Federal Energy Administration proposed today new rules for determining what the companies may charge for crude oil they buy from their own foreign affiliates.

title: A Book by Magruder Will Come Out in June
description: Jeb Stuart Magruder, one of the early Administration casualties of the Watergate scandal, will be one of the first persons to record their involvement in a book.

title: PRO MUSD GIVES ITS LAST CONCERT
description: The New York Pro Musica! Antigua performed for the last time at an invitation Petrarch concert last night at the Pierpont Morgan Library, and today the collection of instruments used in its performance, of early music is being turned over to New York University.

title: Energy Goals in Doubt
description: An expert panel of engineers reported yesterday to the Federal Government that it would take enormous effort to provide enough energy for American needs during the next 10 years and even then the effort might only postpone a grim future. Page 53.

title: CITY UNIT FOCUSES ON OVERCHARGING
description: The Department of Consumer Affairs has instructed its supermarket inspectors to pay particular attention to the possibility of overcharging in the city's supermarkets. The emphasis resulted from a case in whcih three store employes were discharged following a complaint of overcharging in an A. & P. at 220 East 46th Street.

title: 8 Are Accused of Fraud In Insurance TakeOver
description: TRENTON, state May 16A grand jury today indicted eight former officers of the bankrupt Equity Funding Corporation of America, a national financial conglomerate based in California, on charges of having defrauded the office of the New Jersey Insurance Commissioner and Bankers National Life In

title: Waldheim Asks Portuguese To Heed Africa Resolutions
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 16Secretary General Waldheim has made an approach to the .new. Portuguese Government urging it to heed United Nations resolutions calling for independence for the African Portuguese territories.

title: Notes on People
description: After they both received honorary Doctor of Laws degrees at commencement exercises at the predominantly black Alabama State University in Montgomery, two old adversaries of the nineteensixties shook hands. They were the Rev. Dr. Ralph David Abernathy, who succeed the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. as head of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, and Gov. George C. Wallace, who tried physically to block the integration of the University of Alabama at Tuscaloosa 11 years ago. The citation accompanying Mr. Wallace's degree said that Because of his good judgment and official restraint, no freedomloving and freedomseeking student or other person met violence at the hands of the law on the Alabama state campus during the civil rights struggles of the nineteensixties.

title: Harrison M. Sayre, 79, Education Publisher, Dies
description: Harrison Monel Sayre, former president of the American Education Press and cofounder of My Weekly Reader, which is widely used in public schools, died Wednesday in Columbus, Ohio. He was 79 years old.

title: Morris Udall, Backed by 27 in House, to Explore Presidential Bid
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Representative Morris . Udall of Arizona will begin this weekend an exploratory campain for the Presidency at the urging of 27 of his colleagues in the House.

title: Climb for Housing Starts Was Almost 10% in April
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Housing starts rose by almost 10 per cent in April to an annual rate of 1.63 million units, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Victor Geoffrion, Musician Under Toscanini, Is Dead
description: Victor Geoffrion, a bass violinist for 65 years, died Tuesday at St. John's Queens Hospital. He was 89 years old and lived in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: GIFT INQUIRY TO ASK WHITE HOUSE DATA
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI)  The General Accounting Office disclosed today that it intended to seek access to records of the White House gifts unit in an investigation of compliance with the law regarding foreign gifts to Government officials, and the President's family.

title: Market Place:Further Damage On Stock Credit
description: The latest figures from the New York Stock Exchange on margin debt clearly point to a further deterioration in stock market credit. As of the end of April, accounts that were less than 40 per cent paid upthe ones most vulnerable to margin calls as stock prices recedemade up 16 per cent of all margin accounts. The figure was 12 per cent in March.

title: Legal Questions Raised by Staged Arrests
description: The arrests of a United States Customs Court judge, his son and his son's law partner on Tuesday raise usresolved questions concerning the propriety of using fake artechnique for investigating corruption in the criminaljustice system.

title: Consumer Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) The Senate's Government Operations Committee approved today a bill to create an independent consumer protection agency. The measure now goes to the full Senate. Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, called the committee action a big victory for the American consumer.

title: 4 TenantRights Bills Win Final Legislative Backing
description: TRENTON, May 16  Four measures ,broadening the rights of the state's 3.8million tenants received final legislative approval in the State Senate today with no opposition.

title: City Projects Plan 8% Rent Rise To Cover skyrocketing Costs
description: Citing skyrocketing fuel and maintenance costs and a serious operating deficit, the City Housing Authority yesterday proposed rent increases averaging 8 per cent, beginning Aug. 1, in twothirds of the 165,000 apartments in its lowincome projects.

title: ISRAELI TOLL IS 24 AS 4 STUDENTS DIE
description: TEL AVIV, May 16As Israeli planes struck today at Palestinian targets in Lebanon, the Israeli death toll in the guerrilla raid in Israel that brought on the retaliation rose to 24.

title: Impeachment Panel Hears Evidence on Hush Money
description: WASH1NGTON, May 16Members of the House Judiciary Committee were told in a closed swion today the details of how funds from President Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign were allegedly used to try to obtain the silence of the Watergate burglars.

title: An Explanation: How Money That Financed Watergate Was Raised and Distributed
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 The House Judiciary Commit tee heard evidence today about one of the key elements in the Watergate case  the vast amount of money that financed the Watergate burglary and the subsequent payments to the burglars.

title: GOING OUT Guider
description: ART A little time for midday diversion? If so, you can see what some 20 artists who allegedly live or work in midManhattan are doing these days with wood, string, cloth, metal, laser beams and even paint. The Parks Department and the Durst Organization are cosponsoring an exhibition, Center City, in Gallery 43, a temporary setup.

title: Runout on Rents
description: In the shambles of the adjournment rush at Albany, the Republican majority in the State Legislaturewith indeterminate help from Governor Wilsonhas undone the sensible rent control bill agreed upon by the Governor, Mayor Beame and a bipartisan coalition of legislators from New York City. In its place, the Legislature has enacted a measure that provides almost no relief from the .irresponsible vacancy decontrol law adopted three years ago.

title: Advertising: Bid by a 4A Chief
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., May 16No sooner was John Elliott Jr., chairman of Ogilvy & Mather, elected the new chairman of the American Association of Advertising Agencies here today than he asked for money. How's that for getting off on the right foot?

title: Kleindienst Admits Misdemeanor Guilt
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Richard G. Kleindienst, the former United States Attorney General, pleaded guilty today to a minor criminal offense growing from his testimony before the Senate in 1972 during an investigation of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation case.

title: U.S. Is Said to Tell Allies of Plan to Call EastWest Summit
description: PARIS, May 16Secretary of State Kissinger has informed the British and West German Foreign Ministers about his recent talks with Soviet officials looking to an early EastWest conference, according to a highlevel source.

title: UptoDawn Last Session Wilts Weary Legislators
description: ALBANY, May 16The State Legislature closed its electionyear session with an allnight marathon of wrangling and compromise early today, and then was ordered to return in two weeks for the delicate political task of reapportioning Congressional and legislative districts in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: About New York
description: Its golden arches spread through the city, fulfilling the promise of hamburgers without end, but there are those who curse it as a pestilence. Some of them cursed it the other night at Community Board 8. McDonald's Hamburgers, they said, had struck again.

title: The Pop Life Some Sing and Leap And Some just Sit Still
description: Popmusic performers operate at varying energy evels, and anyone who wanted to check out that proposition had an ideal laboratory this week at New York's two principal rockfolk cabarets. At Max's Kansas City through Monday, Buzzy Linhart, along with his latest group, is putting on a daunting show of manic energy. Leaping about from instrument to instrument, sweat pouring from his body, he belts his way through a diverse assortment of songs and idioms. It's impressive in its way, although one might prefer that he mastered one way of doing things really well.

title: FLAHERTY BACKED IN PENNSYLVANIA
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 16  Just as Herbert S. Denenberg began his speech here last night to more than 800 Dauphin County Democrats, squad of redcoated waiters began clearing the tables.

title: Cinaue: A Dropout Who Has Been in Constant Trouble
description: SAN FRANCISCOWho is Field Marshal General Cinque of the Symbionese Liberation Army?

title: MORE THAN 20 DIE
description: SAIDA, Lebanon, May 16Israeli planes bombed and strafed Palestinian refugee camps and suspected guerrilla hideouts in Lebanon today in swift reprisal for the massacre of 20 Israeli students yesterday.

title: Grumman Chief Says Company Expects to Regain Credit Line
description: The president of the Grumman Corporation said yesterday the company expected soon to regain its credit line with commercial banks and to cancel the agreement providing loans from the Navy.

title: Mr. Nixon's Neglected Cabinet
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The President's Cabinet has been put in an awkward position by the impeachment inquiry in Congress, and it is clear from their public statements that they have been neglected by the White House and that they have not yet sorted out their loyalties.

title: Cabe Drivers Increase Request for Rate Rise
description: The Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, representing fleet owners of 6,100 medallion cabs, raised it rateincrease applidation to the Taxi and Limousine Commission yesterday,

title: Nakamura Leads Golf
description: TOKYO, May 16 (AP)Japan's Toru Nakamura shot a courserecord 64, eight under par, for a twostroke lead in the $71,428 Dunlop golf tournament today.

title: Russell M. Sanderson, 65; Official of Smith, Barney;
description: Russell M. Sanderson, a for, mer director and vice president of Smith, Barney & Co., Inc.,, member of the New York Stock Exchange, died of cancer yesterday at Hillcrest Hospital in Pittsfield, Mass. He was 65 years old and lived in Stockbridge, Mass., and previously in Englewood and Tenafly, N. J.

title: $1Million in Heroin Seized
description: CLEVELAND, May 16 (UPI) Nearly $1million in heroin, three guns and $5,982 in cash were confiscated in a raid on an east side Cleveland residence yesterday, the police said. Five men and one woman were arrested,

title: 2 Are Apparent Victors In School District Vote
description: Election officials counting the ballots in the District 1 Community School Board vote last Tuesday said yesterday that two candidates, Adolph Roher and Henry Ramos, had apparently been elected.

title: SECRETARY HOLDS DAMASCUS TALKS
description: TEL AVIV, Friday, May 17 Secretary of. State Kissinger returned to Israel early this morning after making some last minute new approaches to President Hafez alAssad of Syria to overcome the remaining hurdles toward a SyrianIsraeli troop separation agreement on the Golan Heights.

title: JOHN DAVIES STAMM, ART COLLECTOR, DIES
description: John Davies Stamm, an art collector of this city and Lenox, Mass., where he owned the WalkerRockwell Gallery, died of a heart attack on Wednesday at his home, 120 East 95th Street. He was 63 years old.

title: The Legislature Retains Vacancy Decontrol of Rents
description: ALBANY, May 16A week after Governor Wilson proposed a tenantoriented system of statewide rent regulation, the Legislature early this morning passed a drastically different bill limited to New York City and its suburbs and retaining the basic provisions of vacancy decontrol.

title: NBCTV Pays Peak $5Million To Show Gone With Wind Once
description: Gone With the Wind, the periodically released 1939 MetroGoldwynMayer historical romance that has sold more theater admissions than any other motion picture, is finally going the way of all filmto television.

title: Mosque Arsonist Returned To Australians by Israelis
description: TEL AVIV, May 16 (Reuters) Dennis Michael Rohan, the Australian sheepshearer who set fire to Al Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem four years ago, has been returned to Australia, airport police sources said here today.

title: Dillon Enters Race. To Be Prosecutor Of Nassau County
description: Denis E. Dillon, chief of the Federal Organized Crime Strike Force in Brooklyn, announced his resignation yesterday to seek the Democratic nomination for District Attorney of Nassau County.

title: 3 Witnesses See No Hint Of Trot Fix
description: The defense in the racefixing trial of New York harness drivers yesterday trotted out three of the sport's wellknown authorities at the Brooklyn Federal Building to support its claim that there had been no wrongdoing by its clients.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Memphis Ruling Backs W.F.L. Team

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 17.3 billion tonmiles, 1.4 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 543,860 cars, 0.9 per cent below last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 2.5 per cent Mow last year.

title: Cash Prices
Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Stockholders Told of Investing Need
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16J. Kenneth Jamieson, chairman of the Exxon Corporation, today defended soaring oilindustry profits and said that legislation now before Congress would intensify the industry's problems.

title: WHEAT FUTURES SHOW A DECLINE
description: Wheat futures inched upward yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade still influenced by talk of additional export business, mostly from Japan and Colombia. July delivery wheat closed at $3.71, up from $3.70 bushel.

title: MansionLike Home for Aged in the Bronx Solaces Only the OnceWealthy
description: Although the millionaire could not halt the passage of time, he knew that the comforts of money sometimes could make growing old more bearable. And when he died in 1915, Andrew Freedman, the benefactor of aged gentlefolk, left $5million to build a sumptuous Georgian mansion for the aged in the Bronx.

title: BANK FOR CUBANS OPENED IN MIAMI
description: MIAMI, May 16 The Continental National Bank, believed to be the first Cubanowned and Cubanoperated bank in the country, opened for business here yesterday.

title: They're All Past 60, Retired, And All Are Trying to Help
description: On the kind of windswept morning with driving rain that makes people grateful if they don't have to go out, a small bus jounced among construction sites on Roosevelt Island and pulled up in front of Goldwater Memorial Hospital.

title: Wood, Field &Stream
description: For the remainder of this month, the Sportsman's Edge, Ltd., art gallery at 136 East 74th Street is exhibiting paintings of Richard Ellis, who is also an angler and scuba diver.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: Blood Sport, by Robert F. Jones (Simon & Schuster, $7.95). A father and son on a huntingfishing trip in a phantasmagoric world.

title: Contract Awards
description: The General Electric Company announced yester day receipt of an order valued at more than $200million for five nuclearpowered, large steamturbine generators. The order was placed by the Arizona Public Service Company acting as project manager for the Arizona Nuclear Power Project. Three of the units would be installed at the Palo Verde nuclear plant about 45 miles west of Phoenix, Ariz., with the other two reserved for installation at an undetermined site. All are rated at 1,325,000 kilowatts, the largest G.E. makes. General Electric also confirmed its selection by Bernische Kraftwerke, A. G., of Switzerland for a 1.14millionkilowatt boiling water reactor for its new nuclear power plant to be built near Graben, Switzerland. The order, for which no price was announced, includes nuclear fuel. The plant's value is estimated at $400million.

title: New Jersey Wins Met Golf Trophy
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I. May 16 New Jersey, the 1973 winner, captured the 49th Golf Illustrated Trophy in the women's Metropolitan Golf Association intersectional matches played today at the Cold Springs Country Club.

title: House Votes Legal Service Bill; Senate to Act on Final Approval
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Compromise legislation on a legal services. plan barely survived a serious test in the House of Representatives today but then went on to win passage by a vote of 227 to 143.

title: US ENERGY AIMS CALLED HIGHCOST
description: WASHINGTON, May 16It will take enormous effort to provide enough energy for American needs during the next 10 years and even then the effort may only postpone a grim future of scarcity, an expert .panel of engineers reported to the Government today.

title: Kleindienst: Loyal Aide
description: With his guilty plea yesterday, former Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst became the first former Cabinet member convicted of misconduct in office since Albert B. Fall, who in 1929 was found guilty of bribery in the Teapot Dome scandal while serving as President Harding's Interior Secretary.

title: Sweden Detects Soviet Blast
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, May 16 (Reuters)  The seismological institute here today reported registering an underground explosion from the region of the Soviet nuclear testing area in Siberia. The blast registered 5.6 on the Richter scale, the institute said.

title: U.S. JURY CHARGES WIDE BID RIGGING
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) A Federal grand jury today indicted 12 building maintenance concerns and five company officials on charges of rigging bids and allocating customers throughout New Jersey.

title: 92 Reading Breaks A 78Y ear Record, Brings Voltage Cut
description: In an unseasonable burst of summertime weather, the ternperature climbed past a 78yearold record of 87 degrees here yesterday and set a new May 17 mark of 92, leading the Consolidated Edison Company to begin its first hotweather voltage reduction of the year and causing extensive delays on the Long Island Rail Road.

title: CHARLES G. LOEB
description: Charles G. Loeb, a retired journalist and former children's columnist for the Macy's newspapers in Westchester, died Thursday in Dunedin, Fla., where he lived. He was 70 years old and formerly lived in Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: DUNA DAS DEAD; INDIAN NEWSMAN
description: NEW DELHI, May 17Durga Das, one of the most prominent journalists in India, died here today of a heart attack. He was 73 years old.

title: Inside Report on the Sources Mob
description: WASHINGTON, May 17To find out what is happening in the Watergate affair these days you have to go to a mysterious group of people who are never publicly identified except as sources. All are members of the infamous, tightlyknit Sources family, which has terrorized government for the past four decades and now has tentacles reaching into the highest offices in the land.

title: PRICES OFF AGAIN ON AMEX ANDTC
Ballet:RilleMalGardee
description: Sir Frederick Ashton's La Fine Mal Gardee has the quality of a series of changing pretty pastoral pictures. Thursday night Ann Jenner Mid David Wallan ideal leading castbrought those pictures beautifully to life with the Royal Ballet at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Nebraska Villagers Flee Rising Waters
description: NIOBRARA, Neb., April 19 Helen Liska summoned the fortitude she had stored up over 70odd years and complained.

title: Mail Rate Changes, With Letter at 9c, Proposed by Panel
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) The cost of mailing a firstclass letter would be trimmed by a penny while rates for second, third and fourthclass mail would go up under a proposal by the staff of the Postal Rate Commission.

title: People and Business A. T. &
description: John D. deButts, chairman of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, has asserted that his company's research would never extend to development of Sophisticated wiretap or eavesdropping devices.

title: COURT VOIDS LAIN ON ADULT HOMES
description: A Federal district judge in Brooklyn yesterday declared unconstitutional sections of Long Beach, L. I,, ordinance that banned released state mental patients from the city's adult homes.

title: Alabama Curb on Abortions Is Ruled Unconstitutional
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 17 (UPI)  Supernumerary Circuit Judge Frank Embry today struck down the Alabama antiabortion statute as unconstitutional.

title: EVANS F. HOUGHTON
description: Evans F. Houghton, a publicrelations man died Thursday at New England Deaconness Hospital, Boston. He was 59 years old and lived in Newton Corner, a Boston suburb.

title: Schmidt Pledges Continuity of West German Foreign Policy
description: BONN, May 17Chancellor Helmut Schmidt pledged today the continuity of West Germany's foreign policy and stressed the need for partnership with the United States in achieving the politicAl unity of Europe.

title: Treatment Improves Materials
description: WASHINGTON, May 17A Boston freelance inventor has crowned 30 years work by completing his method of compressive treatment of woven and nonwoven textile fabrics, paper and other sheet materials. The process is now being used throughout the world, and is regarded as enhancing the quality of the materials. Richard R. Walton was granted a broad patent (No. 3,810,280) this week. A toolmaker and longtime associate, George E. Munchbach, is coinventor, but Mr. Walton holds full rights.

title: Asbury Park Puts on Its Best Face for Centennial Observance That Opens Tomorrow
description: Centennial bumper stickers and commemorative signs have blossomed all over Asbury Park, once one of New Jersey's more popular seaside resorts, as it prepares to begin its centennial ob

title: Pilic Plays But the Sets Lose Again
description: UNIONDALE, LI., May 17  Like the cavalry, Nikki Pilic arrived just in the nick of time for the New York Setsthey had a 13 wonlost record and were in the middle of a fourgame home stand.

title: Rep.Roncallols Acquitted; Asks House Study of Case
description: WESTBURY, L. I, May 17Representative Angelo Roncallo was acquitted of all charges of extortion and conspiracy by a Federal jury today and immediately announced that he would ask the House of Representatives to investigate his indictment.

title: Jefferson's Private Life
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.The letter below was written in 1858 by Ellen Randolph Coolidge, granddaughter of Thomas Jefferson, to her husband, Joseph Coolidge, in Boston, while she was visiting her brother in Albemarle County, Va. It is now made public for the first time by courtesy of her greatgrandson, Harold Jefferson Coolidge.The letter is of immediate interest because it deals with the Sally Hemings story, which has been recently revived in Fawn M. Brodie's new Jefferson biography, Thomas Jefferson: An Intimate History, and which seems to be regarded in certain quarters as wholly true despite the dearth of evidence.

title: Gloomier Second Sight
description: The incredibly gloomy estimate originally issued by the Commerce Department on the depths of national slumpflation in the first quarter of this year has proved not gloomy enough.

title: He's a Man of Many Talents And the Apple Figures Called on Most of Them
description: I always think it's great to have a oneman show on the best corner in New York, said Robert Heitmann.

title: Illinois Prison Protest Ends
description: CHESTER, Ill., May 17 (AP) Sixty inmates at Menard Penitentiary released unharmed the remaining three guards they had held hostage today and returned to their cells, the authorities reported. They said the incident involved no violence and no injuries. A fourth guard had been released uniarmed by the inmates earlier.

title: U.F.T Leads in District 1 School Election
description: At least fiveand perhaps sixmembers of the slate supported by the United Federation of Teachers appeared headed for victory and a majority voice on the new District 1 School Board yesterday as ballotcounting continued following last Tuesday's election.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Hughes Aircraft Company has received $31.6million in military contracts, including a $21.7million addition to an Air Force award for the Maverick airtoground missile and a $9.9million addition to a Navy contract for the Phoenix airtoair missile control systems for the Grumman F14A fighter.

title: MARTIN SACKLER
description: Martin Sackler, retired realestate agent and father of Howard Sackler, playwright who won a 1969 Pulitzer Prize for The Great White Hope, died Wednesday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 75 years old.

title: Youth Sentenced for Raping Victim in Spouse's Presence
description: An 18yearold Bronx youth who confessed to raping a 49yearold woman last Sept. 2 in the presence of her disabled husband was sentenced yesterday to 6 to 18 years in prison.

title: Ruchel Magee Plea Denied
description: LOS ANGELES, May 17 (UPI) A Federal judge yesterday denied a petition filed by Ruche! Magee, a survivor of the 1970 Marin County courthouse shootout that left four dead, to have his murder trial moved here from the San Francisco Bay area. District Court Judge Harry Pregerson ruled that the murder suspect had failed to prove that his civil rights would be violated by being tried in Santa Clara County.

title: Italy Loses Cup Tennis Aussies
description: NAPLES, Italy, May 17 (UPI)  Evonne Goolagong and Dianne Fromholtz scored straight set victories today over Italian opponents and moved Australia into the semifinal round of the Federation Cup tennis competition with a 30 victory. Britain also advanced by defeating South Africa, 21.

title: FULBRIGHT LEADS IN FUND. CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Senator J. W. Fulbright, the chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, whose political career is being threatened in Arkansas Democratic primary, may lack support in the opinion polls but not in his campaign purse,

title: Asimov and His Fellow Writers Are Looking for a Bright Future
description: UNION, May 17  Science fiction is the only relevant literature, Isaac Asimov said here today, because it prepares us for the future.

title: Firemen Say Uniforms Are Highly Flammable
description: The Fire Department has suspended its sale of new firefighting uniforms for the city's 11,000 firemen amid gathering rankandfile complaints that the newly prescribed clothing is highly flammable.

title: Women Architects Building Influence In a Profession That Is 98.8% Male
description: Elmer Botsai, a San Francisco architect, made what he considered a rather innocent remark to a newspaper reporter three years ago.

title: Economy's Activity. Revised Downward
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The performance of the United States economy was a little worse in the first quarter of this year than had been estimated earlier, with inflation greater and the decline in total output deeper, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Maxwell, Eckstein Dead; A Composer and Arranger
description: Maxwell Eckstein, composer, pianist and arranger, who was a consultant and former piano editor of Carl Fischer, Inc., music publishers, died Thursday at his home, 108 Sanford Street, Yonkers. He was 69 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CEN. C. V. EMERSON
description: Brig. Gen. Gouveneur Vincent Emerson, Army Medical Corps, retired, died Thursday in St. Francis Hospital, Port Jervis, N. Y. He was 85 years old and lived in Milford, Pa.

title: Art: Pure Spirit in an Impure World
description: Richard Long may or may not be the most distinguished artist that England has lately produced  I don't, myself, see many rivalsbut he is out on his own for his aloofness, his personal reticence, his contempt for compromise. He leaves behind him, as he goes, no canvases that can pass from hand to hand at everhigher prices; no sculptures in editions of 10 or 11; no gimcrack multiples that dilute the original idea to the point of disappearance.

title: Aluminum Prices Are Raised by 2 Cents a Pound
description: The major North American aluminum companies, whose shares tumbled Thursday when Jamaica outlined plans to get more revenues from bauxite, increased prices for the metal yesterday by 2 cents a pound.

title: Big Bank Deposits Laid To ExDetective's Wife
description: Mrs. Ann King, wife of a former narcotics detective now under investigation in the theft of millions of dollars worth of heroin from the police department property clerk's office, made substantial deposits to numerous banks over the last five years, according to court papers filed yesterday.

title: Italy Loses Cup Tennis To Aussies
description: NAPLES, Italy, May 17 (UPI)  Evonne Goolagong and Dianne Fromholtz scored straight set victories today over Italian opponents and moved Australia into the semifinal round of the Federation Cup tennis competition.

title: Larson, Giants Center, Quits Football
description: Greg Larson, a courageous competitor who missed only three regularseason games in 13 years as an offensive lineman with the New York Giants, announced his retirement yesterday from professional football.

title: Market Place: Institutions A Closer Look
description: The recent spectacle of 40 per cent drop in the shares of both Combustion Engineering and Consolidated Edison in the wake of an adverse newspaper article on Combustion and a dividend omission by Con Ed has rekindled fears of institutional domination of the stock market.

title: Business Briefs
description: Pan American World Airways proposed yesterday total consolidation of its North Atlantic operations with those of Trans World Airlines, and pooling of all revenues on the route. Pan Am expressed the view that this wholehog approach would increase the two carriers revenues $75million to $80million and cut costs.

title: Mental Depression Is Cited as Aldrin Forgoes a Speech
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI) Edwin E. Aldrin Jr., the second astronaut on the moon who is now national mental health chairman, canceled scheduled speech yesterday because of recurring symptoms of mental depression that developed after his Apollo 11 journey.

title: Banker Pleads No Contest In Agnew FundRaising Case
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 17 (UPI)  Blagden H. Wharton, a Maryland banker, pleaded no contest yesterday to a misdemeanor charge stemming from a 1972 fundraising affair honoring Spiro T. Agnew, then the Vice President. Two perjury charges were dropped.

title: SAFETY UNIT BARS A CIGARETTE BAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) The Consumer Product Safety Commission said today that it lacked the authority to ban hightar cigarettes.

title: A Wandering Turkey Walks Into Missourian's Backyard
description: ST, JOSEPH, Mo. (AP)A potential dinner made an appearance at the Bob Wayne home recently.

title: Billy Welu, Bowler, Dies; On ABCTV Sports Staff
description: HOUSTON, May 17 (AP)Billy Welu, nationally known professional bowler, died Thursday, apparently of a heart attack, at the age of 41.

title: Israeli Jets Hit Lebanon In a 2d Day of Reprisals
YOUNGSTERS TOLD OF RIGHTS BATTLE
description: The real heroes at yesterday's 20th anniversary celebration of the Supreme Court's ruling on public school desegregation turned out to be not the distinguished lawyers and judges who moved the case through the nation's courts, but the black parents, ministers and students who had acted mainly on the resolve that they were fed up with the crude school facilities available to black children.

title: 4 School Aides Disciplined In Irregularities on Tests
description: An acting assistant principal has been demoted and disciplinary action has been taken against three teachers as a resuit of official investigations into allegations of irregularities in last month's citywide pupil Ireading tests, School Chancellor Irving Anker said yesterday.

title: TENSION PREVAILS IN MONEY TRADING
description: LONDON, May 17Uncertainty and tension prevailed today in the foreignexchange markets all over Europe as Austria announced a de facto revaluation of her schilling and West Germany was forced to intervene in support of the Danish, Swedish and Norwegian currencies.

title: 2 COMPANIES PLAN 20,000CAR RECALL,
description: DETROIT, May 17 (UPI) Chrysler and General Motors announced today recall campaigns involving almost 20,000 vehicles, including 3,700 G.M.0 motor homes that may have defects that could cause the accelerator to stick or a wheel to fall off.
