description: He can't run now. He can't even jog. He can't ride horse or a bike. He can hardly swim. He certainly can't play football.

title: Controversy Threatens Indy 500
Bridge: Italians and North Americans Lead Field for Bermuda Bowl
description: VENICE, Italy, May 19Italy and North America are the chief contenders for the world team championship which begins here, Tuesday. The Italians will defend their Bermuda Bowl title with a modified version of their famous Blue Team. Giorgio Belladonna, Benito Garozzo, Pietro Forquet represent the old guard who have won scores of international titles between them. They are supported by Benito Bianchi, who won his first title in Brazil last year and by two talented youngsters making their world championship debut, Arturo Franco and de Falco.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Night on Town Fails for 2 Inmates

title: Bridal for Rise Andler And Richard Liskco.
description: Miss Rise Lynne Andler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Andler of Newton Highlands, Mass was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Grant Liskov, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Liskov of Bridgeport, Conn. The bridegroom's father is a member of the Connecticut House of Representatives. Rabbi Samuel Chiel performed the ceremony at Temple Emanuel in Newton Center, Mass..

title: Tyree Glenn, Jazz Trombonist In Era of Big Bands, Dies at 61
description: Tyree Glenn, who played the trombone and vibraphone with many of the great jazz names of the bigband era, died Saturday in Englewood (N.J.) Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 308 West Englewood Avenue in Englewood. Mr. Glenn joined Louis Armstrong's AllStars in 1964 and remained with the great trumpeter until his death in 1971. If Mr. Armstrong wasn't feeling up to the high notes in later years, Mr. Glenn recalled earlier this year, they would smoothly switch parts. Last year he organized a sextet that played at the Royal Box in the Americana Hotel for several months.

title: Aberdeen's Scots Feel the Touch of Texas
description: ABERDEEN, Scotland The electric guitars and the lyrics to American country and Western ballads boomed out across the dance floor at the Petroleum Country Club here the other night as oilmen enjoyed a boisterous session of drinking, dining and dancing.

title: AID FOR EGYPT TIED TO SUEZ CANAL USE
description: Senator Hubert H. Humphrey declared last night that he would not support President Nixon's recent request for economic aid to Egypt until Israel was assured that it would be allowed passage through the Suez Canal,

title: Paperback Boom Reshapes World of Books
ArmWrestler Bears Down to Win
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 19 Armwrestling may strike most people as a harmless reaffirmation of masculinity i for boys of all ages, usually carried on in the corner tavern after five or six boilermakers.

title: A New OTBRale Bars Wagering for Minors
description: Paul R. Screvane, president of the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation, said yesterday that he had adopted a new regulation making it a criminal offense for an adult to place an OTB bet for someone younger than 18.

title: POLICE SCATTER STREET VENDERS
description: Warned by the police to move their street market or face confiscation of their wares, craftsmen and venders near the steps of the Metropolitan Museum of Art yesterday went into a brief flurry of packing up their silverandbead jewelry, watercolors, paintings, leatherwork, pillows, pre:Columbian figures., Haitian baskets, potted cacti and mire elephants. The pair of police officers disappeared after Issuing only coqple of summonses  for peddling in a restricted area and most of the venders had soon unpacked their traycases, trucks or shopping bags and were back in business. They also collected the signatures of 300 sympathetic strollers on a petition and talked about organizing ourselves and getting a lawyer.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Four Brooklyn youths at the rear of a subway platform who saw a man fall to the tracks, striking his head on the rail, leaped to the tracks and lifted him, unconscious, to the platform seconds before a train roared into the station.

title: Jurors Go to the Races in Fix Trial
Foreign Policy Association Designates New Chairman
description: Carter L. Burgess, chairman of Flagship International Inc., has been designated chairman of the board of directors of the Foreign Policy Association.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: For Eric Greene, today s qualifyIng rounds for the United States Open golf championship are the first steps toward what is confidehe will be a spot in the tournament June 13 through 16 at Winged Foot in Mamaroneck N. Y. Greeriell only 17 years old and one of the youn lest hopefuls.

title: Aramco Is Transferring U.S. Base to Houston
description: The Arabian American Oil Company is moving its United tates operations from New York to Houston, a spokesman.confirmed yesterday.

title: Only 556 See Sets Defeated
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., May 20 With the screams of a tiny crowd of 556 echoing in the spaces of Nassau Coliseum, the Baltimore Banners defeated the New York Sets, 2423, tonight by taking a 9point, suddendeath tiebreaker in the mixed doubles, the last match.

title: U.S ESTABLISHES SHORTAGES PANEL
Rep. Holtzman Calls U.S. Lax on Nazi Inquiries
description: Representative Elizabethl Holtzman charged yesterday that an appalling laxnes's and superficiality in investigations by the Immigration and Naturalization Service had made America a haven for at least 73 alleged Nazi war criminals over the last 25 years.

title: Man Slain Uptown
description: Ivan Cardenas of 546 West 180th Street was fatally shot shortly after 4 A.M. yesterday at the corner of St. Nicholas Avenue and West 177th Street, according to the police.

title: Catholic Conference Is Sued as Lobbyist
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The lobbying activities of the United States Catholic Conference are being challenged in court for the first time in a suit brought by the Women's Lobby, a small group with a registered lobbyist that concerns itself with legislation affecting women.

title: ITALIAN COURT BOWS TO KIDNAPPERS BID
description: ROME, May 20  A court in Genoa yielded today to the demands of a band of kidnappers who have been holding a public official for more than a Month, and agreed to the release of eight convicts in exchange for the safe return of the official. The court also ordered that the convicts be provided with passports or other documents that would enable them to leave Italy.

title: A Promising Newcomer in Museums
description: The founding of an art museum is, under any circumstances, a heroic undertaking, but nowadays it must be deemed doubly heroic. Rivalry for outstanding private collections is already keen among established museums; the newcomer is obliged to muscle its way into an intense competition. Budgetsno matter how generousinevitably fall short of rising costs, and., yet the public demands ever higher standards in both the quality of museum facilities and the art that they contain. Compared to the tasks confronting a new museum today, the labors of Sisyphus child's play.

title: ROAD EIVELL, ANTHROPOLOGIST
description: OTHELLO, Wash., May 20 (UPI)Dr. Roald Fryxell, the anthropologist who discovered what are believed to be the oldest documented human remains in the Pacific Northwest, died Saturday in a car accident. He was 40 years old.

title: People and Business
description: Howard P. Goldberg has been named president and chief operating officer of Ohrbach's, Inc., the 11unit specialtystore group in the metropolitan areas of New York and Los Angeles. He succeeds Robert J. Suslow, 40, who, as previously reported, will become president of the Famous Barr Companynine department stores in the St. Louis area owned by the May Department Stores Companyon July 1.

title: Stepfather Denies Queens Boy Slain by Police Officer Had a Gun
description: The stepfather of a 10yearold boy who was slain last year by a police officer told Queens jury yesterday that the boy did not have a gun when he was shot to death, as contended by the defense.

title: 13DAY STRIKE ENDS AT BRITISH AIRWAYS
description: LONDON, May 20 (Reuters) Two strikes which have crippled operations by British Airways ended today.

title: Tennis Eyes Turn Abroad This Week
description: For the first time sinte January, the tennis merrygoround slows down this week with competition centered on World Team Tennis and Bournemouth.

title: H.E.W Aide Backs Ban on Drug Gifts
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The Administration's top health official testified today in favor of legislation to prohibit drug companies from making gifts to doctors and pharmacists to promote the companies products.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: May 21, 1974 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Cavaliers Get Chones For Top Draft Choice
description: Jim Chones of the Carolina Cougars was signed by the Cleveland Cavaliers of the National Basketball Association yesterday in a deal that involved draft rights with the Los Angeles Lakers. The center had been placed on waivers by the Cougars and wasn't claimed by any of the other American Basketball Association clubs.

title: Ms. on British Passports
description: LONDON, May 20 (Reuters) Feminists who picketed the passport office in Britain last month heard today they had won their campaign to have the prefix Ms. on passports, instead of Miss or Mrs. The passport office said today that the British Foreign Office had approved the title.

title: Actions by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Boston Shipbuilding In 250Million Pact To Build 10Carriers
description: The Boston Shipbuilding Corporation announced yesterday that it had signed preliminary agreements with three United States shipping companies for the construction of 10 38,000deadweightton product carriers over the next three and a half years. The value of the contract exceeds $250million.

title: Fahmy Invited to China
description: CAIRO, May 20 (Reuters)Foreign Minister. Ismail Fahmy today accepted an invitation to visit China, at a date to be fixed, the Middle East News Agency reported. The invitation was offered during talks today with Ambassador Chii Tsemin of China..

title: Our Story Up to Now
description: So President Nixon will stay on. His decision will not be universally approved, of course. There will be the customary handwringing about a constitutional crisis, which we have had repeatedly since the Watergate affair first surfaced in 1973, but this will have little effect now upon a people fatigued with these constant cries of constitutional crisis.

title: Cubs, Hooton Stop Mets, 21, On 2Run Single by Williams
France's New President
description: The election of Valery Giscard d'Estaing as the third President of the Fifth French Republic gives promise change for his country, for the European Community and for the Atlantic alliance. Ended is sixteen years Gaullist rule characterized by a strong admixture archaic nationalism in all aspects of policy. The helm now is in the hands of a modern conservative whose ambition, he once said, was to become president of united Europe, a Europe that he wants to move toward close and equal partnership with the United States.

title: State Office Building in Harlem Is Dedicated
description: In a quiet ceremony tinged with irony, paradox and anticlimax, the State Office Building in Harlem, one of the largest and most controversial projects in a black community, was dedicated yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In recent debates in Albany about state aid to Con Edison, New York's large utility system, some lawmakers reportedly opposed such aid because it would benefit mainly shareholders (whose dividends were recently suspended for the first time in more than 85 years).

title: Frankenstein on a Split Screen?
description: Reaction shots are closeups of people reacting to someone or something that affects them, underscoring the emotional impact of the happenings on the screen. Watching Frankenstein's monster stalk through the woods may be frightening, but seeing the look on his victim's face can be emotionally devastating.... Reaction shots are so typically a technique of film and television drama that use of them in nonfiction presentations maybesides intensifying emotiongive viewers more of an illusion that they are watching a drama.

title: Screen: Theater of Life Gangster Feature From Japan Is at Regency
Bridge
description: VENICE, Italy, May 20Eight days of team championship play begin here tomorrow afternoon, with North Africa, Brazil, France, Indonesia and New Zealand hoping to deprive the Italians of their Bermuda Bowl title.

title: RECORD HARVEST FOR WHEAT SEEN
Ousted Lisbon Chiefs Flown to Brazil
description: LISBON, May 20Former President Americo Thomaz and former Premier Marcello Caetano, whose rightwing Government collapsed in an armed forces coup, were flown today to exile in Brazil.

title: WOMEN EFFECTIVE ON POLICE PATROL
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The Police Foundation reported yesterday that a yearlong study indicated that there was no significant difference in job performance of male and female police officers on patrol duty.

title: EXFRANKLIN LAWYER EXPLAINS RESIGNING
description: Stanley D. Waxberg, senior partner of the firm of Kaye, Scholer, Fierman, Hays & Handler and general counsel to the Franklin National Bank for the last 10 years, said yesterday that he personally had resigned the Franklin account for his firm on May 12 when he became aware that the bank was releasing to the press a statement on its planned rights offer and its foreignexchange losses.

title: Child Molesters Try Shock Cure
Elections Official Urges Raise, More Help for Board's Chief
description: A raise for the man who runs the city's election machinery and the hiring of additional employes to help him were called for yesterday by a member of the Board of Elections,

title: U.N. FORCE READY TO POLICE GOLAN
description: CAIRO, May 20The United Nations force that mans the buffer zone between Egyptian and Israeli forces on the Suez Canal front is ready to act almost immediately to send troops to the IsraeliSyrian front as part of a disengagement there, a United Nations spokesman said here today.

title: Tax Bill on Adoption
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP)  Russell B. Long, chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, proposed today a personal income tax deduction for the expense of adopting a child.

title: JUDGE DISMISSES PLEA BY REINECKE
description: WASHINGTON, May 20  A Federal District Court judge refused today to dismiss a perjury indictment against Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke of California, a Republican, dr to transfer, his trial from the District of Columbia to California.

title: OUTSPOKEN PRIEST IN MOSCOW QUITS
description: MOSCOW, May 20A Communist youth unit in a Moscow borough has successfully demanded that a popular Russian Orthodox priest be silenced because his outspoken sermons were drawing young people, sources close to the Orthodox Church have disclosed.

title: BOMBED CAMPS IN MONEY PINCH
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 20 Yesir Arafat, head at the Palestine Liberation Organization,, reportedly appealed over the weekend to the ambassadors of Arab countries represented here for help in rebuilding refugee camps struck by Israeli planes last week.

title: Tennis Eyes Turn Abroad This Week
description: For the first time since January the tennis mengo round slows down this week with Competion ceritered on World Team Tennis and Bournemouth:

title: State Finds Wide Waste in Bronx School District
description: The former administration of a Bronx:school district wasted a considerable amount of nearly $1.9million in contracts for computerized teaching and management efforts over the last two school years, Controller Arthur Levitt.charged yesterday.

title: Westbury Is Facing New Threat
description: WESTBURY, L.I, May 20 A showdown was threatened tonight on Roosevelt Raceway's new rule that forbids brothers or fathers and sons from competing against each other in virtually all races here.

title: LDOPA Found Not to Slow Parkinson's Disease
description: LDOPA continues to be highly effective in alleviating the incapacitating symptoms of Parkinson's disease, but pioneers in its use told an international symposium here on Friday that the drug does not seem to slow the underlying progression of the disease.

title: Wood, Field &
description: The Sebago Canoe Club of Brooklyn, a 40yearold community service organization that has taught generations of adults and youngsters the fundamentals of canoeing and smallboat handling and safety, may, say its officers, be forced out of existence by the city's Ports and Terminals department.

title: Sales and Net of Sears Up For First Fiscal Quarter
description: Sears, Roebuck & Co., thel nation's largest retailer of general merchandise, had a 9.7 per cent increase in net income in the first fiscal quarter, endedi April 30, on a sales gain of 8.8 per cent. In reporting the results to stockholders at yesterday's annual meeting in Chicago, Arthur M. Wood, chairman, said the figures set records for the period.

title: Morgenthau in District Attorney Race
description: Already rated the frontrunner by most politicians, Robert M. Morgenthau yesterday formally announced his candidacy for the Democratic nomination for Manhattan District Attorney, a nomination that is generally tantamount to election.

title: CIBAGEIGY PLANS MERGER OF A UNIT
description: The CibaGeigy Corporation said yesterday it planned to merge Funk Seeds International, in which it has a large Interest, into a new wholly owned CibaGeigy subsidiary as soon as possible. The formalities will take a month or so, according to a company spokesman.

title: Books of The Times
description: In spite of all the nonfiction books on the subject, it is difficult to feel how much this country has changed in the last 40 Or 50 years until you read a good novel set in that earlier timelike The Wine of Astonishment, by Rachel MacKenzie. Because I don't doubt for a moment the authenticity of this book, I find myself looking at the characters and their behavior in something like amazement. Were we really so moral, so patient, so committed to life as we found it, so hard working, so innocent? It all seems so very long ago. In fact, if you look back to the characters of Shakespeare, or even Chaucer, they appear to be more worldly, more sophisticated, than the men and women of Miss MacKenzie's Pliny Falls, N. Y.

title: COLSON ATTORNEY DEFENDS BREAKIN
description: WASHINGTON, May 20An attorney for Charles W. Colson, contending that the law on searches without warrants was less than crystal clear in 1971, argued today that the six defendants in the White House plumbers case had a right to defend themselves on the ground that their burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist was a national security operation authorized by the President.

title: Design School Head to Quit
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., May 20 (AP)Talbot Rantoul, president of the Rhode Island School of Design, announced today his plans to retire at the end of the next academic year.

title: Weekly Parties for 500 Chill Tenants
description: Considering all the nasty things this neighbors have been saying about him, the striking thing about David Mancuso is how considerate he's been of his fellow tenants in the double loft building at 645647 Broadway.

title: Local School Officials in Bronx Bar Investigators in Paddlings
description: Authorities in Community School District 9 in the Bronx refused yesterday to allow three investigators from Board of Education headquarters to interview teachers and students at a junior high school ,where there have been charges that youngsters who misbehaved were beaten by two male deans with a thick wooden paddle, leather straps and fists.

title: Briefs On The Arts &
description: The allday country music show scheduled for the Aqueduct Race Track on Saturday has been canceled, the show's promoters announced yesterday. Lou Flax's Concert Spectaculars said that financial difficulties arose late last week, and that the organization had been unable to obtain a further extension from the New York Racing Association, which operates Aqueduct. A racing association spokesman confirmed that Mr. Flax had already been given an extension from May. 1 until last Friday for his next payment. When he failed to meet the deadline, his option was canceled.

title: Arrest Made in Slaying Of ExColumbia Athlete
description: A 34yearold unemployed man was arrested yesterday and charged with the murder of Ronald Sedlock, the former Columbia University football player who was slashed to death with a straightedge razor on Saturday when he objected to the mistreatment of a dog.

title: Meeting is Set for Friday.. On Integrating Lane High
description: The Board of Education has scheduled a meeting next Friday between education officials in Brooklyn and Queens to, begin working on a plan to bring about greater racial balance in the Franklin K. Lane.High Scheel, district, as directed:last Friday by Federal District Court Judge John F. Dooling: Jr.

title: M'CULLOCH REPORTS CLASSSUIT FILING
description: LOS ANGELES, May 20 (AP) The McCulloch Oil Company said today that an alleged stockholder had filed a classaction suit against it, certain members of its management, and its independent public accountant. Arthur Young & Co.

title: Soccer Fan Killed in Brazil Melee
description: BELEM, Brazil, May 20 (Reuters)  One soccer fan was fatally wounded and three persons were in critical condition in a hospltal,today after a policeman fired on rioting spectators during a soccer match between Remo and PaissanduBelem last night.

title: SENATE APPROVES A 4YEAR PROGRAM TO HELP SCHOOLS
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The Senate voted 81 to 5 today to authorize $25.2billion to aid the nation's schools over the next four years and stood firm on a compromise amendment that would act to reduce the busing of pupils.

title: NBCTV CutsDinah's Place For New Name That Tune
description: Dinah's Place, the halfhour daily potpourri with Dinah Shore, who won an Emmy award as best daytime hostess, has been canceled by NBCTV. The show will be replaced July 29 by a new version of Name That Tune, a game show with. cash prizes that had been an evening series several years ago.

title: Golden Gloves Belt Irish, 83
description: Spurred by a screaming crowd of 3,804 fans and by themusic of Paddy Noonan's Band, the Irish national boxing team tried its best against a team of New York Golden Gloves boxers but ran into a profusion of knockout, punches and lost eight. of ii matches last night at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum.

title: Market Place: An Institutional Panic Analyzed
description: If further proof was needed, that ResearchCottrell stock plunge of last Friday indicates once again just how badly institutional investors have damaged the stock market. Price changes of 5 per cent were once less common than the precipitous losses of today.

title: Protection Against Illness
description: In his radio address yesterday on national health insurance legislation, President Nixon made two significant contributions: he acknowledged the inadequacy of existing protection; and he suggested greater flexibility in the Administration's readiness to reach a compromise with rival proposals in the shaping of an acceptable and effective bill.

title: Catholic Conference Is Sued as Lobbyist
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The lobbying activities of the United! WASHINGTON, May 20The States Catholic Conference are being challenged in court for the first tithe in a suit brought by the Women's Lobby, a small group with a registered lobbyist that concerns itself with legislation affecting women.

title: POLITICAL STRIKE CHOKES BELFAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 20  The hardline Protestant resistance movement succeeded today in choking life in this city down to what, in effect, was a bare subsistence level.

title: Suffer Little Children
description: Three years ago, the Congress of the United States woke up to the particular horror of children dying becoming blind or brain damaged simply because they Were hungry and gnawed at the paint in the houses where they lived. Appalled by official estimates that approximately 200 children a year died from leadbased paint poisoning and that 400,000 children had elevated lead levels in their blood, Congress passed the LeadBased Paint Poisoning Prevention Act of 1971.

title: Two Rail Lines to Compete On a New Passenger Run
description: Next Friday in Louisville, Ky., a curious phenomenon in midtwentieth century America will occur: The start of a cornpetitive race on the rails betwcen free enterprise and railroad nationalized in everything but name.

title: Dance: An Uncommon Treat From the Royal Ballet
description: For connoisseurs of ballet and just plain dance lovers, last Sunday was the day of days in the current Royal Ballet calendar. It was the day when all the stars came outat both performances virtually a complete roster of the Royal Ballet principals was in attendanceand it had the company giving the first New York performances of two new duets, and making its New York debut in Balanchine's Apollo. There was also the only performances this season of Frederick Ashton's Symphonic Variations, and both afternoon and evening program's ,opened with Petipa's La Bayadere. It was just one ,gorgeous day at the ballet.

title: The Whole Truth
description: The legal trails leading up to and away from the original Watergate burglary have some resemblance a maze. The Senate Watergate Committee, the House Judiciary Committee and the special prosecutor are the pursuers. President Nixon and his close associates are the pursued.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Tia Scott liked the movie Paper Moon so much she wanted the name for her boutique at 1100 Madison avenue between 82d and 83d Streets. However, there already was a Paper Moon up the Avenue, at Number 1192, so she compromised. She translated it into French, Lune en Papier.

title: DEDUCTION OF TAPES AS GIFTS FACES BAR
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The Internal Revenue Service will issue a ruling shortly specifying that public officials cannot take tax deductions for gifts of tape recordings to charitable organizations.

title: Columbia Pictures Hires Clive Davis
description: Clive J. Davis, who was discharged by Columbia Records year ago for alleged misuse of company funds, has been liked as a consultant to the recording and music operations of Columbia Pictures Industries, the movie company announced yesterday.

title: Lyons Drops His Broadway Column After 40 Years
description: Leonard Lyons dropped his last 151 names in The New York Post yesterday.

title: KISSINGER MAKES GOOD PROGRESS IN MIDEAST TALKS
description: TEL AVIV, May 20Secretary of State Kissinger said today. in Damascus that good progress had been made in his talks with President Hafez alAssad of Syria toward concluding an agreement to seParate Syrian and Israeli troops on the the Golan Heights.

title: Campbell Soup Plans to Open Chain of Steak Houses in State
description: CAMDEN  The Campbell Soup Company, so diversified now that soup no longer accounts for even half of its sales volume, plans to open a chain of large steak houses in New Jersey this year.

title: Changes By N.F.L. Opposed
description: Criticism of some of pro football's rule cbanges by George Allen and the Players Association came to light yesterday as many of the sport's renowned figures gathered for the annual dinner of the New York chapter of the Pro Football Writers Association.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Boeing Company announced yesterday that it sold a 747B jumbo aircraft to Singapore Airlines for $38million, including spare, parts. A company spokesman said that delivery was set for next year.

title: Arab Guerrilla Leader Gives Terms for Joining Peace Talks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 20The leader of the guerrilla group that attacked the Maalot school in Israel last Wednesday said today that the Palestinian resistance should go to the Middle East peace conference in Geneva if Israel recognized the national rights of the Palestinian people.

title: PRESIDENT EASES HEALTHAID STAND
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., May 20  President Nixon offered today to compromise on a national health insurance program in order to enhance prospects for passage of national health legislation this year.

title: GIRARD ASSUMES OFFICE DIA WEEK
description: PARIS, May 20 (Reuters)Valery Giscard d'Estaing, elected President by a thin margin yesterday, said today that he would assume the leadership of France next Monday to launch the new era that he has Promised.

title: SENATE APPROVES 4YEAR PROGRAM TO HELP SCHOOLS
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The Senate voted 81 to 5 today to authorize 825.2billion to aid the nation's schools over the next four years and stood firm on a compromise amendment that would act to reduce the busing of pupils.

title: Most Common Market Officials Welcome Election of Giscard
description: BRUSSELS, May 20  Common Market officials generally welcomed yesterday's election of Valry Giscard d'Estaing as President of France.

title: Jurors Go to the Races in Fix Trial
description: There goes Gilmour fourwide, a defense attorney called out in Brooklyn Federal Court yesterday as a field of pacers swept into the stretch on a television screen.

title: INCREASES IN AID TO INDIA IN DOUBT
description: NEW DELHI, May 20Western diplomats raised doubts today about increased aid to India following her detonation of a nuclear device on Saturday.

title: Texts of Ruling by Judge Sirica and of Letter by Jaworski to Senator Eastland
KISSINGER MAKES GOOD PROGRESS IN MIDEAST TALKS
description: TEL AVIV, May 20Secretary of State Kissinger said today in Damascus that good progress had been made in his talks with President Hafez alAssad of Syria toward concluding an agreement to separate Syrian and Israeli troops on the the Golan Heights.

title: Death of Missing Boy, 7, Is Attributed to Drowning
description: An autopsy performed on the body of 7yearold Mark Wilson, who disappeared from his home in Harlem May 10, disclosed yesterday that death had been caused by asphyxia due to drowning, according to Dr. Faruk Presswalla, an associate medical examiner. There were no marks of violence, he said.

title: College Board Initiates Study of Hiring and Tenure
description: The Board of Higher Education announced yesterday the formation of its special shortterm committee to study the question of faculty hiring and tenure, to be headed by Quigg Newton, a former Mayor of Denver and University of Colorado president.

title: Lisbon's Soldiers in Mozambique Are Divided on Territory's Future,
description: MONTEPUEZ, Mozambique, May 16Here, 1,500 miles north of the seemingly unaffected capital of Lourenco Marques, in the malariaridden uplands cut by crocodile infested streams, soldiers and officers close to the hitandrun war feel either that time is running out on Portugal's hold over Mozambique or that nothing has changed at all since the military coup of April 25.

title: Mobutu Displays 48 Doomed
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 20 (Agence FrancePresse)President Mobutu Sese Seko displayed 48 condemned murderers before a mass rally here yesterday, announcing that all would be hanged.

title: TROOPER IS KILLED ON DRUG CASE HERE
description: A state trooper, working as an undercover agent, was fatally shot in the head last night while attempting to make a purchase of narcotics at Somers street and Stone Avenue in the Brownsville section of Brookthe police reported. The trooper, whom the police lleclined to identify until his nearest relative had been notified was working with the Federal Drug Enforcement Administration. He was felled by one shot shortly before midnight and taken to Brooklyn Women's Hospital where he died an hour

title: SYMPHONY SEASON GETS 2 FROM MET
description: NEWARK, May 20Marilyn Horne the soprano, and Giorgio Tozzi, the bass tenor of the Metropolitan Opera, will be among the soloists performing in the 197475 season of the. New Jersey Symphony, Henry Lewis, music director, announced today.

title: Start of Life Debated at Abortion Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, May 20As the few Senators in attendance listened with the perplexed attentiveness of students in an advanced biology course, scientists debated such matters as whether the moment when life begins can be scientifically determined, or whether an eightweek fetus feels pain.

title: Clash Over Maalot Disclosed by Dayan
description: JERUSALEM, May 20Detense Minister Moshe Dayan today attacked the Israeli Government's initial decision last Wednesday to give in to the demands of the Arab terrorists who were holding students hostage and said that he had personally opposed it.

title: Panel Proposes Dropping of 11 Brooklyn Hospitals
description: A staff report of the Health and Hospitals Planning Council of Southern New York has proposed that 11 small, obsolete voluntary and proprietary hospitals in Brooklyn be phased out through government action or other means.

title: OWNERS GROUP WINS SUIT IN PARKCHESTER
description: The owners of the huge Parkchester apartment doyelopment in the Bronx have won court round in their attempt to convert the entire 12,000famiiy complex from rental to con.cltiminium status.

title: TRADE PACT NEAR ON OIL PROBLEMS
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The world's leading trading and industrial nations are near agreement on a mutual pledge to avoid measures in restraint of imports or exports as a means of coping with large deficits in their balances of payments arising this year from the explosion of oil prices.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BACK AGAIN She first came to New York from Argentina as a student, sold candy in Macy's, felt alone, hungry and lost, because the city was a demanding taskmaster. Tonight, at least a decade later, Ginamaria Hidalgo, now a popular singer in Argentina, Peru, Mexico and other Latin countries, makes her American debut at Carnegie Hall (2477459).

title: Jipcho: Pay First, Run Later
description: As an amateur, Ben Jipcho said he always collected his money before he ran, like the time he set a world record in the steeplechase.

title: POLITICAL STRIKE CHOKES BELFAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 20 The hardline Protestant resistance movement succeeded today in choking life in this city down to what, in effect, was a bare subsistence, level,

title: SIRICA BIDS NIXON HEED A SUBPOENA FOR MORE TAPES
JOHN G. M'LEAN, 56, OIL OFFICIAL, DIES
description: John G. McLean, chairman and chief executive officer of the Continental Oil Company, died yesterday in Greenwieh (Conn.) Hospital. He was 56 years old and lived on Contentment Island Road in Darien, Conn.

title: Frazier Working Hard
description: PHILADELPHIA May 20 (UPI) The former heavyweight boxing champion Joe Frazier completed his first week of heavy workouts to in preparation for his June 17 bout. with Jerry Quarry in New York's Madison Square Garden. title: World Bank Sets Loans
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UPI) The World Bank Group announced today the approval of highway and telecommunications loans for a total of $28million for Haiti and TrinidadTobago. The World Bank made an $18million loan to the Trinidad and Tobago Telephone Company, Ltd. to help finance a telephone network  rehabilitation and expansion project.

title: Advertising: Children and TV
description: Faced with an or else attitude on the part of the chairman of the Federal Trade Commission, the advertising industry has come up with a selfregulation program to cover the thorny issue of advertising to children.

title: Music: Keen Innovators
description: Most symphony orchestras these days worry, and rightly so, that they project an image of fusty conservatism. The Buffalo Philharmonic is something else again. For many years, under the leadership of Lukas Foss and more recently. of Michael Tilson Thomas, the orchestra has been known best as an instrument for experiment and innovation.

description: WASHINGTON, May 20The world's leading trading and industrial nations are near agreement on a.mutual pledge to avoid measures in restraint of imports or exports as a means of coping with large deficits in their balances of payments arising this year from the explosion of oil prices.

title: Central Resumes Phillipsburg's Commuter Service
description: NEWARK May 20Commuter service from Phillipsburg to New York resumed today as the Central Rail road Company of New Jersey's first train left at 6:02 A.M., two minutes behind schedule.

title: Saigon Seeks to Recover Control of Outer Defenses
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 20 (Reuters)South Vietnamese Government troops moved in force today to regain control of Saigon's outer defenses after pommunists had captured three outposts and had blown up gasoline tank at the country's biggest oil depot,

title: WILLARD H. CARR
description: Willard H. Carr, head of the Carr Bros., Inc., importexport company, until its dissolution and a former president of the Mexican Chamber of Commerce of New York, died Sunday at his home in Washington, Conn, He was 69 years old.

title: DISCOUNT STORES FACING PROBLEMS
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 The American discount retailer, who built a lowpriced image into a $35billion volume in about two decades, is neither very happy nor very successful in this period of high inflation.

description: What would make up a model vestpocket revue? Perhaps a cast of three  that's sufficient crowd. This trio Would be personable, cleanlooking young people, sharp as a tack and even funnier, perhaps, if they happened to write their own material. The composerlyricist should also be seen in at least two numbers, especially if he delivers a bright, tuneful score.

title: Notes on People
description: Reports that he.and his wife are separated and that a divorce is planned simply aren't true, said King Palden Thondup Namgyal of Sikkim. The king of the small Himalayan country, in New Delhi On a semiofficial visit to India, said it was true that his wife, the former New York socialite Hope Cooke, and their three children have been living in seclusion in Manhattan, but there is no question of divorce; I have asked her to remain in New York for the time being for her own happiness.

description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., May 20  President Nixon offered today to compromise on a national health insurance program in order to enhance prospects for passage of national health legislation this year.

Pierre MendesFrance, the leftleaning Premier of the nineteenfifties,. told friends as the returns Oiled up election night.

title: On the Ashes of Maalot
description: In the space of one short week, the emotions of thoSe concerned with making peace between Arabs and Israelis have gyrated from grief to fury to futility to something on the way to euphoria. The sense of futility grew from the terror and violence of Maalot and Lebanonjust at a moment when Israel and Syria, that most intransigent of the neighboring Arab states, seemed on the verge of a. farreaching security accord.

More Ford executives and other American automobile men are on the way, lured not only by reports that Volvo has found a different, perhaps better way to make automobiles but by possibility that the Swedish firm may have found a partial antidote the worker alienation and discontent troubling industrial societies everywhere.

title: ARGUMENTS HEARD IN CATENA APPEAL
description: TRENTON, May 20 (UPI).Gerardo V. Catena, a reputed mobster, should be kept in prison until he agrees to talk to the New Jersey State Commission of Investigation or until the panel goes out of existence, a state attorney argued today. Mr. Catena's attorney, Robert Weinberg, of the Washington law firm of Edward Bennett Williams, told the Supreme Court his client should be freed because there is no substantial likelihood he would talk.

title: Road Building Costs Rise
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UPI)  Reflecting inflationary prices In the first quarter, highway construction costs rose 11.7 per cent over the last quarter of 1973  the highest quarterly increase since the Federal Highway Administration initiated such records. In a report issued today, the agency said the unprecedented rise in prices increased the composite price index for the first quarter of the year to 36.1 per cent above the first quarter a year ago.

title: Oil Shale Lease Awarded
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP)  The Interior Department allnounced today.the awarding of an oil shale lease in Utah for a high bid of more than $45million. A spokesman said the department had accepted the bonus bid of the White River Corporation for a 5,120acre tract of Federal land, designated Tract UB, some 40 miles southeast of Vernal, Utah. White River Corp. represents Phillips Petroleum Co., Sun Oil Co., and Sohio Petroleum Co., the spokesman said.

title: Fightin'
Philadelphia Flies High As Its Flyers
description: All those people going around in Philadelphia yesterday with a finger in the air were not trying to be rude. They were fans calling attention to the fact that the Flyers are No. 1, having won the Stanley Cup, emblematic of the championship of the National Hockey League.How do I tell a guy who wants a cab from a Flyer fan? complained a Philadelphia cab driver. Oh, well, it sure helps liven a normally zero Sunday night around here.Thousands of hysterically happy fans seized the opportunity of the Flyers upset victory over the Boston Bruins to run wild. The celebration started after Sunday's game and resumed yesterday with a parade with the Flyer players. They blocked the streets, rode on top of cars and buses, sang loudly and obscenely, streaked nude and recreated New Year's Eve and the end of World War II combined.One, two, three, four, who the hell is Bobby Orr? was a favorite chant, deriding the leader of the defeated team, a symbol of the Establishment. The Flyers had beaten the Bruins 4 games to 2 in the championship series.God Bless America, God Bless Kate Smith, God Bless Bernie Parent, chorused others, paying allegiance to the Philadelphia national anthem, the singer who brought them amazingly good luck and the Flyers goalie, who won a trophy and a car for being the most valuable player in the playoffs.Philadelphians have not had too many opportunities to go berserk over pro sports champions. Their recent winners in each sport are the Phillies in baseball in 1950, the Eagles in football in 1960, the 76ers in basketball in 1967 and Atoms in soccer 1973. They also had Joe Frazier during his reign as heavyweight champion.

title: Japan. A Void at the Core

title: Mood of Enjoyment Marks the Singing Of Mabel Mercer

title: Books of The Times Speaking Frankly of Death
description: In 1970, when Lynn Caine learned from the doctor that her 49yearold husband, Martin, was riddled with cancer and that the prognosis was zero, she thought death could be braved with a stiff upper lip. When I was a little girl, my favorite storythe one I read over and overwas the story of the Little Spartan, the boy with the fox gnawing away at his innards who never betrayed his agony. I identified totally with that story. And even as an adult somewhere inside me I was still that nineyearold girl trying so hard to be a Little Spartan. But when death came to Martin 14 months later, Lynn Caine discovered the void that lies beyond roleplaying. In the small hours of too many mornings, wnen real time CraWIS to a SLOP, she would awake from nightmares of death to find herself numb with panic. She would crawl to her desk, take pen and paper, and spill out curses at the husband who had abandoned her, the children who were burdening her, the God who had failed her.

title: Plumbers Defense Wins A Point on Security Data
description: WASHINGTON, May 21A Federal judge decided today that he would permit defendants in the White House plumbers case to attempt to subpoena national security documents that they contended were relevant to their case.

title: DON'T FIGHT
description: the elements for your copy of The New York Times. Order home delivery. To arrange it, call (212) MU 74700.

title: Discounters Find Profit In Catalogue Showrooms
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Only a few years ago discounters were anxiously eyeing the catalogue showrooms as brash new competitors. Now the discounters are joining the cataloguers.

title: The Dance: Canticle of the Elements Ailey Company Gives Janet Collins Work
Inflation: The Mood Turns Foul
description: Sometimes the most important things about the condition of an economy are not facts but moods. And at the moment the mood of a great many businessmen, investors, economists and consumers is foul. Inflation is undermining the willingness of people to save and invest, and is deepening their distrust of governments and the paper money those governments print.

title: PROSECUTOR FREES 61 ON DRUG COUNTS
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 21Narcotics charges against 61 of 63 persons, including a pathologist and a radiologist, who were arrested May 5 are being quashed, Atlantic County Prosecutor Richard J. Williams announced today.

title: Independent Mozambique Expected by Lisbon Aide
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, May 21  The minister in charge of Portugal's overseas territories said here today that he expected Mozambique to become independent within a year.

title: Soviet Dominates Mat
description: AUGUSTA, Me., May 21 (AP)  A teenaged team of Soviet wrestlers won four of five matches from Maine's allstar schoolboy squad tonight in the first stop on an eightcity tour of the United States.

title: A TEST VOTE BARS BUSING IN BOSTON
description: BOSTON, May 21In a nonbinding referendum that brought out what was said to have been the smallest vote in Boston's history, voters here overwhelmingly declared their opposition today to the busing of schoolchildren for racial integration.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
Detective in Bronx Apparent Suicide; Is Linked to Leuci
description: A 47yearold detective who was a former member of the police Narcotics Division apparently shot himself to death yesterday in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, the police reported. His.38caliber service revolver was found nearby.

title: Radio
Garbage Power
description: The recently announced plans in Connecticut, the town of Hempstead, L. I., and Westchester County to convert garbage and other trash into electric power and useful byproducts signal rapid advances toward a happy ending to a municipal nightmare.

title: Indy Race Threatened by Injunction, Damage Suit Filed Over Qualifying
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 21The Indianapolis 500 auto race without a hassle would be like Indianapolis without rain, and the newest confirmation of that maxim came today with the filing of an injunction and a $1million damage suit that could force a postponement of the 58th running of the race next Sunday.

title: House Rejects Fuel Price Cut and Rationing Plan
description: WASHINGTON, May 21The House rejected today a new bill, opposed by the Administration, to roll back oil and gasoline prices and to give the President standby authority to impose gasoline rationing. The vote was 191 for the bill and 207 against.

title: Nan Smith Is Wed To Joseph Runde
description: Miss Nan Marie Smith and Joseph Runde, who bnraduated Sunday from the Universitv of Notre Dame, in South Bend, Ind., were married there yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Robert Griffin performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in the Sacred Heart Roman Catholic Church on the Notre Dame campus. He was assisted by the Rev. Raymond Runde, cousin of the bridegroom.

title: Paper Says Miss Hearst Thinks Father Failed Her
description: LOS ANGELES, May 21 (AP) Patricia Hearst said she had nothing to do with her own kidnapping but later joined her abductors because of digsatisfaction with her father's $2,million food program to free her, The Los Angeles Times said today. Miss Hearst said she felt that her father, Randolph A. Hearst, had not done everything in his power to get her back, The Times said.

title: Stocks Continue to Fall In Spite of Bullish News
Widening Gap in Views Is Registered Between College and Noncollege Women
description: The generation gap appears to be fading for college students, but the academic gap  measurable in differences in the attitudes, values and aspirations of collegeeducated and noncollege youths of 16 to 25is widening. And nowhere is the chasm deeper than it is among young women.

title: Warren Fears Watergate Overreaction
description: ATLANTA, May 21Former Chief Justice Earl Warren said today that the Watergate scandals had caused so much doubt and cynicism that some Americans were beginning to propose dangerous changes in the country's basic governmental structure.

title: Pushouts Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 The Department of Health, Education and Welfare is studying data collected from the 20 largest cities, including New York and Newark, in an investigation of the disproportionate number of children from minority groups expelled or suspended from public schools.

description: The results of last week's special school board election in District 1, on the Lower East Side, were officially certified yesterday as officials began trying to clear the way for the new board to take over.

description: WASHINGTON, May 21The Senate Judiciary Committee passed today a resolution of support for Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor, in responseled to the dismissal of Mr. Cox. Both Sought Tapes his complaint yesterday that president Nixon was attempting to undercut his authority.

title: Mets'
Bonavena Is Victor
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 21 (UP1)The Argentine heavyweight, Oscar Bonavena, using a relentless left hand, dropped his opponent once in the seventh round and went on to a unanimous decision over Larry Middleton of Baltimore in a 12round bout tonight.

description: Norton Simon, the industrialist, charged yesterday in Los Angeles that the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation had withheld information about $117million in antitrust lawsuits against the company.

title: West Virginia Dam Is Termed a Threat To CoalMine Town
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 The West Virginia coal mining town of Wharton is in imminent danger of the same kind of massive inundation by watery mine wastes that swept away an entire nearby community in 1972, an Interior Department hearing officer ruled here yesterday.

title: James Joyce Is Dead at 53; Music Arranger for Films
description: LOS ANGELES, May 21 (AP) James Joyce, a singerarranger for films and television programs and choral arrangerdirector for the King Sisters and the King family for many years, died Friday. He was 53 years old.

title: Orders for Durable Goods Climbed by 3.6% in April
description: WASHINGTON, May 21New orders received by manufacturers of durable goods.rose sharply in April following a dip in March, the Commerce Department reported today.

description: BONN, May 21East Germany hinted today that it might reconsider a measure that has been a major obstacle to good relations with West Germany.

title: 6 BRANCHES CLOSED BY THOMSON FIRM

Fergusoni, chairman and chief executive, stressed that the closings did not reflect the kind of acute belttightening that has characterized some other firms.

title: Staten Island Boy Seized in a Series Of Violent Crimes
description: A 17year old Staten Island youth was arrested yesterday and charged with homicide, rape, arson, burglary and robbery in connection with a series of crimes that took place over the last four weeks, the police reported.

description: Despite the millions of dollars spent for syndicated media research and the billions of dollars spent for print advertising based on its results, the companies who do it, up until now, have never had their studies independently audited.

title: LowIncome Minority Pupils Called Interested in College
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP) Interest in attending college is high among minority high school students from lowincome homes, according to re search by the National Scholar ship Service and Fund for Negro Students.

Lansky, the school superintendent of Manhattan's District 2, appeared last night before the Board of Education to ask Chancellor Irving Anker to remove the community school board, which had voted 6 to 3 to open the superintendency to all qualified applicants. Mrs. Lansky's initial twoyear contract expires June 30.

McGuire, head of the Newark Joint Organized Crime Strike Force since November, 1971, was shifted yesterday to become chief of the Organized Crime Strike Force in the Eastern District of New York. He replaces Denis E. Dillon, who resigned last week to seek the Democratic nomination for Nassau

description: Kaufman & Broad, Inc., a multinational home builder that has been criticized for its accounting and reporting methods, has included in its annual report this year the detailed 10 K report, which itlike other publicly held companiesmust file with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Hans Christian Andersen Stories and Other Fun for Youngsters
description: All through the chilly months, as Hans Christian Andersen sits in Central Park, he is utterly silent. But starting Saturday at 11 A.M. Diane Wolkstein will be standing alongside him again to give him voice.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SALT LAKE CITY, May 21 (AP)The Utah Stars owner, Bill Daniels, said today that a.deal to sell his American Basketball Association team locally had fallen through, raising the possibility of an outofstate sale. The inability to sell $3.5million in publicly offered stock by Aug. 31 was cited by another spokesman as a major hangup in the deal.

title: Colombian Peasants See Little Hope New President Will Cure Their Ills
description: SAN PEDRO, ColombiaMost campesinos don't believe in elections and promises of agrarian reform any morewe've learned we have to fight for our rights, says a spokesman for the 200 peasant, or campesino, families in this rich, rolling hill land.

title: People in Sports
description: Norm Cash, one of the senior members of the Detroit Tigers and the American League, lost his glove, his cool and an argument Monday night against the Brewers at Milwaukee and yesterday he was suspended for two days and fined $100 for his actions. The Tiger first baseman became incensed over a fair call on Dave May's double down the rightfield line. Cash threw his glove in disgust and Bill Kinkel, the first base umpire, who made the call, threw him out of the game. The Tigers lost, 64. Said Cash: I don't usually lose my cool.

title: Income Tax for Jersey
description: Governor Brendan T. Byrne's plea for a state income tax inches New Jersey politicians a step nearer to a decision they have been evading for years but cannot much longer avoid.

title: Bids Made on C.C.C. Holding in Intra
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 21The Lebanese Government and at least two other bidders have made offers to buy out the United States Government holding in the Intra Investment Company, which owns part of Middle East Airlines, a shipyard in France, and a gambling casino in Lebanon.

title: Consumer Price Index in Region Rose 0.1% in April
description: Consumers in the New York metropolitan region beleaguered by the soaring cost of living got a modicum of relief in April. A sharp drop in meat and women's apparel prices worked to counter steeply rising dairy, medical care, gasoline and usedcar prices, and resulted in an increase of onetenth of one per cent in the Consumer Price Index for the month.

title: F.P.C. IS CAUTIOUS ON POWER SUPPLY
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 The Federal Power Commissior reported today that electric utilities will have more generating capacity this summet butbecause of shortages of coal, oil and natural gasmay e unable to deliver all the power consumers want.

description: Don't imagine for a minute that this is the length she recommends all of the time. For daytime, she said, hemlines have to be short. The intermission length is for dinner and dancing. It usually appears in black dresses and it can be emphasized by a rim of black fox.

title: Samuels Asks More CrimeVictim Aid
description: Howard J. Samuels urged yesterday a substantial expansion of the state's program for compensating victims of crime and said it should :'be financed from the Sale of goods made by criminals in prison.

description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting and the Ford Foundation announced yesterday grants totaling $10.5million to help start a national cooperative plan for public television programing. Under the plan, public TV stations are asked to pay a percentage of the cost of some national programing they would have gotten free in past years.

title: BacktoWork in elias Fizzles
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 21An effort by labor union leaders to launch a backtowork campaign against the shutdown in Northern Ireland by the Protestant resistance movement collapsed today.

title: Trot Defense Weighs Need To Call Insko
description: Defense lawyers in the racefixing trial of New York harness drivers appeared ready yesterday to rest their case within a day or two. The major uncertainty is whether Del Insko, one of 13 drivers indicted last Dec. 20 on bribery charges, will testify in his defense.

description: ST. LOUIS, May 21  The Rev, Dr. Ralph A. Bohlmann, a conservative theologian educated at Yale, has been appointed acting president of Concordia Seminary of St. Louis, the theological school of the Lutheran ChurchMissouri Synod.

description: A 16yearold boy was charged with the rape of two women in Coop City In the Bronx. The police identified him as Tommy Merriwether, of 10026 Einstein Loop, Coop City.

description: WEMBLEY, England, May 21 (AP)John Conteh of Britain, the European lightheavyweight champion, stopped a countryman, Chris Finnegan, tonight after 2 minutes 25 seconds of the sixth round in a title bout scheduled for 15 rounds.

description: The Manhattan chapter of he New Democratic Coalition last night endorsed Robert M. Morgenthau for District Attorney.

description: MAYS LANDING, May 21 (UPI)  An Atlantic City man has been sentenced to 29 to 30 years for bludgeoning Wilmington, Del., man to death and setting him on fire.

title: PANEL HINTS NIXON KNEW OF COVERUP BEFORE DAY CITED

description: The world is moving rapidly into a situation of oil surplus rather than scarcity, according to John H. Lichtblau, executive director of the Petroleum Industry Research Foundation. Details on Page 62.

title: MAGRUDER GIVEN A 10MONTH TERM
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 Jeb Stuart Magruder, the deputy director of President Nixon's reelection campaign; who has been cooperating with Federal prosecutors for more than a year, was sentenced today to. serve a minimum of 10 months in prison for his role in the Watergate breakin and coverup.

title: City, Charging Deceit, Asks End Of Driver School's Accreditation

title: Laver Erasing Mechanical Man Image With Frankness, CrowdPleasing Play
description: When Rodney George Laver resumes competitive tennis in August, he will be 36 years old. He has completed the first half of his selfimposed curtailed scheduled in top form, adding both the singles and doubles titles in the Alan King Classic at Las Vegas last weekend to his recent surge. Any tendency to consider him a hasbeen has been buried under an avalanche of praise from opponents and observers.

title: Flyer Fans Get Reward: 5 Days to Love the Cap
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 21 (AP)  Philadelphia Flyers fans will have a fiveday opportunity to see the object of their affection  the 84yearold Stanley Cup.

description: The spectacular rise since 1972 in the price of paintings by American abstract expressionist painters, including Mark Rothko, could not have been predicted, Donald McKinney, president of the Marlborough Gallery testified yesterday in Surrogate Court.

description: Butcher & Singer, a brokerage firm based in Philadelphia, yesterday offered to put all of its 148 securities salesmen on salary.

title: 1972 Candidate for Senate Is Charged With a Violation
description: CONCORD, N.H., May 21 (AP) Peter J. Booras, who organizoci a writein campaign for fortner Vice President Spiro T. Agnew in 1972, will be prosecuted for failing to report large contribution to his own 1972 campaign for the United Sta,tes Senate, Attorney General Warren B. Rudman said today.

title: Auto Maker Cites Costs, Denies It's Violating Federal Accord
description: DETROIT, May 21 (AP)The American Motors Corporation said today was raising prices on its vehicles an average of $67, or 1.7 per cent, effective tomorrow.

title: David Eisenhower and Wife Rent Apartment in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP) Mr. and Mrs. David Eisenhower, finding commuting to the suburbs too difficult, have rented a twobedroom duplex apartment not far from the White House, Their previous landlord, President Nixon's friend, C. G. Rebozo, has sold the house they rented in Bethesda, Md.

title: ARCHDIOCESE SPURNS ITS PAPER'S POLICIES

description: Justice Joseph A. Sarafite of the State Supreme Court yesterday upheld the City Commission on Human Rights in awarding $13,816.65 damages to a teacher, Mary Anilyan, who had charged she was dis missed from Seward Park High School in retaliation for a complaint to the commission.

title: Bridge: North American Team Finds Italy as Tough Foe as Ever
description: VENICE, Italy, May 21The North American representatives found their old rivals from Italy as tough as ever when they clashed here tonight in the second round of the world team championship.and was duly reached in spite of vigorous bidding by EastWest, West eventually sacrificed in five clubs, a contract that would have failed by just one trick, but Garozzo, always a daring bidder, persevered to five spades.

title: LEON W. ELLWOOD
description: Leon W. Ellwood, who retired in 1960 as chief real estate appraiser for the New York Life Insurance Company, died yesterday at a nursing home in Allendale, N. J. He was 78 years old and lived at 20 Ridge Road, Ridgewod, N.J.

The daily lottery prize structure has been revised to provide a new top prize of $10,000 and chance for nonwinners to enter a new $100,000 grand drawing.
