description: Monday is Memorial Day. Following is a list of services that are affected:

title: Council, 411, Voids 4% Rent Increase
description: The City Council voted overwhelmingly yesterday to repeal rent increases of up to 4 per cent a year in many of the one million rentcontrolled apartments here.

title: The Pop Life
description: You don't always have to be a musician to be a superstar in the pop life. Take Chip Monck and Jimmy leaner, for example.

title: Kuh Aided Two Who Lost Suit Over a False Arrest
description: Richard H. Kuh, the Manhattan District Attorney, disclosed yesterday that he had intervened to help have set aside a $10,000 judgment against two Upper West Side merchants, one of whom mistakenly identified a former Columbia College student as an armed robber three

title: Miss Corillo Wins Title
description: WOODBURY, L. I., May 23 Mary Carillo of Douglaston, Queens, retained the Eastern women's hardcourt tennis championship today, beating Ruta Gerulaitis of Howard Beach, Queens, 63, 36, 63, in the final. The match was moved from the Woodbury Country Club indoors to the Woodbury Racquet Club because of rain.

title: RAW MATERIALS SLIGHTLY HIGHER
description: Prices of post basic raw materials closed slightly higher yesterday, on the leading commoditY exchange after earlier lower quotations attracted buying late in the day.

title: The Making of a Hero In a Hijacking Drama
description: Athletic, adventurous, something of a daredevilthose were the qualities ascribed to William S. Hale yesterday after the 21  year  old helicopter ground attendant subdued an armed hijacker in a Hitchcockian struggle atop the fogenshrouded Pan Am Building Midtown Manhattan.

title: Israeli Coalition Partners Formalize Plan for Cabinet
description: TEL AVIV, May 23 (AP) Premierdesignate Yitzhak Rabin won approval today for dovish and precarious new government to replace that of Premier Golda Meir.

title: RISE IN DEBT CEILING IS VOTED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) The House voted today to raise the national debt ceiling $19.3billion to a total of $495billionbut only after Speaker Carl Albert cast a tiebreaking vote.

title: Wood, Field &
description: If you are fortunate enough to have a pond, whether large or small, on your property, now is a good time to consider planting it with various natural foods for wild fowl.

title: Franklin National Suffers 325Million Deposit Drop
description: The New York Clearing House Association disclosed yesterday that deposits of the Franklin National Bank had declined $325million, or 11 per cent, in the two weeks since the bank disclosed large losses in foreignexchange trading.

title: Bibliographer Calls Transcripts a 5Typist Job
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 ,William B. Todd, a bibliographer by profession, took a Ousman's holiday one recent Sunday and sat down with a pencil and paper and a copy of the White House version of the Oval Office tapes. Among his conclusions was that at least five different typists worked on the transcriptions.

title: People and Business City Pension Stock Will Vote Against G. M.
description: The 390,000 shares of General Motors Corporation stock owned by New York City's pension funds will be voted in favor of two independent stockholder proposals that are opposed by the management, according to Controller Harrison J. Goldin. The G.M. annual meeting will be held today in Detroit, with the pension,fund votes cast by proxy.

title: 2 Yiddish Groups Follow Traditional Path Uptown
description: Another bit of Yiddish culture and thought will depart from the Lower East Side today when the Workmen's Circle, a politically and culturally inclined fraternal group, and The Jewish Daily Forward begin a joint move into the old Harper and Row Building at 45 East 33d Street.

title: DR, JOHN GERSTER, CANCER SURGEON
description: Dr. John C. A. Gerster, a surgeon who pioneered in drawing the public into the fight on cancer, died of the disease Wednesday at his home, 34 East 75th Street. He was 92 years old.

title: Dr. John Raper of Harvard Dies; Expert on Fungi Reproduction
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 23 John R. Raper, chairman of the Harvard University biology department and a world authority on the reproduction of fungi, died Tuesday night at Peter Bent Brigham Hospital. He was 62 years old.

title: HalfFare Plan Extended To'75
description: As a result of a remarkable increase in ridership, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority has extended its Sunday halffare plan to Jan. 1 and has added five major holidays.

title: Head Urges A Reduction in Ads For Children's TV
description: WASHINGTON, May 22Richard E. Wiley, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, said today there was too much advertising on children's television and that Government action might be necessary to reduce it.

title: Nixon Expected to Deliver Radio Speech on Economy
description: WASHINGTON, May 23President Nixon will probably make a radio address to the nation over the weekend on economic policy.

title: U.S. LOAN TO SOVIET
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI)  Representative William R. Cotter, Democrat of Connecticut, said today a lowinterest, $180million loan to the Sovietl Union was an insult to millions of Americans who are payin much higher rates of interest on their loans.

title: A Series of Rapes Chills 3d Ward in Englewood
description: ENGLEWOOD, May 22The azaleas and geraniums were brilliant in the earlymorning sunshine, and the only pers'on visible on the block was woman hosing out her birdbath when the black unmarked police car turned the corner this morning and brought a hint of unaccustomed menace into Otsego Place.

title: Telephone Company Told to Revise Plan On Service Refunds
description: ALBANY, May 23The Public Service Commission voted today to require the New York Telephone Company to start revised Basic Service Index plan, whereby $1.50 refunds are made to subscribers in a service district in any month when the service falls below a predetermined level. Dissenting were the commission chairman, Joseph C. Swidler, and Commissioner Edward P. Larkin.

title: State Prosecutor Kidnapped In Italy Is Reported Freed
description: GENOA, Italy, May 23 (AP)A state prosecutor kidnapped by leftist terrorists five weeks ago was released tonight, his wife reported.

title: ' That's Entertaiment!' Certainly Is
description: When Graham Greene was a movie critic in the nineteen-thirties, he detested close-ups of the open mouths of singers; his reviews complained steadily of teeth and tonsils. He would be miserable at "That's Entertainment!," a tour of M-G-M musicals from 1929 to 1958but those who don't share his phobia will hugely enjoy this movie. Written, produced and directed by Jack Haley Jr., it opened yesterday at the Ziegfeld.The pleasures are abundant: Gene Kelly squelching sublimely through puddles in "Singin' in the Rain"; Judy Garland singing "Get Happy" over a series of clips of her faces at all agesthe result is a joyful obituary; Donald O'Connor dancing on his knees; Fred Astaire and Eleanor Powell in a breath-stopping duet from "Broadway Melody of 1940." Glimpses of Mr. Kelly, springing about on the scaffolding of a half-constructed building, and Mr. Astaire, dancing with a hat rack, distill the contrasting styles of both great hoofers.Mr. Kelly's acrobatic talents make you aware of the exertion as much as the dexterity: what he does is triumphantly difficult, and we know that almost no one else could leap so smartly from one spot to another. But, as many have noted, Mr. Astaire makes every step look easy: as he soars and swoops and glides, infinite spectators feel that they could do exactly the same.Some of the musicals of the early thirties were creaky because dramatic actors were suddenly pushed into a medium that didn't suit them. In "Idiot's Delight," Clark Gable dances and sings abominably, and Joan Crawfordone rigid finger laid against her cheek  prances like a lumberjack. The movie's funniest moment may be the apotheosis of Esther Williams in the early fifties: climactic scenes of that brawny Venus sinking into or rising from the water appear to mock the imagery of the Aquarian age. Incidentally, the big ballet from "American in Paris" seems soupier than ever.Ars Gratia Artis indeed . . . Today, there's a pang in watching that lion roar above M-G-M's motto, to see the ravaged sets of the studio whose existence was imperiled for a while (although movie production has resumed). Elizabeth Taylor, James Stewart, Mickey Rooney and the other stars who narrate this picture are sentimental about the pastbut why shouldn't they be? Meanwhile, most of the numbersfrom Jimmy Durante coaching the young Frank Sinatra in "It Happened in Brooklyn" to Leslie Caron drifting in and out of Mr. Kelly's grasp  run long enough so that you can re-experience the original. Hence this isn't nostalgia, it's history.

Economists See a Surge in Profits Steel Men Hear Eckstein and McCracken
description: Economists Paul W. McCracken and Otto Eckstein said yesterday that American business had entered an extended period of extraordinary profits.

description: Four Bronx teenagers were charged yesterday with throwing a molotov cocktail against the side of the firehouse of Engine Company 82, the police said.

description: John Schilling leaped 6 feet 9 inches to break the Catholic ,high schools AA high jump record yesterday and lead Archbishop Molloy to the team title in the Athletic Associatiorr of Private Schools track championships at Downing Stadium on Randalls Island. Molloy scored 86 points.

title: About New York A Horse'sEye View of the City
description: The H horse is definitely it, the horse player was saying in the Offtrack Betting parlor. He was speaking with the conviction of a born loser, and he was saying that the H horse, whose name was Eventuality, had a lock on the first race at Belmont yesterday.

title: DR. WILLARD WICKIZER
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 23 (AP)  Dr. Willard Wickizer, former vice president of the National Council of Churches in the U.S.A., died Tuesday in Community Hospital. His age was 73. Dr. Wickizer also was retired national executive of the Christian Church (Disciples of Christ). He retired in 1966 after 30 years as executive of the Disciples division of church life and work.

title: Killian Defeated by Rep. Grasso In Hartford Governor Primary
description: HARTFORD, May 23After a hardfought campaign, Attorney General Robert K. Killian failed today in his home town to win the endorsement of Democratic voters for his candidacy for Governor.

title: People vs. Production
description: STOCKHOLM  Fer many years, about 70 per cent of the young people taking industrial jobs in Sweden had seven years or less of education: By the early seventies, when the Volvo Company began planning its new automobile assembly plant at Kalmar on Sweden's southeast coast, 70 per cent of young people seeking industrial jobs had ten to twelve years of education, and another 20 per cent had more than that.

title: Constructive Party Pleases Louise Nevelson
description: For a woman who has battled shyness most of her life, Louise Nevelson had a ball. Midway through the party on Spring Street, Wednesday night, she surreptiously kicked off her shoes and swept through the maze of rooms, that make up her home and studio, looking like what one fascinated spectator called a Russian empress mingling with the peasants.

title: Shooting That Led to an Implant Produces Manslaughter Verdict
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 23Andrew D. Lyons was found guilty yesterday of voluntary manslaughter after a jury of eight men and four women had deliberated for 14 hours. The case generated considerable in terest because the heart of Samuel M. Allen Jr. the man shot by Mr. Lyons last Sept. 10 had been removed for use in a transplant operation while it was still beating with the assistance of artificial systems.

title: Bridge North Arryericans Defeat ?? Then Indonesia
description: VENICE, May 23The North American team had a good day in the world team championship here, defeating France, 200, and then beating Indonesia, 182. The Italian Blue team, defending its world title, was held to a 1010 draw by Brazil in the afternoon session, but then played brilliantly to defeat France 20 to minus 2.

title: Blood Tests Planned for State Tracks
description: A departure from the established practice of saliva testing at New York Racing Association tracks will be introduced shortly, it was announced yesterday by Bertram D. Sarafan, chairman of the New York State Racing and Wagering Board. The new system will be a postrace blood test, which will be in addition to the postrace urinalysis.

title: With Murders Off by 9.1 %, City Police See Downtrend
description: Homicides have decreased significantly in the city so far this year and police experts are saying gingerly that the homicide rate, which has been rising with some fluctuations since the nineteenthirties, may have peaked and a downward trend may have begun.

title: CARBON CLEARED IN LAKE POLLUTION
description: Canadian scientists, carrying out the most ambitious controlled lakepollution experiments to date, report that they have virtually ruled out carbon as a key to eutrophication or depletion of oxygen, of lakes by manmade products.

title: Thomson and Branca Team Up for Lawsuit
description: Bobby Thomson and Ralph Branca teamed up yesterday and launched a $1.85million lawsuit against three companies for violating their civil rights in showing a film clip of The Shot Heard Round the World. It has been on New York television often in the last few months. The shot was Thomson's home

title: Northwest Airlines Sets Record Revenues in April
description: Northwest Airlines reported yesterday record revenues for the month of April and net earnings for the month of $7.3million, or 34 cents a share, up from $2.1million, or 10 cents a share, in the corresponding month last year.

title: Family Groceries Down $20 a Year
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) A 1.1 per cent decline in retail prices of farmproduced food from March to April meant a $20 drop in a year's supply of groceries for a typical household, according to figures released today by the Agriculture Department.

title: 3 of State's Parks To Open for Season
description: Park facilities at'Bear Mountain State Park, Sebago Beach, and Rockland Lake North will open daily starting tomorrow and will remain open daily through Labor Day, the Palisades Interstate Park Commission announced. The rollerskating rink at Lake Sebago will not be operated this year.

title: Supreme Court Justice Censured For Denying Man a Fair Trial
description: In an unusual decision, the Appellate DivisiOn for the First Department has reprimanded State Supreme Court Justice George Starke for what it called his failure to accord a fair and impartial trial to a defendant The man was found guilty last year by a Bronx jury of seconddegree burglary and seconddegree robbery.

title: Rep. Donohue Bars Race
description: WORCESTER, Mass, May 23 (AP)Representative Harold D. Donohue, Democrat of Massachusetts, secondranking member of. the House Judiciary Committee, will not seek reelection this fall. Mr. Donohue, 72 years old, said in an interview published here that he would return to private law practice in Worcester. He was first elected to Congress in 1946.

title: Jersey Lottery Seeking To Broadcast Winners

title: Saxbe Reaffirms His Support Of Jaworski's Independent Role
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Attorney General William B. Saxbe promised today to use appropriate aleans to support the independence of Leon Jaworski, the special Watergate prosecutor.

title: Books of The Times Behind the Assassination
description: I gave up bothering with Richard Condon's books about five novels ago when in Any God Will Do he led me all the way through his snobbish hero's search for royal forebears, only to reveal at the end that said hero was actually the offspring of dwarfs. It seemed to me that Mr. Condon was making his point through overkill, just as he had done in his previous novel, An Infinity of Mirrors, a onedimensional attempt to exploit our revulsion with Nazism. The verve and cleverness that produced The Manchurian Candidate seemed drained. And what little I was able to read of the four novels that followed Any God Will Do failed to dispel this impression. Either Mr. Condon had burned himself out, or the atmosphere of the times had passed him by. But when I dutifully began to read his 11th and latest novel, Winter Kills (the title comes from The Keeners Manual": Spring seduces, Summer thrills, Autumn sates, Winter kills.), and I discovered that it concerns a young oil entrepreneur numed Nick Thirkield whose father, Tom Kegan, is one of the wealthiest men in America and whose older halfbrother, President Tim Kegan, was shot to death from the sixth floor of the TV Center warehouse while riding in a motorcade through Hunt Plaza in Philadelphia on Feb. 22, 1960, I did a slow doubletake.

title: One Sounds Very Mexican, the Other Doesn't Sound French
Graceless and Graceful
description: No cannons went off in New York recently to celebrate National Historic Preservation Week; all that could heard was the familiar sound of rubble sliding down chutes to the dump truck.

title: Gems Reported Missing Were Only Misplaced
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 23 (AP)A Clarks Green, Pa., man and his wife who had reported $16,000 worth of jewelry missing from their hotel room here found the gems in their closet Wednesday, an official of the ChalfonteHaddon Hall Hotels said.

title: Jersey High Court Backs Legislative District Lines
description: TRENTON, May 23  The New Jersey Supreme Court today upheld the state's legislative reapportionment plan, contending that partisan considerations were valid in carving the new districts.

title: Dibbs Gains in Tennis; Solomon, Gottfried Lose
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, May 23 (AP)Eddie Dibhs of the United States, who is seeded sixth i whipped Juergen Pohmann of West Germany, 46, 60, 61, today and advanced into the quarterfinals of the German International tennis tournament.

title: MOBIL RIDICULES LILCO'S LAWSUIT
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation said yesterday that the Long Island Lighting Company's $248million lawsuit against several oil companies was straight out of Alice in Wonderland.

title: Thai Premier Who Quit Accepts Bid to Return
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Friday, May 24 (AP)Premier Sanya Dharmasakti, who had submitted his Cabinet's resignation earlier this week, said today that he would return to head Thailand's Governemnt because of confidence given to me by all sectors of the country.

title: Newspapers and Printers Reach a Tentative Accord;
POLICECALL TAPE PLAYED AT TRIAL Suspects Sought Night Boy Was Slain Are Described
description: A police hunt was under way in Queens for two black males in their early 20's when Police Officer Thomas J. Shea killed a 10yearold black boy he later said he thought was one of the suspects.

title: Music: Baroque Week
description: The Baroque music Marathon that is being run this week at Carnegie Recital Hall reached the halfway mark on Wednesday night. The University of Georgia's Baroque String Ensemble, directed by the Austrian violinist Eduard Melkus, performed the third of its six scheduled programs, this one concerned with Music in England and France. France was represented by Couperin's Apotheose de Lulli, two of Leclair's violin sonatas as well as Lully's brief suite, Une Noce de Village. England put up four of Purcell's Fantasies for Strings and the first of Handers Op. 1 violin sonatas.

title: Kalmbach Asked Envoy For $72,000 for G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Herbert W. Kalmbach, while President Nixon's personal attorney, solicited $72,000 in Republican campaign contribu taions from Vincent DeRoulet, at the time the Ambassador to Jamaica, according to Mr. Kalmbach's testimony in a civil deposition made public today.

title: Supreme Court Justice Censured For Denying Man a Fair Trial

The man was found guilty last year by a Bronx jury of seconddegree burglary and seconddegree robbery.

title: Lauda Hits Barrier at Monte Carlo
description: MONTE CARLO, May 23 (UPI)Niki Lauda of Austria set the fastest time today in the opening practice session for Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix auto race before crashing in his Ferrari on the swimming pool curve. He was not injured.

title: Coroner Reconstructs Terrorists Deaths
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23A description of how six members Of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army died last Friday in their bulletriddled and burning hideout was pieced together today by the Los Angeles County Coroner, Dr. Thomas Noguchi, whose team of experts is conducting a psychological autopsy to learn what strange compulsions motivated the kidnappers of Patricia Hearst.

title: Coroner Reconstructs Terrorists'
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23A description of how six members of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army died last Friday in their bulletriddled and burning hideout was pieced together today by the Los Angeles County Coroner, Dr. Thomas Noguchi, whose team of experts is conducting a psychological autopsy to learn what strange compulsions motivated the kidnappers of Patricia Hearst.

title: SAMUELS OPPOSED BY TEACHER UNION
description: The board of directors of the 207,000member New York State United Teachers has notified the state Democratic party that it opposes the candidacy of Howard J. Samuels for Governor.

title: J. Peter Grace to Direct Drive to Add Jobs Here
description: Mayor Beame yesterday appointed J. Peter Grace, the scion of one of America's bestknown business families and grandson of a 19thcentury New York Mayor, to be chairman of his Council of Economic and Business Advisers.

title: Benefit to Portugal Is Seen in a Loss of Her African Territories
description: LISBON, May 17No economic catastrophe would befall Portugal if she were to lose her African empire, and she would even find substantial advantages in such a loss, according to economic and political analysts here.

title: Citadel of Japanese Business Under Assault on Many Fronts
description: TOKYO, May 23The Citadel Of Japanese business is uncle': assaultand a changing qf the guard this week is not likely to lift the siege.

title: Defense Attacks Fix Case
description: Iron comes from the ground, and steel comes from iron, Jacob Lefkowitz reminded a jury in Brooklyn Federal Court yesterday, but don't let a fast talker tell you, Therefore, ladies and gentlemen, steel comes from the ground.'

title: The Dance
description: Janet Collins gained her widest celebrity as a dancer when she appeared in the 1950 Cole Porter musical, Out of This World, and when she became the first black ballerina regularly engaged by the Metropolitan Opera, from 1951 to 1954.

title: HENRY J. GUCKER JR.
description: Henry J. Gucker Jr., a real estate management agent with St. Thomas Management Corporation and a member, of the Real Estate Board, died yesterday in St, Barnabas Hospital of injuries suffered in a traffic laccident last September. He was 48 years old and lived at 239 East 79th Street and in Centerport, L. I.

title: CAPITAL RALLY AIDS GROUPS IN AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, May 23A march, rally and conference are the highlights of the third annual African liberation celebration that got under way here today.

description: TEL AVIV, Friday, May 24Secretary of State Kissinger, after another day of negotiations in Syria and Israel, said early this morning that he had made good progress toward removing a principal obstacle to the conclusion of a SyrianIsraeli troop  disengagement agreement.

title: Ernie White, Pitcher, Dies; Helped Cardinals to 42 Title
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., May 23 (UPI) Ernest D. White, a former pitcher with the St. Louis Cardinals and the Boston Braves, died last night at the Oliver General Hospital after undergoing surgery to remove bone chips from his knee. He was 62 years old and lived In Spartanburg, S. C.

title: High Honors Come Early in Life For Advisor, to New York Firms
description: An honor which comes to fewand then usually after lifetime, of aehievementwas awarded Wednesday to a 32yearold New Yorker who has been breaking records ever since he began his life insurance career ten years ago.

title: Liddy Charges Nixon Prejudiced Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 The attorney for G. Gordon Liddy contended today that President Nixon severely prejudiced his client's constitutional right to a fair trial when he told the nation in televised speech on April 29 that Mr. Liddy's refusal to talk was one of the obstacles to the case.

description: Homicides have decreased significantly in New York City so far this year and police experts are saying gingerly that the homicide rate, which has been rising with some fluctuations since the nineteenthirties, may have peaked and a downward trend may have begun.

title: Black Power Reflected at Just a Party
Chicago Faithful Salute Absent Mayor
description: CHICAGO, May 23. For many  years, the Chicago and Cook County Democratic organization's annual dinner here was the apotheosis of the political soire, and amalgam of selfcongratulation and earbursting rhetoric with every [clich, in the political lexicon about party fealty.

title: U.S. TO RENOUNCE MINI ATOM ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The United States gave assurances today that it would not develop a new generation of miniaturized nuclear weapons that could be used interchangeably with conventional weapons on a battlefield.

title: FARM POLLUTION CUT IS WEIGHED BY E.P.A.
description: TWIN FALLS, Idaho, May 23 (AP)The Environmental Protection Agency, seeking to reduce pollution in farm irrigation systems, opened the nation's first hearing on discharge permits yesterday and was greeted with pleas for help in funding the project.

title: Correctional Officer Charged
description: DETROIT, May 23 (AP)Clinton Taylor, an officer at the Federal Correctional Insti tution at Milan, has been indicted on charges of accepting a bribe to drive prisoners to a rendezvous with women in a nearby motel, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said.

title: CITY TEACHER TEST
description: A suit charging the Board of Education here with discrimina. ing against blacks and Puertt Ricans in its hiring of teachers was filed yesterday in Federal Court by a group of plaintiffs seeking abolition of the present teachers examinations.

title: Last Thai Troops Leave Laos Under Peace Pacts
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 23 (AP)Thailand withdrew her last troops from Laos yesterday, ending more than 10 years of direct military involvement in this country, informed diplomatic sources said.

title: Business Briefs
description: American industry plans to spend $3.03billion to improve onthejob health and safety this year, up 18 per cent from 1973, according to a survey by the McGrawHill Publications Company.

title: Assault on a Citadel
description: The citadel of Japanese business, known as Keidanren, is under assaultand a changing of the guard this week is not likely to lift the siege. Details on Page 45.

title: Short Eyes Moves to the Beaumont
description: Have you ever been to prison? Or have you ever been a minority of one? Have you ever been lost in a world of irrational desire? Probably, not, but Miguel Phlero's Short Eyes, opening last night at the Vivian Beaumont Theater, Lincoln Center, can give you something of that experience. But it is fundamentally a play about men and the lives they lead.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX MOVE DOWN AGAIN
Segretti Loses Bid to Curb Bar's Use of His Testimony
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23 (Reuters)Donald H. Segretti, who has been convicted as the result of political dirty tricks in the 1972 Presidential campaign, lost today in his bid to prevent the California State Bar, from using his Senate Watergate committee testimony against him in disbarment proceedings.

title: City Jobless at 7%; US. Aid Is Offered
description: New York City's unemploy. merit rate hit 7 per cent in April, the State Labor Depart.ment reported yesterday, making the city immediately eligible for at least $11.7million in Federal publicemployment pro. gram funds.

title: Suspected Cheating On Annapolis Test Under Navy Inquiry
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 23Officials at the United States naval Academy are investigating possible cheating incidents involving an unknown number Of midshipmen, the academy's 4iperintendent, Vice Adm, William P. Mack, confirmed today.

title: ABRAHAM MARSHALL G.E. CHEMIST, IS DEAD

title: It's Helmut and Valery and a New BonnParis Relationship
description: BONN, May 23The two new leaders in Bonn and Paris call each other by their first names. This casual intimacy, and a number of other factors, have started officials in West Germany and France talking about the chances that new vitalfty can be injected into the FrenchWest German alliance, the heart of the ninenation Common Market. Chancellor Helmut Schmidt telephoned Presidentelect Valdry Giscard d'Estaing early Monday morning to congratulate him on winning the French election. Mr. Schmidt, who put a picture of Mr. Giscard d'Estaing over his desk when he took over from Willy Brandt last Thursday, spoke in English. The two are expected to get together in Paris during the first weekend in June for a first

title: Ocean County Population Limit Is Urged
description: TOMS RIVERA Federal plan to limit the population of central Ocean Countyto 70,000 people less than the area's projected 1990 populationhas left municipal officials in this area bewildered and somewhat angry.

title: Two Elizabeth Youths Get Life Sentences for Slaying
description: ELIZABETH, May 23 (AP)Two Elizabeth youths were sentenced to life imprisonment here yesterday after being convicted of beating a 66yearold man and leaving him to die on a city street.

title: BRAZIL IS HOPEFUL ON COFFEE TALKS
description: LONDON, May 23 (AP)Brazil confirmed today that she was hopeful that a new international coffee agreement would emerge from talks between coffee producers and consumers held here this week.

title: Ecudoran Oil Is Cut Back
description: Texaco, Inc and the Gulf Oil Corporation said yesterday that they had been ordered to cut back production of oil from their cdncessions in Ecuador, The two companies have been producing about 250,000 barrels a day from a joint venture. The Government has ordered the two companies to reduce output to about 210,000 barrels day for conservation reasons.

title: Ulster Protestants Set to Step Up Strike
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 23Leaders of extremist Protestant groups decided today to, intensify their protest strike in the campaign to bring down the provincial administration here.

title: Krypton Monitoring Cut Off By Strike at Test Facility
description: A fourmonth program to monitor the drift and spread of the radioactive gas krypton 85 from the National Reactor Test Station in Idaho has been cut short, in part because a strike at that installation has cut off the emissions, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration reported yesterday.

title: Indy 500 to Run Unchanged on Sunday As Suit to ReOpen Trials Is Dismissed
description: The course for the Indianapolis 500, scheduled to run Sunday, superimposed on a map, of midManhattan

title: What's Up, GoldWise
description: It is now common knowledge, and doubtless true, that the meteoric rise in the price of gold in the free market is just another manifestation of the rush away from paper to things. And this rush in turn reflects citizens lack of trust that their governments can or will control the value of paper money. Obviously real estate, art, silver and sugar futures and many other things have risen in price along with gold.

title: TRADE BILL IS DUE FOR EARLY ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The chairman of the Senate Finance Committee pledged today that his committee would begin closeddoor consideration of the manysided Administration trade bill as soon as possible and in any case within the next several weeks.

title: At Roosevelt...
description: A showdown with the Dancer brothers over the new rule that prohibits brothers from competing in the same race was averted by a simple stategya race was split in half. Stanley Dancer had said he would drive Smog tomorrow night in a pace against his brother, Vernon, who would handle Cory. Stanley threatened legal action if he was not permitted to start. Track officials, however, made two separate races of the one race, and asked Stanley to compete in one and Vernon in the other.

title: Felt Forum Bouts Set
description: Benny Rodriguez of Los Angeles, a highlyrated bantamweight, will meet Davey Vasquez of New York in a scheduled 10round bout on June 3 at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum. Omar Piton of Argentina will face Eddie Parks of Paterson, N. J., in a 10round welterweight bout.

title: $8Million in Cash Awatts Unaware Lottery Winners
description: TRENTON, May 23Charles C. Carella, the New Jersey lottery executive director, announced today that, in an effort to contact winning ticket holders before their tickets expired, the lottery would request special permission from the Federal Communication Commission to broadcast the numbers of unclaimed, major, prizewinning tickets.

title: Bank Robbed by Note
Police to Acquire 180 Cabs To Expand Crime Patrol
description: The Board of Estimate authorized the Police Department yesterday, to spend $800,000 to buy 180 standard yellow taxicabs to expand the taxi aspect of its anticrime patrol units, and $67,000 for nine expensive passenger cars to be used to infiltrate the high levels of organized crime and the narcotics trade,

title: Beame Suggests 1c Rise In Sales Tax May Stay
description: Mayor Beame suggested yesterday that the 1cent increase in the sales tax hereauthorized by Albany only for the fiscal year starting July 1might become permanent.

title: Block Island Sailing Race Starts Today
Rain, 24 Mark Put Damper On Seaver's CyYoung Prize
description: Tom Seaver, who hasn't had anything resembling losing season since coming to the New York Mets in l967 after only one year in the minors, received the Cy Young Award at Shea Stadium yesterday afternoon.

title: Credit Crunch
description: The First National Bank of Chicago and the Michigan National Bank of Detroit have raised their prime lending rate to an alltime record of 11 per cent. Other major banks are still charging their most creditworthy corporate customers 11 per cent, but the banking community fully expects to see the prime rate go to 12 per cent or higher. Even at the present level, if one includes compensating balances"the minimum percentage a line of credit that a bank's customers are expected to keep on balance at all timesthe effective prime rate is now between 13 and 14 per cent, an astronomical figure for huge corporate borrowers.

title: Weekly Retail Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.039billion up 13 per cent from the yearearlier $923million. Total retail store sales were about $10.341billion up 6 per cent from last year's $9.752billion.

title: U.S, PUSHES PLAN ON AIRLINE HELP
description: An Administration official said yesterday that a White House task force was pressing several projects to increase international airline revenues and forestall the need for subsidies sought by the nation's two largest overseas carriers.

title: Advertising: Cadillac's Answers
description: Come hell or high water or even another energy crisis, luxury car owners have no plans to change their life styles, a selfserving survey by Cadillac shows.

title: Moyers Looks at Future And Squelches Rumors
description: Bill Moyers is once again refusing to follow the standard television script. He announced he was discontinuing Bill Moyers Journal at a point when the weekly se ries, produced at WNET/13, had gained superstar prom inence on the publicTV schedule.

title: MOSCOW REOPENS CHINA RIVER ISSUE
description: MOSCOW, May 23The Soviet Union told China today that She must recognize Soviet sovereignty over an island at the confluence of two border rivers in the Far East if Chinese ships are to use Soviet inland waterways.

title: MARSHAL CINQUE IS BURIED IN OHIO
description: CLEVELAND, May 23The chapel was filled beyond its capacity, and an even larger crowd waited on the street outside, but at his funeral here today Donald David DeFreeze remained a mysterious figure.

title: Israelis Kill 6, Capture 2; New Massacre Plot Seen
description: TEL AVIV, May 23  Six Palestibian guerrilla infiltrators were killed and two were captured today by Israeli troops. An Israeli spokesman said that the two captured guerrillas had said th:at the group planned to carryout a massacre similar to. the killing of students at Malot last week.

title: Franklin National Suffers 325Million Deposit Drop
description: The New York Clearing House Association disclosed yesterday that deposits of the Franklin National Bank had declined $325million, or 11 per cent, in the two weeks since the bank disclosed large losses in foreignexchange trading.

title: FIRST MORTGAGE TO SKIP DIVIDEND
description: First Mortgage Investors,a real estate investment trust, disclosed yesterday that the high cost of borrowing money had eroded its profits to such an extent that it had voted against paying a dividend for the first fiscal quarter. A year earlier it had paid a dividend of 48 cents a share.

title: NEW UNIT FORMED BY TV WORKSHOP
description: The Children's Television Workshop, the nonprofit production company that produces Sesame Street and Electric Company for public television, has formed a commercial television subsidiary as a possible avenue toward making the workshop financially selfsupporting. From the time it was organized, more than six years ago, C.T.W. has depended on grants from foundations,'industry and government to produce the educational children's shows.

title: Seton Hall Ineligible for 440 Relay
description: Seton Hall lost the 440yard relay without leaving the starting blocks or dropping the baton yesterday, and the technical foulup could spoil the school's chances for a team title in the I. C. 4A. outdoor track and field championships.

title: Michigan Carton and Subsidiary Are Acquired by St. Regis Paper
description: The St. Regis Paper Company has acquired the Michigan Carton Company and its subsidiary, Litho Services, Inc., Battle Creek, Mich., for 540,000 common, shares. St. Regis closed on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday at 25, up  The value of the transaction is equal to $13.8million.

title: On Those CarRental Deals: Slow Down, Curves Ahead
description: While gasoline supplies may or may not be a problem for vacationing motorists this spring and summer, trying to figure the cost of renting a car definitely is, what with a maze of packages, deals, specials and freemileage offers.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Association of American Railroads reported today freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 17.2 billion tonmiles, 0.2 per cent below the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 541,451 cars, 2.1 per cent below last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 5.1 per cent below last year.

title: Learning How to Be a Mother Right at the Start
description: Fivemonthold, Austin Thomas sat, propped up by pillows, for 15 minutes yesterday. He still lists a little, but last week Austin's limit was only five minutes.

title: The Nuclear Nightmare
description: WASHINGTON, May 23India's underground nuclear explosion has surprised the world. U.S. intelligence and even British intelligence, which is better in that part of the world, did not anticipate it, and the Canadians, who helped India with its nuclear technology, feel they were deceived.

title: Felt Forum Bouts Set
description: Benny Rodriguez of Los Angeles, a highlyrated bantamweight, will meet Davey Vasquez of New York in a scheduled 10round bout on June 3 at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum. Omar Piton of Argentina will face Eddie Parks of Paterson, N. J., in a 10round welterweight bout.

title: SENATE UNIT'S BID FOR TAPES DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The United States Court of Appeals here turned down today efforts by the Senate Watergate committee to subpoena five tape recordings from President Nixon, ruling that the committee's need for, the tapes was marginal.

title: U.S. Five Victor Over Estonians
description: TALLINN, U.S.S.R., May 23 (UPI)The United States National basketball team beat the Estonian national team, 8975, today.

title: Screen: Poignant Glimpses of History
Mrs. Ralph A. Burkhart, 65, Democratic State Official
description: Mrs. Alice Diabrow Burkhart, who became vice chairman of the Democratic State Committee in 1942 when James A. Farley was elected chairman, died in her sleep early yesterday at her home, 40 Birch Street, Mount Vernon, N.Y. She was 65 years old.

title: SCHOOL STRIKERS CHALLENGE PERON
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 23President Juan Domingo PerOn today faced his first major strike since his return to the presidency seven months when 200,000 public school teachers staged a 24hour walkout.

title: Counci1,411,Voids 4% Rent Increase
Bar's Head Sees Risk by Nixon On Evidence in Plumbers Trial
description: WASHINGTON, May 23President Nixon would risk committing an impeachable offense if he refused to obey or appeal a court order to provide relevant evidence for a criminal trial, the president of ,the American Bar Association declared today.

title: Perry Dampens Orioles'Spirit
description: Moisture has long been associated with the pitching of Cleveland's Gaylord Perry. At least the opposing batters lave often felt that the Indian righthander had more than his fingers on the baseball.

title: A Free Mozambique?
description: The recent statement by Antonio de Almeida Santos, minister in charge of colonial policy in the new Portuguese Government, on the future of Mozambique is fresh evidence of the enlightened course Portugal has charted since the April coup. Mr. Santos told reporters the other day that there would be a referendum on the colOny's future within a year and predicted that a majority would vote for independence.

title: Chaikin of Open Theater Stages Remarkable Electra
description: Joseph Chaikin has disbanded the Open Theater, but his theatrical exploration continues, leading him back to the spoken word and into the classics. Over the last three months, he and the playwright Robert Montgomery (along with three actors) have been investigataing the Electra legend.

title: Michigan Carton and Subsidiary Are Acquired by St. Regis Paper
description: The St. Regis Paper Company has acquired the Michigan Carton.Company and its subsidiary, Litho Services, Inc., Battle Creek, Mich., for 540,000 common shares. St. Regis closed on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday at 21, up . The value of the transaction is equal to $13.8million.

title: NIXON STILL PLANS JUNE SOVIET TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 President Nixon told a visiting Soviet group today that his plans were moving ahead or nicking in Moscow with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Communist party chief, probably at the end of ,June.

title: Chicopee School Rolls Drop
description: CHICOPEE, Mass., May 23 (AP)  Public school enrollment here has dropped by more than 1,000 students since September because of the inactivation of Westover Air Force Base, according to Sophie J, Chmura, the school superintendent.

title: Eximbank May Refuse Some Loan Applications
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., May 23 (AP)Because of a big increase in requests for loans, the United States ExportImport Bank may have to reject up to 33 per cent of qualified loan applications next year, the bank's chairman, William 1 Casey, said today.

title: Ballet: A Touch of Class
description: Anthony Dowell, Rudolf NuWev and a female streaker tall in one evening may well have spoiled for life the Royal Ballet's audience at the Metropolitan Opera House on Wednesday night. First it had Rudolf Nureyev and Monica Mason in Mr. Nureyev's staging of Petipa's La Bayadere, then there were Anthony Dowell and Lesley Collier, making their local debuts, in Sir Frederick Ashton's La Fille Mal Gardee, and finally there was this naked girl traipsing across the stage for a fickle posterity. You have to do more than take your clothes off to equal artalthough, to 1N honest, in certain circumsteinces taking your cloth8 off might possibly help.

title: Soviet Ship Starting Cruises to Nowhere
description: Luxury cruising a la Russe from the Port of New York becomes a reality tonight. The vehicle for this Soviet venture into Western capitalism is the 25,000ton liner Maxim Gorki, which will be managed by a firm called, appropriately enough, Wall Street Cruises, Inc. The Gorki will sail on a fourday cruise to nowhere from West 44th Street at 9.

title: Market Place: S.I.P.C. Group Views Changes
description: The Securities Investor Protection Corporation, a governmentindustry agency set up in 1970 to protect investors, has released its annual report for 1973.

title: Bruins Sign Collegian
description: BOSTON, May 24 (AP) Gordon Corson Clark, AllAmerican right wing and captain of the University of New, Hampshire hockey team, has signed a contract with the Boston Bruins of the National Hockey League,

title: State's Pupil Tests Show a BlackUrban Lag
British Bar Negotiations With the Ulster Strikers
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 24The British Government decided today against making concessions to the Protestant extremist groups that are crippling Northern Ireland in a strike that is now 10 days old.may be open, negotiates with oil ,companies and decides just how much power Belfast should have.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, May 24 (AP)English soccer clubs have been told to construct dry moats, South American style, around their fields to keep spectators away from the playing area.

title: Subsidized Luxury
description: New York's housing jinx is reliably at work. One the city's earnest efforts to get more housing for more people has boomeranged.

title: Judge Denies U.S. Security Justified Ellsberg BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 The Federal judge in the White House plumbers case ruled today that the President has no constitutional right to authorize breakin and search without a warrant even when national security and foreign intelligence are involved.

title: Harris Poll Finds 32% Support Nixon on Job
description: Louis Harris, the pollster, says President Nixon received a positive job rating from 32 per cent,of the respondents in a nationwide survey:

title: Kheel Gives Details On Innovative Pact Of Papers and Union
description: The newspaperindustry contract agreement reached Thursday will give the publishers of The New York Times and The Daily News the unrestricted right to use automated processes in exchange for lifetime guarantees of employment to regular and substitute printers1 and sixmonth paid sabbaticals as incentives to retirernent.

title: Du Pont Is Told by N.L.R.B. To Reinstate Complainant
description: BOSTON, May 24 (AP)The National Labor Relations Board has ordered the E. I. duPont de Nemours & Co. to reinstate former employe at its Doyle Works plastics plant in Leominstar.

title: Vacations for the Aging
description: To shed the sameness of life's four walls, to lift the spirit with visits to new places, to wish for cool streams away from the city's asphaltfor such everyday dreams there is no age ceiling. For sensitive younger people, there is no more exhilarating sight than watching senior citizens board buses outward bound for the country.

title: Cordons's Concert Canceled
description: The concert of Ray. and Helen Gordon scheduled for Sunday afternoon at Town Hall has had to be canceled. Mrs. Gordon suffered a back injury while horseback riding. The concert will be rescheduled in the fall.

title: Added Loss by Franklin National Of 5Million Cited by Sindona
description: Michele Sindona, the Italian financier who is the largest stockholder in the parent corn. pany of the Franklin National Bank, said in an interview published yesterday in Milan that the bank had lost $5million in securities transactions above and beyond the foreignexchange losses previously disclosed.

title: Regents Assail City Board For Report on Integration
Blomberg Singles Off LeftHander in Rare Start
The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
ARTHUR L. FISK JR.
description: Arthur L. Fisk Jr., a retired counsel of the JohnsManville Corporation, died Thursday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived in Greens Farms, Conn., and at 1100 Park Avenue.

title: Two Truck Drivers Killed
description: STROUD, Okla., May 24 (UPI)Two freight company drivers burned to death in the cab of their truck when it smashed :through a guard rail into !ditch and disintegrated in a fire and series of explosions. The victims were Frank D. Giles, 59 years old, of Pauls Valley, and :Michael A. Weingartner, 30, of Oklahoma City.

title: Puerto Rico Party Denounces the U.S. For Colonial Move
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 24A spokesman for a Puerto Rican minority party advocating independence accused the United States and Gov. Rafael Hernandez Colon yesterday of colonial maneuverings to keep the island from securing independence.

title: Soviet Seaman Defects
description: ERIE, Pa., May 24 (AP)A young seaman aboard the first Soviet freighter to dock here has defected and will settle in the United States, the State Department saicl late today. He was identified as Ivan V. Rhonenko,23 years old, a member of the crew of the freighter Shura Kober.

title: Newcombe, EZ Riders and Rain Add to Sets'
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 24 The New York Sets may still be an unfamiliar name around New York but everybody knows who John Newcombe is. Perhaps that accounted for the 2,085 tennis fans who made their way through the rain and the holiday traffic tonight at Nassau Coliseum to see Newcombe and the Houston El Riders shoot down the Sets, 3223, in a World Team Tennis contest.

title: The Holiday Retreat Depletes City
description: Beckoned by forecasts of fair weather and plentiful gasoline throughout the threeday Memorial Day weekend, hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers retreated from the city yesterday in search of peaceful country lanes and surfrolled beaches.

title: Job Rewarding to Woman Police Head
description: OLD WESTBURY, LI., May 24I don't get a penny, but I do geb a shield and a chance to meet a lot of nice people.

title: Marcos States Way Is Opened To Revive Habeas Corpus Writ
description: MANILA, May 24 (AP)President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that he was opening the way for the restoration of the writ of habeas corpus to prevent summary arrest and detention.

title: People in Sports
description: Lenny Wilkens went back ta..coaching yesterday and for starters he has Bill Walton on his side. The Portland Trail Blazers hired Wilkens, one of the top guards in the National Basketball Association, to fill the coaching vacancy left by the resignation of Jack McCloskey. Wilkens signed a threeyear contract, but Herman Sarkowsky, the Trail Blazer president, said, the next time we call a news conference to make an announcement of this kind, we hope to say that Wilkens is on Medicare. Wilkens is the fourth Trail Blazer coach since the franchise was formed before the 197071

title: Judge Denies US.Security Justified Ellsberg BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 The Federal judge in the White House plumbers case ruled today that the President has no constitutional right to authorize breakin and search without a warrant even when national security and foreign intelligence are involved.

title: Reporter Denied New Trial In Dispute Over a Source
description: DADE CITY, Fla. May 24 (AP) A Florida. judge has denied new trial for a St. Petersburg Times reporter sentenced.to eight months in jail for refusing to identify a confidential source.

title: BOY'S INJURY AWARD IS RULED TOO LARGE
description: TRENTON, May 24 (AP)A lstate appeals court ruled today that $90,000 was too big a;etdement for a young child who was permanently scarred in an laccident caused by a chemical used in his older brother's science class. The Appellate Division of Superior Court here ordered a new trial to determine the amount of damages that should be awarded to Mark 1Klein of South Orange, who was 6 years old when the accident occurred, in 1969.

title: Phillips Petroleum Sells Two Brazilian Interests
description: The Phillips Petroleum Company announced yesterday it had sold its interest in two Brazilian companies.

title: Romaine Coleman, Designer, Married
description: Miss Romaine Hilary Coleman, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Shalom Coleman of Perth, Australia, was married here yesterday morning to Dr. HoWard Herichel Kaufman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Lewis D. Kaufman of Flint, Mich. State Supreme Court Justice Sidney A. Fine performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: DR. NORMAN POWELL, BARUCH PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Norman J. Powell professor of political science at Baruch College, died of a heart attack Thursday after an academic career of 35 years with the college. He was 65 years old.

title: Hutchinson Out of Hospital
description: WASHINGTON. May 24 (AP)  Representative Edward Hutchinson of Michigan, the ranking Republican on the House Judiciary Committee, which is considering impeachment proceedings against President Nixon, was released from the hospital today. He had undergone an operation for hemorrhoids. A spokesman said, There were no complications.

title: The Divine Mr. J.' at Festival Theater
description: A dull, dirty-mouthed and utterly infantile "religious satire" movie titled "The Divine Mr. J." is a piece of amateur camp claptrap. It opened like a garbage-can lid, yesterday at the Festival Theater. Directed and produced by Peter Alexander, it displays some of the world's worst actors self-consciously mincing around various lawnswith some wedged-in footage from other sources  and mocking the story of Jesus.The picture also "stars," Bette Midler, according to the ads and opening credits, who appears as the "Virgin Mary," for about 10 minutes, singing a bar or two, and gushes as coyly and tastelessly as the others. A wan mumbler named John Bassberger portrays Jesus.A battery of Midler fans were in front of the theater yesterday handing out "a personal statement" from their idol explaining that her "sequences were shot several years ago in the very early stages of my career." The statement protestd exploitation of "my current professional status." It adds: "However, I did it and there's nothing I can do about it." She atones, partly, by adding: "In my opinion, the movie is dreadful." Further, she sued in State Supreme Court yesterday to have the film billed as her movie debut. Bingo, Bette.

title: Hatchet Man Scores 10Length Victory
description: John Hay Whitney visited Belmont Park yesterday to watch one of his horses compete, and he liked what he saw The former Ambassador to the Court of St. James's and publisher of The New York Herald Tribune until its demise in 1966, came out to see Hatchet Man in the onemile event that was the third race on the card.. Whitney owns the Greentree Stable together with his sister, Mrs. Charles

title: SCHOOL BOARD HEARS FRANKLIN LANE ISSUE
description: Officials of the city Board of Education yesterday heard communitygroup spokesmen and, school personnel express their views concerning rezoning plans for Franklin K. Lane High School.

title: Mary Hill Is Bride of G. F. Worden
description: In the Dana Chapel of the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church here yesterday afternoon, Miss Mary Virginia Hill, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Michael Hill of Atlanta, became the bride of Geoffrey Field Worden, son of Mrs. Robert Elliot Worden of Wynnewood, Pa., and the late Mr. Worden. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read.

title: Miss Furtseva Is Reprimanded For $170,000 Moscow Dacha
description: MOSCOW, May 24Yekaterina A. Furtseva, the Minister of Culture and this country's politically most prominent woman, has been reprimanded by the Communist party for building an ostentatious, $170,000 dacha outside Moscow, informed Soviet sources disclosed today.

title: L.I. COLLEGE ROLLS EXPECTED TO DROP
description: ALBANY, May 24The State Board of Regents has asked public and privatecollege officials on Long Island to delay any expansion plans and to restudy their enrollment goals in in the light of new demographic data that show a decline in college enrollments by the midnineteeneighties.

title: 6 COUNTY LEADERS JOIN CAREY RANKS
description: Daniel P. O'Connell, the longtime Albany County leader, and five other upstate DemJacratic county chairmen yesterday announced their support for Represeptative Hugh L. Carey in his bid for, the party nomination for Governor.

title: D. K. Thompson Weds Miss Staple
description: The marriage of Miss Elizabeth Ann Staple to David Keith Thompson, son of Mrs. Warner Keith Thompson Jr. of Wrightsville Beach, N. C., and the late Captain Thompson, U.S.C.G., took place yesterday morning in Washington. Judge Tim Murphy of the Superior Court of the District of Columbia performed the ceremony in the Pension Building.pleted one year of study at the Georgetown University Law Center. She is a former analyst for the New York City Bureau of the Budget.

title: Duke Ellington a Master of Music,Dies at 75
description: Duke Ellington, who expanded the literature of American music with compositions and performances that drew international critical praise and brought listening and dancing pleasure to two generations, died here yesterday at the age of 75.

title: Cambodian Cabinet Ends 4 Years News Censorship
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 24 (UPI)The Cambodian Goernment said today that it had stopped censoring outgoing news dispatches for the first time in four years, but gave no official ,reason for the action.

title: Stocovaz Horse Wins At Devon
40Million Lawsuit Filed by Penthouse Against Playboy
description: Penthouse, which describes itself as a sophisticated entertainment magazine for men, filed a $40million suit in Federal Court here yesterday against Playboy , Enterprises, Inc., for allegedly disseminating false and fraudulent information about Penthouse's circulation among advertisers and ad agencies.

title: Spring Mill Lifts Dividend
description: Directors of Spring Mills, Inc., voted yesterday to increase the second quarter dividend on the company's common stock to 183,4 cents a share. The company has paid dividends of 15 cents per share since August 1972. The second quarter dividend is payable June 28 to shareholders of record June 12.

title: PRICE INDEX SETS RECORD IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, May 24  The sweeping tax measures put into effect by Prime Minister Wilson's Administration shortly after he took office in March contributed immediately to sharp increase in the rate of inflation in Britain, according to a Government report issued today.

title: YOUTH SENTENCED IN MOTHER'S DEATH
description: WITCHFIELD, Conn., May 24 While women wept in the crowded courtroom, 19yearold Peter Reilly was sentenced today to serve between 6 and 16 pyears in prison for the slaying of his mother, Barbara Gibbons, in their home in Falls Village.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Moses is going to the mountains. Moses Malone is the most coveted high school basketball player in the nation, a 6foot11inch center from Petersburg, Va., who averaged 38 Voints and 23 rebounds during the recent season. Coaches predict that Moses will lead the college of his choice to the promised land of the national championship. He is the likely successor to Bill Walton as college basketball's most dominant center. But first Moses is scheduled to appear tomorrow at the Seamco Classic, a schoolboy allstar game, at Kutsher's Country Club in the Catskill Mountains. Since the Red Sea is not readily available, the test for this Moses will be the parting of the holiday traffic on Route 17 so that he might arrive and depart quickly. His next appearance is listed for Monday in Tulsa, Okla., the site of Oral Roberts University, named for the evangelist. Just the thought of Oral Roberts himself attempting to convert Moses is beyond the realm of both religion and rebounds.

title: Hatchet Man Scores 10tengt Victory
China Ousting 6Man U.S. Marine Unit
description: HONG KONG, May 24 The United States Marines, are being ousted from Chinaall six ofthemapparently on suspicion of carousing.

title: People and Business
description: The National Advertising Review Board is looking for a new chairman. The unexpected search began yesterday with the surprise announcement that Edwin D. Etherington was resigning for personal reasons after the Spring board meeting on June 5. The 49yearold former president of the American Stock Exchange and Wesleyan University is recovering from his second openheart surgery and has found the workload too heavy with advertising's selfregulatory body.

title: Lawyer Loses Traffic Case
description: HOUSTON, May 24 (UPI)Percy Foreman, a defense lawyer accustomed to winning highly publicized divorce and murder cases, was convicted yesterday of driving while intoxicated last New Year's Eve. Mr. Foreman, 71 years old, was ordered to pay a $200 fine and sentenced to a 30day jail term probated for one year.

title: Rodino Said to Ask Release Of Evidence on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The chairman of the House Judiciary Committee will propose next week that the panel make public most, and perhaps all, of the Watergate evidence it has been examining in closed impeachment hearings, wellplaced Congressional officials said today.

title: Successor Plan Denied as Tito Turns 82
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 24The secretary of the Yugoslav Communist party said today that party officials had given no consideration to picking an eventual successor to President Tito, and that the subject of succession would not arise during the party's 10th Congress opening next Monday.

title: US. Film Wins Top Cannes Prize
Old Foes Meet Today in Lacrosse Semifinal
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md, May 24The National Collegiate Athletic Association came around to giving its ultimate stamp of recognition to lacrosse three years agoan annual championship tournament for schools playing the old Indian game.

title: No ClicketyClack
description: PRINCETON Americans will be traveling by trainbetween, into and within citiesmore in the future than in the recent past for a variety of reasons that become more obvious every day.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Public Service to Refund $865,000

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Federal Prosecutor Is Sworn In

title: Helicopter Hijacking Shocks Suspect's Friends
description: Friends and neighbors of the 22yearold man who hijacked a helicopter to the Pan Am Building on Thursday described him as a polite, softspoken person with no apparent inclination toward violence. Acquaintances of the man, David Kamaiko, and his family uniformly expressed surprise that he would be involved in such a crime. He had no police record, nor any history of political activism.

title: Inquiry at Cancer Center Finds Fraud in Research
description: A scientific investigating cornmittee at the Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center has concluded that a scientist deliberately falsified and misrepresented research results and has recommended that his affiliation with the center be terminated.

title: ENLISTED MAN GAVE DATA TO MIDSHIPMEN
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May. 24 (UPI)A quartermaster who just likes to see the guys Pass supplied examination answers to onesixth of the United States Naval Academy's sophomore class on Tuesday, a faculty source said today.

title: An Unnatural Silence Pervades Estes Paintings
description: The freedom to look at bad art and read bad books is one of the inalienable human rights. Like the freedom to scratch oneself, it is common to every level of society. Neither power nor money can proscribe it; if anything, they give it an additional sanction.

title: Brazil Frees French Priest Convicted for Inciting Revolt
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 24Rev. Frarcois Jen lei, the French priest condemned to 19 years in prison for encouraging Brazilian peasants to revolt against large landholders,.wa,s freed last night, his lawyer declared today.

title: Israeli Jets Attack Syrians as Fighting Intensifies in Golan
description: TEL AVIV, May 24Israeli planes today bombed Syria, day after the Syrians allegedly permitted eight terrorists to infiltrate into Israel.

title: Treasury Bills Off At the Weekly Sale
The Council Yields
description: Will we yield to the lesser impulses or will we affirm the decency and tolerance and justice which is so much a part of the very best of what we are and stand for, Councilman Carter Burden asked the other evening as the City Council prepared to vote on a longdelayed bill ban discrimination against homosexuals in jobs and housing.

title: Avis Reports I.T.T. Purchased Its Stock
description: Avis, Inc., said yesterday that the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, owner of 52 per cent of the outstanding common stock of Avis, had purchased an issue of cumulative preferred stock of Avis for $5million.

title: HEATH IN PEKING; GREETED WARMLY;Ceremony Almost Equals That for Heads of State
description: PEKING, May 24 (Agence FrancePresse)Britain's former Conservative Prime Minister, EdWard Heath, arriVed in Peking tonight and was greeted by ceremonies almost equal to those for a Government head or the leader of a friendly political party.

title: Trustees and Banks Seek Pennsy Change of Status
description: The trustees of the Penn Central Railroad, as well as consortium of 53 banks to which the bankrupt carrier owes $385million, yesterday filed separate briefs with Federal Judge John P. Fullam of the Federal District Court in Philadelphia in which both groups took the position that the carrier should be dismissed from reorganization.

title: Ambro Nominated By Li. Democrats To Run for House
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., May 24 Nassau and Suffolk County Democrats early today nominated Jerome A. Ambro,. the Huntington Town Supervisor, to be their candidate for Congress in the Third Congressional District on Long Island, now represented by Angelo D. Roncallo.

title: Du Pont Recalls a Pesticide Blamed for Carolina Death
description: RALEIGH, N.C. May 24 (UN) A death and a serious injury resulting from the use of the presticide Nematicide VydateL has prompted E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., to recall its product, which is used in transplanting tobacco.

title: Milk Suit Dismissal Sought
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 (AP) Justice Department lawyers formally asked a Federal judge today to dismiss Ralph Nader's milkprice lawsuit as moot. Mr. Nader is suing the Government over President Nixon's 1971 iorder raising the level of Federal milk price supports, which Mr. Nader contends was an legal payoff for campaign dona1

title: Duke Ellington, a Master of Music, Dies at 75
description: Duke Ellington, who expanded the literature of American music with compositions and performances that drew international critical praise and brought listening and dancing pleasure to two generations, died here yesterday at the age of 75.

title: REV. S. A. CUDDEBACK
description: The Rev. Stephen A. Cuddeback, who retired in 1971 as pastor of the Roman Catholic Cure of Ars Church, Merrick, L. I., died Thursday of a heart attack in the rectory. He was 74 years old.

title: SOVIET REPORTED RESUMING SUPPLY OF ARMS TO EGYPT
description: CAIRO, May 24The Soviet Union has resumed limited shipments of arms and spare parts to Egypt as part of an effort by both countries to improve their recently strained relations, informed foreign diplomats said today. The shipments are understood to be the first in about six months.

title: Ziegler Criticizes Tactics on Topes By Rodino and Doar
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., May 24 (UPI)Ronald. I.. Ziegler, White House press secretary, said today that the chairman and chief counsel for the House Judiciary Committee used diversionary tactics in calling the edited Watergate transcripts unsatisfactory.

title: Terror In a Legal Vacuum
Federal Jury Given Report On Killings at Southern U.
description: BATON ROUGE, La. May 24 (UPI)The Louisiana Attorney General's office turned over to a Federal grand jury yesterday details of a state investigation into the 1972 killing of two Southern University students.

title: Chemical Concern Is Sued., For $5.5Million Over Leak
description: CHICAGO, May 24 (AP)The city has sued a chemical storage company for $5.5million in damages resulting from a storage tank leak that forced thousands of persons froth their homes.

title: TAFT ASKS A STUDY OF HEALTH AGENCY
description: Citing recent episodes of serious occupationally caused illnesses, Senator Robert Taft Jr. asked the General Accounting Office Thursday to review the effectiveness of the National Institute of Occupational Safety and Health, the Federal research agency that oversees the health of the nation's work force.

title: Philip Corner Plays AvantGarde Music AllWeek at Kitchen
description: Under the general title of Metal Meditations, Philip Corner, the composer and performer, has been offering a series of events this week at the Kitchen. From Tuesday through yesterday in the afternoons, his collection gf resonant metal objects and calligraphic scores was on display. And Wednesday, Thursday and last night, Mr. Corner and friends offered three different programs of performances.

title: LYNN BANKS CLARKE
description: LARGO, Fla., May 24Lynn Banks Clarke, a New York advertising and publication executive for nearly 50 years before his retirement in 1967. died today at his home in Belleair Bluffs. He was 78 years old.

title: FIVE CBS STATIONS SIGN DINAH SHORE
description: Just days after her halfhour, morning program was canceled by NBCTV, Dinah Shore has been signed. by the. five CBS owned stations for a regular afternoon program of talk and entertainment to begin in the fall. The program"Dinah!"will be scheduled for 90 min. utes each weekday on the CBS stations in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Philadelphia and St. Louis and will be licensed to an outside firm for syndication to other cities.

title: New Bank a Striking Addition to Minneapolis
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The new Federal Reserve Bank here is striking and not easily forgotten addition to the cityscape. Designed by Gunnar Birkerts and Associates of Birmingham, Mich., its major visual element is an 11story office wing that, rather than being built on a frame set into the ground, is hung from curving cables like a suspension bridge. The cables hang from two end towers in great catenary (the natural curve formed by a cable hanging between two fixed points) and the glass of the walls above the curve is set back to express the curving shape on the facade.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: England Acts to Curb Soccer Fans

title: A Tale of Two Cities
description: WASHINGTON, May 24The best of times, the worst of times. In Washington lawyers were in the saddle, reason was dying and people were half mad with thinking about Nixon. We bolted.

title: 47th St. Merchant Robbed Of Diamonds Worth $50,000
description: A West Side merchant was robbed yesterday of cut diamonds he said were worth $50,000 on a staircase in the Jewelers Building at.36 West 47th Street, between ,Fifth Avenue and the Avenue of the Americas.

title: Binioid Gives Different Style to Indy 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 24Nobody goes around asking, Tom Who? any more, says Tom BinfOrd.

title: Mayor of Syracuse Is Emerging As Democratic Senate Hopeful
description: Moving into whit many Democratic leaders believe is a political vacuum, Mayor Lee Alexander of Syracuse has emerged as a leading contender for the Democratic nomination to oppose Senator Jacob K. Javits.

title: British Bar Negotiations With the Ulster Strikers
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 24The British Government decided today against making concessions to the Protestant extremist groups that are crippling Northern Ireland in a strike that is now 10 days old.

title: Heart Patient, 20, Dies
description: PALO ALTO, Calif May 24 (AP)Thomas C. Hewes of Ledyard, Conn., died early today !while awaiting a heart transplant donor at Stanford University Medical Center. Mr. Hewes, who became 20 years old this week, was thought to be the youngest candidate for a transplant. He suffered a virus infection of the muscles surrounding the heart.

title: Thailand's Role in Asia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 24  A farreaching foreignpolicy debate here is questioning some fundamental assumptions. At issue is Thailand's future place in Asia. In keeping with a long and successful tradition of selfinterest, few of the Thais involved in the debate are suggesting bold opening moves. But with a fullblown democratic order expected toward the end of this year, the discussion is likely to leave the tranquil corridors of the Foreign Office and enter the street

title: Fire Levels Hotel on Beach
description: NORTH SCITUATE, Mass., May 24 (AP)A general alarm fire with flames fanned by ocean breezes and leaping 250 rambling, 70yearold Cliffs Hotel on the beachfront in this south shore community. feet in the air leveled the NORTH SCITUATE, Mass.,

title: Dryden Ends Holdout, Signs Contract With Canadiens for Record $150,000
description: Ken Dryden moved yesterday from his post of $150aweek law clerk to $150,000ayear goalie to end his selfimposed sitdown strike against the Montreal Canadiens.

title: Court Rejects Suit Asserting Catholics Lobby on Abortion
description: WASHINGTON, May 24A suit challenging the lobbying activities of the United States, Catholic Conference has been dismissed by Judge Aubrey E. Robinson Jr. of the United States District Court for the District of Columbia.

title: lnquiry at Cancer Center Finds Fraud in Research
description: A scientific investigating committee at the Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center has concluded that a scientist deliberately falsified and misrepresented research results and has recommended that his affiliation with the center be terminated.

title: All 5 Marines Being Ousted From China
description: HONG KONG, May 24 The United States Marines are being ousted from Chinaall five of them apparently on suspicion of carousing.

title: Trade Surplus Posted in April
description: WASHINGTON, May 24 Soaring exports pulled the United States balance of trade back into surplus in April despite another big jump in the dollar value of oil imports, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: J. WILLIAM O'REILLY
description: J. William O'Reilly, who retired last June as a vice president of the New York Stock Exchange, died yesterday in Ridgewood Valley (N. J.) Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived in Ramsey, N. J.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PARK SPIN Not rain, snow, heat, gloom of night, nothing stay the hardy cyclists from completing their Central Park rounds today and tomorrow in the third annual 200mile, 24hour PepsiCola bicycle marathom.

title: Young Soviet Wrestlers Taste Victory, Hamburger
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., May 24Like most teenagers, they seemed a bit shy when the photographer asked them to pose for pictures. Like most teenagers, too, they stood stiffly and awkwardly as the photographer's flash went off.

title: Text of Judge Gesell's Decision in the Ellsberg Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 24Following is the text of a decision by Federal District Judge Gerhard A. Gesell on the national security aspects of the breakin case involving the former psychiatrist of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg:

title: JoAnn Tomaiuolo Wed to C. E. Scebold
description: Miss JoAnn Tomaiuolo, daughter of Mrs. Frank P. Tomaiuolo of Easton, Conn., and the late Mr. Tomaiuolo, was married there last evening to C. Edward Scebold of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert R. Scebold of Missouri Valley, Iowa. The Rev. William Barnes performed the ceremony in the Jesse Lee United Methodist Church,

title: ExTreasury Chief Cites Korea Effort
description: SEOUL, South KoreaDavid M. Kennedy, former Secretary of the Treasury, said after a recent business trip here that he was optimistic about the South Korean Government's efforts to reduce red tape and eleminate corruptiontwo major complaints of American businessmen in this country.

title: Indians Lose Defense Move
description: ST. PAUL, May 24 (UPI)Judge Fred Nichol of Federal District Court denied today a defense motion to suppress admission of evidence, including four Molotov cocktails, in the trial of Russell Means and I Dennis Banks, leaders of the Indian occupation of Wounded Knee, S. D. The evidence was obtained in a search of an automobile at a Government roadblock outside Wounded Knee on March 6, 1973.

title: Green Chips to 2Stroke Lead
Gen. Vicente Countinho 63, Brazil's Army Minister, Dies
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 24Brazil's Army Minister, Gen. Vicente de Paulo Dale Coutinho, died today of a heart attack barely two months after taking office. He was 63 years old.

title: TheBallet:'Bartok.No.3
description: John Clifford is an interesting young choreographer who keeps on remaining young and interesting. He still perhaps has not fulfilled himself, but I felt hints of a new originality in Bartok No. 3, which was given its New York premiere by the New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater on Thursday night. This was probably Mr. Clifford's most mature work to date.

title: Council Panel Votes a Bill Barring Promotion Secrecy
description: A bill designed to remove secrecy in the promotion and demotion of city workers was voted out of the City Council's Civil Service and Labor Committee yesterday. It is expected to be approved by the full Council at its next session.

title: Business Briefs
description: Volkswagen Cites Production Costs

title: BYRNE STRESSES COURT ECONOMY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 21 (AP)  Governor Byrne informed New Jersey judges today that he was looking for economy in their courts. Governor Byrne told the annual New Jersey Judicial Conference that while he supportedand would sign  a bill raising judges salaries, he saw opportunities for economy.

title: Hope for the Delaware
description: The inhabitants of the beautiful Delaware River valley have been reprieved again. Two new GovernorsBrendan T. Byrne of New Jersey and Malcolm Wilson of New Yorkhave, fortunately, taken positions prejudicial the proposed Tocks Island Darn, which would turn one of the last free stretches of river in the East into stagnant lake 37 miles long, dull when full and a muddy eyesore when drawn down in the dry season.

title: Israeli Cabinet Endorses Kissinger's Compromise
description: JERUSALEM, May 24Thed Israeli Cabinet today gave itsle general endorsement to Secretary of State Kissinger's cornPromise plan, which he hopes will win Syria's approval tomorrow and lead to rapid completion of a troopseparation agreement on the Golan Heights.

title: NIXON MAY SET UP POST ON ECONOMY
