title: Photography
description: THE small exhibition of Arthur Rothsteln's Farm Security Administration photographs at Soho Photo Gallery (through June 2) is a vivid reminder of what time, distance and the current nostalgia boom for the Thirties has done to our vision of that grim yet hopeful era. Pictorially, a movie like Peter Bogdanovich's Paper Moon is conceived almost entirely in terms of FSA photographs, from the opening shot of a little blonde girl's sorrowful face stark and monumental against an empty sky to the final shots of a rusty, battered pickup truck chugging fitfully across vast and desolate Midwestern prairies.ters long since put out of mind doing in such a delightful fairytale world?

title: Nixon Is Firm in Refusal To Yield Watergate Data
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 President Nixon continued today to hold fast to his position that he must defend the Presidency by refusing to turn over evidence sought in two major Watergate criminal cases.

description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (AP) Dr. Clyde L. Cowan, a pioneer physicist and codiscoverer of the neutrino, died yesterday at the age of 54.

title: Rich, Virile Tone Marks Herr Songs
description: John Bucher Herr, who made his New York debut Sunday night in Carnegie Recital Hall, is a lyric baritone and an exceptionally gifted natural singer. His tone is instantly appealing, a rich, virile, plangent sound that opens out easily and securely at full voice.

description: When the British first went to India, Dilip Hiro recounts in this study of race relations in Britain, they were attracted by travelers tales of people who were interestingly different and who had goods to sell and gold to spend. But the traders found a power vacuum, which naturally they abhorred and filled.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 25 (UPI)  Communist raiders destroyed one government helicopter and damaged six others at a Mekong Delta airfield early today, military sources said.

description: TEL AVIV, May 25Secretary of State Kissinger, after again narrowing differences between Syria and Israel, agreed tonight to make another attempt tomorrow to bring about a troop separation agreement on the Golan Heights before returning to Washington.

Y., became the bride of Benjamin Carlos Cohen. The Rev. James Ford, the academy chaplain, performed the Protestant ceremony.

description: DETROIT, May 25 (UPI)Chuck Seelbach, a Detroit Tigers relief pitcher, quit baseball today rather than accept a demotion to the minor leagues. Seelbach was sent to the Tigers Evansville farm club yesterday.

title: 73% SEE NIXON LINK IN WATERGATE POLL
description: Public belief that President Nixon was involved in the Watergate bugging or the subsequent coverup has shown very little change since last June, despite the release of the White House transcripts, and other intervening events, a Gallup Poll reported yesterday.

Federal German Republic and of France and their predecessors.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Fred Shero, Philadelphia Flyers coach, looks back: If someone asked me if I thought this team would win the Stanley Cup at the beginning of the season, I'd have said they were crazy. I wasn't even thinking of first place in the division. I didn't think this team would work this hard.

title: Officials Are Investigating the Death of Hundreds of Fish in the Peconic River
Is Etchmann In All of Us?
description: sTANLEY Milgram's study, Obedience to Authority, recently received national publicity on CBS's Sixty Minutes. The study purports to show that the ordinary person, in situations of normal obedience to authority, would do things which go against decent or humane behavior. Mr. Milgram seeks to show that all of us are likely to do so if we simply follow orders. We all, in short, can be Eichmanns. Or, as CBS's Morley Safer put it, in introducing the experiment, if concentration camps were, ever created , in the United States, it would not be difficult to staff them.

title: Windup of European Conference On Security Is Now in Doubt
description: GENEVA, May 25The possibility of a meeting of Eastern and Western leaders this summer to wind up the European security conference is dimming rapidly, conference sources said today.

title: State's His tonal Society Gets an Elegant Facelift
description: NEWARK  New Jersey's famous shoreline, as well as its mountain lakes, unending rivers and oldtime canals, are being explored afresh in a highly pictorial exhibition that is now on view at the New Jersey Historical Society, 230 Broadway.

title: Barometric drop

description: Miss Elizabeth Lee Foothorap, daughter of Mrs. James Frederick Foothorap and the late Mr. Foothorap, was married yesterday noon to James Matthew Timmes, son of Dr. Joseph John Timmes, a surgeon, and Mrs. Timmes. Both families are of Short Hills, N.J. where the Rev. George MacCray, an Episcopal priest, and the Rev. William Mellilo, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the caremony in Christ Episcopal Church.

title: Last Highway Post Office Following Pony Express Into Oblivion
description: ABOARD THE CLEVELANDCINCINNATI HIGHWAY POST OFFICE The highway post office, a littleknown, fourwheeled descendent of the Pony Express, is preparing for its last run, a victim of optical Scanners, automatic sorters and jet engines.

description: To The Editor:

title: COLLECTION DANCES, AND HUMOR WINS OUT
description: The Theater Dance Collection has a social conscience, as exemplified by Lynne Taylor's Flowers for Departed Children, and a sense of humor, displayed in Rodney Griffin's Misalliance. Humor is its stronger suit. The company presented its second program nifty evening at the Theater of Riverside Church.

title: Sunday Observer
description: It seems to me you can't go more than five minutes with the TV set this year without seeing somebody eat something absolutely awful. Or somebody, usually a woman, getting ready to serve something to eat that is absolutely awful I wonder if we have passed through some kind of cultural watershed here.

title: Bridge
description: A number of bridgeplayers believe that in all circumstances they should paint a perfect picture of their hands for their partners. They are quite wrong. The fallacy in this was pointed out many years ago by the British authority Skid Simon: Picturepainting is desirable if it helps your side to reach the right contract, but once the play starts the picture is likely to help the opposing side.

title: To Preserve a Treasure
description: All the efforts to maintain the mansion, outbuildings and grounds of George Washington's Virginia estate would be substantially diminished in effect if the magnificent and virtually unsullied view of the Maryland bank of the Potomac River were to be destroyed by commercial development. The view from Mount Vernon, as Washington saw it, remains largely unchanged today and adds to the deep sense of historical authenticity felt by more than a million tourists who visit this great site each year.

title: Portugal Begins London Talks With Rebel Group From Guinea;
description: LONDON, May 25The first formal talks aimed at reducing or even ending Portugal's status as a colonial power in Africa began this evening at a quiet hotel here.

title: The New Snares Facing Outside Directors
description: No title in the lexicon of business evokes more spleen, written and verbal, than that of the outside director. To Peter Drucker he is a tired fiction, a shadow king! a mere showcase or in simnel businesses, a sad lot of widows of former partnets".

title: WILSON SUSPENDS SURTAX FOR YEAR
description: ALBANY, May 25  Governor Wilson announced today that he had signed into law measure suspending for one more year the 2.5 per cent surtax on state personalincometax payments.

description: BELFAST"We don't even know their names, an official in London objected when asked why the British refused to talk with the militant Protestant leaders of the Ulster insurrection.

title: Television Day by Day,
description: ALK, the natural stuff of radio, has become the artificial staple of television. Turn on the set at any hour of the day and someone, on some channel or other, is likely to be yapping away about anything from the latest recipe for eggplant dip to intimate experiences in bisexuality. Johnny turns everything into a joke, Dick waffles betiten being serious and being funny, Mike is the eternal nice guy, Mery 111 sincere, Dinah is ebullient, Barbara is hardedged.

title: HELEN C. DENMAN
description: Helen C. Denman, a former public rations executive, who serval the Brooklyn Bureau of Charities and the Arthritis and Rheumatism Foundation, died Friday in a nursing home in Williamstown, Mass. She was 86 years old and lived in Hillsdale, N.Y.

description: A fully eciuipped hematology ward for the treatment of Cooley's Anemia has been opened at Long Island College Hospital.

title: Numismatics Up, Up Over There
description: The recent report in this space concerning the continuing growth of European coin collecting among Americans omitted a vital part of the picture: European coins are scarce and thus increasingly costly here because they are even more popular among collectors in Europe.

title: Data on Ouster of Pupils Here Are Scored by a School Aide
description: The statistics used by the United States Department of Health, Education and Welfare's Office of Civil Rights to prove that a.disproportionate number of minority children have been suspended by New York City schools are invalid, according to Frederick Shaw, head of the Board of Education's research bureau.

description: It was a fishy kind of party, starring smoked salmon and, not incidentally, Marlon Brando. The smoked salmon was from the Lummi Indians of Washington State, Marlon Brando was from Tahiti.

Hawkins of Dallas. The wedding is planned for Aug. 3, Miss McKee has completed her junior year at Smith College. Her fiance, an alumnus of the University of Texas, received a master's degree from Southern Methodist University. He is director of marketing for Belin & Associates of fiouston, land developers.

The Elderly Get an Education on Bureaucracy
description: UNION  Elderly citizens, the subjects of an increasing volume of special legislaton, are going to school in an effort to find ways to influence the laws that affect their lives.

title: R. Max Ritter, ExTreasurer Of Olympic Committee, Dies
description: R. Max Ritter, a former Olympic swimmer and retired textile chemist, died Friday in Jenkintown, Pa., where he lived. His age was 87.

title: Grand Prix of Monaco Is Europe's Indy 500
description: The two famous races tomorrow are about 4,500 miles apart; in a way, they are as different as is Gasoline Alley from the floral gardens of the Mediterranean, which is the garage area here. They are as disparate as the beerdrinking, potsmoking crowd in the snake pit and the wild parties on the yachts in the harbor here.

title: Criminals At Large
description: May be, strictly speaking, it is not a mystery book. But it does have action, suspense and, at the end, a holocaust. And it is exceedingly wellwritten. So don't miss CARRIE by Stephen King (Doubleday, $5.4), a first novel and one guaranteed to give you a chill.

title: Recordings
A MACHINE, DANCERS STAR IN KING WORK
description: Kenneth King's new work in progress, Praxiomatics (The Practice Room), in memory of the phenomenologist Edmund Husserl, runs two hours without a break. By the last halfhour Friday, assaulted by Mr. King's wordsplits sound collage, an exhaustive explanation of his new metamachine, the Telaxic Synapsulator, and dancers often barely glimpsed in silhouette at the othe end of the darkened Transmedia Kinetrics Coalition loft, what remained of the audience was arrayed horizontally on the mattresses provided for seating.

title: Group Fighting School Vote Apathy
description: BALDWIN  School board elections seldom evoke widespread concern or participation among district residents, so when a group of concerned citizens decided to combat public apathy here, the effort provided a refreshing change.

title: ThreeState Smog Study Set to Begin Next Week
The Great American Wage Puzzle
description: WASHINGTON  The Bureau of Labor Statistics published last week some new statistics that are both striking and puzzling. Whatever else they may be, they are obviously heartening for the United States competitive position in the world. The salient feature of the new figures  a feature without a ready explanation  is that American wages last year rose far less than wages in nearly all other industrial countries.

title: TO CURB INTERNAL RACISM
description: In the strongest policy state ment yet issued by the Police Department on interrial race relations, Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd last week announced that racial confr6ntations between police officers would be fully investigated by their superior officers, who would be held accountable for the accuracy and integrity of such investigations..

title: U.S.E.T. Leaves for Europe Tuesday
2 Hearings Are Set By Estimate Board
description: The Board of Estimate has set Thursday, June. 20 for a public hearing at City Hall on a proposed $6aroom monthly rent increase at Kingsview Homes, a middleincome housing development adjacent to the Long Island University downtown campus at Fort Greene Park in Brooklyn. Rents at Kingsview now average $32 a room.

title: COL. WILLIAM BOUGHTON
description: TROY, N.Y., May 25 (AP)Col, William Boughton, who served in the New York State Selective Service office for 29 years, died here yesterday in hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: 100 Yards From High Tide

description: The annals of history do not appear to have recorded a single era of stable prices.

title: Gardens

title: Legislative Notes Another Defeat for Dugan

Dugan to impose a 50day waiting period before a voter, on switching parties, could vote in a primary election of his new party.

title: No Job Dearth for Volunteers
description: MORRISTOWN  High school and college students on the hunt for meaningful activities this summer can look forward to a wide variety of volunteer opportunities.

description: WASHINGTON, May 25The House Judiciary Committee has what its investigators believe is conclusive evidence that a hush money payment of $75,000 to E. Howard Hunt Jr. was initiated on March 21, 1973, a few hours after President Nixon told John W. Dean 3d that such a payment would keep the cap on the bottle of the Watergate scandal.

title: Tract Stirs Dispute In New Brunswick
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  This city and neighboring East Brunswick are engaged in a heated controversy over the proposed development of a 69acre tract in New Brunswick.

description: WASHINGTON, May 25 The White House said today that President Nixon would attempt to fulfill the House Judicial Committee's request for his income tax records.

description: NEW DELHI, May 25 The Indian Government and press, stung by foreign criticism of the nation's nuclear test, is reacting with anger and dismay.

title: Purity and Beauty In Hidalgo's Voice
description: Ginamaria Hidalgo, an gentine singer who made North American debut Tuesday night at Carnegie has a soft soprano of excepc tonal purity and beauty. Used naturally, it has lovely, delicate vibrato and eveness. But Miss Hidalgo has other vocal colors at disposal, as well: a white, childlike piping and a nasal, edgy cry, which she can push up into a fascinating, if particularly attractive, upper extension.

title: State TV Network Hopeful on Future

title: FRANTISEK SOKOL, BIOCHEMIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Frantisek Sokol, an associate of the Wistar Institute of Philadelphia and associate professor of biochemistry at the University of Pennsylvania, died yesterday of a heart attack in Booth Bay Harbor, Me, He was 49 years old and lived in Philadelphia.

title: Nassau Regtricting Its Parks
description: EAST MEADOWOn Saturday Nassau County Parks will shut their gates to all but county residents who hold Leisure Pass identification cards.

title: Carl Wies Marries Miss Hardenbergh
description: Miss Margaret Bailey Hardenbergh, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel B. Hardenbergh of Fairfield, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Carl Hendricks Wies, son of Dr. and Mrs. Frederick A. Wies of Branford, Conn. The Rev. Stanley L. Houston performed the ceremony in the Greenfield Hill Congregational Church, assisted by the Rev. Dr. P. Pierson Parker, an Episcopal priest.

title: A.B.A. Flunks Its Demography Test
description: Why is the American Basketball Association, having completed its seventh season in far better shape than most of the successful leagues were at that stage, struggling against extinction? Because it has, in the jargon of today's sports world, the bad demographics.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
What It Costs...
description: This is how my total firstclass fare of $2,297.25 for, the two round trips on the France was calculated: The first lap (New York to Southampton, Le Havre and Bremerhaven, Germany) cost $599.25. The second (back to New York the same way), also cost $599.25. That was the highseason fare with a 15 per cent discount for the continuous round trip. The third lap (New YorkSouthampton only) fell in the intermediate season and cost $529.75. The fourth (SouthamptonNew York) was in high season again and was $568.75. Again those figures included a 15 per cent discount. I paid an additional $25 for the bed and board for the one night the ship was in New York between the second and third crossings. If you wanted to do the same thing this summer it would cost $400 more because of increased fares and the fuel surcharge. Remember, too, that the France's crossings this year are being made in six days instead of five because she is traveling at a slower speed to save fuel. And no calls are being made at Bremerhaven, just New YorkSouthaniptonLe Havre.

title: Kathleen Effler Wed to Officer
description: Miss Kathleen Ann Effler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Charles Effler of Scarsdale, N. Y., was marriedyesterday afternoon to Lieut. John Bradley Marvin, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Everett D Marvin Jr. of Norman, Okla.

title: Ballet: Vehicle for Stars
description: Whatever may be the intrinsic merits of Kenneth MacMillan's fullevening Manon, which Britain's Royal Ballet has introduced to the Metropolitan Opera House this season, it is a remarkable star vehicle. For its three leading dancers, Manon, her lover, Des Grieux, and her brother, Lescaut, it provides splashy opportunities for both dancing and actingparticularly, perhaps, acting.

title: Navy and Air Force Upgrade Weaponry
description: The Navy and the Air Force are well into a sweeping, costly and, in some areas, controversial program for the modernization and improvement of their generalpurpose forces.

title: Florida Boat Is Block Isl. Race Victor
Lisbon Communists Gain Quietly
description: LISBON, May 26When the Communist party came into the open after the military coup a month ago, it had a prisonhardened prestigious eader, dedicated party workers, a loyal following among various groups from farm hands to bank employes, and a doctrine for all of Portugal's problems.

title: Peking Uses Round of Banquets To Show New Political LineUp
description: HONG KONG, May 26 Peking has been entertaining distinguished foreign guests at a furious rate, as if competing for a prize as the international capital to hold the most state banquets in a month. So far this month it has held seven. What is involved, it appears, is not a diplomatic offensive so much as a subtle rearrangement of political power in the Chinese leadership. Since public appearances by China's top leaders are rarely reported except when foreigners are on hand, Peking seems to have a real need to import state delegations the way other capitals import ballet troupes, whenever it wants to display lineup.

title: Old Drug Gets a New Use In Treating Rare Disease
description: Doctors have developed ant apparently effective therapy for a previously untreatable chronic disabling disease by discovering a new use for one of man's oldest drugs.

title: Article 1  No Title
Pact Set in Auto Strike
description: DETROIT, May 26 (AP)A: tentative agreement settling a, 13day strike by 4,600 workers at the Fisher Body Fleetwood plant here was ratified by union members today, according to a Fisher Body spokesman, Terms of the settlement with the United Automobile Workers were not announced.

title: DISPUTE ON BUSING IN BOSTON HEATED
description: BOSTON, May 26  This city's volatile school integration controversy continues unabated after an advisory referendum vote that rejected busing. Boston is under a state court order to begin busing of school children this September to integrate its schools in compliance with the state's nineyear old racial imbalance law.

description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP) Stewart Alsop, the columnist, died today at the hospital at the National Institutes of Health in nearby Bethesda, Md. His age was 60. He had been undergoing treatment for leukemia.

title: Peterson's Lotus First In Grand Prix of Monaco

title: Departing School Chief Is Praised
description: MONTCLAIR, May 26James A. Adams, who was the focal point of substantial controversy during his two and half years as superintendent of schools, primarily over his plan to bus gradeschool pupils to achieve integration, will leave his post at the end of next month.

description: The Metropolitan Mile, the first of the series of races presented by the New York Racing Association as the handicap triple, will head the program at Belmont Park today. Rounding out the triple are the Brooklyn, at 1 3/16 miles on July 4, and the Suburban, at 1 miles on July 20. These last two races will be run at Aqueduct.

description: Securities and Commodity exchanges, banks and United States Government offices will be closed today for the Memorial Day holiday.

title: Lolich, Pitching Like a Tiger Again, Sets Down Indians, 21
description: A month ago, the baseball talk was that Mickey Lolich, who has been wearing the Detroit Tiger uniform for 11 years, was pitching like a grayhaired man, trying to get by just lobbing the ball over the plate. While his wonlost record fell to 15, and his earnedrun average zoomed to 4.84, the highest of his career, the 33yearold, 8100,000 lefthander had trouble maintaining his composure as the gallery of critics cried he was through, washed up and over the hill.

That is for the Judiciary Committee or the President to take, the issue to the courts.

title: Delivering Services
description: New York City's own United Fund, the United Fund of Greater New York, followed the pattern of most major cities in that it was organized by public spirited citizens in response to the waste and frustration of many competing appeals for funds as well as for volunteer time and effort.

title: End of High School Crowding in Manhattan Seen
description: Highschool overcrowding Manhattan should be virtually eliminated by 1976, according to school officials, because decreasing enrollments and the opening of a new school.

title: Red Smith
description: David James Wottle is a gaunt strip of gristle recognizable in any pack of foot racers by the duckbilled cap tattletale gray pulled down over his mop of tan hair. few years ago he was the one on the Bowling Green twomile relay team who didn't wear a cap, but his accomplices came to regard their headgear as a badge of brotherhood and persuaded him to adopt their style. Then he went out into world competition where it is customary to go bareheaded as in a cathedral, and the fact that he covered up as in a synagogue set him apart from the mob.

title: Lifting of Duty Asked On Canadian Wood Pulp
description: WASHINGTON May 26 (UPI)  The New England Congressional Caucus has said that import duties imposed on Canadian hardwood pulp being brought into this country should be lifted because the entire American paper and pulp industry is being hurt.

description: KINNELON, May 26Nearly 400 men have been combing 5,000acre wild woodland tract here since Friday evening in an attempt to find Edward Diggles, a 13yearold junior high school honor student who disappeared while completing his newspaper route.

title: EMBANK HALTS CREDIT TO SOVIET

description: PALM BEACH, Fla., May 26 (AP)Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., sai,d today that President Nixon's economic policies had made it impossible for half of the families in the United States to buy a home. The Democratic senator blamed the Administration's tightmoney and highinterestVete policy for driving up mortgage interest rates to what he Oiled Staggering levels.

title: An Intruder Attacks Connecticut Couple At Plaza Hotel Here

title: For Black Artists, the Street Offers Little
description: ORANGEBURG, S. C.Mr. Nelson Algren of Chicago writes that life is in the streets, preferably the streets of a big city, and that a writer should be where the action is. That is his right. But when he goes so far as to say that blacks, represented by a $300aweek television interviewer, are on the way to losing their souls as a result of getting enough to eat, I think he goes too far.

Crangle, who is also Erie County Democratic leader, and three other leaders of heavily populated and Democratic countiesMeade H. Esposito of Brooklyn, City Councilman Matthew J. title: Building's Role Is Lofty, Its Form Too Much So
description: The publicrelations department of Mount Sinai Medical Center says that the institution's new $117million Annenberg Building at Fifth Avenue and 1BOth Street is the largest structure in the country combining hospital and medi calschool facilities. Few residents of the neighborhood of the east ninetiesor the west nineties, for that matterwould dispute it. The structure, which, because of such high vertical areas as an auditorium, mechanical spaces and a library, rises to the equivalent height of a 43story one, looms over its neighbors in this area of smalland mediumscale apartment buildings, and dominates  no, destroys is more the wordthe skyline over central park.

title: President's Ouster Is Backed, 4837%, In New Gallup Poll

title: Falco's Huescape,  Sleepers, Speeds
description: Unquestioning admiration of sleek technique is a seduction that lies on both sides of the footlights for the Louis Falco Dance Company. Its members are so beautiful in their persons and training that audiences rarely ask for more than a glimpse of them tearing brilliantly through almost any pattern of movement. The company showed two pieces from its repertory and the new Speeds Saturday evening at Alice Tully Hall, with a certain amount of selfcontentment.

title: Soviet Toughens Narcotics Penalties

title: Jazz: An Era Recalled

So the New York Jazz Repertory Company's effort on Saturday o revisit the street, as it was known, could scarcely catch the raffish, rowdy excitement of the block. But some faint echoes of the music that was played there could be heard even at Carnegie Hall.

description: The funeral service for Duke Ellington will be broadcast in its entirety today, starting at 1 P.M., from the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine by radio station WRVRFM. A spokesman for the station, which specializes in jazz, said the program had been arranged because we felt no one was greater contributor to the jazz field than the pianist, composer and band leader, who died last Friday at the age of 75.

title: Bridge: North Americans Fail to Gain Over Italians in World Play
U.S. RELIEF GROUP AIDS PALESTINIANS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 26, (UPI)Two United States Air Force transport planes arrived in Beirut today bringing 23 tons of medical supplies for Palestinian refugees.

title: GERMAN MAGAZINE CANCELS SPY REPORT
description: BONN, May 26 (UPI)In the face of a threatened lawsuit and of denials by the West German and American Governments, a West German magazine today canceled plans to publish a report that the United States Central Intelligence Agency considered the chief of West Germany's Intelligence Service a Communist agent himself.

title: Party Infighting in Israel Stalls Naming of Cabinet
description: JERUSALEM, May 26Bitter factional rivalries within the ruling Labor party over the distribution of cabinet portfolios are jeopardizing Premierdesignate Yitzhak Rabin's monthold efforts to assemble a new coalition government.

title: Syrians Bomb Israeli Positions But No Casualties Are Reported
description: TEL AVIV, May 26Four Syrian MIG17's this afternoon bombed positions in the Israeliheld salient of Syrian territory, but Israel said there were no casualties.

title: 5 Die in Polish Mine CaveIn
description: WARSAW, May 26 (Reuters) Five coal miners died in ail underground accident at Piekary in southern Poland, the official press agency PAP reported today. Three other miners, trapped by a cavein at the mine Friday, were rescued.

title: Mrs. Carroll Badeau, Won $1 Million in Jersey Lottery
description: Mrs. Alice Brewster Badeau, I who in November, 1972, won $1million in the New Jersey Lottery, died Friday at her home, 17 Tudor Court, Elizabeth, N. J. Mrs. Badeau, who was too ill at the time to attend the drawing, was 80 years old.

title: Timothy T. Triumphs
description: STOCKHOLM, May 26 (AP) An Italian owned stallion, Timothy T., came from behind today and won the $73,000 Elite trot race at Solvalla ahead of two French horses, Amyot and Equileo. The victory was worth more than $20,00.

title: United States May Sail With Bicentennial Exhibits
description: A project has been launched that could bring the United States out of mothballs for use as a floating historical, cultural and industrial exposition center for the forthcoming bicentennial.

title: Priest Explains Eulogy Of Slain S.L.A. Woman
description: IRVINGTON, May 26A 25yearold priest who eulogized Angela Atwood, a member of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army, said today that he understood the forces that niay have driven her.

title: G.M. Workers End Strike That Had Idled 8,100
description: DETROIT, May 26 (UPI) Hourly workers at General Motors Fisher Body Fleetwood plant in Detroit ratified a new contract today, ending a 12day strike that had idled 8,100 G.M. workers at three plants. A United Auto Workers spokesman said the exact vote count by the 4,000 workers of Local 15 was not known, but he said the pact was ratified by a substantial margin.

title: Timothy T. Triumphs
description: STOCKHOLM, May 26 (AP) An Italian owned stallion, Timothy T., came from behind today and won the $73,000 Elite trot race at Solvalla ahead of two French horses, Amyot and Equileo. The victory was worth more than $20,000

title: McGovern Bloc Replaced In Massachusetts Voting
description: BOSTON, May 26 (AP) Nearly all the activist supporters of Senator George McGovern of South Dakota who took over the Massachusetts Democratic party in 1972 have deserted party politics, the Boston Sunday Globe reported.

title: Coast Democrats Lead, 41
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 26 (Reuters) More than four times as many Californians are registering to vote as Democrats than Republicans, according to figures released by the Secretary of State's office. From Jan. 1 to April 11, some 125,000 Voters registered as Democrats, compared with.29,000 as Re_publicans.

title: STATE TO AMEND LOBBYING RULES
description: TRENTON  The New Jersey Election Law Enforcement Commission, which enforces the state's new lobbydisclosure law, is preparing to amend its regulations to exclude some groups and individuals who spend less than $100 a year attempting to influence legislation here.

title: Ful bright Facing Danger
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., May 26 The stature of Senator J. W. Fulbright, facing his gravest danger of defeat in a long and controversial career, brought the network television crews and the overseas press to this steepy capital for the final day of the campaign before the Democratic Senatorial primary Tuesday.

title: Nixon's Travels: New Impeachment Strategy
description: MIAMI, May 26 President Nixon, in his efforts to salvage the rest of his term, has turned once again to what he considers his strongest appealthat of a world statesman whose leadership is essential to maintaining peace.

title: For Met Standee, Waiting Is Half the Fun
description: Up against the wall! Thomas Hacker, security guard at Lincoln Center, roared through his bullhorn one recent Sunday morning. He was greeted by cheers and laughter from the more than 250 people scrambling to their places in a line that stretched along one side of the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Kathryn Blair Green Is Bride Of Richard Kleeman Lazarus
description: The marriage of Miss Kathryn Blair Green, daughter of Col. James B. Green, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Green of Los Altos, Calif., to Richard Kleeman Lazarus took place yesterday in Cincinnati. The bridegroom is a son of Ralph Lazarus, board chairman of the Federated Department Stores, Inc., and Mrs. Lazarus and a grandson of the late Fred Lazarus Jr., a founder of Federated.

title: Ford Says He Cautioned Nixon On Confrontation Over Tapes
description: DANBURY, Conn., May 26Vice President Ford said here today that he told President Nixon last Thursday the White House's refusal to provide relevant information to a House impeachment panel could lead to an emotional institutional confrontation.

title: Carey Charges Samuels Aides Spread False Rumors He'll Quit
description: Representative Hugh L. Carey charged yesterday that people in the camp of Howard J. Samuels, one of his rivals for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination, were spreading false rumors that Mr. Carey was not really in the race and would drop out to run for the United States Senate.

title: A Gentle Poet Now Protects Poe Cottage in Bronx
description: About 2 A.M. last April 30, a drunk stumbled up to the front door of the Edgar Allan Poe cottage in the Bronx and tried to kick the front door down.

title: Orioles Lose, 65 and 75
Once Addicted to Drugs, They Prepare to ReEnter Society
description: It had been a long journey, symbolically, for the 15 young people who came to the kitchens of New York University's School of Education the other day for a session of cooking and tledyeing.

title: Rutherford Captures Indy 500 With Bobby Unser Finishing Second
Emily Eisenberg Wed To Robert N. Karelitz
description: Miss Emily Louise Eisenberg, daughter of Dr. Sidney E. Eisenberg, a cardiologist, and Mrs. Eisenberg of New Britain, Conn., were married there yesterday afternoon to Robert Nelson Karelitz, lawyer with the Fiduciary Trust Company in Boston. Rabbi Harry Zwelling performed the ceremony at the Eisenberg home.

title: Maritime and Seafarers Unions Agree to Discuss Consolidation
description: The nation's two largest deepsea seamen's unionsthe National Maritime Union and the Seafarers International Union, each with a membership of 25,000 blue water sailors have agreed to discuss a merger. Last Monday, during a meet ing of a special maritimeunity committee of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations in Washington, Paul Hall, head of the Seafarers, agreed to merger discussions. He also agreed to ask the A.F.L.C.I.O. to withdraw special sanctions imposed by the Seafarers against the Maritime Union in 1960.

title: Cosmos Win Friends, Tie Napoli, 22, With Rally
description: The New York Cosmos rallied to score two secondhalf goals and tie Napoli of Italy, 22, in an exhibition at Downland yesterday, but the New Yorkers considered it a moral victory.

title: Jews Begin Observance Of the Feast of Weeks
description: Shabuoth, the Jewish commemoration of the giving of the Ten Commandments, began last night with observances in temples and synagogues. Known also as the Feast of Weeks, the holiday is mentioned in the Bible as.the time of the emergence of the first fruits of the spring planting.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ORADELL, May 26Each year, the growing system agegroup track meets in New Jersey produces a talented freshman runner who challenges both state and national records. In the last two years Buck Buckstad of North Edison has won the national 1415yearold agegroup mile and Chris Hallinan of Bernards has placed high in the state crosscountry final as a freshman.

title: AMERICAN AIRLINES AND UNION IN ACCORD
description: American Airlines and the Transport Workers Union of American last night announced tentative agreement on six new contracts covering 20,000 and averting a strike scheduled for midnight.

title: Walter Werner Weds Mrs. Simon
description: Mrs. Anne. W. Simon of New York and Chilmark, Mass., was married yesterday to Walter Werner, a widower of New York and Redding, Conn. Justice of the Peace Jeff Norton performed the ceremony at the Edgartown (Mass.) Court House.

title: Miss Stang Is Bride Of Robert S. Brody
description: Miss Deborah Jane Stang, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Stang of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Robert S. Brody, son of Dr. and Mrs. Alfred W, Brody of Omaha. Rabbi Daniel Schwartz performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert A. Stang of New Rochelle, N. Y., uncle and aunt of the bride, whose father is the actor.

title: Brenda Reed Bride of Lawrence Rauch
description: Miss Brenda Gail Reed, daughter of Mrs. John S. Routh Jr. of Greenwich, Conn,. and Palm Beach, Fla,, and the late Gwyn E. Reed, was married yesterday afternoon to Lawrence Howard Rauch of New York. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Rauch of Mount Vernon, N.Y.

title: About New York
description: No. 100 happened this was Lorenzo Bryant lunged with a knife at another man, and when a policeman got between them, Mr. Bryant lunged at him. too. Then, the policeman drew his pistol, fired, and killed Mr. Bryant with a single shot, Then, another policeman called the Sixth Homicide Squad, and Detective Richard Marcus answered.

title: Georgetown U.Dispute Resolved As Ouster of Official Is Upheld
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 The controversy over the dismissal of the Rev. Edmund G. Ryan as Georgetown University's executive vice president for academic affairs was resolved last week when the board of directors voted to uphold Father Ryan's discharge, while regretting Its precipitant manner.

title: KISSINGER MAKES PROGRESS IN SYRIA BUT SNAGS ARISE
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 26Secretary of State Kissinger virtually resolved today the major issue holding up the SyrianIsraeli accord on troop separation, but some other lastminute snags developed, threatening further delay on a final agreement, American officials said.

title: Expo Concessionaire Worries Legal Units
description: In the three weeks since the compact world exposition opened in this sparkling rivercleft city, investigators have been inquiring particularly into a series of transactions between elements of the two parties that suggest a close collaboration.

title: Urban West Point
description: Mayor Beame and Chancellor Robert J. Kibbee City University are to be congratulated on their plans to establish the nation's first municipal training institution, an urban West Point that is scheduled to open next September at the C.U.N.Y. Graduate Center midManhattan.

title: Anniversaries
description: HAMMERMr. & Mrs. Samuel Hammer are happy to announce their 65th Wedding An. niversary on May 30, 1974.

title: Philadelphia Gas Rates Up
description: PHILALELPHIA, May 26 (AP) The Philadelphia Gas Works has received approval from the City Gas Commission for a $10.2million increase for its largevolume gas users. The increase, effective July 1, will affect only large industrial and commercial concerns, including the city and the Housing Authority, but will not affect residential customers.

title: 2d Golf Victory For Mrs. Carner
DR. W. ROBERT BAILEY
description: Dr. W. Robert A. Bailey, coordinator of health science programs at the University of Delaware and coauthor of Diagnostic Microbiology and Diagnostic Bacteriology, died May 19 of a heart attack in San Juan, P.R. He was 56 years old and lived in Newark, Del.

title: Toyota Unit Hints Sales Shifting Into Low Gear
description: With Volkswagen expected to show red ink this year for the first time in its history, can Toyota be far behind?

title: The Poppies of Anatolia
description: A totally unnecessary confrontation is brewing between the United States and Turkey; unless it can be talked out in terms of reason and good will, serious resentment could erupt to jeopardize Western security interests in the eastern Mediterranean.

title: No Detours for Texas Gentleman
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 26 Things haven't always gone exactly right for Johnny Rutherford. Take the time here back in 1971 when he needed six pit stops and more than one hour to figure out that he was racing with a bad battery. His 10lap time during that hour was 19.978 miles an hour, much slower than his wife, Betty, drives to the supermarket back in Fort Worth, Tex. But today everything went right for Gentleman Johnny as he won the first full 500mile Indianapolis race that he ever completed. And at 2:13 P.M. Eastern standard time, Rutherford drove into Victory Circle, which is actually a squre.

title: Anarchy in Energy
description: There is no such thing as energy policy in Washington today. The most that the Administration and Congress alike have been able to muster all these months is a series of ad hoc responses to crises as they develop, followed by deterioration and disinterest in executive and legislative branches when the specific crisis fades:

description: ARABIANS TO RIDE

title: Gary Player Captures Golf by 2 Shots
Naval Scare Tactics
description: Admiral Elmo Zumwalt, the outgoing Chief of Naval Operations, in an effort to take the case for a bigger Navy to a wider public, asserts in the June issue of Playboy magazine: Since the Cuban missile crisis, the Soviets have built three and a half times as many ships as we haveincluding an aircraft carrier, cruisers, destroyers, submarines, amphibious ships and auxiliary ships. During the last five years, the United States Navy has given up more than 400 ships, a net reduction 80 ships per year, and will drop to 511 ships by the end of the fiscal year 1974. Of that, 30 per cent need replacement as soon as possible.

title: Ulster Coalition Showing Signs of Strain As British Discuss Steps Against Strike
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 26Prime Minister Wilson interrupted a long weekend in the Scilly Isles to fly to a Royal Navy base to discuss the deteriorating situation in Northern Ireland with Merlyn Rees, the British Secretary of State for the province.

title: Elyse Goldweber Lawyer, Married
description: Miss Elyse Goldweber, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Max Goldweber of Westbury, L. I., was married at noon yesterday to David Sloss, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard A. Sloss of Hewlett Harbor, L. I.

title: Michael Gumport Weds Miss Sterne
description: Miss Pamela S. Sterne, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bruce Colyer Sterne of Timonium, Md., was married there yesterday afternoon to Michael A. Gumport, son of Dr. and Mrs. Stephen Lawrence Gumport of New York and Nantucket, Mass,

title: Luxembourg Vote Threatens to Oust LongTime Rulers
description: LUXEMBOURG, May 26 (UPI)A strong showing by the Socialist party in parliamentary elections today threatened to topple the Christian Social party from 50 years of rule,

title: God as the Ultimate Portfolio Manager
description: Theologians and laymen forever ponder and speculate about God's motivations, His demands on mankind, His decisionmaking process, and sometimes, of course, His very existence. I shall not discuss the latter question; rather I shall assume that He exists. Instead, I plan to explore the question, how does God decide who shall be rewarded and who shall be punished?

title: Pamela Bush Wed To Robert Eubank
description: Miss Pamela Mason Bush, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. William M. Bush of Rye, N. Y., was married last evening to Robert Eastin Eubank, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mahlon Z. Eubank of Larchmont, N. Y. The Rev. Wendell Phillips performed the ceremony in Christ's Episcopal Church in Rye.

title: Record Day at Monticello
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., May 26Monticello Raceway achieved its first milliondollar mutuel handle today. The Sullivan County Catskills harness track, now in its 17th season, attracted 10,618 fans for its holiday Sunday program, a record for a matinee and the crowd wagered $1,040,636.

title: MINERS OPPOSE IMPORTS OF COAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The planned importation of coal from the Republic of South Africa has met with resistance, and more controversy Is expected. The United Mine Workers in Alabama said that nearly all its 8,000 members in District 22, in the rich coal fields around Birmingham, got sick or simply failed to report for work last Wednesday to protest the plans of the Southern Company, a major electric utility chain in the South, to purchase about 2.5 million tons or lowsulphur coal from South Africa for consumption at two of its Gulf Coast power plants.

title: A PriestBroker Leads Paterson Fight on Blight
description: PATERSON, May 26Thanks to a $70,000 demonstration grant from the State Department of Community Affairs, the Cathedral Housing Corporation will be able to expand its efJersey forts to reclaim Consumer abandoned, and boardedup housNotes es. The nonprofit corporation, which is associated with Roman Catholic Family and Community Services, is headed by the Rev. John H. Weiss, a 34yearold licensed real estate broker who is well versed in the intricacies of plumbing, heating and plastering.

title: Milk Cooperative Is Continuing Political Role, But Cuts Costs
description: SAN ANTONIO, Texas, May 26Associated Milk Producers, Inc., the dairyfarmer cooperative whose political role looms so large in the impeachment proceedings against President Nixon, changed its management in early 1972.

title: Some Questions and Answers on India's Test of a Nuclear Device
description: NEW DELHI, May 26  India's surprise nuclear test has buoyed Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government but stirred angry comments from Western nations. It has provoked a nurnber of questionsabout the decision to set off the underground nuclear device as well as the implications and even the morality. of it.

title: Van Rams Palace Gate And Fleet Street Offices
description: LONDON, May 26 (Reuters)  A driver crashed his van into three newspaper buildings here tonight, then rammed the gates of Buckingham Palace.

title: Boy, 6, Dies as Gun Found by Playmate. Goes Off by Mistake
description: A 6yearold Queens boy wag accidentally shot to death last night when a revolver found byan 8yearold playmate went off while he was showing it to his friend.

title: Books of The Times
description: You will be glad to hear that, in the latest psychoanalytic opinion, you are hero. Just getting through your daywhich is actually akin to a Greek tragedy is a triumph in itself. This is quite change from the sniveling and ignoble image of ourselves that most psychoanalytic thought used to offer. In The Denial of Death, our heroic stature is revealed through a merger of the mythicoreligious and the psychoanalytic. For the sexual heroics of Freud, Ernest Becker substitutes the existential heroics of Kierkegaard, Otto Rank and Norman a Brown. It is not, he says, a desire to sleep with our mothers and slay our fathers that drives usbut a wish to be our own fathers, to emancipate ourselves from the idea of mortality.

title: MRS. JOHN MARSACH
description: Mrs. Gertrude Desch Marbach, White Plains City assessor and former president of the New York State Association of Real Estate Boards, died Friday at her home, 90 Bryant Avenue, White Plains. She was 81 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Machine Tool Orders Up in April
description: New orders for machine tools totalled $288.2million in April ,almost 20 per cent higher

title: CLARENCE DAVIS, 80, EXINTERIOR AIDE
description: LINCOLN, Neb., May 26 (AP) Clarence A. Davis, Under Secretary and Solicitor of the Department of the Interior during the Eisenhower Administration, died here today at the age of 80.

title: Forego Set For Feature At Belmont
description: The Metropolitan Mile, the first of the series of races presented by the New York Racing Association as the handicap triple, will head the program at Belmont Park today. Rounding out the triple are the Brooklyn, at 13/16 miles on July 4, and the Suburban, at 1 miles on July 20. These last two races will be run at Aqueduct.

title: Florida Boat Is Block Isle Race Victor
Housing Police Capture Staten Island Escape
description: A 20yearold fugitive from a narcotics treatment center on Staten Island was caught by the city Housing Police last night when he returned to his apartment at 75 Hill Street, in the Stapelton Houses project. He was arrested there last Friday after having allegedly threatened his 2yearold son with a knife, according to the police.

title: Hunter and Hunted
description: It is hard to quarrel with the immemorial right Eskimos to hunt whales. They catch but few, and they take those few strictly for their own consumption. Nevertheless, there is something repugnant in the enthusiastic publicityseeking of Senator James L. Buckley of New York in participating in a whaling expedition by the hunters of an Alaskan village.

title: Wanted: History Buff to Buy Inn on Princeton Pike
description: LAWRENCE TOWNSHIP, May 26The Mercer County Cultural and Heritage Commission is looking for someone with a hardbitten interest in the hotel and tavern business and a soft spot for history to buy and restore the Princessville Inn here, turn it into a profitable business, and so save the building as a historic site.

title: BURNS WARNS U. S. ON HIGH INFLATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Dr. Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that the future of our country is in jeopardy if the recent rate of inflation is not moderated.

title: GUILD AND REUTERS AGREE ON CONTRACT
description: A 10day strike against the American bureaus of Reuters, the British news agency, was settled yesterday when members of The Newspaper Guild of New York accepted a new threeyear contract containing a costofliving clause.

title: Greek Junta Unpopular, But Few Expect Change
description: ATHENS, May 26"It's too bad to last, said one foreign diplomat, but I can't see how it's going to change.

title: 4 Runs in 9th Top Pirates
Soviet Dam, Showpiece of Central Asia, in Setback
description: NUREK, U. S. S. R., May 21 Soviet Central Asia's most vaunted hydroelectrical project is costing two or three times as much as original estimates and is now producing only half the power previously announced, according to Communist party and engineering officials.

title: Leftists Bid Lisbon Free Cuban Officer
description: LISBON, May 26  Soldiers used, tear gas tonight to disperse a crowd of ultraleftists, including ,many black Africans, who were demonstrating for the release of a Cuban Army officer captured by Portuguese forces during operations against guerrillas in Portuguese Guinea.

title: Only Souvenirs and Memories Remain for The Horde at Indy
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 26Well this year's party is over. The Horde last night raised hell all over the streets of Indianapolis and didn't stop until maybe six minutes before the balloon went tin at Indy at 11 AM. and the 33 cars took the green flag and roared off in search of as they say, glory. Glory at Indianapolis means a lot of sweat, work, disappointment, and an endless river of cash.

title: RIVAL OF ONASSIS ONCE MED NIAREU
description: ANGELES, May 27About 20 years ago Stavros Niarchos, the Greek tankei operator, hired a former Federal. Bureau of Investigation agent whose office rent was paid in part by the Central Intelligence Agency and assigned him to undermine a valuable shipping contract held by, Aristotle Onassis, an arch rival.

title: A Billion Burgers
description: Fast food places, though welcome on open highways, are a mixed blessing on New York's residential streets.

title: Brett Loses Bid for Perfect Game in 9th
description: Despite registering a 60 victory over San Diego, the short and otherwise happy day of Ken Brett, a Pirates lefthand pitcher, was irreparably spoiled by Fred Kendall of the Padres, in the first game of a Memorial Day doubleheader yesterday before a crowd of 16,000 at the Three Rivers Stadium in Pittsburgh.

title: MANES DEVOTES DAY TO CAMPAIGN
description: While his three opponents relaxed yesterday, Borough President Donald R. Manes of Queens put in a full day of campaigning for the Democratic nomination for Governor, touring sections of Brooklyn and charging that the Government was not doing enough for Vietnam war veterans.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (Reuters)The ExportImport Bank today announced that it had made available credits totaling more than $13million through banks in five countriesthe United States, Britain, Peru, the Philippines and Ivory Coast.

title: TITO BIDS PARTY TIGHTEN CONTROL
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 27President Tito opened the 10th congress of the Communist party today with a call for an extension of party control over most elements of the nation's life and a practical end to political dissent.

title: Pilot Ejects After Missile Accidentally Hits His Jet
description: NORFOLK, Va., May 27 (AP) A Navy pilot safely ejected today before his A4 jet aircraft crashed into the sea after being accidentally hit by an inert missile fired by an A7 Corsair jet attack aircraft off the coast of Jacksonville, Fla., Atlantic Fleet headquarters reported.

title: DIANE KEATON SINGS IN A COLORFUL VOICE
description: Diane Keaton, who is known primarily as a film actress in The. Godfather, Play It Again, Sam and Sleeper, is also, it turns out, a singer with an unexpectedly welldeveloped, colorful voice. She is currently making her singing debut at Reno Sweeney with a program that covers pop music from the twenties to the seventies and indicates that she is trying to find her own way of doing things.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MOM ART A number of persons are experimenting with video as an art form. In this sense, video is not television. It is what you see on televisionactudlly, what you see on a monitor. With a video setupa camera and a monitor, what you see on the monitor can be changed instantly (by changing what the camera picks up) to suit you. The video idea has been utilized by a number of women who have put together an exhibit and program entitled Video Sculpture Performance.

title: Advertising: Fledgling Magazine
description: Despite gloomy news of magazines going out of business because of zooming production and postal costs, and other publishers taking drastic moves because of those costs, other people who think they have the big idea continue to come into the field.

title: Idle Dice Wins Jump At Devon
description: DEVON, Pa., May 27Idle Dice, the nation's premier jumper, glided to an easy victory in the first open jumper class tonight at the Devon Horse Show.

title: Last Stands Are Turning Into New Lease on Life
description: Funny thing about the standup comic in New York: what looked like his last stand here only a few years ago may be turning, into a new lease on life, although making a living out of his art is no laughing matter.

title: Massena Will Hold Vote on TakeOver Of Power System
description: MASSENA, N. Y., May 27 (UPI) here will vote Thursday to decide whether to authorize a municipal takeover of the power system from the Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation. Essentially, voter approval of a $4.5million bond issue would allow the town and village boards to condemn the transmission facilities of the Niagara Mohawk.

title: Grim Ulster Prospect
description: LONDON, May 27  His hands shaking, a neatly dressed man walked up to the barrier in front of the rented house on Belfast's Hawthornden Road, last week's headquarters of the striking Protestant extremist groups. My daughter is in the intensive care unit of the hospital, he said. I need a pass for petrol to go see her every day.News Analysis

title: Prompted by Suit, Prisoners Study Justice System
description: A complex prisonerrights suit begun nearly two years ago by inmates at the Brooklyn House of Detention is leading the prisoners toward a philosophical examination of the criminal justice system.

title: Elaine's and 19 Other Food Outlets Flunk 2d Sanitary Inspection
description: Elaine's, the popular East Side restaurant that serves as a. club for many of the city's bestknown writers and a showcase for many of its most famous celegrities, has been cited by the Department of Health for uncorrected violations and given until Friday to comply with department regulations or be closed.

title: High Tides Around New York
NixonFord Friendship Seems Strained
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 There are strong indications that the 25year personal and political friendship between President Nixon and Vice President Ford has begun to unravel.

description: HOCKEY

title: Paul Berl, 67, Directed Mannes Opera Workshop
description: Paul Berl, who headed the opera workshop of the Mannes College of Music, died Sunday in New York Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 250 West 85th Street.

title: 205Mile Sail Spoiled by Lack of Air
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 27The woman had phoned last night from Pennsylvania to try to find her man, who was occupied over the weekend in helping to race a yacht 205 miles out to Block Island and back in the Storm Trysail Club's annual event. This man and about 700 others of his kind were long overdue because of a paucity of wind.

title: SOVIET BOLSTERS ITS MIDEAST ROLE
description: MOSCOW, May 27Tge Soviet Union today mounted a diplomatic and propaganda offensive to bolster its influence among the Arab states.

title: Major League Baseball and Standings
GUARD APPOINTS CHIRAC, GAULLIST, FRANCE'S PREMIER
description: PARIS, May 27  Jacques Chirac, the 41Yearold Minis ter of the Interior, was namec Premier of France today.

title: Arbees Boy, $122 ,Wins Metropolitan; Better Arbitor Is Jersey Derby Victor
description: The longest shot in a field of eight horses came through with a dramatic victory in the $112,000 Metropolitan Mile at Belmont Park yesterday.

title: Premier of Luxembourg Resigns After His Party's Defeat at Polls
description: BRUSSELS, May 27Luicembourg's Premier, whose Christion Social, party suffered a setback in general elections yesterday, handed in the resignation of Ms coalition Cabinet today.

title: THOMAS ROBSON HAY, HISTORIAN, DIES AT 85
description: Thomas Robson Hay, a historian and former editor of trade journals, died Sunday in Community Hospital, Glen Cove, L. I. He was 85 years old and lived on Birch Hill Road in Locust Valley, L. I.

title: BRONX MAN RE IN FAMILY ABUSE
description: An unemployed 33yearold Bronx man was arrested late yesterday afternoon and accused of having tortured and imprisoned the woman he lived with and her four children in her apartment at 390 East 156th Street in the southeast Bronx.

title: Sharon Walsh Signed by Sets
description: Tennis was fighting dragons over the weekendfrom Rome, where the Italians shut the door on Jimmy Connors, to New York's Central Park, where hundreds of frustrated players almost stormed the Arsenal building in protest against court conditions.

title: And, Psychologist Finds, Funny Men Are Sad Men
description: After extensive interviews and testing of 55 nationally known comics  including all of the biggest names in the businessa New York clinical psychologist who, while a student, worked as a songanddance man on the Catskills borscht circuit, has concluded what has long been felt: that the vast majority of funny men are sad min.

title: NixonFord Friendship Seems Strained
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 There are strong indications that the 25year personal and political friendship between President Nixon and Vice President Ford has begun to unravel.

title: INDIA'S RAIL STRIKE ENDS IN COLLAPSE;
description: NEW DELHI, Tuesday, May 28  India's 20dayold rail strike ended today. The collapse of the walkout was a major triumph for Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

title: Funny Things Happen Again As Comics Return to Clubs
Dave Anderson
description: You new.here? Carlos May asked. You just get here?

title: Death of a Jersey Woman, By Car Studied in South
description: The suspicious circumstances surrounding the hitandrun death in Louisiana of a New Jersey bride, whose husband, a suspected bigamist, tookout a $200,000 insurance policy on her life just before their marriage, are to be presented to a grand jury within the next several weeks, according to the New Orleans police.

title: Panel Vote to Impeach Won't Surprise Ziegler
description: CAYNE, Fla., May 27 (UPI)  Ronald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary, said today that a House Judiciary Committee vote recommending President Nixon's impeachment will come as no surprise."

title: Major League Leaders
KISSINGER MISSION ENDS TOMORROW; PACT STILL SOUGHT
description: TEL AVIV, May 27  Secretary of State Kissinger said tonight that although he had further narrowed the differences between Syria and Israel in roundtheclock talks in Damascus, he had now decided to return home Wednesday even without a troopseparation agreement.

title: A Forceful Premier
description: PARTS, May 27Georges Pompidou called him his bulldozer.

title: Long Lines at Gas Stations Are Gone But Inquiries and Litigation Linger
description: For most of the metropolitan area, the recent energy shortage is a faint, irksome memory. For the region's politicians, prosecutors, investigators, judges and grand juries, it is the subject of continuing scrutiny.

title: Yanks Beaten, 53; Shifting of Murcer Is Weighed
description: The Yankees reverted to their more normal style of play yesterday, dropping a 53 decision to Chicago that was routine except for the defensive play of Lou Piniella in left field, who threw out two White Sox runners at home plate on consecutive hits.

title: BRONX MAN FIELD IN FAMILY ABUSE
description: An unemployed 33yearold Bronx man was arrested late yesterday afternoon and accused of having tortured and imprisoned the woman he lived with and her four children in her apartment at 390 East 156th Street in the southeast Bronx.

title: Jofre to Defend Title
description: MEXICO CITY, May 27 (UPI)  The World Boxing Council's featherweight champion, Eder Jofre of Brazil, will defend his title against Alfredo Marcano of Venezuela on July 27 in Brazil, the council has announced. The exact site of the fight has not yet been decided.

title: British Soldiers in Ulster Occupy. Key Fuel Facilities
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 27British soldiers armed with carbines and machine guns occupied gasoline stations and oil storage depots at strategic points in Northern Ireland today as the general strike threatened to bring a complete stoppage of food supplies, medical services and electric power.

title: Blacks in Mozambique Slums Support Guerrillas
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, May 26About fourfifths of the haltmillion people of the capital of Mozambique live in black shantytowns from whose poverty the white minority shrinks. Curious, and suspicious stares met a white visitor today in Xipamanine  although a black friend accompanied him  and in every house he visited he was told he was the first white man to do so.

title: 2 Studies Discount Urea As Sickle Cell Treatment
description: Two medical research teams that have investigated the effectiveness of the chemical urea in treating patients with sickle cell anemia, have concluded that that regimen, does not work.

title: 2 Studies Discount Urea As Sickle Cell Treatment
description: Two medical research teams that have investigated the effectiveness of the chemical urea in treating patients with sickle cell anemia, have concluded that that regimen does not work.

title: Miss Gosliner Wed To William Jones
description: Miss Kathy Gosliner and William Cecil Jones, reporters for The Rocky Mountain News in Denver, were married here yesterday at noon. State Supreme Court Justice Martin Stecher performed the ceremony at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Bertram Gosliner, parents of the bride.

title: Market Place:
description: You may have seen the New York Stock Exchange's ad.

title: U.S. Ground Forces Get Latest Weapons Systems
description: Rapid advances in weapons technology, demonstrated in the 1973 Middle East war, are being incorporated into a major modernization program of the United States land forces.

title: Chess: Mere Erudition Is Not Enough Against Soltis Fierce Drive
description: The seventh GoldwaterMarshall invitational tournament was won this year by International Master Andrew Soltis, who topped the 10man, field with a 6.3 score. Soltis's brew of strong opening play and alert middlegame tactics enabled him to run effortlessly through the event, held at the Marshall Chess Club in New York and sponsored by its president G. Walter Goldwater.

title: About the Yankees...
description: Bill Sudakis suffered a 1 gash when Jorge Orta spiked him crossing first base in the seventh inning. At first I thought I broke my ankle, said Sudakis, who needed two stitches and will be out for about four days.... Roy White returned as a pinchhitter after missing five games with a strained hamstring in his left leg.... Lou Piniella doesn't look for alibis when he fails to hit. He was particularly incensed at himself for striking out with runners at second and third and one out in the third. There's no excuse for striking out, he said. You gotta get the ball in play, no matter where, After swinging at the third strike, he flipped his bat into the air, then kicked it as it landed. If I had brought the s.o.b, back to the dugout, I would a broken it in 50,000 pieces, he remarked.

title: Arctic Gas Pipeline Route The New Issue in Alaska
description: Another long, complex and controversial chapter has started to unfold in the continuing saga of the Prudhoe Bay oilandgas field and the means of funneling its Arctic bonanza to market.

title: Indy 500 Victory Earns $245,031 for Rutherford
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 27 (UPI)The Indianapolis Motor Speedway tonight distributed a record purse of $1,015,686 to the competitors of yesterday's Indianapolis 500mile auto race. Johnny Rutherford, the winner from Fort Worth, Tex., split $245,031 with his crew from Team McLaren of England.

title: Ballet: A Matchless Style
description: Our Royal Ballet revels now are ended, and the company has left for a twoweek stand at the Kennedy Center in Washington. By and large this has been the British troupe's most successful New York visit, if not from the creative point of view, at least from the sheer dance power of the company.

title: 60Foot Fall at Circus
description: BOSTON, May 27 (AP)  A swaypole rider with the Ringling Brothers, Barnum & Bailey Circus plunged 60 feet to the ground yesterday. A spokesman at Massachusetts General Hospital said that 24yearold Tony Nock suffered multiple fractures of both legs and a fractured rib.

title: Guidolin Resigns as Bruin Pilot
description: BOSTON, May 27 (UPI)Bep Guidolin, coach of the Boston Bruins for the last 18 months, resigned today after failing to reach a con. tract agreement with the National Hockey League club.

title: Valdez Still in Hospital
description: MONTE CARLO, May 27 (UPI)  Rodrigi Valdez, Colombia's newly crowned World Boxing Council middleweight champion, remained in a Monaco hospital for the second day today under observation for pogsible brain damage suffered in his victory Saturday against Benny Briscoe of Philadelphia. Valdez won on a knockout in the seventh round.

title: Morse, at 73, Again Seeks Senate Seatin Vote Today
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 27Former Senator Wayne Morse, who became the prophet of the antiVietnam war movement 10 years ago and was defeated for reelection in 1968 partly because of it, is making his second and probably. last attempt to return to the United States Senate.

title: COL. A. E. SCHON BERGER
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Col. Adolph E. Schonberger, a former member of the Army Adjutant General's Office, died today of cancer. He was. 72 years old.

title: Participants in Credit Market. Face Busy Slate in 4Day Week
description: In the fourday work week that starts today, participants in the credit markets face an estimated $680million of new cdporate offerings, an estimated $439million of new tax exempt offerings and a multi billion dollar round of Government financing. The. fully packed week comes along at a point that finds a widening discussion and anatysis  of where the United States economy really, stands and in which direction such major ingredients as prices and/or, costs, including interest rates, are headed.CreditMarkets

title: Kenneth Rush's Post: An Award for Loyalty
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Deputy Secretary of State Kenneth Rush was host the other day to a highlevel delegation from Poland that ineluded a deputy prime minister.

title: $150Million Deal Signed By Philippine Central Bank
description: MANILA, May 27 (Reuters)The Philippine central bank and a consortium of 47 international financial institutions from Europe, North America and Asia today signed a fiveyear credit agreement for $150million.

title: Joly Seen as First N.H.L. Draftee
description: MONTREAL, May 27 (AP)A defenseman, Greg Joly, of the Regina Pats of the Western Canada Hockey League, likely will be the first player selected in the 1974 National Hockey League amateur draft tomorrow. The Washington Capitals, one of the two expansion teams, already have expressed interest in Joly and there was a report today that the Capitals, who have first pick in the draft, already had signed him to a fiveyear contract for an estimated $400,000,

title: City Is Taking Possession Of Concourse Plaza Hotel
description: The City takes over the Concourse Plaza Hotel today for conversion into a residence for the elderly  a move that is symbolic, Bronx planners say, of the effort to arrest neighborhood decay along the tree shaded Grand Concourse.

title: French President Newest Figtire on World Scene
description: The inauguration of Val Giscard d'Estaing as President of France yesterday formally completed one of the numerous transfers of power that have made. 1974 a year notable for changes in leadefthip in many parts of the world.

title: Metropolitan Handicap;  1974, by Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Daft; Racing Foam)
description: EIGHTHThe Metropolitan Handicap, S100,030 added, 3Y0 and up 1 M. Start good, won driving. Off, 5:31. Winner, dk. b. or br. c., 4, by Handsome Boylovely Ann, by Flaming Fleet. Trainer, G. W. Weckerle Jr. Value to winner $67,200; second, $24,640; third, $13,440; fourth, $6,720. Times22 2/5; 443/5; 1:19; 1:342/5.

title: Simon Advocates A Balanced Budget
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP)  Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon says the Government should aim toward a balanced budget in 1976 as a key to controlling the nation's totally unacceptable inflation rate  11.5 per cent in the firstquarter.

title: Federal Mediators Joining Talks in Jersey Bus Strike
description: PATERSON, May 27Federal mediators will join negotiators tomorrow in an effort to resolve a fourweek old bus strike that has affected 34,000 people commuting daily between northern New Jersey and New York.

title: LONDON TIGHTENS AIRPORT SECURITY
description: LONDON, May 27Scotland Yard has begun taking over responsibility for security at London's Heathrow Airport, nicknamed Thiefrow because of a high rate of pilferage and other crime there.

title: JOHN F. LEAVITT
description: STONINGTON, Com., May 27 (AP)  John Faunce Leavitt, associate curator of Mystic Seaport, died Saturday at his home. He was 69 years old.

title: Youth's New Values
description: The nation's college students have learned to enjoy life in a sick society, and noncollege youths would like to share the fun. A cynical view? Yet, this is the general picture that emerges from the latest study by Daniel Yankelovich, Changing Youth Values in the Seventies: A Study of American Youth.

title: NOW Elects Syracuse Lawyer as Head
Ousted Mozambique Bishop Visits Privately With Pope
description: ROME, May 27  Pope Paul VI today received in private audience the Most Rev. Manuel Vieira Pinto, Bishop of Nampule, Mozambique, who was expelled from that city last month by Portuguese authorities.

title: Beame Given Degree
description: Mayor Beame received an honorary degree from Niagara University Saturday, where he spoke at commencement exercises, a mayoral spokesman. said. He spent yesterday with his eldest son, a college professor, and other members of his family in Canada.

title: Briage: Italians and Aces Open Play In World Championship Finals
description: VENICE, May 27The Italian world champions got off to a good start this afternoon defending their title against the Aces, and led after the first 74 deals by 48 international match pOints.

title: 656th Cosmos Satellite
description: MOSCOW, May 27 (Reuters) The Soviet Union launched the 656th in its series of cosmos satellites today. Tass, the Soviet press agency, said that equipment on board the satellite was working normally, but did not give details of its function.

title: Msgr. Henry J. Pregenser, Headed Archdiocesan Unit
description: Msgr. Henry J. Pregenser, since 1968 pastor of St. Anthony's Roman Catholic Church, Nanuet, N. Y., and former New York archdiocesan director of sodalities, died Friday in Good Samaritan Hospital, Suffern, N.Y. His age was 70.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Federal mediators will join negotiators today in effort to resolve a fourweekold bus strike that has affected 34,000 people commuting daily between northern New Jersey and New York. The strike, which began on May 1, has shut down six routes operated for InterCity Bus Lines by Transport of New Jersey under a stateordered takeover, of the bankrupt company.

title: Britons Capture Two Ring Titles
description: PARIS, May 27 (AP)Kevin Finnegan of Britain scored a close, uananimous decision over JeanClaude Bouttier of France tonight to win the European middleweight boxing championship at Roland Garros Stadium.

title: Television
description: David Niven in The Bluffers, on Channel 4 at 8 P.M.

title: And, Psychologist Finds, Funny Men Are Sad Men
description: After extensive interviews and testing of 55 nationally known comics  including all of the biggest names in the businessa New York clinical psychologist who, while a student, worked as a songanddance man on the Catskills borscht circuit, has concluded what has long been felt: that the vast majority of funny men are sad men.

title: A Drastic Anticrime. Law Stirs Jamaicans
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica  Beneath the placidly beautiful exterior of this perennially ,sunny island of two million people, a crime problem involving drugs guns and international smuggling has led to a drastic new law that is stirring intense debate.

title: PAUL HEMKE
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., May 27 (AP)  Paul Hemke, former vice president, dean of faculty and provost at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, died here Saturday. He was 84 years old.

title: About the Mets...
description: It was weighin day for the Mets yesterday, a routine that takes place about once a month to determine whether players are keeping their weights within reasonable limits. Rusty Staub, who has been on base eight times in his last 18 times up, was seen toting a small paper bag out of the club's hotel dining room. See, he's taking his lunch with him and not eating it until he weighs in at the clubhouse, said Ed Kranepool.... The lefthanded Kranepool said he played golf last week and found three righthanded clubs in his bag. My wife's a righthander, he explained.... Pete Rose, one of the Reds most reliable batters, has been in a slump.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Fast Trials Without Indictment Allowed Under New State Law
description: A state bill aimed at reducing the backlog of cases awaiting grandjury action and providing speedier trials for defendants  by having them waive indictment and consent to be prosecuted on the basis of an information  has been signed into law by Governor Wilson.

title: Major Restructuring of U.S. Tax Laws Sought by Several Groups in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 Proposals for major changes in the nation's tax laws are pending in every corner of Congress. The fate of several of the most important will be decided this week or next.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
How the Teams Stand Today
Reds Top Mets, 42 Seaver Gives All Runs Early
description: CINCINNATI, May 27The Cincinnati Reds teed off on Tom Seaver in the first two innings tonight and inflicted a 42 defeat on the New York Mets.

title: ... Duty Under Law
description: In ruling that the national security tent cannot be stretched to cover illegal entry, Judge Gesell also, in effect, warned President Nixon that his stonewalling may be tantamount to obstruction of justice.

title: Reds Top Mets
description: CINCINNATI, May 27The Cincinnati Reds teed off on Tom Seaver in the first two innings tonight and inflicted a 42 defeat on the New York Mets.

description: WASHINGTON, May 27President Nixon, Vice President Ford, Senators Mike Mansfield, Hugh Scott and Russell B. Long, and Representatives Carl Albert, John J. Rhodes and Wilbur D. Mills have all agreed in recent weeks on one thing.

title: Belmont Race Charts
New Jersey Sports
description: MONTCLAIR, May 27  It's not exactly a new game in town, but high school lacrosse is coming of age in New Jersey this spring with the first official state tournament scheduled Wednesday through June 8.
